review.title: I was treated like a king!!!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont just brought excellence to another level! I felt like I was treated like a royalty when I entered the hotel! Devynn of the front desk was extremely pleasant and courteous! She upgraded my room, gave me a city view room, and free internet access. Also, I had a little bit of an issue, but Sergio immediately called me and compensated my minor inconvenience. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone who visits the San Francisco area!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and gorgeous hotel room!
review.locationRemarks: Great locations!

review.title: Two rooms, two days
review.reviewText: First time for us to stay at the Fairmont. Check in was to be 3PM. One room was ready early but the second room wasn't ready until 4:20 PM. Can't remember ever having to wait over an hour from check in time. There were no coffee cups for the coffee machine in the first room. Room service took almost an hour to bring them. As for the second room, the maid forgot to put any toilet paper in the bathroom, there was none. Bathroom has no vent fan. So when you take a warm or hot shower the mirrors totally fog up. We had lunch the first day there. Watch out on the check. They automatically add a 18% gratuity and there is a line below that to add one. Breakfast buffet was over priced. After adding tax and gratuity it is $42 a person. I was also surprised that there was not a list of hotel amenities in the room. Parking was also a bit high. $58 plus tax so almost $70 per night to park your car. I've paid a lot to stay in other 5 star properties, this just fell short of our expectations.
review.positiveRemarks: History, and there should be that as well in each room.
review.negativeRemarks: Yes staff education. Better room service

review.title: Nob Hill classic Hotel - close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Have stayed at the Fairmont many years ago, at that point it was in need of a bit of a refresh. The hotel and staff were all top notch. My wife and children went to book in after dropping me at a business meeting. The room was not ready, so they gave my wife a $50 certificate to use at the hotel. I arrived back just after 4pm and found them in the lobby restaurant snacking on apps with very low stress (if any) about the room being slightly delayed. The room was ready within 15 minutes and we were told we had very nice room in the main building with a view of Alcatraz and Coit tower. 

Our room was actually the Piazza suite, traditionally (beautifully) appointed with a large dining area and pull out couch for the kids. Both the bedroom and living area looked out over SF bay - great views! The Piazza suite was perfect for us, - comfort and privacy, from two youngish children. We had a quick room service dinner that was delicious, and dashed out to the Giants game and got back after 10pm. The room was quiet, sleep was uninterupted with very good black out draw shades, and the bedding was very comfortable. 

Altogether a very nice hotel with premium service and classy, traditional surroundings.
review.positiveRemarks: service was great, decor is traditional, but not ugly ostentatious. The food was very good as it should be for the prices, selection was wide.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill (grand buildings other nice hotels), cable car line on Powell, 4 walking blocks from Union Square - downhill and bit of a climb uphill!

review.title: Interesting
review.reviewText:
On a whim I decided to spend the night in San Francisco and saw a good deal for the Fairmont. Knowing this was an excellent hotel, I was excited about it. I toured SF and went to my room around 10:30 pm.  
Due to the drink I had at the Tonga Lounge downstairs, which I think had too much sugar in it, I had trouble falling asleep.  What surprised me was that it was very, very noisy. I heard people coming down the hallway yelling to one another, I heard people having sex, and what sounded like revealers returning to their rooms late in the night, not caring about the noise they were making. I was surprised that the rooms were not a bit more soundproof, and it felt more like a Motel 6 experience.
Needless to say, I did not fall asleep until at least 1 am and woke up late and did not get to see as much of the city as I was hoping since I ended up falling to sleep so late. 
Other than that, the staff were very nice, the check-in and check-out process was very smooth.

review.reviewText:
We stayed in the deluxe tower. Beautiful view of the city. 

The air conditioning was broken in the room our first night on our 20th anniversary. 81 degrees was not fun. Took them a day and two reminders for them to fix it. They took no discount off our stay. 

Another thing that annoyed me was the sound in the pipes when we turned on the hot water when taking a shower. It rattled so hard it felt like someone was banging down a door. After a while I just started laughing. It was so loud that I'm sure other guests could probably hear it. 

If it were not for these two issues it would be a perfect room. We expected a little more when celebrating our 20 year together. It could have been better.

review.title: If you want your valuables stolen, stay here!
review.reviewText:
I stayed at The Fairmont for four nights around Memorial Day. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are aesthetically pleasing and quite clean. That said, it's an old building with paper thin walls, so be prepared to hear your neighbors in every way. 

The disappointing part of my stay was as follows: Within my first 24 hours at the hotel, I had a pair of Tiffany earrings stolen from my toiletry case (it was closed, and my earrings were subsequently invisible to the eye unless someone opened it and poked around). 

I reported the theft within minutes of returning home (it was at that time that I realized they were in fact, stolen). A full week has elapsed since I reported the theft and j have heard nothing back from management. They even have the semblance of a "security department"; this consists of a handful of overtly incompetent men who did absolutely nothing to make amends in my case. In my 36 years of life, I have never had such an experience. I highly recommend staying elsewhere. If this is the only place you can stay for some reason, please lock up all valuables at all times. Housekeeping does random, unscheduled room checks for no apparent reason. This merely adds to the sketchiness of the hotel (it's not quality assurance as it may suggest).

It was a great experience. Friendly staff took care of my requests and even a late check in did not phase them at all. I stayed over the Memorial Day weekend and even with a completely booked hotel, the staff performed exceptionally.

It's the grandest of all the hotels we stayed in on this road trip - kind of saving the best for last. So conveniently located to Union Square for our shopping and Chinatown where we indulged in our Dim Sum fix every day. Taxi fares to and from the Fairmont are cheaper than the tickets for two on the cable cars. It is well worth joining the Presidents Club for free to get free higher speed internet and gym access.

Had a bottle of wine to my room first night, second night had colleagues join me in hotel bar and asked if it was OK to drink remaining wine to finish (we were buying other drinks too) and was charged $25 corkage. review.title: Good, but not great
review.reviewText: I've stayed at many Fairmont hotels, and this one was definitely below their [usually] high standard. On the plus side, the room was clean and comfortable. And the building from the outside is pretty impressive. However, when you look closer, it's clear they need to refurbish this hotel. It's beat-up and worn-out in many places—walls, condition of the elevators, and the windows are pretty dirty, spoiling the view. Staff friendliness was hit-and-miss. The employee at check-in was great, friendly, professional. The lady at check-out was none of the above. Not even a "hello" or "how did you enjoy your stay?" Very strange considering Fairmont staff are usually top-notch. Maybe she was having a bad day, but at these rates, the customer shouldn't notice.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is in need of maintenance—fresh paint, wallpaper, and take a look at the elevators. Staff are not consistently friendly and professional.

review.title: On a Hill
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont is a wonderful hotel and centrally located to many things.  Our room was exceptional - we had a view of the city and the bay.  Every member of the staff we came across was very accommodating, kind and pleasant.  They helped us with a smile and followed up.  Definitely speak with the concierge.  Thomas was especially helpful.  The trolley is a must do for a first time tourist.  Mass transportation is at the bottom of the hill.  We visited Golden Gate park (which is a lovely family day out - there are museums on site), Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown and a tour on the ferry towards Saucelito.   The hotel is on top of Nob Hill.  If you choose to walk, just know one has to go up and down very steep hills to get around.  Although San Francisco is a walking town the hills do slow down progress - there are exceptionally steep hills around Nob Hill -exceptionally steep.  Keep that in mind.   
The only con to our stay was a convention which came to the hotel one day into our stay.  This meant swarms of very rude guests which made eating in the hotel restaurant impossible (it became loud and rowdy) and getting around the hotel tricky.  The convention people changed the atmosphere of the the hotel.  They were ill mannered: shoved past us, took over the lovely lobby, and were just plain rude.  If you do book a stay, find out if there is a convention coming in.  Then avoid those dates.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was wonderful.  The view exceptional.  Room service was lovely - though inconsistent.  Central location.  Staff amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing is the convention.  I know these are integral to hotels in general.  But the shift in hotel tone was noticeable.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf and to the bottom of the hill to the buses and muni. Shopping center at bottom of hill.

review.title: Best Experience ever!!
review.reviewText: We first stayed at the best western and our car got broken into. We lost luggage and it was the worst experience. Then we came over to the Fairmont and told them what happened, and then they really turned everything around for us! With complimentary wine, breakfast, and helping us find a place to get our window fixed. They were just amazing :) best hotel I've ever been to in a long time!

review.title: Exterior View?
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is old school glamour! We had the lowest Expedia rate ($189). Our room was beautiful and very spacious.... The only downside was it was an "exterior view" which means a view of the wall. That was strange, but the service, the decor, the elegance were terrific. The extra $120 would have been worth a room with an outside view on top of nob hill. Stayed across the street at the Mark Hopkins when I couldn't extend my stay at the Fairmont  and wow it did not even compare to how fabulous the Fairmont was!!!

review.title: Not a top of the line hotel
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at top hotels all over the world but never at a Fairmont property. So why not try it since it is an iconic property? Disappointment all around. Very few things in the room that we needed. Evidently you have to ask for everything. Sorry, but at $500+ a night $66 for parking, etc you want me to ask for a toothbrush? Bedding was substandard, as was pretty much everything else.
If you are familiar with top properties, this is NOT one of them. Beautiful lobby, so just stop in for a picture and stay somewhere else.

The worst part was when we checked out and expressed our disappointment, the hotel staff argued that they are the "best in their class" instead of just saying they were sorry that they didn't meet our expectations. Basic training was lacking here.
review.negativeRemarks: Food in the main restaurant was under seasoned and nuts were rancid.

review.title: Nice hotel, great area
review.reviewText:
We spent one night in January in Fairmont. We had to pay $40 extra to get early check-in. The room was very clean, and the views from our 17th floor room were fabulous. The hotel staff were very friendly. We ordered room service for lunch - though pricey, the staff was incredible - the food was yummy and steaming hot. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom and shower were very nice and the shower was very hot with nice showerhead. The location of the hotel is incredible - about 4 blocks from shopping, nice walking, 6 blocks (walking distance) from BART. There were taxis everywhere. We had breakfast buffet next day and it was very nice. The restaurant (LC) staff were very courteous. They made our stay very comfortable.

Only regret was that while booking, we mentioned that it was my husband's big birthday but the hotel did not even acknowledge that. Other than that, it is a great hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill - very close to shopping, nice restaurants within 5 minutes by taxi.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel, shame about the staff
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a gorgeous building with beautiful architectural features and a certain presidential air about it. I just wish the staff were nicer and more accommodating. I also would have assumed certain items like ear buds would have been available at such a nice hotel since it's the small things that make a big difference to your stay. We weren't offered to have our bags taken up to the room for us, weren't asked if we enjoyed our stay, weren't told about the free wifi available in the lobby until after we purchased Internet facilities within our room and worst of all, my husband's dairy allergy was disregarded by the staff who treated it as though it was nothing (although he can stop breathing if he has anything with dairy in it so it's no small matter!) and didn't offer to accommodate with meal alterations or alternatives. Room service food was cold and dry so I would not recommend that. Overall, it was a beautiful hotel with a comfortable bed and clean bathroom but if you are expecting more than this for the price you are paying to stay here, I would perhaps try the Intercontinental instead.

review.title: Christmas Nightmare
review.reviewText: I will never stay at the Fairmont again or any of its sister hotels. The only positive was that the room was nice. The hotel staff was overwhelmed and lazy. Even valet at the front would wait a few minutes before leisurely walking to your car. They vacuumed the hallways at 8 AM on Christmas morning and brought my 100$ Christmas room service 2 hours late with a dirty receipt under the eggs and bacon. The food was also cold. To comp us they promised a 75$ room credit which was never applied. Also, my credit card was over charged 400$ for a fee that the front desk could not be explain. Their excuse was that they were so busy because of the holiday, but if you can't operate at your hotels standards and operating capacity then you shouldn't operate as 5 star hotel. Competitive 5 star hotels would never operate to the horrible standards that the Fairmont does. DO NOT STAY HERE
review.negativeRemarks: They need to improve their customer service levels, and train their employees to operate at their capacity even during busy times

review.title: Spectacular luxury and view of the city
review.reviewText: A seamless experience. We had one of the large suites that has a huge balcony. And while the room is spacious, the bathroom was clearly sized according to the standards of a past era. The colors and decor of the room are extremely tasteful and elegant. The views from atop Nob Hill are panoramic, and you are walking distance from some of San Francisco's old world charm and architecture. The view at night is simply city lights at its best. I think there are few cities in the US that offer city lights like San Francisco. The gardens, lobby, and amenities hearken back to the Belle Epoch. I used to stay at the St. Francis, but will now make my future visits to San Francisco an opportunity to revisit The Fairmont.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much. I cannot speak for the other rooms, but they could expand the bathroom in the large suite, we stayed in, just a bit.

review.title: Prime location on the hill.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in prime spot on the hill. Quite a way from the bay but easy to access by nearby cable car (when there is power!) Relaxing bar, with 'mostly' friendly staff. Stayed in a newly refurbished room, but curtain tie had come away from the wall, therefore looked tatty! Rang for bell boy twice to pick up bags but didn't arrive! Hotel were very apologetic & compensated by taking a little off our bill. Unbeknown to us, there was a Ferrari event, which prevented us from driving to the front of the hotel. Advance notice would have been preferred with advice on where to park. Overall though, a pleasant stay.

managementResponses.response:

I hope you would be willing to return in the future and allow us the opportunity to make your next stay better than your last.
Sincerely,

review.title: Sorry this hotel is not run better
review.reviewText: This wonderful historic hotel deserves better then the current management. We were upgraded when we checked in and told the fold out would be made up as we dashed to dinner. When we returned well into the morning hours, no bed was made, bedding was missing, no water in the room, and in the mini bar, old food from another patron. The air was broken and the room was damp until we could turn it off and open the windows. The front desk seem very supportive, and said they would look into it and call us, but we never heard from them. Disappointing for a room that was $800 a night.
review.negativeRemarks: service

review.reviewText: The Fairmont was the site of my high school "Senior Ball" umpteen years ago.  My wife and I just stayed there for a quick weekend trip to SF.  We were duly impressed - lobby is absolutely  gorgeous, room was immaculate, and well stocked.  Inside rooms do not have any view, so if you want a view, you need to stipulate that when reserving.
review.locationRemarks: Grace Cathedral Episcopal Church (one block away) is a must see.  Unbelievable architecture and stained glass work.

review.title: Travel the World
review.reviewText:
When you travel the World ------places such as the Fairmont in San Francisco are a rarity.  There are the modern places with the modern lamps but places like the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto, Canada and Fairmont in San Francisco are a step back in time when elegance was the watchword.  Unfortunately today's amenities bring today's funk.  However, if you want to be treated like a Lady or a Gentleman------try the Fairmont and I guarantee you won't be disappointed.

C. Raymond Dawson, Jr.
Toronto - CANADA

The Presidio; Danielle Steele's Home; The Embarcadero; Alcatraz; Fisherman's Wharf;
A great town to walk around but if not in shape-cab it !

review.title: Very comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: Upon check in we were assigned a room that smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke. We immediately returned to request a different room and the front desk staff were happy to oblige. Our new room on the second floor was surprisingly quiet and quite comfortable. We had friends staying on the 18th floor of the tower and WOW- the view was incredible! The staff at the concierge desk were very helpful in booking some activities and making dinner recommendations and reservations. Breakfast in the hotel was quite good and a good place to start your day. The hotel is situated at the top of a VERY steep hill so while walking to shopping, activities & restaurants was fine, walking BACK is definitely a workout! Ultimately, we had a great time and would definitely stay at the Fairmont again.

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: Stayed one night-beautiful, historic, romantic hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Read some review about it being old and crumbley and was a little worried--but it was immaculate and well taken care of--absolutely beautiful --could imagine the 1906 earthquake and the 1945 signing of the UN Charter--beautiful lobby. No issues-very comfortable bed. Clean room. Good location. Wish I had paid more for a view--would the next time. Very nice hotel. Close to Chinatown and Wharf and All of downtown.  Super friendly valets and staff out front. Really nice time.

Nice hotel but wasn't great.  I don't want to nitpick but there were several lights not work in the rooms like the restroom and lamps.  The room was nice but there was very little closet space no view and for $540 a night that's crazy plus $58 a day for parking

Lovely stay and our room on the 6 th floor overlooked gentleman' s club .
Very comfortable bed with tea, coffee making facility. 
Restaurant service excellent and food ' fixed priced ' meal of excellent quality and good value for this type of hotel.
All staff helpful and friendly and Nobb hill a safe and classy district although a little off the beaten track for down town San Fransisco and Fisherman's Wharf etc. The cable cars do run past the hotel but their timings are rather hit and miss and it it quite an arduous trek up the hill.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Tonga restaurant was very good. Our room was very nice and clean. The best part about the room was the bed. It was very comfortable. The only downside to our room was the air conditioning. It was a little warm in the room. When we arrived the air was set to 65 but the room temp was at 75. We asked the front desk to have someone to come look at it when we went out for dinner. When we came back the room temp was still at 75. Also the sink in the bathroom was a little clogged. Overall the hotel is excellent and location is nice too close to everything. Would definitely stay here again.

The car rental was a problem because the Hertz person left early and the concierge on duty then did not offer us any alternative.
review.positiveRemarks: The linens were fabulous. It was very clean and the house keeping staff was very accomodating and friendly.

review.title: "Five star DOGGIE Hotel"
review.reviewText: My expectations of a five star hotel are not on spot at the Fairmont SF. A five star hotel is characterized by luxury appointments, superlative service , and the highest  standards of service and cleanliness. The Fairmont failed in all areas. Hotel lobby and room had masked pet odor that made my stomach turn.  At night, I was awaken by flea bites. The carpet was soiled in different areas( most likely pet stains )Baseboards had layers of dust. The odor, fleas and loud A/c kept me up all night.   In my opinion, all rooms in a five star hotel,  should have the same standards, regardless of the floor or rate one paid.   Rooms and hotel in general  should be exceptionally clean, odor free, and pleasant for all guests.  If Fairmont choses to not make improvements, perhaps it should be renamed "The Fairmont Five Star DOG hotel".

review.title: Old school SanFran
review.reviewText: The old Fairmont Hotel on Nob Hill is a beautifully maintained "old school" hotel with classic old decor and modern amenities.  The deluxe rooms with a view in the tower are beautiful and well equipped.  It's expensive but worth it.  The only negative are the complete financial robberies  of the price of coffee and cola.  $6.00 for  12oz domestic beer is reasonable.  $6.00 for an 8.5oz coca cola is shameful.

review.title: Great historic hotel with a classy high end touch.
review.reviewText: Extremely friendly staff and glamorous hotel interior but the beds were a bit too soft. Would not recommend to people with back problems.

review.title: Love the 5 star treatment
review.reviewText: Charm, character, ambience..,but since it's a 5 star hotel, expect to tip everyone...they all expect something "tip" even if ur not a VIP.  But it's SF! So only oblige if it's called for! My two cents

review.title: short vacation in SF
review.reviewText:
Rooms were quite and bed was soft.
Great to sleep in.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff is great.
review.locationRemarks:

Great place to eat.

review.title: Weekend Getaway at the Fairmont
review.reviewText: I was born in San Francisco and worked there for a long time. My husband lived and worked there too. We moved to San Jose in 1988, and try to get to the city when we get the chance. This time, we decided to be tourists and booked a night at the Fairmont and a day on the Big Bus hop-on, hop off bus! We had a great time seeing "our" city through the eyes of visitors.  About the Fairmont, very classy and beautiful! All of the staff members were nice, helpful and professional. Our room was beautiful and clean. I loved the walk in closet! We enjoyed cocktails in the lobby where we listened to lovely piano music. We walked to dinner at Farallon and had an exhilarating 4 block hike back up Nob Hill! We had a really nice time and are glad that we chose the Fairmont. I'm also happy that I went through Expedia and got a great price and free parking!
review.positiveRemarks: Old world, classy and historical. Beautiful lobby and room.
review.negativeRemarks: Honestly, I have no complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, and all sorts of transportation options. The Big Bus hop-on, hop-off stop is only four blocks away, steep blocks though!

review.title: Awful!
review.reviewText: Checked into the room; the room smelled like smoke; when I called the front desk they sent a gentleman to the room who acknowledged it smelled like smoke and then offered to spray the room with deodorizer.  I called the front desk - they offered to move me but I had checked in late at night (around 9:20 pm) and by the time the move would happen it would be closer to 10:00 pm so I decided against it; they offered to comp breakfast (which I appreciated).  Next morning - toilet clogs.  I call the front desk and they literally say "it happens" and they will send someone up to unclog it.  Most unhelpful front desk and least empathetic.  I was excited to stay at this hotel but truly - the facilities are subpar and old and the service is least helpful.  An awful experience.

review.title: Overpriced, overrated
review.reviewText: The room was stuffy, the magazines old, and check-in staff made me feel like a criminal because I'd lost my ID. I was stressed enough without that. At least air out the room before you rent it, and don't tell me you've upgraded it. Jeez.
review.positiveRemarks: The high tea was delicious, which it should have been.
review.negativeRemarks: Manners, overall. I  arrived a bit early and was glared at and told to go to the bar. Ten minutes later, lots of charm and attention. Weird.
review.locationRemarks: Good views. Bring trainers if you plan on walking up or down the hill.

review.title: Beautiful well maintained hotel
review.reviewText: Check in seamless, room neat and tidy. Nice amenities. Would return to this location.

review.title: Historic but in desperate need of a makeover
review.reviewText: The Fairmont on Nob Hill is not a 5 star and is in need of a makeover.  Layers of paint had been reapplied carelessly over the years without removing previous layers, old wall paper, etc.  And there was no elevator key security or guards observing to get to rooms.  The restaurant on the main floor has outdated decor and food was only so, so.  And reservations were required but I never saw it even a quarter full.  Most hotel staff was nice.  But had issues with one gym staff clerk scrutinizing my use of the gym (even though I paid) and a sales clerk following me around in the gift shop.  But I was able to check in at 10:00am and received a room upgrade.  But it was noisy from traffic including sirens outside all night and had no shades just decorative drapes that didn’t close.  I think I’ll try the Palace or something else near Union Square next time.  I loved Union for its pristine setting, upscale restaurants, shopping, movie theaters, etc.  And its pretty level for walking compared to hilly areas in San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: Removing unprofessional staff, a hotel makeover, security, better restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is on Nob Hill.  A lot of walking to Union Square.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your recent experience at the hotel. I'm pleased to hear you found the suite beautifully appointed. I did want to note that members of our FPC loyalty program actually receive complimentary internet, so I apologize if you weren't made aware of that fact. Thanks again.

review.title: Charging for Internet - really?
review.reviewText: We enjoyed a  weekend in the beautifully appointed, but somewhat small, Pakistan suite. You can imagine this is not a cheap room. When we attempted to access the internet and found we could do so only at an additional charge, it put a damper on our estimation of the Fairmont Hotel chain. In fact, this is the last time we stay at a Fairmont.

review.title: Wonderful getaway!
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful. Our room was clean and nicely appointed. The staff exceeded our expectations. Service was professional, personal and memorable. We enjoyed the Tonga Room, a step back in time!  Our server for breakfast took the time to make our dining experience special by offering to take our picture and gave us suggestions as to what to see on our next visit to the area. He even brought over a hot pecan roll as a treat for me since I had ordered something savory rather than sweet. It was delicious and thoughtful. Check in and out was fast and courteous.  Can't wait to return!

review.title: A splurge & so worth it!

We ate in the restaurant, went to To ha room for drinks, ordered room service for dinner & Breakfast...all excellent.
We we able to check in over an hour early, offered a discounted upgrade with a beautiful view!

review.title: Nice hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful. We arrived after a long trip, they had upgraded our room, which was nice. We got to our room only to find a yellow stain on the bed. I called the concierge, they were appalled. They offered me another room, I opted for them to just come clean and change the sheets. They came pretty quickly and changed the sheets. The supervisor of housekeeping called and apologized profusely. She gave me her direct number, if there was anything I needed call her. Other than that I enjoyed everything. They also had bathrobes for you very nice. I would go again.

review.title: Walk San Fran
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a true landmark that provides great views and easy walking to great areas of town

From start to finish our stay was exceptional. CLEAN, beautiful views, excellent in-room breakfast. The bar is elegant and cocktails are reasonably priced. Front desk staff was wonderful. A comfortable bed and a beautiful bathroom. Rooms aren't huge but well lit, and nice decor. Seemed very clean and fresh. We'll be back!

review.title: Fairmont Hotel is a historical footnote
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed my San Francisco trip immensely, but was dissappointed in the service and attention to detail at the Fairmont.  I had to call for my bag to be delivered to my room 3 times over 3 hours.
The front desk got my newspaper request right on the 3rd day, not on the first two!  The hotel looks a little the worse for wear.  All the attention is on the new Ghirardelli Fairmont, there is a sales center for million dollar apartments in the Fairmont Downtown lobby.  The location and the lure of SF means the Hotel will continue to do great business.  There was a car show, proms, conventions, tours going on, so the people watching was great!  The location at the top of a steep hill makes walking daunting even for young folks.  Next time, I'll get a newer hotel location on more walkable ground.
review.negativeRemarks:
Better attention to detail from front desk staff.  The maid service and room service were fine, the 
failure to execute came from the Front Desk.
review.locationRemarks: Location is deceptive.  At the top of an impossibly steep hill, walking anywhere is not a good idea.  Even young families could not walk down the hill

The only down side that I would love for the hotel to have a better place to dance hear music and a nice bar to hang out  with the group of people of my age. I went to the tango Restaurant  and felt out of lace to much young people and the food was not good at all. The dance floor was so small I really didn't enjoy it.  I end up going to Mark Hopton Hotel there was good music great people . nice atmosphere I had a great time there we end up standing there all night ,  Something that I would have done if the fair mount Hotel had the same dancing place to hang out.

review.title: Absolutey fantastic weekend stay in SF
review.reviewText: The room was beautiful and extremely clean with no annoyances of any kind---no dripping faucet, runny toilet or broken drawers.  Great attention to detail in all respects.  Keurig coffee pot is a huge bonus.  The towels were so big and soft.  Room was VERY quiet (inside court view side).  No traffic noise, no neighbor or hall noise, just very peaceful and luxurious.  Shower head was perfect, plus a nice big tub for soaking.  The bed was wonderful!  I got an excellent sleep both nights.  The hallway carpets were so plush and soft to walk on.  Everything was CLEAN. Love the historic photos along all the hallway walls. Very convenient and soothing dining room experiences.
review.positiveRemarks: Its historic background, the luxurious decor, beautiful lobby, comfortable, clean and quiet room. Every single staff member was cheerful and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish the room shades were blackout. Nothing major!
review.locationRemarks: Directly on the MUNI and cable car route, easy access for Uber drivers, beautiful CIty views.

review.title: Grand Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel with a lot of history. Very clean rooms and comfortable bedding. Perched at the top of California and Mason streets. Be warned that walking from the Hotel is a pretty steep walk in all directions, but there are always taxis waiting to take you where ever you want to right on the street. Located in a nice part of San Francisco, about a 30 minute walk to Fishermans warf, and about 20 minutes to Union Square and BART

review.title: Solid Hotel, No Complaints.

review.title: Beautiful old hotel, but not all rooms are equal
review.reviewText:
My wife and I loved this historic hotel.  It's really 2 different hotels, so know what you are booking.  There is the original 5-story hotel with beautiful touches.  And there is the 20+ story tower that is much newer.  We stayed in the original hotel so we can't comment on the tower.  Though the front desk staff were eager to upcharge us to move to the tower.  The only benefit I can see in the new tower is the view.  But we don't stay in hotels for the view... we get out and see the city.

In our room, the walls were paper-thin.  We heard conversations (at normal level...no shouting) in the next room.  I don't think this is this is typical of all their rooms since we don't see a lot of reviews that mention it.
review.positiveRemarks: Fantastic old touches.  Well-preserved classic hotel.  Very recently updated rooms (with plenty of outlets for all your devices)
review.negativeRemarks: sound dampening between rooms
review.locationRemarks:
It's San Francisco... there's everything to do near by.

It's located at the intersection of the two cable-car routes so it's easy to get anywhere

review.title: Nice hotel but not for the casual traveler
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel but way overpriced. Staff helpful but nothing out of the ordinary. I've stayed in high end hotels all over the world. Probably fine for the business traveler who has a huge expense account. Otherwise, for the traveler who wants to use a hotel for a staging area, there are better ones. I booked this for a mother-daughter birthday getaway. We spent very little time in the hotel; were out exploring the city all day, every day.
review.negativeRemarks: It's fine for what it is intended, the spare-no-expense international traveler.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to cable cars and short walks to tour buses. Short means extremely steep streets.

review.title: One of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in !
review.reviewText: The staff weren't helpful at all . I requested for our sheets to be changed since they were not cleaned . They didn't . Once I called again they said it's too late ! Wait till tmr . I was in shock ! The room was not clean at all . Coffee machine was broken . There were only one glass in the room . Long story short it was a disaster !

review.title: first class plus
review.reviewText: The hotel is on Nob Hill so walking to restaurants, parks, beaches is fairly easy. Coming back, uphill, is another story; for that you might want to Lyft it
review.negativeRemarks: more smiles in the restaurant

review.title: Amazing stay!
review.reviewText: Every detail of our stay was excellent. From the amazing view of San Francisco bay to the convenience of valet parking and the superb condition of the room.  I've stayed at a lot of hotels in the city and this one is number one in my book at this point.

review.title: Sorry, but I expected better.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the SF Fairmont for two nights (this past Saturday and Sunday).  I expected so much more from this "luxury resort".  In the past, I have worked as the guest services manager of a 5 star resort.  I know what is to be to expected as a guest of a luxury resort of this caliber.   Unfortunately, I felt let down.  From the stained and tattered sofas in the lobby, one robe (with two hangers) hanging in the bathroom, to the elevators with buttons that would not light up, the hotel seems tired and old.  My biggest complaint was at 5:45am on Sunday morning, when I called to the concierge to ask what time the gym opened.  I was told "6am".  I went down to the fitness center/spa at 6am and found the doors locked and a sign that read that they opened at 7am on weekends.  When I went by the fitness center later, I was told that the concierge mistakenly says that "all the time".   I rarely write poor reviews, but I would have to give this hotel 3-stars, based on this visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Definitely needs a makeover or facelift.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't care for the location, as it is difficult to walk to sights.  Not centrally located.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel but value is just not there!
review.reviewText: My son and I stayed in this hotel.  The hotel is beautiful but the staff and service were terrible.  We had a $115 in room breakfast which was scrambled eggs and 1 bagel with a fruit bowl.  The milk was sour.  We left the hotel for 7+ hours 10am-almost 6pm.  When we returned, our room smelled like sour milk as the dishes had not been cleared nor the room cleaned.  The internet cost $14 a day and was not working half the time.  The business center charged for use of the computer by the minute.  WHen I'm paying $600+ for a jr suite at a hotel I do not like being nickel and dimed to death.  It took 2 calls to get the room cleaned at 8pm and the next morning before 8am the maids (who were obviously mad from the previous night) were turning on our room lights and waking us up.  We are so low maintenance it's a joke in our family but this was a firmly disappointing experience.  DON"T OVERPAY FOR BAD SERVICE HERE!

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Fairmont Hotel, perfect for enjoying San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is my second stay at the Fairmont and hopefully not my last. The location is ideal, not far from Grace Cathedral, walking distance to many places, beautiful grand lobby, gracious staff not only at the counter but including the maids who attend the rooms.  We enjoyed afternoon tea in Laurel Court and one evening enjoyed wine and cocktails in the bar area. This visit I choose to stay in the original building -- Room 226 which was very comfortably decorated and had a nice view overlooking a small garden & fountain and views of the city including the Transamerica Building.  Very quiet room, peaceful room.
review.positiveRemarks: The old world elegant & charm, the friendly but professional staff, the location within the city, and it's a very dog friendly hotel.

review.title: It was Christmas Eve
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was beautifully decorated with a giant tree and a large gingerbread house. Children and adults were all over the place! We have to say, however, our parking was free, so thank you, Expedia!  The Tonga Room was so fun!  It has a Hawaiian theme with a ceiling waterfall and a lake in the middle of the floor.  A live band climbed onto a secure raft, drifted onto the lake, and performed great songs.  That was the highlight of our evening!
review.positiveRemarks: The accommodations were wonderful as we were upgraded to a comfortable king-size bed. The room was spacious as well as was the lovely bathroom.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText:
I was here on a quick business trip so I didn't get to enjoy the room and the view as much as I would have liked. It was a really great room with 2 caveats: wifi costs $14 or so/day to access and the shower water is pretty tepid. The first night I took a shower hoping that the temperature would get warmer, but it never went past lukewarm. Concierge sent an engineer to work on it, and he turned the temperature up as high as it could go. When I took a shower the next evening, it was a vast improvement, but it was still shy of the heat that I normally prefer. I don't know if it was because I had the handicap access room, but I've never been in a hotel room that had such a low temperature setting for its showers. That's difficult for me as a good shower is one of the best parts of the day. 

I had an excellent meal at the hotel and would be more than happy to go there to eat again.
review.positiveRemarks: Everyone working there was very good and the service was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi - they could have a lower bandwidth and a higher paid bandwidth. Hotter showers.

review.reviewText: Had a good time but $100.00 per person for brunch is ridiculous.

review.title: Wonderful Iconic Hotel
review.reviewText:
We had a marvelous experience at The Fairmont. The hotel is dressed to the nines for Christmas, which makes the already elaborate detail even more spectacular. Location is conveniently near Union Square and trolley stops. The higher floor rooms in the tower have great views of the city in every direction.

If you have time visit the Tonga Room in the old pool room, but make a reservation. Even the bar tables were booked up. Expect to pay city prices for drinks and food, though they're hard to escape in San Francisco. 

The staff was attentive, remembering our names and helping however they could. The only frustration we experienced was the wait at the valet, which isn't a reflection of the hotel itself but rather the tight streets around the block.
Classic Hotel, but WIFI should be included and Valet could be faster.....

review.title: Overrated and unbecoming
review.reviewText:
I stayed five nights at a during the holidays and will not make the mistake of staying there again in the future. 
The tower rooms are spacious and with a great view (I stayed at the 20th floor). However, the room had several maintenance issues: (1) the doors of the closet were not closing off properly, leaving the closet light on permanently and had to report it even though it was extremely hard to close them completely (how did housekeeping miss it, it´s still a mystery); (2) the furniture was chipped and there wasn´t even an attempt to put some glue on it during my stay; (3) the door of the bathroom had peculiar stains; (4) the windows were greasy and dirty from the inside diminishing the quality of the view; (5) I had to call three times over a three hour period to have my room service cart removed from my room; (6) the quality of the food was substandard from both room service and the restaurant, including the Christmas brunch; and finally (7) it was really hard to enjoy the beautiful building because it was overcrowded with the gingerbread house visitors wandering all over the place.

review.title: Grand old hotel atop Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: Old style elegance, great service. Try to stay in the older part for charm, the towers if you want modern with a view (but a little more homogenized).  The only caution is that it is atop Nob Hill, so be prepared to walk steep hills, or take taxis. Finally, the staff is absolutely fantastic.
Grand hotel with old fashioned charm. Loved the room

review.title: Our stay was so perfect for the holidays
review.reviewText: My daughter and I go to San Francisco every year for the holidays to shop and go to great restaurants. Mission accomplished . Our room 514 was the perfect room with spectacular views from three hugh windows. I would stay at this hotel again !! The staff made this trip wonderful, so professional.

review.title: Great room and service

review.title: Christmas in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We booked the Fairmont because they had a special with no parking fees. We upgraded to a "city" view and it was worth every cent! We stayed just one night and it was the highlight of our Christmas season.
Loved the beautiful tree and gingerbread house in the lobby! All the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We want to make it an annual trip and would definitely stay at the Fairmont again! Dennis and Patty Dunbar (Guests on 12/21/14.)
review.positiveRemarks: The history and ambience of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance of the cable cars, Union Square and fabulous restaurants!

review.title: Hotel nickel and dimes you!
review.reviewText:
When we arrived we were told that the hotel was "oversold" for the evening and they would upgrade us to a "suite." My husband and I were excited and we agreed. WRONG choice! The suite looked like the last person that stayed there was from the 19th century and the place smelled musty! The next morning we moved to a regular room. That room was okay except the toliet didn't flush correctly! Also maid service was sketchy, most days they just made the bed and folded the towels. Also they forgot to refill tolietries. 
We were charged for Internet which was ridiculous because we joined the president's club. The staff in General was helpful however I left my phone charger in the previous room and it is now "lost forever."
Another complaint is the health club which they charged $10 a/day for! This is ridiculous for a four star hotel! Any kind of amenitie which is normally free at any other hotel including budget motels we were charged for at the Fairmount! The Fairmount concierge was not very helpful; while we understand Christmas is a busy time and staff is short they need to have more people on. Also we did the Gingerbread Tea which was nice but not $212 nice!
Overall our experience was mediocre at best.

review.title: San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice central location but traffic is insane. Do not try to show up in the middle of the afternoon. We walked a lot because everything is only about a mile away but the hills are at 45 degree angles so be prepared for a workout.

review.locationRemarks: Lots of places to eat and things to see. Book Alcatraz at least a week in advance. Many things are close enough to walk to but the hills are steep.

We didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant because the hotel is so close to Union Square and all the choices there. This place definitely isn't in our budget for regular stays in the city, but for special occasions, we will definitely come back.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the view, the staff, the lobby!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.

review.title: Beautiful hotel located in a posh neighbourhood.
review.reviewText: Despite a power outage caused by torrential rains, I enjoyed my stay.

This is a beautiful hotel, especially around the holidays.  We enjoyed our stay.  However, we had some trouble with the shower, and it took 3 phone calls for maintenance to finally arrive.  We waited 45 minutes to take a shower!  We were compensated with two free beverage tickets which we were unable to use as we needed to check out and be on our way.

review.title: Just wonderful!
review.reviewText: Survived the 'great storm' at this luxury hotel. Decorated beautifully for Christmas and the staff treat everyone with kindness and respect. Great service and the refurbishment has ensured that this hotel remains as THE place to stay in SF.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay with us. While I'm happy you decided to join us after a fantastic stay 15 years ago, I'm sorry to hear this visit wasn't as memorable. There is certainly no excuse for the mistakes with the in-room dining order and I apologize for the overall sloppiness of the stay. This is not indicative of the level of service we strive to provide. I hope that you would be willing to return and allow us the opportunity to give you the experience you deserve.
Sincerely,
Lucas

review.title: Disappointing stay
review.reviewText:
I had anticipated staying at the Fairmont as I remembered a fantastic stay about 15 years ago. However this stay was different. I felt the attention to detail was lost and service was sloppy. This isn't a hotel I can easily afford so it was depressing to not be thrilled with the quality of service and the room.
My husband and I were there this past weekend and we're looking forward to being spoiled. We ordered room service for breakfast but they only got half the order right. Silly things like 2 coffees but 1 orange juice for the continental breakfast for two. I had also ordered 2 oatmeal a but just received one. Also requested a paper - marked it all on the breakfast fill out form - but they apparently ignored our order. It just ruined our breakfast in bed we were so looking forward to.
Also lights were out in our bathroom! Weird as the whole stay seemed sloppy. Something you'd expect from a Days Inn or cheaper hotel.
Anyway - they reimbursed us for our breakfast but I still felt disappointed and most likely won't be back.
It was a great stay but the room was a little small for the price.

managementResponses.response: Thanks very much and we hope to welcome you again in the future.

review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel. Love the holiday decor!  Great rate from Expedia!

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a very accommodating staff.
review.reviewText: Our first room was beautiful but had a smoke smell.  After one night when I asked if we could switch the people at the front desk were fabulous.  They immediately assigned us to a much nicer room and sent a bell man to help us make the move.  Our star was close to perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary wi-fi in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great location, good restaurants, cable car, yoga in a beautiful cathedral across the street, beautiful view

managementResponses.response: I'm happy to hear you were able to stay with us after visiting a number of times. The holidays are a special time at the hotel and I'm glad you were able to see it come to life. Thanks again and we hope to welcome you again in the future.

review.reviewText: I had been to the Fairmont for a couple of events but had never stayed there.  We were celebrating my wife's birthday and were so very pleased with everything about our stay.  The king sized bed was extremely comfortable.  We recommend the Bay view (we were on the 8th floor of the tower part of the hotel).  The bathroom has a single sink, but this was the only aspect of our stay that required just a bit of planning.  I had planned meals off the grounds, but the room service was attentive for breakfast.  All hotel staff expressed genuine interest in our happiness.  The feeling was what one would have in a boutique hotel.  The gingerbread house was 2/3 way through construction at the time of our stay and was an amazing thing to watch as the staff tended to it.  My wife had a manicure; excellent salon service, but keep in mind that it is closed on Sundays.  This was a very special place for us to stay, and we will hope to return again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed for 2 nights in November 14.  Lives up to its high rating, with excellent friendly staff, beautiful decor and a great location on Nob Hill.  Highly recommended

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Most comfortable bed, sheets & pillows, great view, lots to live

review.title: Lovely in every way
review.reviewText: The staff are professional. The food is great.  We had a clean spacious room and enjoyed drinks in the lobby area.   We would recommend the fairmont to anyone wanting a comfortable San Fran stay.

review.title: Glad we stayed here.
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont SFO is a very professionally run hotel with excellent and friendly helpful staff throughout this lovely hotel, the lobby and bar areas will stay with you forever, they are really beautiful and you can spend an eternity admiring their achictecture and layout.
However we had two rooms, one for our son who is 21, our room was a good size and layout with a view of the Garden, the room our son had had no view really just a roof and a little on the small side, that was a bit dissapointing, they did offer another room but it was on a different floor and we wanted to be close together. 
All transport is very available from the Fairmont and cabs readily available 24 hours a day, the hotel is in a very good location and really nice area, I would recommend you stay here if you want to spoil yourself, the Gingerbread House in the Lobby for Christmas is amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: The whole experience is worthwhile, staff are so friendly and helpful nothing a problem for them, made you feel welcome and the ambience of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot really think of anything at all.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is virtually on the doorstep, Chinatown did nothing for us, very seedy and give your money and leave attitude, Union Square is close.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for your kind words about the hotel. We look forward to sharing with the staff and your return.

review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely helpful. The concierges gave us excellent advice about nearby restaurants. Our room in the tower was gorgeous and we loved our stay. We hope to return soon!

review.reviewText: We had a great time in SF and staying here made it even better. Staff was very friendly. The room was cozy and and we would definitely stay here again!

Very disappointed with the service from a hotel of this reputation. Called on the consierge several times during or stay and could never get them to answer the phone. Personally witnessed a confrontation between a bellman and a cab driver that was horrendous, made worse because we were sitting in the cab at the time!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location on Nob Hill, great corner suite in the hotel.

review.title: Finally got to check in at The Fairmont
review.reviewText: I have always wanted to stay at the Fairmont SF, and never really got the opportunity until now. I liked the hotel, but it wasn't the five star experience I was hoping for. Everything was just ok, but not great. Maybe I had high expectations, but you should when you're spending hundreds of dollars a night. The grounds were a little unkempt, the gingerbread house wasn't spectacular, and the staff was a little inattentive. A doorman yelled at me, and it took 5 hours to get a crib in the room. They did comp us for that, which was nice, but I just wasn't blown away.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was pretty and we had a nice view
review.negativeRemarks: General upkeep of a legendary hotel
review.locationRemarks: At the top of Nob Hill, a short walk to China Town, Union Square shopping, restaurants and sweeping views

review.title: A Luxury Hotel at it's Best!
review.reviewText: From check in to all the services that were provided by this wonderful hotel we were 100% delighted.
review.locationRemarks: On Nob Hill the views of the city skyline and the Bay were amazing.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your kind words about the hotel. I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and hope to welcome you again in the future.

review.title: Excellent staff, accommodating. Exemplary bellman.
review.reviewText:
Every morning at 7am treated with hello and how can I help you. Remember previous request and friendly. 
Only problem was access to gym. Fees were required unless Presidents Club. Dated concept.

review.title: Perfect location & perfect view! Perfect bed, too!
review.reviewText:
Everything I asked for and more. Location is the best (5 minutes walk to Union Square, but being off Union Square it's not busy or noisy) - I didn't mind the slope going up to the hotel.  It's a very easy walk if you are reasonably fit (but I do see a problem for elderly or those who are less mobile).

Loved the lobby and corridor decor - super classy.  I kind of felt instantly richer just by sitting in the bar lounge.  The serving of food was very big (ordered the salmon flatbread, was expecting 2 pieces but there were 8...).

The view from the tower room is AMAZING.  The room's very big and the bathroom's extremely spacious (with separate bath and shower).  Loved the scent of the toiletries.  Most comfortable bed ever.

The staff was very friendly.  The doorman was heaps good.  I only requested a regular taxi to the airport and he got me a "sedan" (hired car) because it charged a fixed fee ($55) and was probably cheaper than a taxi anyway given the traffic at that time.

Had a couple of house keeping issues but the house keeping manager Julie was very professional and was able to sort those out quickly.

Expensive wi-fi ($13.99 for a 24-hour period) but I knew about this when I booked so I can't complain.
review.positiveRemarks: Location; View; Decor; Bathroom; Service; Staff; Bed; Blanket.  Almost everything.
review.negativeRemarks: House keeping (the room wasn't completely cleaned up before I checked in, but the issue was resovled quickly).
review.locationRemarks: The hotel's so amazing that I would have been happy to just stay inside the hotel for the whole duration of my visit.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your very kind words about the hotel. I'm thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us and enjoyed the history of the property. As you mentioned we are fortunate to be centrally located with access to man of the City's most desirable locations. Thanks again and we hope to welcome you again in the future.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a lot of history!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco is one of the best hotels to stay at in San Francisco.  The rooms are lovely, clean, and comfortable with all the amenities you need.  Our view was beautiful!  The location is good.  It is easy to get to all the sites in San Francisco from the hotel's location.  The hotel itself is beautiful!  We love the architecture of the hotel, and it's rich history!  We would recommend The Fairmont San Francisco to anyone travelling to the area!
review.positiveRemarks: We like the rooms, the views, the amenities, the location, the architecture, and the rich history of the hotel!

review.locationRemarks: The Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the shopping district, Chinatown, Gagliardelli Park are all easy to get to from The Fairmont.

review.title: Stunning historic hotel with stellar service
review.reviewText: We stayed at this gorgeous hotel for two nights during Halloween weekend along with another couple. Staff was excellent and although we probably were not clientele they usually receive (we are younger couples, and not as affluent) we did not feel as though we treated any differently. What was strange is that our friends' room was at least 50% larger albeit having booked the same exact room. It was mine and my husbands' 10 year anniversary and we did receive complimentary chocolate covered strawberries (which is always lovely), but we all thought it a bit strange? Otherwise wonderful hotel in a great location and would certainly stay again. Beautifully updated yet it has retained its' historic charm. I might add that wifi is not included and neither is breakfast, but if you sign up for the Presidents' club I believe they do provide wifi free of charge. We enjoyed exploring nearby breakfast/brunch places. Be prepared to walk steep inclines! Loved every second of it and will be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautifully updated historic hotel, wonderful service. Perfect location.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was not as comfortable as I would have thought it would be. Same for my husband. Could lower wifi prices

review.title: Old World Charm in the Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Fairmont has the perfect location in San Francisco -- just minutes from the Fisherman's Warf, Union Square, the Financial District, Chinatown and North Beach.  Beautiful lobby and facilities, it is the perfect place to stay when in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: China Town, Union Square, North Beach, Financial District

review.title: Good but to be outstanding it needs free wifi
review.reviewText: At the top of Nob Hill this is one of the best hotels in SF. We had two rooms both without a view(623 & 625) we had requested a view but the rooms had been recently refurbished to a very high standard and to upgrade was 90$ per night per room so we didn't bother. I would have expected a few extra things in a 5* hotel. Unlike The Shelbourne in Dublin or the Fairmont in Canada, here everything  was an extra. There is NO  free wifi, and no complementarywater anywhere in the hotel. Only Valet parking allowed and at a charge of course. It depends what you're looking for; personally I wasn't bothered that we had no turndown service we had a good time and we will return to SF and may stay here. But the Stanford/International and the Scarlet Huntington are all in the same square so I will be checking them out first.

review.title: Had a lovely time

review.title: Lousy Service
review.reviewText:
They got it wrong right from the booking.
They sent me an open and used bottle of Jam with my croissant. When I called In room dining about it, they apologized, but didn't offer to send another bottle. Considering there is a $5 room service charge and a 20% gratuity over that, I think this service was unacceptable. Has to be one of my worst Fairmont experiences. 
The waiter in the coffee shop in the lobby was very specific that he had just one coffee machine and he was just the one staff waiting at that time(3pm) and as such the Espresso would take 15 mins. 
Like I said, Lousy service. For that money, I'll stay elsewhere. Has to be one of my worst Fairmont experiences.
review.negativeRemarks: Loads. Too long a list

review.title: Fabulous hotel with an amazing foyer.
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the most impressive I have stayed in.  The foyer is huge, breathtaking with beautiful marble and gold everywhere.  Very opulent and luxurious.  The bedroom was newly refurbished and spacious.  The staff were very attentive and gave 6 star service.  I would definitely stay here the next time we are in San Francisco.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for commenting on your recent stay with us. I'm very pleased you found the hotel nice and conveniently located. I can appreciate your preference for more drawer space and will share your feedback with the team. Thanks again and we hope to welcome you again in the future.

review.title: Very nice and convenient
review.reviewText:
The only negative comment would be that we wish that there had been more drawer storage space.  The only drawers were two in a nightstand.  We stayed for 3 nights and had planned on completely unpacking our suitcases, place the contents in drawers and on hangers, and repacking for the rest of our trip.  There was plenty of closet hanging space (not necessary for our wardrobes) and a couple of 12" wide shelves.  In addition there was only 1 luggage rack in the room.
The hotel is lovely, comfortable, and beautiful with a friendly staff.  We enjoyed are stay at the Fairmont San Francisco Nob Hill.  It was very convenient for reaching the various sites.  And the free parking as part of our package was greatly appreciated.  The parking lot staff was very patient, helpful, and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: See above "Write about your experience" remarks.

review.title: Our stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel which is in a great location.  The staff was awesome except for the hostess in the Tiki Bar.  She was a bit rude but other than that it was great.  I would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really

review.title: low end 5*

lobby smaller than expected. didnt like the hilly walk to union so too tiring. this hotel is away from most areas and a lot of walking is required. my room never had a nice view just the roof of older rooms. the trolley always has a long line difficult to get on one.
staff are very rude, only a couple people and conceirege were nice, checkin and door man very unhelpful. more information provided about the local area would be useful. room service was very poor standard and very expensive. the sandwich made was soo basic. they always expect tips which i am not accustomed to. nice cafe downstairs . the only reason this hotel is woww is because of its history nopthing else.the location is awful to many homeless people around.

review.title: Room with an Amazing View
review.reviewText:
Stayed on 23rd floor overlooking the bay, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge and Coit Tower. 
Beautiful facility with excellent service. Bed was extremely comfortable with nice linens. 
Breakfast was delicious but very costly at $100 for 2 without tip or alcohol. 
Be prepared to take taxi for sure up to the hotel and caution walking down. Not meant for folks with any limited mobility. Leave heels at home !!

review.reviewText: I had a terrific experience at this San Francisco Landmark hotel.  The service and room were top notch and live up to the Fairmont reputation.  The Fairmont's location surpasses all of the other grand hotels in San Francisoco

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText:
Booked this hotel with the free parking included and half price room with the Expedia deal and was surprised to receive an upgrade from a queen room to a king without even asking.  The hotel has been completely renovated and the rooms are awesome, 10 foot ceilings, new beds, carpet and furniture with down pillows as well which we love.  Room is very comfortable and quiet with a great location to Union Station shopping, the Wharf, Chinatown and little Italy for meals.  

Hotel is close to everything and to get there you are going downhill, coming back means you are going uphill, no surprise you are in San Francisco after all.  Highly recommend this hotel !!!!

review.title: Beautiful hotel close to union square

review.title: Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In.
review.reviewText:
This is by far and away the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rudeness of the staff is beyond believable.  
We were a little noisy which admittedly a little unacceptable on our part however instead of asking us to keep it down, they asked is to leave with no warning or request to keep it down leaving us with nowhere else to go which is totally unacceptable.
Aside from this, the room was small a bit dirty and not what you'd expect from the outside. 
To add the cherry on top of the cake, my partner was offered drugs by staff there which goes to show what a classless place this really is.
My advise DO NOT STAY HERE!!

review.title: The one and only Fairmont San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Fairmont was the culmination of our Family holiday along the West Coast of the US. We couldn't have hoped for a more beautiful hotel, better room or more accommodating staff than at the Fairmont. The location atop Nob Hill afforded stunning views of the City.  My only concern is that other hotels will fail to live up to the same standards in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel deserves a less utilitarian spa
review.locationRemarks: It is in the heart of SF. Everything is in hill climbing distance of the hotel.

review.title: Conveniently located;  part of SF history!
review.reviewText: A historical monument of San Francisco at the heart of down town. Well maintained and with food facilities.

review.title: Luxury in San Francisco
review.reviewText: If you love history and historic buildings you will appreciate the pedigree of the Fairmont San Francisco.  This is a completely up-to-date modern hotel with all the amenities and luxurious details you could dream of.  A city view is worth the indulgence, even if it is cloudy.
review.positiveRemarks: History, cleanliness and high quality of furnishings and bedding.  Loved the old photos!!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk DOWN THE HILL to Union Square.  This hotel is high on a hilltop, not for everyone.

review.title: avoid at all costs
review.reviewText: Although the hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are very basic.  They nickle and dime you at every single turn.  Despite the fact that the room was very expensive, the valet service for the car was $70 per night and you had no in and out privileges.  There was not even a free water bootle in the room itself.  I needed to use the conference room and it was beyond archaic.  The center itself did not have a person on staff and there were no pens, staplers or anything else one may need in addition to the fact that the printer was broken.  I needed to fax a 10 page report because there was no scanning ability.  the first page was $3 and the next 9 pages were $2 each.  Also the on site gym was no better than any other hotel gym and in fact not as good as many.  Despite that, to use it was another additional $15 charge.  I will stick with the St. Regis and Four Seasons thank you very much.  Oh also, we only stayed one night.  Check out at 11.  Despite this we had maid service knocking on our door at 8am!  why would a room be made up before we check out?
review.negativeRemarks: rates for nearly everything are outrageous.

review.title: Upmarket area
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel but if you want to be in the heart stay around union square.  This is nice but a good up hill walk to get to town and back.  Or you could catch the trolley bus

review.title: Good  hotel
review.reviewText: Good staff, great customer service. Room clean and comfortable. Would recommend  although you need to be fit to walk up Nob Hill.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
This must rate as one of our all time best hotel experiences. A great location in a great city, superb service and a very relaxing bar and restaurant. The Tonga Room is well worth a visit just to see it.

Highly recommended.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location with a great roof garden

review.title: A high quality classic hotel oozing with class
review.reviewText:
We arrived in san francisco mid way through our calafornia road trip. Leavimg the sunhine and outdoors of yoesemite behind, the fairmont was a becon of utter luxury. The newly decorated bedroom was very tasteful and comfortable and spaceous. We had a double queen room for a familyof 4 and it was ample size. Very clean bathroom, theost luxurious bedding  and stunning bar, lobby area. Location wise, there was a trolley stop to the piers and fishermans wharf right outside the hotel and it was easy to walk to union square for shopping and china town. The only dowm side was the price of breakfast (Apprpx 40 $ each)
We enjoyed coffee and pastries at the downstaors coffee shoptuch more!

review.title: A GRAND OLD HOTEL
review.reviewText: This is the nicest hotel that I have stayed at in many years. The room was huge and well appointed. terrific coffee shop on site
review.negativeRemarks: nothning
review.locationRemarks: close to cable car lines

review.title: Top Class Hotel
review.reviewText: From the minute we arrived everything was top class. Great Service.  Room upgrade without request - room was top class and the view amazing.  Great history to the hotel - my 15year old daughter and I were intrigued by previous guests and loved the Tony Bennett connection - his first performance of San Fran hit was sang here.    Front desk clerk (again without asking) recommended cocktails at Tonga Bar as happy hour on Friday and apparently best Mai Tai in San Fran and she was right!  We had dinner there later in the evening food was great as were the rest of the cocktails.  Live entertainment and dancing great way to finish off our holiday.  Have to give a particular mention to Bash who looked after us in Tonga - top top man.  I can't wait to return.  Great rate from Expedia too.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in was rather slow but it was Friday evening.
review.locationRemarks: Great location over looking San Fran everything close by

review.title: clueless and expensive
review.reviewText: The hotel security, the same guy as a matter of fact, questioned me about if I was a guest or not, told me on one occasion, at 4:30 am that I had to go! I think it was because I was from the east coast and woke up early because I was still on EST! They started to serve free coffee at 4:15 am! I was there to get coffee, yet I was interrogated two consecutive mornings about my right to be there despite the fact that I was paying hundreds of dollars per night for the room! Two mornings in a row? Really? Plus, 10 dollars for a bowel of rice crispies! I will not stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: forget the cable cars, they are impossible to get on

review.title: huge rooms lovely hotel
review.reviewText: The only downside is that you can hear your neighbors next door, but other than that the rooms are extremely spacious, clean, and fully equipped with everything u need.

review.title: Good location but not very cosmopolitan
review.reviewText: Good location but lacking certain basic amenities like a laundry bag, docking station, digital clock in the room, etc. looked like it was better than other hotels around but still seemed lacking.

review.title: The only hotel to stay at in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The customer service is always on point, the beds so comfy the fitness facilities so amazing and the hotel restaurant never let's me down.   Our room was a bit, not spic and span, it just looked like someone dumped coffee in the sink and there was one clearly used towel but not a big deal!

review.title: Room with a beautiful view
review.reviewText: We stayed in a recently renovated corner executive suite in the tower, which had wonderful views of the city.   It was nicely appointed, but I think the walls are a little thin.  We could plainly hear other guests opening and closing doors, turning on the shower, etc.   We also heard loud thumping music on Saturday night probably coming from a wedding reception.   Luckily, we put on the TV and drifted off to sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, professional & welcoming staff.   Mattress & bed linens were comfortable -- we slept like babies.   Loved the Keurig coffee maker too!
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wi-fi would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf & lots of restaurants.  Cable cars stop across the street, although you may have to wait an hour to get on one.

review.title: Rich in Tradition but lacks in customer service.
review.reviewText: Very expensive, food was terrible, rooms are tiny for the price.  Oh and the upgraded room at $60 with a view over looking the rooftop of the lower level was laughable!  My wife and I celebrated our 10 year anniversary and made this clear to the hotel.  Well, we were expecting an acknowledgment of our celebration but it never came. They input my name backwards in the system and while it didn't bother me my wife asked twice if they could correct it and call us by our proper surname but until the day we checked out it was incorrect. The only thing I enjoyed was the cocktail at Tonga's and I'm not a drinker so that doesn't really count because anything would probably have sufficed.

review.title: Beautiful hotel but uncomfortable bed
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont Hotel is a quintessential San Francisco experience. The premises are gorgeous, and the staff is excellent -- friendly and helpful.  I had booked a King "exterior" room which promised a view, and it delivered -- I had a beautiful view of the Transamerica tower, the bay bridge and the bay in the distance.  The room furnishings had been recently updated and it was classic and beautiful.  My huge disappointment was that when I went to get into bed, I discovered that the mattress was worn and had two deep valleys from the body impressions of previous guests, with a big lump between them.  ICK.  I'd showered and it was late and I didn't want to deal with moving to another room.  So I had an uncomfortable night.  It was a huge  let-down after everything else was stellar.  That room deserved a really great bed.

When I checked out the next day, I told the desk person about the bed.  He was quite apologetic ("the bed is the most important part of a  hotel stay," he said) and comped my parking fee (which is pricey) and a few incidental room charges to make up for it.  So I left satisfied but felt that I'd be wary about checking the bed before I settled into the room if I were to stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, wonderful views, historic quality of hotel, beautiful appointments in hotel and in room.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds should be updated often and checked for comfort.  In room snack charges were outrageously high, gouging.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, cable car stop near by.  Be aware that hotel is at top of Nob Hill so that any walking will require a massive uphill walk to return.

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: After paying so much for the rooms, I didn't like being charged extra for everything here.  Parking and internet was a big added expense. Breakfast was really overpriced. The one bar has a Hawaiian theme that's straight from Disneyland. The band floats on a barge and rain falls from the ceiling. Bad drinks in '70's ceramic coconut containers.  Not what I expected for the price.  We'll stay somewhere else next time.

The Fairmont San Francisco was excellent!!  The room we stayed in was a two bedroom suite. This was an upgrade. What a surprise! Hotel was everything we wanted and more.  Beautiful lobby and extremely clean rooms and a great location. The view from the hotel was amazing.

review.title: Safe hotel
review.reviewText:
I really loved this hotel
Had a relaxing time

Around my attractions

Staff are lovely and helpful

Room are large

review.title: Fantastic Hotel, fantastic position
