review.reviewText: Friendly staff, comfortable bed after multiple flights, recommended.

review.title: Excellent Landmark Hotel - Impressive Facility
review.reviewText: We chose the Fairmont as our "Landmark - Marquee" hotel for our stay in San Francisco. Needles to say, the property lives up to that assessment and more.  The lobby exudes history, sophistication and classic refinement, yet it's attendants afford it quite a welcoming and refreshing touch warmth and hospitality, even for such a large facility, you are made to feel at home, welcome and truly serviced. The rooms are very clean and the service was impeccable. Be weary of space when booking but, generally, we were very satisfied with the accommodations and would gladly return.  The sheer feeling of arriving at the Fairmont San Francisco, or leaving for a day in the city, amidst the cool San Fran Breeze or the breathtaking views along the cross streets that line its walls are testament to the historic beauty of the site, the city and the property. Close enough to all areas of interest in San Fran, yet standing imposing and ever-present atop the echelons of Nob Hill and its vicinity, the Fairmont is the quintessential San Francisco hotel destination.
review.positiveRemarks: Breathtaking lobby and imposing facilities , friendliness of staff , genuine availability and disposition to serve. Amenities are laudable.
review.negativeRemarks: Some services are cost-excessive, i.e. $65 to park.,
review.locationRemarks: All San Francisco tourist/interest spots are nearby.  Very close to all points of interest.

review.title: Great hotel, but on top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent and service was good as expected, except that the complimentary coffee products were not filled daily.  The hotel is located centrally, but you should be aware it is on top of Nob Hill, which means that a walk to almost anywhere (shops, restaurants, etc) requires the negotiation of steep streets unless you take a cable car or cab, both of which are expensive.  If you like to walk as we do, this is a problem.  Also, I would not recommend renting a car as parking in the hotel's garage was a ridiculous $65 overnight.  Some public parking facilities in the area are a little cheaper.  For that matter, parking anywhere in SF is costly.  This is why we wanted to be able to walk to various destinations.  If you have trouble walking up and down steep hills, be prepared to spend alot on cabs, cable cars or other public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: Five star is a true representation of the quality of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much could be improved except for not having to remind the housekeeping staff to refill the complimentary coffee products.
review.locationRemarks: There are many high end shops, malls, restaurants and sights to see within a reasonable distance of the hotel.

review.reviewText: Great. Just didn't like that the staff could be a bit rude and the gym was an additional charge which is ridicules to me.

review.title: Iconic hotel in an iconic city!
review.reviewText: Every member of staff which i spoke to was extremely courteous and professional, a top class hotel - the reputation of the hotel is well justified.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, hotel...whats not to like!
review.negativeRemarks: To be supplied with a map of the hotel when you check in would be useful.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very central however it is at the top of a very steep bank, not easy for the unfit or people in wheelchairs to access.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: San Francisco is an exhausting city mostly when you just flew from the east coast. The Fairmont is the Ace to stay at to get some rest and discover the City. Highly recommended.

Well-maintained historic hotel; great location on Nob Hill; it is a large hotel - the Huntington Hotel down the block is more quiet and more charming - but this is a solid hotel. The new décor is modern and fresh.

review.title: Great hotel at san francisco
review.reviewText:
It one of the best places to stay in 
San francisco.  Its wonderful clean a nice view and very close to the cable train stations.  I'll stay again without thinking.

review.title: Terrible room assignment
review.reviewText: I booked through expedia with the free parking deal. Customers are given least desirable room if third party is used almost to punish. That is not honest. If Fairmont does not like reservations with expedia, then just don't allow it and let those rooms that faces the cables and other hard wares of hotel go with lower price. My room view was horrible especially knowing that you cashed out 125 some dollars you could get beautiful view which other reviewers are talking about. Lobby was impressive but you dont need to stay there to have a look. not too close to Market street or waterfront. Hotel was empty. Front desk clerk did not bother assigning little less claustrophobic room in view of low occupancy. By the way their service gave me impression that they were still in training .hyatt, Marriott does far better than this.  Overall I expected more from Fairmont and even I am Presedintal member would not choose Fairmont any time soon.

review.title: Nice loby.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very nice.  The staff was very friendly and the loby was very 
 pretty.

Hotel was great.  Fantastic location and stunning lobby.  Staff was just OK. Line for cars was long at times and hotel was looking to change you more and move you to more expensive rooms while other hotels I have stayed looked to upgrade you complimentary.  Nice but you will pay for everything.

review.title: weekend getaway
review.reviewText: Great  place to stay. Close to everything. Staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: a list of prices for taxi's, cable car, etc. also best way to get around the city
review.locationRemarks: The golden gate bridge of course and Muir Woods. Alcatraz and route 1

review.title: Nice comfy place to stay and it's quiet.
review.reviewText: Really nice no problems at all, honestly I could not fault it at all.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs an extractor fan in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Fransisco what more can you say, China Town is close by and the cable cares are also handy.

review.title: Staff is impeccable.
review.reviewText: The rooms in the old section were remodeled in the past month!  They are beautifully done.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel with beautiful views.
review.reviewText: Area clean with an easy walk down to Embarcadero and points beyond.  Rooms, hallways and lobby absolutely gorgeous.  A great experience.
review.locationRemarks: Easy cab ride to restaurants and events.

review.title: AMAZING
review.reviewText:
Had an amazing stay at the Fairmont. We upgraded to a Signature King Room facing the San Francisco bay and the views were to die for! We saw the 4th of July Fireworks. I would highly recommend the upgrade.
Only issue was the noise from the adjoining rooms is quite loud. The adjoining rooms can be accessed through an internal door - which is locked but the noise feels as though the door is open. Commented on this to staff when checking out so hopefully they will look into it.

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff, beautiful hotel. Would stay again, but we could only have afforded this hotel due to Expedia. 
You pay for what you get and this place isn't cheap, when you enter the hotel you can see why. A little bit of a trek to union square or fishermans wharf on foot, but doable if you're healthy. Loved our stay.

review.title: Great hotel near Chinatown and union square.
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is decorated beautifully, the pictures all along the hallway displays the hotels great history.
Location on top of nob hill was a tough climb. Trolley cars were often full so we had to walk several times.

review.title: Beautiful, historic hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco is a beautiful hotel.  The location is great with lots to do within walking distance or with a short trolley ride.  The only issue I had at all was that the staff in the restaurant was quite slow.  Other than that, all other staff members were attentive, friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel in the centre of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, room furnishings were to a high standard, staff very good, cleanliness excellent
review.positiveRemarks: Its location, quality feel about the place
review.negativeRemarks: Get double glazing. If you have a room facing the street the noise levels are intolerable, starting from 0600hrs till after midnight very little sleep

review.title: Fabulous & Friendly
review.reviewText: A unique combination of high style and relaxed comfort-it made our 5-day stay in San Fran perfect! The setting, location, and ambiance ate hard to beat!

review.title: first time at fairmont
review.reviewText: Always wanted to stay at the Fairmont.  Excellent customer service from all staff members.  Breakfast too expensive, 40  dollars.  Great location.  They need to complete renovation of restaurant/bar on 23rd floor of tower.
review.negativeRemarks: top floor restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Easy to walk, ride cable cars to all points of interest in downtown San Francisco

review.title: Classic hotel in a perfect SF location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fairmont for 4-nights. Our room had recently been renovated, was very comfortable and we would highly recommend it. The location is atop Nobs Hill, which is a great, central location in San Francisco. A short walk down to Union Square for shopping.. and equally not far to Fishermans Wharf for views of Alcatraz, Golden Gate, etc. The only downside with the hotel is that there is no complimentary Wifi - the cost was $18 for one day! Which is staggering. Amazes me that hotels still charge for wifi for paying guests. Other than that, no problems at all.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi should really be provided complimentary for paying guests, or at least at a significantly reduced cost.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and Union Square (10-mins walk). Fishermans Wharf for access to Alcatraz, Golden Gate tours etc (15-20 minute walk). Chinatown (10-min walk).

review.title: Outstanding!
review.reviewText: Amazing experience! Great view and wonderful staff. The beds were like sleeping on a cloud.
We had an excellent experience at the Fairmont Hotel. Everything was first class.

review.title: Not a five star hotel
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because they offered free parking with the package and a decent price for a Sunday/Monday night stay.  The staff was professional and pleasant.  The room as small but nice.  There was a refrigerator inside the room, but it was filled with drinks and whatever else was provided.  I wished there was room for me to put my own food and drinks.  Internet access was available for a price.  I felt that even though people paid good money to stay at a nicer hotel, the hotel will still try and squeezed every dollar from you.  I called down to the front desk and asked for some toothpaste and it took them another phone call and 1hr 45min.  The shower was also lukewarm.  The water from the sink got hotter.  Overall, it was a decent experience, but I would look elsewhere next time.
review.negativeRemarks: There aren't many amenities in the room.  WiFi should be free of charge and there should be a refrigerator to put your own food and drink inside.

review.title: Above and beyond
review.reviewText: We got upgraded and got in iut room early . Nothing could be better . First class service

review.title: Updated facilities with Old world Flair
review.reviewText: We upgraded at a nominal price to a suite that was completely redone recently.  New everything, we felt like we were in the lap of luxury.  We stayed two nights for our 49th Wedding anniversary.  We had stayed at the Fairmont 30 years ago and found that it is even better today.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and old world charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is uphill from everything in SF.  Cable cars, taxis, and  trolleys, are all at hand to take you anywhere you want to go.

review.title: Not the best Fairmont but still a place to be
review.reviewText:
We are Fairmont customers since long time ago and have been in several fo their locations around the US and Mexico. The Fairmont in San Francisco is a historical and very recognized place, but it is not a Fairmont at it's best. The place is in a perfect location to move around the city located in Nob Hill it is perfect to wonder around the best areas of the city. A good issue on the original building rooms where we stayed is that we asked for a room with a view, if you have an inner patio room they have an awful look of the inner building which is really unpleasant for a place like this. We didn't get to know rooms in the tower but I think those have a better comfort and space.
The hotel was allways with a lot of buzz and action ranging from weddings to conventions and private parties. Restaurant for breakfast was allways packed and they do not have enough space even using the bar tables. So we passed on having breakfast there.
Ammenities in the room are good and bed is comfortable and clean. Bathroom in our room was small for a Fairmont and even uncomfortable with the tub/shower disposition.
Dinner was excellent and well served but on the pricier side, even though very well appointed and prepared. Service on our first day was slow (very) so we decided to pass and enjoy some of the really good restaurants on the San Francisco área.
By the way if you are a sport fanatic you better wake up early the fitness room was completely packed after 7 am.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant facilities must be bigger for a hotel with this ammount of rooms. When a convention is working there the service can be completely a mess.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is perfect for moving around San Francisco. If you can afford to be there then it is the best place to move around.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Great location
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning on my next business trip to SF.

review.title: SF Fairmont
review.reviewText: Not again no comparison to Taj,Fpur Seasons etc yet same price

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText:
As always we found the Fairmont in San Francisco up to the other fairmonts we have stayed in
Great location shame the cable cars were not working

review.title: Nice location. about 20 min. walk to the wharf
review.reviewText: right next to the cable car station, 20 min. walk to union square.

review.title: Most favorite hotel.
review.reviewText: This is my most favorite hotel. the customer service is absolutely top notch, and the quality of the rooms is nothing less than total luxury. A big plus for me is appreciating the décor like the lighting, the wallpapers and how wide the corridors are. I would stay at the Fairmont anytime over several other luxury hotels.
Fabulous location. Room was killer. Wonderful staff. What a great hotel!

review.title: Marvelous view of the Bay
review.reviewText: Hotel personnel were helpful, friendly. Went above and beyond. Food was outstanding. Proximity to places we needed to go....great!
review.positiveRemarks: The quaint historical Victorian style in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the modern world.
review.locationRemarks: Loved a Grace Cathedral, cocktails at Top of the Mark, Chinatown. Not far to Cable Cars.

review.title: Gorgeous room!
review.reviewText: We were only there overnight, but loved every minute of it!!!

review.title: Weekend at The Fairmont
review.reviewText: We got an amazing deal through Expedia and thought why not after all it's The Fairmont. We would definitely do it again. Helena at the front desk was terrific and was able to check us in early. The room was clean, tasteful, and very comfortable. The cafe was perfect for a light breakfast and the location is great- everything is within walking distance or a short cab ride away.
review.positiveRemarks: The guest service, nice rooms, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: A fridge and an alarm clock in the hotel room would be great.
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you want to see a show, shop in Union Square, or catch the cable car. Short cab ride to the ballpark, Ferry Building, or the warf.

review.title: Great hotel awesome
review.reviewText: Landmark location, great environment and view highly recommend it
It will cost one $15 a day to use the gym. Most high- end hotels provide free wi-fi and gyms, especially the hotels that don't have swimming pools and saunas like Fairmont.

review.title: Nice location in the heart of San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
At the time of booking, we asked that the three couples staying together, the rooms should be close by. One of the three families arrived earlier than the other two, and reminded the receptionist of assigning thre rooms close to each other, and she agreed. We arrived at the hotel around 4pm and found out that the rooms are not ready even though it says 3pm guarunteed check in. Finally rooms were ready closer to 5pm. We were attending a wedding whose recetion started at 5pm and our wives needed to get ready and we were delayed to the recption. Spoke with Hotel Management that the rooms were not ready and we should get a discount. That request was denied because they claimed there were rooms ready in other floors but since we requested three rooms close by we had to wait.
Three rooms close by was requested at the time of booking, so nothing new.
No one at check in said that we can get rooms immediately if we are willing to be in seperate floors. We have no idea if the rooms were in fact ready by promised 3pm.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located and valet parking included in hotel room rate
review.negativeRemarks: They need to understand customers' request better and assign rooms accordingly. Cannot beleive they could not assign 3 rooms together if they tried.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located with lots of nice restaurants and shopping

review.title: Great hotel. Most of the staff were arrogant.
review.reviewText: Staff needs to get over themselves. They are not that cool.

review.title: What a fancy place!
review.reviewText: Loved this Fairmont Hotel. It was recently renovated and simply gorgeous. The lobby area is stunning and the rooms have all of the necessities. Beautifully decorated and comfortable bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Service was friendly and it was in a great location.
review.locationRemarks: Clsoe walk tot he Cable Car museum, not too far from Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: IT WAS WONDERFUL INTERLUDE FOR US.
review.reviewText: We found the Fairmont when looking for a place in San Francisco for just one night. It was so beautiful and excellent service and lovely unrushed meal that we felt she had been treated to a royal vacation right in our own backyard. (We had to be out of our home for a repair. ) Our room looked out on a little oasis or lawn, a pond and palm trees with an adjacent cityscape. Just beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: No recommendations.
review.locationRemarks: Too many things to recommend in this short space.

review.title: Renovated hotel
review.reviewText:
Completely redone and rooms are gorgeous.
Very helpful concierge service.
Highly recommend.

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText: Had an excellent stay. The price of the parking was high but everything else was good.

review.title: Outstanding view
review.reviewText: Great sopt recently renewed rooms, and most imprtanly very friendly staff and fast service

review.title: Splendor atop Nob Hill
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco delivers in all ways. Beauty, elegance, and history all wrapped up into one great experience!

review.title: Best place to stay in SFO!
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best. I was here on Friday May 16. I was to check out and go to another hotel, but because I was so please with the service and recognition of the Fairmont, I choose to stay the remainder of my trip here. You wont be disappointed.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was mindful of everything you need. If they did not have an answer they found one.
review.negativeRemarks: NA

review.title: It was just a bad experience
review.reviewText: I requested things first time, they claim they already delivered, and the attitude of the hotel's staff is just not nice at all

review.title: Gracious hotel in best part of town
review.reviewText: It was my first time at the Fairmont San Fran and I will be back. Nicely appointed room, beautiful lobby. A staff members I encountered were excellent. Wasn't crazy about the charge for the gym but they waived it when I joined their President's club.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and ambiance. Newly renovated room

review.title: Only a couple of night but a lovely stay
review.reviewText:
From the moment we checked in to the moment we left everything was perfect. Watch out for the hills but hey it is San Fransico. And you can always get the trolley bus.
We stayed in the tower on the 9th floor and the vista was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: We where told it may be a bit of a tired hotel but everything was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper rooms ha ha
review.locationRemarks: Truly bus right next door so ride the rail and get a true San Fran experience. Go down to fisher mans warf and hire a bike and ride along bridge.

review.title: Romantic Get Away
review.reviewText:
After whisking my girl friend away in a Stretch Limo from her house to the Water Bar is SF, followed up by nice sight seeing tour of SF with champagne glasses full. We stopped at the palace of fine arts for a romantic walk under a full moon. Unaware that are final stop for the night would be the Fairmont Hotel, my girl friend had a smile from ear to ear. We proceeded to our room where pink roses where waiting for her. I than ordered dessert which included hot chocolate  at 1:00 am which arrive promptly to our room. I ll leave the rest up to your imagination but be assured we work up very rested. We finished our visit with Sunday Brunch and walk around the area.
The Fairmont is the way to go, a cake is not without the icing- this girl most likely will marry me one day.

review.title: Nice hotel at the top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our one day stay at the hotel. Everything that was advertised about the hotel lived up to our expectations. Breakfast buffet was very good but pricey - My only complaint was the overnight parking charge for hotel guests - $60 - I think way over the top!

review.title: Beautiful hotel in heart of SF.
review.reviewText: You can walk to almost any attraction. Lots of hills just wear comfortable shoes.
review.negativeRemarks: sound proofing, the hallway sounds out noisy

review.title: Love location
review.reviewText: Did not like the lady st the front desk. Had 2 bad experiences with her.

review.title: Great deal that included free parking
review.reviewText: Great room and great service. Beautiful hotel. Tonga room is a lot of fun.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel is beautiful as are the rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Doing a happy hour
review.locationRemarks: Walt Disney Museum, At&t Park

review.title: good location!
review.reviewText: During a 4 night stay, the 3rd night a new note guest moving into the room across the hall from us with 3 small happy dogs that barked whenever anyone walked down the hall! After 3 calls to management they moved us to an alternate room (they should of moved the guest with the dogs out) that had an inferior view. We paid for an upgraded room with a bay view, which we lost in the relocation.
review.negativeRemarks: The food is not affordable unless on expense account! $22 for a hamburger +$2 for cheese, +$2 for bacon, ect .. 1 bowl oatmeal, 2 pcs. toast=$18!

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: For the price there should be more no charge amenities

review.title: Beautifully appointed room--HVAC view.
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel, as you would expect. And the room was beautifully appointed--elegant and classic but with modern touches, like the light fixtures. Our only gripe is that we had a view of an adjacent building with an HVAC system in between the two buildings. I suspect this was because we bought the room on a half-off weekend rate and were not frequent stayers. And of course, neither wifi nor a visit to the gym is included in Fairmont's base price. This is annoying--like buying a Jaguar and being charged for leather seating or car mats. This pricing model annoys the well-traveled, so why do they do it? Is their brand really that strong that they don't care?

review.title: Lovely hotel, very near cable car, great view.
review.reviewText: Very clean, pleasant room with a view at a good price.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel, walking distance to China Town, Union Square, The Grace Cathedral is just
cross the street. Efficient and friendly staff.

review.title: Fairmont Hotel - Excellent room and service
review.reviewText: We booked on line at the lowest rate available and then decided to upgrade to a bayview room for an extra $30 per night. It was a well-worthwhile move for us as we had a lovely newly-rennovated room with a great view. Service was excellent and the overall experience very positive. Just a few blocks walk to the central area (Union Square) or Chinatown, and handy for two cable-car lines. Note the walk from anywhere back to the hotel is steep uphill but this is fine to walk off dinner!

review.title: Good but expected better for Fairmont
review.reviewText:
We stayed for 4 nights in a room on the 5th floor by the elevator. The experience was pleasing in terms of the staff but the actual hotel room leaves us with mixed experience.

First off, we had request to be away from elevators as my wife is a light sleeper. I know it's not guaranteed, but it would have been nice if they accomodated us. Instead we got a room on the 5th floor right near the elevator. We understand we can only request, but it was a bit disappointing.

The other issue we had was with the room. Though it is very beautiful and tastefully renovated, the bathtub was just plain gross. I understand it is older, but the grout was all yellow, and the tub all dingy just from pure age. The tile also looks like its seen much better days. Around the toilet it also looks yellowed from age. The window had a beautiful view, but there were gaps around it so wind was blowing in. We stuffed up the big long cushion against it to help cut down on wind blowing in. Granted, the rest of the room had been recently renovated, so it looked nice so nothing to complain about that.

So in a nutshell, good if you want the character of the older Fairmont building, the image that comes from being at a Fairmont, and friendliness of staff. But bad in terms of the bathroom and especially shower.

Overall, I'm not sure if I had to do it again if I would have stayed there.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathtub and toilet needs updating, fix gaps around window.

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: My daughter and I have a fantastic stay at this hotel. We loved the location, the size of the rooms and the staff was fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were large and very comfortable. Great walk in closets and large bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: We loved that the trolly was located within a few steps our our hotel. It was a wonderful way to get around the city and see all the main attractions.

review.title: Great hotel at great location in Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: Overall the Fairmont is a great hotel in every aspect, from location to comfort to staff and to the elegant and classy structure and decor. Room service was excellent, as well as the attentiveness of the staff at the front desk. I did request a newspaper with breakfast room service but it was never delivered, even though I saw that the other rooms had a newspaper by the door, we never got it. The concierge gave us practical and useful information about the places to visit and about the public transportation system that San Francisco has. The location is right in Nob Hill within walking distance to many places and close by to several buses and Cable Cars. Overall it was a great experience. There were a couple of negative things to notice: one day the coffee maker was not cleaned. It was left in the bathroom where I had plugged it. I ended up rinsing it, which is something I do every day at home. Did not expect to do that in a luxury hotel. Another minor thing was that an item that I purchased at the souvenir store had the wrong price marked on it. I was charged more than it said on the tag.
review.positiveRemarks: The building itself is old and beautiful. The room we got was comfortable, spacious and clean, except it looks into the interior courtyard.
review.negativeRemarks: The front entrance seemed to be blocked by cars every time we went out or coming in.
review.locationRemarks: It is within walking distance to many places (China Town, Union Square, Embarcadero, the Cable Cars, Russian Hill, Telegraph Hill, North Beach)

review.title: A wonderful stay in an historical landmark
review.reviewText:
Service was outstanding from every person, from arrival to departure. Accommodations were beautiful. Well appointed rooms.

Disappointed in the retail stores that were open. While I understand and agree that the Beach Blanket Babylon is a San Francisco "icon" now, the display as we entered was not fitting of this hotel. Actually brought it down. Would have preferred a fabulous floral display with fragrances that filled the air for arrival or something more befitting the elegance of the hotel.

review.title: Stunningly beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: A great pleasure to stay in this beautiful hotel. Wonderful staff, you can dine to the twinkling of the grand piano, Le Labo toiletries, everything is gorgeous.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is a perfect location with great views over San Francisco. Very close to Grace Cathedral & first rate shopping. Take a Cable Car for a unique

review.title: Elegant old world hotel on top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms and hallways have been beautifully renovated, and create an elegant, calm, restful environment. I had a very good nights sleep. The hotel restaurant an good alternative to going out after a long day of sightseeing or shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Clean and Convenient; OK not Great
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, nothing special. Nicely appointed rooms, comfortable mattress. Staff were pleasant enough (i.e., not rude) but didn't make you feel like you were staying at a luxury hotel. Ordered quite a bit of room service; food was pretty underwhelming for the cost. Same applied to restaurant in the lobby. Nothing compelling to inspire me to return, but nothing so bad that I wouldn't consider it.
review.negativeRemarks: food; taste and quality
review.locationRemarks: catch cable car to wharf or union square; can also walk if feeling energetic. lots of good shopping.

review.title: Excellent, pricey
review.reviewText:
We had a room with no view but the room met our needs , we were out most of the time.

Everything was expensive . There was no courtesy shuttle service or free wi-fii. We probably should have stayed in a less expensive hotel for our needs and still get back to the hotel with a free shuttle service and wi fii to communicate with friends or downloading our day to day experience on the Facebook.

Staff was helpful and friendly. There was not much to say about their computer room. No pool, not much for a place to workout . Most of the activities were down at the Fisherman's wharf.

The hotel needs more entertainment places close by other than the Tonga room.. something for adults and young adults.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is historical, well located and beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs to merge the beauty of the past and the technologically savvy new generations now and to come. free wi-fi, free shuttles.

review.title: First class experience all the way! Exudes elegant
review.reviewText: Great experience!!! Enjoyed room and view.... Exudes elegance and sophistication.... Incredible service from all staff!

review.title: Beautiful hotel on top of Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with rich history. Anyone who visits need to check the pictures in the hallway leading to the parking garage. Only downside was the rooms were supposedly just updated. Yet the queen bed we had was very worn on right side. It felt like I had to keep myself from rolling downhill all night. The hair dryer that's in the room was outdated and cheap. The power button kept turning off. The wall paper in bathroom was already peeling from corners on walls. Crevices on sink were cacked with dirt and grime. I also reserved a room with either a view of the city or of the courtyard. Yet view was of window on other side of hotel and center roof area.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of rooms and bed properly updated
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, lots of restaurants, union square,

review.title: Grand Dame, beautifully historic!
review.reviewText: Great weekend escape. Top of the Mark acrossed the street. Loved the schmaltzy Tonga room!!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking could be better organized and speedier.

review.title: The nerve of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The overall of Fairmont San Francisco is that is a very cozy and good looking place. Is a landmark but also the people are focused to the satisfaction of the guests.
Desipte is in the top of a hill, the transportation is excellent. Yo may use the cable car to go everywhere... and is properly linked to other services.
Near to Chinatown and Little Italy.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL
review.reviewText: VERY COMFORTABLE AND WELCOMING. GREAT STAFF. IT WAS A GREAT EXPERIENCE AND I WILL RETURN.

review.title: Great Hotel!!
review.reviewText: Very nice location, and staffs are very sweet! I was overwhelmed by the comfort, and the amazing view of my room. If i go to SF again, I am positive that i will stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel at a great price
review.reviewText: Utilized a flash sale for this hotel. We have never stayed here before and were pleasantly surprised on how beautiful the hotel was and how nice all the staff was. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was great, however the breakfast was outrageous!
review.negativeRemarks: The prices of the food in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Great location, next to the trolley and a short walk to union square.

review.title: Gorgeous historic hotel!
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel, extremely comfortable beds, good service. Room service absurdly expensive, but then again, it is San Francisco! Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Beautiful, historic hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: Our first room was AWFUL. Renovated, but down the longest hallway.., the 2nd floor room looked and felt like a basement. Our view was of a wall, and the Queen Beds I had booked, were small doubles. Once I complained, we were "upgraded" quickly, to the room I had actually booked! Book the tower rooms. They're a long walk from the lobby, but much nicer!

review.title: Great Location great reataurants
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, restaurants and classic style covenient for buiness or pleasure
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Accessable to everything in SF

review.title: Very classy.
review.reviewText:
Comfortable beds. Extremely friendly service. Historical building. Fantastic overall

Improvements: better in room dining menu

Cons: 5 blocks UP from union square

review.title: Hotel you will love
review.reviewText: Great location, great service, great food and drinks, beautiful hotel! Loved it. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: BEAUTIFUL! Close to transportation systems
review.reviewText:
Fabulous experience at the Fairmont w/attentive, friendly staff.
Very clean, comfortable, upscale accommodations. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Nice facilities, well maintained.
review.reviewText: The room was superbly maintained. The walls were a little thin and noise seemed to travel. The customer service was a plus, as well as close proximately to eats and other attractions.

review.title: Mini-break
review.reviewText: As Bay Area residents, we don't often stay overnight in the City. We decided to do so in connection with a company event. We got a great room at the Fairmont, with an amazing view of the Bay, from bridge to bridge. The room was comfortable, and our experience at the bar in the lobby was good. Highly recommend the Fairmont, whether you are a visitor from afar, or a local looking for a great, historic hotel.

review.title: Impeccable
review.reviewText: The Fairmont in San Francisco is clearly one of the best hotels in the country. Old School elegance, gorgeous refurbished rooms, amazing staff that anticipates your needs. The place is a gem.

review.title: Beautiful hotel impeccably renovated
review.reviewText: Everything about the Fairmont was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby, decor, room renovation was all completed in excellent taste. The bed was comfortable. We loved the art deco style. All staff was helpful and friendly. Truly felt we were treated like royalty!
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, beautiful hotel, "room and vroom" package was a great deal since parking is so $$$ in SF.

review.title: History personified.
review.reviewText: Staying here was like staying in a museum. You can feel the history surrounding you. On top of the that the rooms, even though a little on the small side, are as clean and comfortable as can be. The bed, linens and pillows were very plush. The staff was by far the nicest and most professional I have met in a very long while.
review.positiveRemarks: You will feel like royalty or even the presidential party as soon as you pull up to the valet.
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot think of anything I would of changed about my stay.
review.locationRemarks: This is San Francisco. You will not be walking far from any hotel on Nob Hill.

review.title: Short work visit to S.F.
review.reviewText: The most friendly helpful staff I have every experienced in San Francisco. A wonderful stay.

review.title: Not worth price
review.reviewText: Room was small bed was comfortable the only thing that sucked was you have to pay for wifi for your phone and you hAve to be awAkend by the sun because the thick shades would not close..

review.title: nice hotel, like the this building
review.reviewText: my parents like this hotel because it's a beautiful building, and we lived in a new model room, which is really nice room. We love it.
review.positiveRemarks: clean and big room, good service,
review.negativeRemarks: there is no free wifi, and it's better to have Chinese channel in TV.
review.locationRemarks: location is not bad, but it's better to have more good restaurant around there.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel! Great location as well!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed out stay and would definitely return to the Fairmont!
review.positiveRemarks: Love the décor, the lobby and lounge area is beautiful and the rooms were just remodeled and were very comfortable and clean.

review.title: top of the hill
review.reviewText: It was a grand view and setting. If I had paid full price I would have been disappointed as they still charge you extra for everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Not charging extra for using the gym, coffee makers in the room

review.title: Nice hotel on hill tops
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby is absolutely beautiful and well maintained. Hotel staffs are friendly and helpful, although certain things you have to ask in order to know, for example free wifi if becoming a club member. There's full of drinks at a charge in the room, but some commonly included things such as coffee maker or tea are left out in the room. We had to ask for a kettle and mugs to boil some water to make our own tea.

review.title: No free WiFi
review.reviewText: Expensive parking, no free WiFi, no free gym access...what year is this?

review.title: Central,friendly and close to Cable cars!
review.reviewText: A fabulous hotel crossing the realms of casual elegance to casual..close to the cable cars and the ab fab nib hill cafe..serving excellent and well priced Italian food..unmissable!!!

review.title: First room not so good, second much better
review.reviewText: So they put us in a refurbished room in a section of the hotel with ongoing construction. Needless to say they worked early am and also on the weekend in spite of being told they would not work these hours. When we complained we were moved to a new room on the other side of the hotel which could use refurbish ins but was spacious and had a beautiful view of the bay. We were pleased. The rest of our stay was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the new pillows. As a matter of fact we are in the process of obtaining them from the local San Francisco vendor. Staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: All the rooms need to be brought up to new and fresh standards. Coordinate and communicate better with your vendors. Avoid guests being inconvenienced
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants huts down the street. Not far from union square. Reasonable distance from the Bart (6 blocks)

review.title: overpriced hotel
review.reviewText:
I was charged $8.60 for a bottle of water in the room when I just moved it off its dock without realizing it. I didn't open the water but still got charged. Breakfast was outrageously expensive with 15% surcharge on top of the bill ($180+ for 4 people!) Parking was over $63 PER night!! I don't think I will go back again and I'd tell people to be aware of this gouging practice.
When I was having lunch with my client in your restaurant, the waiter circled my table and bothered us at least 8 times every other minute and we couldn't talk. Finally he told us that he was leaving and wanting me to pay so he got his tips!!! This is very unacceptable. Awful experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything is overpriced. It cost over $63 to park your car for one night! Breakfast was $160 plus 15% surcharge for 4 people! Facility is dated.
review.negativeRemarks: Go figure yourself - stop the deceptive practice. The price does not justify the value.
review.locationRemarks: Not relevant. I was on a business trip.

review.title: Expected Amenities Lacking
review.reviewText: The room was too expensive to begin with. When I requested a later checkout to accommodate the Women's Conference that was scheduled to be in their own facility, they would only extend the checkout time by 30 minutes. The room had NONE of the amenities I expect to find in "Sufficient" accomodations: No coffee pot, nor Any Way to heat water for neither coffee or tea (No microwave). The TV had NO programs that weren't Pay-Per-View! The Bellboys, Etc. did a good job, but of course those are the people you are paying and tipping (usually). To sum it up, the only thing we got gratis was a wake up call (In fact, they offered and gave us two) The experience was mostly negative! Barbara Iskey
review.positiveRemarks: I was able to stay at the same location that had my event and was able to just immediately put my car in their parking garage (Extra Pay).
review.negativeRemarks: Provide the NORMAL Amenities of other facilities!
review.locationRemarks: I only went to my Womens' Conference, but S.F. has plenty of things to do (Most of them out of reach of middle class folks).

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Lots of history inside with many pictures of very famous previous guests. The hotel rooms are outdated and I swear our room had been smoked in before my allergies were horrible. The lobby is nice but for the price the room was just ok. The staff were very nice though.

review.title: Great hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Great as usual. Views of the bay were excellent. Room was clean and very comfortable

review.title: Great Holiday find
review.reviewText: Great hotel anytime, but during the holidays it was magical. My kids had a great time eyeing the huge gingerbread house and the wonderful dispay of christmas decor. We enjoyed the walk up from the pier to atop knoll hiil. It was refreshing.
review.locationRemarks: we love san franciso and we always walk or take the trolley. we went ice skating in union square and enjoyed the cheese cake factory next door.

review.title: Best place in town!
review.reviewText: Could not have been better. All excellent. Wonderful historical site. Great location. Staff First Class!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: everything is accessible cable car is right there

review.title: Very nice but slightly aged!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont seems like it would have been very, very grand, maybe 50 or 60 years ago. It's certainly still grand but the room I stayed in was showing its age (e.g. old decor, worn door knobs). I think a couple of floors were being renovated so perhaps updates are already underway. Great staff and location though!

review.title: Beautiful Lobby...Dirty Room
review.reviewText:
Lobby is beautiful. Room was dirty. For some reason everything was dusty. Even the door to the room was dusty. Someone had written "Hi" in the dust on the door. Room was large and spacious. As we unpacked we noticed the shelves in the closet were also dirty so when I went to stack my jean on the top shelf and then went to pull a pair down the bottom pair had dust all over them. Same for the rest of the room. Bottom of the curtains were tore and hanging in the window. And then when we went to bed we noticed the pillow shame had holes in it and also tore on one side. Not what you would expect in a 4+ star hotel.

Had dinner just off the lobby and found the food not very good for the price. I had spare ribs and it came out more like pot roast for $37 dollars.

Asked the Concierge for a good place to eat that was kid friendly and they sent us to a fancy steakhouse that didn't even have a kids menu.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby and breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the rooms. I don't think anyone had really inspected that room in a while. Makes me wonder who is looking after their staff.

review.title: worked out really well and a great experience
review.reviewText: very convenient for our stay. very nice and clean. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: very clean and they took care of everything we needed
review.negativeRemarks: no
review.locationRemarks: we went to the Warriors game and it worked out very well

review.title: A Beautiful Uplifting Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband, two children and I just spent a wonderful weekend at the Fairmont. It is a beautiful hotel. We love Europe, and going to the Fairmont was like going back in time to the Renaissance. Walking into the lobby my gaze was drawn upwards to the gold leaf ceiling and my mood was equally lifted. It is centrally located, the dining experience was five star, the staff was friendly, the rooms were spacious and we all left feeling very happy.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the food and the ornate interior design. We felt like royalty and were treated as such.
review.negativeRemarks: The internet could be free.
review.locationRemarks: Grace Cathedral is close by, as well as Union Square shopping and China Town.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel and a lot of sit seeings around it. Nice staffs and clean and comfortable room.
review.locationRemarks: Grace cathedral, Japanese and China town, St Mary's Cathedral

review.reviewText: Very noisy in the hotel room from the next rooms, hall and outside. Needs double glazing windows. Rooms rather schabby, the hotel needs a facelift.

review.title: old luxury
review.reviewText: wonderful old hotel with luxurious ambiance and comfort

review.title: The view!!!!
review.reviewText:
We had a wonderful time at The Fairmont. The hotel and service are
first class.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is a must-see during the winter holidays, as it is beautifully decked out; the lobby has a huge, gorgeously decorated tree, and each year a walk-thru gingerbread house is built by the hotel bakers. There are lights and garlands everywhere. Aside from the aesthetics of this venerable San Francisco landmark, it is located on the cable car line, and you can go just about anywhere a tourist would want to go. We went to Ghiradelli Square for dinner, walked to nearby Fisherman's Wharf, then along the Embarcadero piers (it was New Year's Eve, so there were lots of people, etc), then took the cable car back up to Nob Hill where the hotel is located. Chinatown is a couple blocks down the hill, by the way. We watched the fireworks from the rooftop of the hotel. It was a great way to spend New Year's.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and beauty of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Right by cable car line

review.title: Fairmont Knob Hill NY 2013/14
review.reviewText:
Excellent family stay at the Fairmont

The staff were very accommodating, the lobby and façade of the hotel is outstanding and atmospheric. The rooms were old (because the hotel is old) but very spacious and comfortable.

San Francisco was excellent (though very busy) - We missed the Alcatraz tour as we did not book in advance (good future tip) but this did not upset our trip

Highlights were cycling the golden gate and lunch at Angelinos in Sausalito, the Magic (and the food and excellent hospitality) at the Marrakesh Theatre and "Beuaty and the Beast" at the Curran

Hope everyone else enjoys it as much as we did
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be modernized
review.locationRemarks: Great location - top of the hill - but you need a taxi (or cable car back) as the hill is very steep on three sides

review.title: Excellent old traditional hotel
review.reviewText:
Beautiful and well maintained historic hotel. The room very spacious but awkward distribution, clean and ok.
The restaurants don't have much quality or we (my wife and I) had bad luck. I arrived in Christmas Day and only had a fix menu with no soups with a 40-45 degrees of weather.
The asian restaurant I didn't like. San Francisco is famous for organic and healthy oriented food - not much in the hotel. Christmas Day most of restaurants are closed and I was expected to find a good alternative at the hotel.
I travel all the time for business and I always go to high end hotels that are almost new.
review.positiveRemarks: Entrance, decor and personnel very helpfull.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurants quality of food and variety.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location and centrally located to a lot of places we wanted to visit.

review.title: BEST HOTEL IN SAN FRAN
review.reviewText: OUR FIRST STAY IN SAN FRAN. HOTEL WAS OUTSTANDING. FRESHLY REMODELED. GREAT LOCATION AND SERVICE. HOTEL DINING ROOM A LITTLE EXPENSIVE, BUT WE WENT OUT TO EAT - THE WARF IS THE BEST. CAN'T WAIT UNTIL NEXT YEAR.
review.negativeRemarks: DINING - QUALITY DID NOT MATCH THE COST.
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT LOCATION.

review.title: Did not meet my expectations
review.reviewText:
First time staying at a Fairmont and my expectations were high. My wife saw the hotel photos on the web and decided she wanted to stay there. Expedia had a 50% off deal at the time so we booked for 4 nights. Walking into the foyer is very impressive. The decor has been well done and they had a large Xmas feature also. Check in was easy, we got a room without a view as was expected. I was very surprised to find the bed was only a double. I didn't think they made them anymore. Smallest bed I've slept in for many years. The TV had 100 channels in HD. Very nice. Bathroom was large but had a small vanity basin in the corner so only one person could use it at a time. Poorly designed. The shower was good and wife liked the toiletries. Wifi was not included in the room rate and not even available free in the lobby. Poor form. Valet parking was the most expensive I've ever encountered.
Overall, even with the 50% discount I felt this hotel was poor value for money. Would not stay here again or recommend to anyone.
On this trip to the US we stayed in a Westin, a Crowne Plaza and a Hyatt and they all beat this place hands down at a lower price
review.positiveRemarks: Well decorated. TV had 100 channels. Awesome! Wife liked the toiletries.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi and king beds are a standard in hotels in this category. A larger vanity basin and mirror would be good. Valet parking price was outrageous!
review.locationRemarks: At the top of a verrry steep hill. Cable cars 3 blocks away will take you to Union Square or Fishermans wharf. Be prepared to climb a short mountain!

review.title: Surprisingly disappoihting
review.reviewText:
While the hotel is lovely, many of the staff we encountered were less than friendly. I was rather surprised by this. After bring there for about an hour I commented to my husband "no one here smiles or says hello." It seemed odd to me. We had dinner in the Tonga Room. We had a reservation and arrived 5 minutes early. We stood the the reception desk and waited for the hostess. While waiting, another couple arrived and was waiting as well. The hostess arrived and proceeded to greet the other couple and asked if they had a reservation. They said no and she proceeded to grab menus and invite them in to be seated without so much as a nod or a greeting to us. I said "excuse me?" And she seemed surprised when I explained we had been waiting. She asked if we had a reservation and we said yes. The woman who was being seated mentioned to the hostess we were there before them and told us she was uncomfortable when the hostess went to seat them before us. The whole situation was awkward. As guests in the hotel I would have thought we would have been treated a bit better. The hostess never apologized. In general, every employee could use a refresher In basic hospitality and manners.

We stayed in a recently renovated room which was lovely. The only negative was there is very little sound proofing so we could hear the conversation in the room next door. The lack of sound proofing was actually not nearly as disappointing as the lack of friendliness. Friendliness is free.

review.title: Holiday splendor
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont is a gorgeous hotel, and it is perfection at the holidays. We arrived a few hours after check-in, and the room was not ready. The woman at the desk gave us 2 drink tickets (although there were 4 of us), suggested we wait in the lounge, and they would call when the room was ready. A manager who my husband spoke to saw we were only given 2, and got us 2 more. An hour and 45 minutes later, the manager then came into the lounge and said our room was ready. He was very apologetic and picked up the entire tab for the bar, and got us 2 glasses of champagne as well. He was apologetic and lovely. The next day it took 25 minutes to get our car, and there was no line.

Overall it was great. However, when you pay top price for a room (over $400) and cannot get into it for 4 hours, I am not sure that we were compensated adequately. We would not have gone into the bar (we had 2 kids with us) otherwise, and so we wouldn't have run up a tab there.

It really comes down to customer service. I understand it was crazy, NYE and all, but for the price we paid, I think a 4 hour room delay could have better dealt with.

review.title: Top of the Hill
review.reviewText: Great experience at the Fairmont- checked in early, dropped our bags and walked to the waterfront. Enjoyed the day in the city then walked up the hill to the Fairmont- crashed like a baby and woke to the ringing of SF cable cars at 9 AM. Enjoyed a quick pastry/latte at the quaint café on the property and checked out. Sets the bar for quality and customer service. Presidential.

review.title: Short and sweet
review.reviewText: Overnight stay to visit the cityscape

review.title: Great staff, deserving of 5 stars. Mediocre rooms.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fairmont in SF for the first time New Years Eve. Hotel is very elegant and ornate. Rooms are small. Bed not too comfortable. Bathroom tiny. Location on top of nob hill is amazing. The staff is simply awesome. So polite, accomodating and focused on the customer. We requested a high floor and were happy to be placed on the 7th floor (highest). From the bell hops to the concierge to the valets- everyone treated us with respect and kindness. We felt valued. Bad news: the room got so hot in the middle of the night (felt like 90+ degrees). We had to open the windows. We complained and they said they are remodeling. Parking is expensive. All services cost extra. Room rate does not include much other than the actual room.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything costs extra- even the gym facilities.

review.title: Good luck getting what you paid for
review.reviewText:
I booked a King Exterior room for my husband's 50th birthday. When we arrived, we were told the hotel was oversold, and we were put in a Queen Interior room, with a bed smaller than the one we have at home, and a view of a concrete wall four feet outside our window.

My husband's birthday is New Year's Eve. The hotel obviously had larger and drunker customers that they wanted to accommodate. I booked the room almost six weeks in advance, but was told that with "third party" reservations, the reservation does not always reflect what the hotel has available.

The hotel/Expedia did give me a nominal refund, which means we still spent several hundred dollars for a room no better than we would have gotten at the Hilton for less money. I would never have spent that kind of money on that room if I weren't standing in the hotel lobby on NYE faced with the choice of either taking the room at that outrageous price or wandering the streets of San Francisco looking for something else. I will also point out that they did not mention the downgrade or offer me the refund until I pulled out my confirmation and demanded the room I had paid for.

Both the hotel and Expedia claimed the other was responsible for addressing my complaints and giving me a further refund. Both claimed the other had the money I had paid (laughable). Both offered me coupons for small discounts off future transactions, which I refused because I won't be doing business with either party again.
review.negativeRemarks: They could try providing customers with the service they paid for.

review.title: A Magic Christmas
review.reviewText: Being away from home we wanted to find a place where you couldn't forget that it was Christmas, and the Fairmont SF delivered. From the massive tree in the lobby to the decorations everywhere, to a delicious Christmas dinner in the Laurel Court it was great. Some details: We stayed in the tower because of the view and it was fantastic to look out at the expanse of city below; the bathroom alone made our stay worth it - wow; the wonderful folks at Caffe Cento downstairs made the best Americano of our whole trip. Now, the only downside was that the beds were good, especially if you like the squishy pillow-top bedding approach, but the pillows themselves, although soft, flattened down into virtual pancakes. They left lots to be desired, so ask for thicker pillows if, like us, you need a little head elevation.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, great location, great views.
review.negativeRemarks: A firmer bed and pillow option.

review.title: Fairmont Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff are fantastic. Room was comfortable and clean. Some renovation going on in the bottom level of the hotel but definitely not a issue.
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: It a hike uphill if you do not have a car. You could catch a cable car but difficult since they are always full.

review.title: Nice hotel, but not walkable.
review.reviewText: I didn't realize the hotel was on a hill. Hard to walk around. Nice Christmas decorations, cool bar, and nice rooftop.

review.title: Not worth it.
review.reviewText: Too crowded and room is no better than an average hotel. Not worth the hype.

review.title: Expensive Breakfast. $130 for two?
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed in this hotel on Christmas Eve. The Christmas decoration was wonderful and we loved it.
When we checked in, we asked the price of the breakfast; however, the staff didn't answer it clearly. She just said "I don't know. It varies." I was frustrated by her attitude because she didn't know the info nor did she try to check the price, but anyway we checked the food price list in the room and found the breakfast buffet is $28-30.
In the next morning, after breakfast, we got a bill asking $130!!
With less money, we could have stayed in Ritz with complimentaly breakfast.

review.title: Nice Hotel not worth the price.
review.reviewText: average room
review.negativeRemarks: no coffee maker in the room, had to call twice before we had one delivered.

review.title: 2nd stay at the Fairmont
review.reviewText: We love the location on top of the hill for views etc. We find SF easy to get around from the hotel
review.positiveRemarks: This stay, Christmas decorations were awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: We were completely satisfied
review.locationRemarks: The trolleys make it easy and fun to get to the local attractions. Union Square is an easy walk and The Top of Mark across the street is a must do.

review.title: beauitful room and hotel lobby
review.reviewText: wonderful brunch in the crown room and fun dinner in the tonga room
review.positiveRemarks: room was in excellent quality for older hotel
review.negativeRemarks: 24 hour room service

review.title: Classic elegant hotel in great area
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with almost everything at walking distance. We walked to the pier, little Italy, Chinatown, &. shopping at union square. The walk back to the hotel is steep because it's on top of the hill. Concierge was really helpful in getting us dinner reservations. Only negative thing about hotel is we were unaware of the $65/day for overnight parking & $15/day to use the gym. Overall great stay!

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: A lot of hills if walking, but hotel is worth it.

review.title: Most amazing experience
review.reviewText: This was one of the most amazing experiences I have had in a long long time. I felt incredibly pampered with a fantastic location and amazing views. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and was sensational on all levels. The bed was cozy and comfortable. I visit San Francisco often and I often can't wait to get out and see new art exhibits and the sites. This trip was different. I did not want to leave the hotel.

review.title: Historic elegance at a high class hotel
review.reviewText:
Wonderful experience at the hotel, there are plenty of historical artifacts in the hallways if that suits your fancy.
The room we stayed in had a wonderful view of the Bay, however the rooms were quite musty thus making it a bit uncomfortable. Smelled like an old library. Service was below expectations at the restaurant. We did the brunch buffet on Christmas day, and had to remind our server multiple times for drink refills and getting attention in general. With paying a premium for eating at the Fairmont I think also deserves stellar service - this was the major disappointment during our stay, as our friend highly recommended the restaurant. The attendants at the front desk were awesome - Rae and Emily were very helpful when we checked in, big kudos for helping our trip get to a great start.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant service was below expectations. Hope management will fix this. I was hoping for stellar service and instead got below average service.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in the center of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Enjoy Christmas at the hotel and they go all out for the celebration. They have a 2-story Gingerbread house and a giant x-mas tree. Great Holiday spirit.

review.title: Top of the Line as Expected
review.reviewText: Hotel met it's reputation. Elegant and comfortable with great view of the Bay from our room. Will go back when rates are good.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much. Perhaps the parking during check-in and check-out could be a bit quicker. Space is limited and it gets crowded.
review.locationRemarks: The location offers all the great things of the City in minutes.

review.title: Christmas in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights in this high class hotel.We had a special promotion, so we coulld afford this top class hotel
review.locationRemarks: it's at the edge of downtown, you need to walk a bit, but you can also take the cable car, that stops around the corner

review.title: Beautiful hotel...great views
review.reviewText: Loved our time...front desk occasionally hard to reach by phone...rings and rings

review.title: Nice hotel that's close to Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Very easy to check in and out and they let you keep your bags in the hotel even after you've checked out, which lets you explore the city easily.
review.negativeRemarks: The view from the room wasn't very nice. It just looked down into a concrete courtyard.
review.locationRemarks: Union square has excellent shopping.

review.title: Nice touch of history!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with lots of history behind it! The great staff was ALWAYS friendly and accommodating! I will definitely stay here again as I felt right at home in this amazing landmark!

review.title: Wonder place to pamper yourself
review.reviewText: In town over night and wanted to make a memory. The Fairmont was a wonderful choice to facilitate just that...thank you...;)

review.title: you pay for what you get
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is old and classy but the prices and service at the hotel are way over the top. The service at the terrace room was very poor. Can't blame the waitresses their just wasn't enough help, our waitress was very apologetic and the prices, wow the prices! 2 little crab cakes the size of a golf ball, $18 a irish coffee another $18. the following morning I went down to the terrace room and asked if I could get 2 cups of coffee to take to our room and they pleasantly said that they don"t serve coffee when asked in the morning and recommended the little coffee shop down at the end of the block. like right, you got to be kidding. So with that I went back to our room and ordered a continental breakfast. Big mistake continental breakfast two with a 20% tip that was included with a 15% tax and then the continental breakfast for 2 at our room $68. These prices are crazy and last but not least, don't park there. $56 plus a 15% charge a day for parking. I guess if you are one of the 5% who have a lot of wealth it's ok, but if you are one of the 95% I would recommend another establishment. On the upside, the Christmas ltrees and lights were beautiful and last but least the one thing that I was looking forward to wanting to do with my wife was go to top of the wheel to get some amazing views of the city, forget it, that is now private. so spend your money wisely when in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: needs more help in serving
review.locationRemarks: pier 39, walking and just enjoying the Christmas lights of the city

review.title: Cable car ready
review.reviewText:
Everything was absolutely lovely, however when I checked in the clerk noted that it was for one full-sized bed, and she saw that there were two adults and asked if I would like a larger bed. She had one, but neglected to tell me that she was charging me an additional $114 for this. I don't know that I would have switched had I known about this. This was disheartening as I never saw a bill, yet it was charged to my credit card.

The hotel is absolutely beautiful, especially all decked out for the holidays. Do remember to take the cable car up the hill as it's a tough walk otherwise. I don't know that I would recommend breakfast here, as it was a bit pricey, yet it was convenient and I was desperate for coffee, so chose to eat here regardless.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - ambiance - old world charm - comfortable bed
review.locationRemarks: It is easy to walk down to the BART system and get anywhere you want to go.

review.title: Nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: It was great to stay at the Fairmont, an iconic SF hotel. While the rooms are somewhat dated compared to newer facilities it was fun to imagine what it must have been like years ago in the hotel's heyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be updated.

review.title: Christmas in the city
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautifully decorated. We intend to return every year to enjoy this beautiful city.

review.title: Disappointing: Outdated Classic
review.reviewText: We were put on a floor that had active construction and smelled like wet paint. The woman at the front desk said it was because we were staying for only one night. Also, the TV did not work.

review.title: The Wonderful Fairmont!
review.reviewText: Christmas time at the Fairmont is so festive. We truly enjoyed ourselves in the international city San Francisco! Its the best city west of the Mississippi, and the Fairmont is no exception. We will definitely stay here again. World class!

review.title: Disappointing stay at the Fairmont
review.reviewText: We have stayed at several Fairmonts throughout the country from Boston to Seattle and were really very disappointed in this Fairmont in San Francisco. Our first disappointing experience was the dining room where we were dismissed without any alternate offers and the dining room was empty. The staff did make sure we were able to eat dinner that evening AFTER we complained about the rude dismissal. It would've been nice to have been treated with respect from the get go rather than having to complain first. Also disappointing was the lumpy bed, non-working remote control, boogers on the nightstand...I would never have expected this from a Fairmont Hotel. A Fairmont hotel should be on point from check in to check out and that wasn't the case.
review.positiveRemarks: I will say that we did enjoy the gingerbread house in the lobby, that seemed to be the hit of the city.....
review.negativeRemarks: See above.

review.title: dirty and dusty rooms, bad room service
review.reviewText:
I paid over $400 and I was expecting more.
Room: check behind the night stands and curtains to see the dirt and dust. disappointing
Room service: ordered cheese platter (had only 3 small pieces of cheese), orange juice (looked and tasted like dishwasher foam), and tuna sandwich (I had to eat it or die from hunger). returned the rest. disappointing

review.title: Holiday celebration
review.reviewText: Thanksgiving night a gorgeous Christmas tree went up in the lobby, accompanied by gingerbread houses and other delights. The holiday feeling was truly perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: The large rooms, the beautiful lobby.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great value. It is a little tired but not so much that I would not stay here. To me, it is like staying at the Waldorf in NYC. Sure there are fancierr hotels but this nice, historic hotel is great for a trip to SF. If you stay here, remember that it is at the TOP of Nob Hill so be prepared to climb some hills if you are a walker.

Internet connection was complicated and it's security barrier interferes variety of use with internet.
I will be nice if you provide curtesy water bottle, coffee and a pair of slippers in the guest room.

review.title: construction ruined our stay
review.reviewText: They put us on a floor with construction where they shouldn't have had anyone. Noisy, smelled like paint, only one elevator was working. They shouldn't have put any guests on that floor during construction. We complained and the staff just said we "should have been informed ahead of time" which we were not. Disappointed. We've stayed at the fairmont in Boston and Hawaii and had great experiences but won't stay at this one again.

review.title: Fantastic!
review.reviewText: What a wonderful experience from start to finish! The hotel is magnificent, the staff attentive and courteous, the room was luxurious and comfortable! The hotel occupies possibly the most prime piece of real estate in all of San Fransisco. It was dressed up for Christmas during our stay. Frankly, I could not have been more pleased with every part of our experience!

review.title: Quintessential San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont Hotel was the quintessential San Francisco Hotel which teemed with elegance as you drive up and enter the lobby. Walking the halls gives you a feel of the integral history of the hotel within the city. You really feel like you are staying in style. Staff was very friendly and corteuos, concierge was helpful, and Hertz was on-site. The rooms were large and spacious, and we recieved a complementary upgrade! Overall we would definitely stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Location was very central, easy to get around. On Nob Hill a few blocks downhill walk to Union Square, Chinatown also a walk away.

review.title: San Francisco during the Holidays
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel! they were all decked out for the Holidays which made for a very festive time!! The hotel has old world charm, it has been around for 100 years, but just glamorous. The room could have used a bit of sprucing up but it was clean and very cozy! I would totally take advantage of the 50% off rooms. Totally worth it!
review.negativeRemarks: the room needed some TLC
review.locationRemarks: perfect location! If you want to be right in the middle of San Francisco, this is the place to be.

review.negativeRemarks: A little dated

review.title: Merry Christmas
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautifully decorated. Staff was great.

review.title: Exquisite and comfort
review.reviewText: As my wife and I entered the lobby we were blown away by its sheer beauty. The staff and concierge were professional, and polite. Our room had an amazing view of the bay, Alcatraz, and the Coit tower. First class comfort, First class hotel.

review.title: Outstanding staff, but rooms not "luxurious"
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were outstanding. We wanted to upgrade our room, and we lost my daughter's down vest and asked Lost and Found to see if they had it. In both cases the staff were polite, eager to help, knowledgeable about what was going on, and prompt.

For a luxury hotel in the heart of San Francisco, and the price, there are certainly hotels with better (larger) rooms and absolutely more amenities -- this Fairmont has no shaving equipment, no toothpaste, no toothbrushes, no slippers, no robes. These are all dumb little things, but they are basic expectations when you pay this much for a luxury hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff are very savvy, polite, and eager to help.
review.negativeRemarks: I afraid the size of the suites could be increased without ripping out the walls, but it's desperately needed.
review.locationRemarks: St. Mary's square has an interesting traditional Gothic church. Hopping on a cable-car is easy. Union Square is walk-able if you have good shoes.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: We loved our recent stay at the Fairmont San Francisco! The staff was very friendly, rooms were large and clean (even the closet was huge), and the Christmas decorations were great. The hotel is in a great location situated at the junction of the cable car lines and atop Knob hill which provided some nice views. We had hoped to dine at the Tonga room but all reservations were booked by the time we checked in (Thanksgiving). Our daughters loved the hotel, we will definitely be back!
review.positiveRemarks: Size of rooms, cleanliness, friendly staff and great service, Christmas decorations
review.negativeRemarks: some wallpaper peeling, pillows uncomfortable

review.title: San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: Hotel is out dated. Shower did not work. Bedding was not changed when we got in to the room. Overall disappointing experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Is it close to everything. San Francisco landmark.
review.negativeRemarks: Service. Breakfast menu.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel full of history and charm
review.reviewText:
We stayed in the newer tower of the hotel with a city view. We live on the East Coast and decided against the Bay view since we see the ocean regularly and had planned to have an ocean front room in another part of our trip. Our room was on a corner with windows on two walls and the city view was so spectacular that we never closed our curtains. We saw the city come to life and go to sleep, and it was beautiful. Further, we made a note that this was a honeymoon booking on Expedia and the hotel had chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of sparkling wine in our room when we arrived. We had fun touring the hotel itself and viewing pictures of the famous singers and movie stars that had been in the hotel.

One note, I wish it had been strongly recommended or clearly stated that the Tonga Room is impossible to visit on the weekend and that it is closed during the week. We planned on dining there upon our arrival on Saturday night and had no idea that the line would be out the door and down the hall. We thought we would hit it on another night while we were there, but it was closed during the week, so we missed out on it. That was disappointing.

I will say the staff was friendly and helpful when questions were asked. And, if you are going to San Francisco around the holidays, stop in and see the 2 story, life-sized gingerbread house in the lobby. They were working on it while we were there in early November and it was spectacular!
review.positiveRemarks: The view from the top floors of the newer tower were amazing. The sense of history and very lavishly decorated lobby and meeting rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: More information on the Tonga Room's hours and popularity. Hotel guests should be given some preferential treatment in booking a reservation.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location in Nob Hill. We walked from there to many surrounding neighborhoods. Great local restaurant for breakfast just a few blocks away.

review.title: Luxury
review.reviewText: We had a very lovely stay. This hotel is beautiful and so high class. The staff is extraordinary. The bar was lovely. The bell and car service was top notch. The bed was so soft and wonderful. The toilet in the room was temperamental and the staff at the gym/spa was just average. We only wish we could have stayed longer.

review.title: Fantastic - gracious - elegant
review.reviewText: wonderful stay at a lovely old hotel that maintains its historic charm and elegance.
review.locationRemarks: Tremendous - Union square

review.title: Thanksgiving weekend getaway
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont looks absolutely beautiful for Christmas. Staff were wonderful.
Bed was pretty soft. Walls are very thin. Other than that, we had a lovely experience. Recommend it for a couple's getaway for sure!
review.negativeRemarks: New, firmer mattresses.
