review.reviewText: Stayed here so we could be close to the Van Morrison concert at the Masonic. Great end to a great concert!
review.positiveRemarks: Staying in a classic hotel in SF.

review.reviewText: My daughter and I spent a couple of nights here before Thanksgiving. They were decorating for the holidays and it was a pure pleasure to see it come to life. What a beautiful and historic building.

review.title: Nothing Compares To The Fairmont
review.reviewText: In town to see a Van Morrison concert on Nob Hill, the Fairmont was only a block away from the venue. Everything is great about this hotel, staff is extremely friendly and helpful, rooms are spacious and luxurious, and the location is unbeatable.
review.negativeRemarks: Other than more affordable rates, nothing needs to be improved. No better place to stay in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco, no shortage of things to do. Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building, etc.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We Decided to spend our thanksgiving at the fairmont. A very great choice indeed!

review.title: NOT DOG FRIENDLY AT ALL
review.reviewText:
Let me start with the good, it's a beautifully located hotel in San Francisco that oozes with tradionality and for the time of the year we felt very festive, ok the rooms are old a little smelly as is the carpets but for a night or two in SF with the dogs no complaints..... Well until 8pm when the next door heard my dog bark once (only once I swear!!!) he banged on the wall which I thought was unacceptable however doing that of course made our little little
Dog bark again, now I hear a lock on the door to my surprise theres 5 men in suits issuing me a warning ... That's right 8 o'clock in a dog friendly hotel they heard two barks and have 5 intimidating men at my door being aggressive, well I'm not the person that stands for that and decided not only to make sure they heard my complaints but to leave and go home, this is not recommended to people that have dogs at all nor is it recommended to people that value having a face to face kinda hotel , these people are uncaring and classless

Stay clear - trust me
review.negativeRemarks: The staff and their attitude to hearing a bark at 8pm at night as well as ensuring there classless staff do not threaten there patrons
review.locationRemarks: Broadway and Chinatown

review.title: Historic, great location
review.reviewText: Check out the history of this hotel with the wall of photographs. Big rooms, easy access to cable cars, Chinatown and Union Square shopping. Doesn't get a 5 because it is so expensive ($63 for parking) and you still have to pay for internet. Parking garagebis $50 flat actoss the street.

review.title: Too hard to get to
review.reviewText: It is a great hotel, but the location is impossible. I forgot how hard it is to walk up those steep hills to the Fairmont. There were many times when I wanted to go back to the hotel from downtown and had to think 10 times about climbing those hills. The taxis and cable cares are there - but much too expensive for several times a day.

review.title: Iconic Hotel
review.reviewText: I travel all over the country and this is one of the finest and helpful hotels that I have stayed. If you are visiting during the Christmas holiday, you have to see their gingerbread house!

review.negativeRemarks: eliminate the charge for internet access. this highlights the fact that the location is a problem. otherwise just go to a Starbucks and log on.
review.locationRemarks: the location is a mixed blessing. while it is a historic it is definitely out of the mainstream. it should try to capitalize on its uniqueness.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, but in dire need of upgrades
review.reviewText: Hotel is beautiful & historic. Everything in the room is in need of updating. Bed was very comfortable. Valet parking is an absurd $56. Took forever to get the car every time. Car garage is small & not built for large vehicles. Staff were not very friendly.

review.title: not worth the price at all
review.reviewText:
not worth the price at all, we were suppost to get a kindg size bed and we were giving a queen bed with the excuse that all king size beds were been worked on, parking for the night was 64.00
not worth going there at all

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: We came to see Van Morrison who was playing at the Masonic Theatre. Great location. Beautiful lobby. Great staff. Parking is very expensive though.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking at $56 plus tax is way too much!!

review.title: 2nd visit and will come again, bus. and personal
review.reviewText: Great trip and hotel always wonderful

review.title: Centrally located, room location not great.
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located- easy access to north beach and union square. Our room was located on the third floor. We constantly heard slamming doors. Maybe it was because the building itself is so old and the hallways are cavernous, but sound really carried. Room was very clean and the bed was super comfortable. Experience with staff was okay, not great. When I called the front desk to explain the noise, they offered to move us to another room down the hall or to the tower for a fee.

review.title: Very good hotel with a central location
review.reviewText: Check in and out was excellent and the staff in the lobby gave very good information on all our questions. We enjoyVery good hotel ed our stay at the hotel very much. Good communications

review.title: Nice hotel but...
review.reviewText: We were in the older part that they will be updating soon. Problems: tv didn't work, low water pressure and tv got clogged easily. We had to call for assistance to get both items fixed. Inconvenient and irritating. So after paying an additional $30 to upgrade to a king size bed it felt like it was our worst hotel stays in the city. Sure there is great history to the hotel and it was near the Masonic where we saw van Morrison, but I won't come back.

review.title: Excellent Nob Hill Property
review.positiveRemarks: All staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful from check in, restaurant staff, concierge to the bellhops. The rooms were spotless and well kept.
review.locationRemarks: The Fairmont is easy walking distance to Union Square; all three trolley lines are close by and a number of good restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: So disappointed
review.reviewText:
Hotel room was just gross. Bird poo on windows. Dog hair covered carpet. No view. No coffe maker. No towels on towel racks. Ratty stained blankets, curtains and robes. The holiday in up the street is 100x better.
Especially for the price.
I would not recommend the Fairmont. Bad bad bad!!!

review.title: Excellent hotel. Perfect location. Great staff.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay, staff were magnificent, very helpful and friendly. Room was very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a very stylish hotel, but very welcoming
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location on Nob Hill. Access to both cable car routes.. Must eat at Tadich Grill down California.

review.title: less than expected from this 5 star hotel
review.reviewText: Yes, it was 50% less than the regular price per night --- but this does not mean that the guest should get less than the regular price (otherwise, it's not really 50% less) --- specifically, the room was inferior to a room at the four-seasons hotel --- for instance, there were no q-tips in the bathroom.

review.title: Opulent hotel with lots of history.
review.reviewText: We upgraded to the tower rooms with a view on the 22nd floor, that was nice. Wish we could have gotton on the Bay side to see the bridge.
review.positiveRemarks: location was convienent. Rooms were large. Beds were comfortable and the sheets were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: the noise from the adjoining door was pretty bad...paper thin and could hear the party next to us...every word.
Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Cable car to most SF destinations. Beautiful views?

review.title: Business stay
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was terrific from front desk to concierge to maitre d' and chef at the Laurel Court restaurant in the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary coffee and water in lobby. Walls were thin and room needs update (noisy heater, peeling wallpaper in bathroom).
review.locationRemarks: The trolley stops in front of the hotel coffee shop. Grace Cathedral is a block away and there's also a nice park to relax and watch dogs play.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: As first time visitors to SF, we loved the location of this hotel. You are only a couple of blocks away from Chinatown, close to Union Square and cable cars with different routes pass right outside the hotel. This made it convenient to get all around. The hotel was gorgeous! The staff couldn't have been friendlier.

review.title: Majestic hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont hotel is a majestic hotel and a top choice in San Francisco. The staff works hard to be attentive to ensure that their guests needs are met and that their time at the hotel is a pleasant one. The lobby is a grand marble and gilded affair with a very open and spacious feel. The hallways are classically wide and the rooms are comfortably appointed.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and friendly and attentive.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is relatively close in San Francisco. The Fairmont is at the top of a hill so if you are walking, your return will be uphill.

review.title: Classic hotel with surprisingly large room
review.reviewText: Huge comfortable room with a view of Grace Cathedral! Terrific value with Expedia special that included free valet parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Classic old world hotel with modern comforts
review.negativeRemarks: better noise insulation on entry door (rest of room was well insulated though)

review.title: Lives Up to Its Reputation
review.reviewText: I heard by word of mouth how extraordinary a stay at the Fairmont hotel is, but I didn't know how extraordinary until I experienced it for myself during my recent stay on a business trip. The staff at the front desk was the most welcoming and friendly I have ever seen, the room was luxurious.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, awesome rooms, great restaurant down in the terrace.
review.negativeRemarks: I honestly have no complaints.
review.locationRemarks: It's basically right next to Chinatown, and I was easily able to walk to different sights downtown and go shopping around Union Square.

review.title: Grand Elegance in SFO
review.reviewText:
This was on a special offer, and a wonderful experience. A proper old fashioned hotel with great values. The staff were uniquely helpful and welcoming, and I got an early check in without asking - after a long flight that counts for a lot!
Located with great views at the top of Nob Hill, accessible easily by tram, it offers a great view and is midway between downtown and Fisherman's Wharf.
Elegant lounge and eating areas matched by old fashioned but luxurious rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining was better out of the hotel, loads of great restaurants close by
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, central to anything of interest in SFO!

review.title: Excellent hotel with a very central location
review.reviewText: The deluxe king room was very nice and had a great view.

review.title: Glorious old-world charm yet wonderfully updated.
review.reviewText: Absolutely impeccable service and welcoming front desk staff. Beautifully maintained old world charm from a glorious era of San Francisco and with views to remind you why you're staying in the heart of the city.

review.title: Fabulous!
review.reviewText: One of the finest hotels in the world. Decor, service, staff, room, restaurants were exquisite!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Top of the hill! One cable car ride to anywhere.

review.title: Dowdy chic?
review.reviewText:
Giant dust bunnies in room. Room service took an hour for a salad.
Windows were so filthy I could not enjoy my view. Bed way too soft for my taste.

review.title: could be an amazing hotel with exquisite facility
review.reviewText: amazing lobby, amazing history, dirty rooms
review.negativeRemarks: clean the bathrooms and walls, they look like they haven't been cleaned since 1920
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Historic and iconic existence in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is an icon. Everyone knows the hotel. It was good because my clients were impressed where I stayed. The entrance and lobby is "wow". The hotel staff are ok but not as established as other hotels I stayed. Too casual. This hotel is not a hip boutique hotel so I expected more sophisticated approach. The room and corridor are very out-dated. Not classic but out-dated. Renovation of interiors are not as per to today's standard. A/C does not work for today's standard. Windows are not air-tight. I expected the level of the Four Seasons George V in Paris -- this is not even close. I would recommend to give wow-factors to your company/clients in the lobby. Room is a different story.

review.title: Friendliest Hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment I walked in to the most I checked out the staff was more than helpful with nothing but smiles.... The room was was excellent and comfortable. The Fairmont is a must when you stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location on Nob Hill San Fransisco.
Very elegant
review.reviewText: It was nice until they charged me again for staying there when it was already paid for threw expedia , and now I have to wait to be credited to my card !

review.title: Looking for my Heart
review.reviewText:
I love Sfo and the Fairmont..We try to go there at least 2 to 3 times a year. We enjoy staying in a elegant place and being pampered. Be sure to drink a Cable Car in the bar. Get your coffee to go in the coffee shop and walk until you cant walk any more. Go to the shops on Chestnut street and watch the local dogs,kids and couples.
Can't say how much my heart belongs to this city..
review.negativeRemarks: There was a wedding going on and the guest were very loud and some stayed across the hall from us..first time this happened.Wedding over now..

review.title: Boyfriend's birthday surprise.
review.reviewText: Wasn't sure what to expect since we both live in the city. That said it was a great get away. The room exceeded expectations and the staff was great.

review.title: live up to the expectation
review.reviewText: We spent 2 nights in the hotel and the overall experience is 4.5/5. It did take us several phone calls to the front desk to have a baby crib deliver to our room, something that they can improve on. The hotel is clean and organize, not a speck of dust visible anywhere, house keeping did their job really well. They also provided us with extra towels and hot water kettle when they realized that we are travelling with an infant (we didn't request it), it was a really nice gesture. Keep in mind this is a older hotel with hundreds of years of history, the windows are not insulated and condensation will start forming on the windows which leads to wetness near the window ledge. No exhaust fan in the bathroom which also worsen the situation after you have a hot bath/shower. Not a big deal for us as our home also have non-insulated windows. Also, the sound-insulation is not excellent due to the non-insulated windows. You will be able to hear the "ding ding" noise from the cable car as well as motorcycles accelerating up the hills. Overall i love this hotel and would recommend it still aside from some of the short falls.
review.positiveRemarks: Great atmosphere, grand and elegant. Hotel staff are top notches, service is second to none.
review.negativeRemarks: Need insulated windows (double glass) to minimize condensation and improve noise insulation.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText:
Overall, very charming hotel at an excellent location. Because I booked the room through Expedia I know that I would be getting one of the less desired room, that was ok by me. I was in one of the rooms on the lower floors with no view. For a short term stay, that was ok, but if you're going to be there for a few days, a room with a view will help you keep your sanity.

Doors are thin, but you have to expect that from an old hotel, it's part of the charm.

It's a short walk to North Beach and China Town and close to the famous Swans Oyster Depot. By the way, if you want to enjoy Swans without the wait, I suggest to go there at 10:15am, they start seating at 10:30am.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be great if Expedia can negotiate for nicer rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, it's a short walk from everything, including North Beach (food and entertainment) and China Town.

review.title: Not Family Orientated
review.reviewText: The hotel is not very good for families with small children. Although hotel was very clean it does not have in-room tea or coffee supplies. The hotel is nearby union square but not really central. The surrounding roads and paths are too hilly for children to walk and get to places so everything needs to be done by public transport or taxi.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was very clean and very roomy.
review.negativeRemarks: Tea and coffee should be supplied.
review.locationRemarks: Adults can do a quick walk to get to union square but nearby roads are too hilly for children.
Nob Hill...great views and perfect location.

review.title: Flagship Fairmont San Francisco A classic
review.reviewText: Grand old hotel with excellent staff. My room was spacious relatively up to date for amenities and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Grand old hotel. Excellent staf who were friendly, couteous, efficient and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: No swimming pool. In room items for purchase are on an electonic pad which automatically records a purchase even if you pick up an item to examine it.

review.title: SF Fairmont
review.reviewText: Grand hotel felling on arrival. Excellent and courteous staff. Very good location for views but somewhat of a walk to access when starting at the bottom of the hill! Large hallways and nice feeling of space. Very comfortable rooms which are well appointed.

Like any other tour bus destination except over priced for what is now available.

Certainly not the Fairmont we remembered.

Staff not responsive....... at desk or in restaurant.

review.title: Excellent.
review.reviewText: Only complaint is the on-site restaurants are unreasonably expensive by any measure, especially breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel bad room.
review.reviewText: My room was on the second floor above a ballroom. The evening event was loud and difficult to get to sleep. Good hotel but be careful which room you take.

review.title: Total Perfection
review.reviewText:
From the moment we entered to the moment we left....not one thing to complain about. There is a lot to be said for staying somewhere that could give lessons in hospitality to every 'boutique' hotel.
Ready to go back!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.title: Great location with lovely views
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful with great service. The room was large and bright, very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay again
anytime
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby and dining room are beautiful. Room is large witha huge closet
review.locationRemarks: This is a great locaytion within walking distance of Union Square, with lovely views of the Bay and the entire city

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText: We moved to the Fairmont from the Hotel Majestic so it really made it look like a palace. Nice place very clean very friendly staff and great location. Would stay there for sure again. Lucy from New Jersey.

review.title: STUFFY
review.reviewText: This Hotels definitely caters to a certain type of society. I arrived at Hotel and was looked up and down by staff like I was a Circus act. Yes I have Tattoos but am the same kind of paying individual as all the other stuffy customers. Host at restaurant desk just looked at me and my wife I had to ask about being seated to eat.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff.

review.title: October 1st-October 5th, 2013
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and room was very nice, bright and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is excellent and hotel is beautiful.

review.title: Definitely not a 4 star hotel.
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk are not attentive and generally rude. When I checked in, I was the only person there, but was told to wait 5-10 minutes. When I checked out, I was ignored while other non-minority people were checked in.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to re-train their staff, particularly at the front desk.

review.title: Very pet friendly!
review.reviewText: We have 3 French bulldogs who are family to us. The Fairmont was the ONLY hotel in San Francisco that would accommodate our needs, which we dearly appreciate. We were able to enjoy our stay even more with our 3 boys present to celebrate my husband's birthday in his favorite city. GREAT staff !!! Wonderful service! Five stars to your establishment. We will surely be seeing you again in the future!

review.title: Expensive hotel with out internet
review.reviewText: The Fairmont hotel, which is rated extremely high, does not provide free internet in the rooms, unless you are a club member or if you have visited more than 2 times. So EVERYONE new to the hotel has to pay $14.00 a day internet fee. Come on now, it is 2013. When I called the desk they gave me a hard time asking me what I mean by free internet service. Also, there was black mold under the sink lip in the bathroom. Wasn't impressed at all but I have an impressive big bill. Complained when paying the bill and there was nothing really said about either issue.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet for everyone.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great places to eat. Walking is difficult if you are handicapped or in bad shape.

review.title: Landmark worth seeing.
review.reviewText:
We were disappointed with our stay for a few reasons. 1) there were no coffee & tea facilities in the room
2) On our 2nd day morning (18th Sept) the chamber staff were loud and shouting down the corridor at 7.30 ish .
3) on our 3rd evening, guests on our floor were shouting, banging doors and calling down the corridor to their friends this was between 10.00pm and 11.30pm.

As we had a very early (5.am) start the following day we did not want the stress of complaining to the hotel.

The hotel is beautiful but some thought should be given to the high expectations for the high prices.
review.positiveRemarks: The décor and pictorial history. Very comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee & tea facilities in rooms, plus staff being reminded to keep noise levels down.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel has easy access to Chinatown and Union square either walking or cable cars. Other transport is easy.

review.title: Old-style, full-service hotel on top on Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: All amenities you need are under one roof. Spacious surroundings and good restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The hallways feel like somewhere out of a century ago......Hotel needs some refurbishment. The bathroom felt cramped.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill has several hotels that offer a variety of amenities and top-notch eating spots.

review.title: Classic
review.reviewText: Great time; classic ambience!......................

review.title: Temperature in our room was never comfortable.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, excellent service, but the temperature of our room was never comfortable. So warm at night that we could not sleep. Will not return, would prefer to go to a lesser hotel that is comfortable where we can get some sleep. Definitely not worth the money that we paid, all for comfort reasons.
review.negativeRemarks: Comfort of rooms
review.locationRemarks: Good location, but you have to sleep to have the energy to do anything.

review.title: Grandeur still exists
review.reviewText: What a magnificent hotel! If you're looking for a luxurious get away in downtown San Francisco this is the hotel. Grand in style and size you feel transported back in time. The hotel has beautiful appointments, luxurious bedding, huge rooms, and great location. we enjoyed hopping the trolley and getting around town from the front of the hotel and the views of the water from our room were fantastic - note we paid for a city view room, worth the upgrade in my opinion.
review.negativeRemarks: The Concierge was bogged down. Parking cost of $56 a night, & if you rent a car from the hotel you can not return it to there, instead 5 blocks away
review.locationRemarks: The trolley is right outside on California St bringing you straight down to the Ferry Building where you can fantastic farmers market & the piers.

review.title: Hotel Review
review.reviewText: This hotel is OK, neither good nor bad. If I go the next time, I will make sure I will get a nicer view room. The view from my room is not that good.

review.title: First time in Nob Hill
review.reviewText: We had no idea where the Fairmont was located, but we're happy we chose to stay there. Wonderful facility with excellent staff. It's located at the top of Nob Hill, so unless you're driving everywhere, be prepared to walk the steep streets of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: We did notice that the housekeeping staff on our floor was a little loud in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located at the top of Nob Hill. Most dining outside of the area hotel restaurants starts three blocks down the hill. Quick to Chinatown.

review.title: Great hotel with a nice view and good location
review.reviewText: Great hotel! staff was nice and helpful. it has a hertz rental car place inside it which was extreme easy to work with. the location is great plenty of places to eat near within walking distance. hotel is beautiful and clean. would stay here again and recommend to others.
review.negativeRemarks: build a pool and hot tub room for guest
review.locationRemarks: hotel is close to sears which is a famous breakfest place and has great food and comes out fast. little italy is close by i loved eating at!

review.title: support staff
review.reviewText: Housekeeping staff and the concierge (she had an European accent) did an excellent job of accommodating our needs. They made our stay at the Fairmont a very nice experience. Have stayed at other Fairmont so I knew what to expect.

review.title: Great hotel with excellent staff
review.reviewText: Should be noted about location. Nob Hill great central location but can be difficult to walk back from being on a steep hill

review.title: Classic
review.reviewText: The hotel had a classic charm from the minute that you walk into the lobby. The rooms are very large with walk in closets and high ceilings. Great location and close to everything. The valet and bell staff were both exceptionally helpful and offering their assistance.
review.negativeRemarks: Some small details in the room fixtures could be improved, slightly aging.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, union square shopping, Lombard street, Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: At the top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Don't trust your wife when she's standing at the Embarcadero nd says "Let's walk back"

review.title: Great Discount leads to enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: We usually stay at the St. Francis at Union Square but an aggressive discount allowed us to experience the Fairmont Hotel for the first time.As we drove up to check-in no one was there to greet us. No One ! No valet staff, no baggage porter no... you get the idea. This was a luxury hotel short staffed on a holiday weekend - not a good start. The check-in staff, while efficient, didn't smile and frankly looked worn out. I was getting concerned. The upper floor room we requested was nicely appointed with a very comfortable bed. The view of the business district overlooking a garden helped ease our earlier anxiety. As the weekend unfolded the staff caught up to the rush and things turned for the better. We asked for a taxi to go to our Morton's reservation arranged by the very competent concierge. What a surprise when the valet staff brought their own town car around and not only took us to our dinner but offered to return and us up after dinner if we would call .Our driver was waiting as we walked out - now that's service ! The Fairmont started living up to their reputation as a great Hotel just in time. Our jewelry was even cleaned for free. I would recommend this fine Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Knowledgable Concierge, Comfortable bed with luxury sheets, a beautiful lobby with a great holiday weekend discount for the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The valet parking and entry check-in canopy is very small and not sufficiently staffed at times.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great and easy to walk down to the Union Square area

review.title: Great Old Fashioned Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel - but disappointing that on arrival in our room the bin had someone else's used coffee cup still in it
review.negativeRemarks: Room Service
review.locationRemarks: Need a cab to go anywhere

review.title: It was a very pleasing stay.
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were very kind- they even upgraded our room for free.

review.title: Hotel with lots of history
review.reviewText: Hotel is beautiful. Personnel from doorman, to concierge, front desk, etc is very well trained and helpful. Our room was nice and spacious. Great place to stay.

review.title: Average age for stay at this hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel is really good for average age 60 and up.
I do not recommend for young couple.
Do not try food at this hotel. No quality. It was terrible.

review.title: Great location, overall great hotel.
review.reviewText: I do love this hotel. Its not my normal type, I like more of a boutique or modern style. We did really love our stay though and really loved the Tonga bar downstairs. I will be going there I'm sure each SF trip for a few drinks. Live music, floating on a little boat in the middle of the bar. Huge dance floor with everyone and their grandmas dancing. Food was not to par with price but the experience was.
review.positiveRemarks: Perfect location, very sexy inside. Tonga bar is awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel food pricing was extremely high. I have stayed at many 5 star with less price for better food.
review.locationRemarks: Its in the perfect location, walkable to union square, few blocks from china town, small taxi to the piers. Gorgeous views.

review.title: Fairmont SF
review.reviewText: Bed was a little uncomfortable (otherwise the room was great). We stayed on the 20th floor and there were private events all weekend long on the 24th floor. We could hear the music from our room. It shut down around 11pm. The hotel staff did warn us, but it was inconvenient nonetheless. The hotel is in a great location. If you walk to Little Italy, use Power (backside of the hotel) as it is a flatter street to walk up and down. The staff was very warm as well. The food in the Tonga restaurant was OK (we were expecting better).
review.negativeRemarks: Better restaurant choices (after 10pm too).
review.locationRemarks: Location was central to Little Italy and the Market St shopping area. We did wine tasting one day and just hanging around the city the day before.

review.title: Very Disappointing Stay
review.reviewText: On the previous night, we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton and staff was great. Very friendly. We decided to stay at The Fairmont because I had always wanted to stay there. First experience was doorman was not very friendly. Seemed disinterested. Bellman Tony was great. Very warm and friendly. Lobby is great and room with view was great, however, walls appear to be very thin. Was able to hear kids and conversations from both ajoining rooms so could not relax. Called front desk and they said they would call occupants. We ended up going out to dinner and came back to message from front desk asking if things were okay and apology. Somewhat quieter, but could hear snoring. Voices started up again in the morning. Could hear kids and adults talking. They were not excessively loud, but could almost hear every word. Would have liked quiet time in the morning without over hearing conversations.
review.negativeRemarks: Did not feel staff was overly friendly like at the Ritz.

review.title: Fairmont SF
review.reviewText: The beds are like sleeping on clouds except for the screaming kid in the room next to mine valet could be faster overall fantastic hotel.

review.title: A beautiful place! Relax and absorb its grandeur
review.reviewText: We had a great stay! We only wish we could've spent more time sitting in the lobby and lounge!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel and very comfortable. Drinks in bar a bit pricey. Very comfortable beds. Overall great hotel and location!
review.negativeRemarks: Too pricey bar
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Luxury Hotel in Perfect Location
review.reviewText: I stayed in a very small single room, which I acquired through Expedia, or I wouldn't have paid Fairmont prices. When I pay that sort of price, it is at a Ritz Carleton or any number of European hotel where every detail is perfect. Everyone who spoke to me at the Fairmont was lovely -- room service, front desk -- but the doorman who greeted my taxi dropped my suitcase on the top step and disappeared. There were no provisions in the room for making coffee, which would be a nice plus night or day. There were no slippers and one counts on that rather than walking barefoot in a strange place.
review.positiveRemarks: Exquisite lobby, brilliant location, very clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide some sort of coffeemaker in the room and provide bath slippers. The front door staff could be a it better trained.
review.locationRemarks: Location is aesthetically lovely and it's easy to get anywhere. I'm a former San Francisco resident so I don't sightsee.

review.title: Fantastic: I'll be back
review.reviewText: Wonderful building, great space. Rooms terrific and staff just so willing to help ! Thank you.

review.title: Very nice location
review.reviewText: We had a great time and got plenty of exercise walking up the hills to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm of the hotel, the Tonga room was very nice, the staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The valet parking was a little tight. If we walked out the front steps we were almost always in the way of an incoming car.
review.locationRemarks: All of the sights we were visiting were very convenient.

review.title: Go back in time
review.reviewText:
You can definitely feel the grandness and nostalgia of the hotel upon entrance. If you have an appreciation for what old hollywood must have felt like, this is the hotel for you. While there is evidence of wear, the beauty and elegance still shines through. Sit back in the bar/lounge area in the plush over-sized chairs and sip on a classic cocktail while listening to the grand piano. The Tonga room is quite a site to see. We did not eat there, but peered in to see what looked like a super cheesy Polynesian restaurant that one might find in Las Vegas or Hawaii that is tourist hot spot. That being said, if we made another trip with our kids, we would make it a point to stop and eat (for the experience). The rooms are nice, but are room never cooled down to a comfortable temp. The windows could also use some TLC to be brought back to their original glory. Love the balconies and long hallways with real wood doors to the rooms. No fridge to store leftovers, microwave, or coffee maker in room, but for our 1 night stay it was not an issue. FYI... for those traveling with children, our 11 yr old son thought it was a really cool place and would like to return, while our 16 yr old son was bored (but aren't they all). Really lovely time, thank you. P.S. the gentlemen who brought our bags to our room and back down to the car were very pleasant and helpful.
P.S.S. you can walk to China town, but take a taxi to the Pier, the Trolley drop off is a 30min walk.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, ambience, and history. The boutique was beautiful with all of the beautiful Kashmir wraps. The gentleman was also very knowledgeable.
review.negativeRemarks: Touch up around hotel.
review.locationRemarks: About three blocks from China Town. No coffee houses or restaurants (except for little Italian place around the corner that was packed) near hotel.

review.title: Old relic. Needs desperate attention
review.reviewText:
It has become a mediocre convention hotel
Truly disappointment of a classic landmark
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Very expensive... Not worth it
review.reviewText: Nice OLD hotel. Way too expensive for a plain, tiny hotel room. Disapointed. But yes, really nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: To renew of the room
review.locationRemarks: For diner, go to Nob Hill Cafe. It's really close by, good italian food, good price.

review.title: Good experience!!!
review.reviewText: It was a great time. The hotel is very well located. I hope stay again in a next trip to SF.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed here several times before and have always enjoyed my stay. Unfortunately, this time they did not have the room that I requested available. Overall, a great hotel to stay at.

review.title: Great Choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My wife and I just returned from celebrating our 10th anniversary in San Francisco. We had a woderful trip and the Fairmont was certainly a part of this. The lobby is very beautiful and the room was quite nice. We stayed in the Tower section and had very nice views of the city. The room was also very spacious. The location is ideal as it is cloe enough to everything, but far enough away on top of Nob Hill to offer a quiet and relaxing stay. We utlized the public transaportaiton system to visit all of the neioghborhoods and could catch a bus or cable car within one block of the hotel. Note: if you wantot ride the cable car, the Nob Hill pick up is tough. Since this is a major tourist attraction and the stop is at the top of the hill on both sides, the cars are typically full when they come to this stop. Very few people get off here, so it is hard to get on the car at this stop. We did find that if you are out and about at or before 8:30am you can catch the cable car here. The Fairmont had very friendly staff and suprixed us wuith Champagne in out room after hearing about our annivesary. We would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, the sixe of the rooms, and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: See review above.

review.title: Great hotel, very comfortable
review.reviewText: The beds were amazing. so comfortable like home. I really enjoyed the location as well. The hotel was old but with modern day amenities. Brunch was excellent and the bar too.

review.title: San Francisco Landmark
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay. Didn't book the priciest room but it was OK and quiet. Food was expensive but good. Got a nice big round table in the Laurel Court for our family party. Nice waitress. Also used the Caffe. The happy surprise was finding a couple of excellent classes at the Club One fitness center.
review.negativeRemarks: No ice cream is served in the Caffe. We wanted a mid-afternoon ice cream.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText:
We arrived and were informed that there were no King rooms available (reservation was made 2 months in advance). We were offered 2 queen beds and no discount. Were given a handicap accessible room.

I was not pleased - front desk clerk should have offered some type of discount or credit against future stay. They simply overbooked the hotel for America's Cup.

review.title: Fairmont didn't flop
review.reviewText: Great location from which to walk in all areas of San Fran. Hotel was a bit expensive for what you get. No pool. Workout area was great. Service was good. No major problems or annoyances.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit pricey, particularly the room service for food. Didn't like the weight controlled device in the room which charged us for just moving an item.
review.locationRemarks: Real good.

review.title: 60th Birthday
review.reviewText:
From the moment they opened the door of our car when we arrived until they opened the door of the car as we left we had an incredible experience. The staff could not have been nicer or more professional - they were friendly and helpful. They gave us a room overlooking the garden; we could watch the trolley coming up and down the street from our room window.
We plan on returning to San Francisco in the near future and staying at the Fairmont again - the experience was that great.
review.positiveRemarks: The old world elegance and charm in the lobby and room - along with the playfulness and "rain" in the Tonga room
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing - it was that perfect of an experience.
review.locationRemarks: Riding the trolley, walking to some of the local restaurants. Fishermans warf and all of the local flavor that it added to the stay.

review.title: Overpriced old elegance
review.reviewText: Even with Expedia discounts, the room rates at this hotel are overpriced. The charm and elegance are in grat supply but a hotel room is basically a bed, a bathroom, a TV, and a desk. Those were standard.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower prices.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill has wonderful views but there are few cafes and luncheonettes in the immediate vicinity.

review.title: Disappointing for a Fairmont hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a classic hotel, amazing lobby, great location.... but.... the first room we were taken to reeked of cigarettes. When i told the man with out bags that it was very smelly, he said it was a non smoking hotel and they can't control if people smoke against the rules, and did not offer to change our room... we called the front and had the room changed. The rooms have high ceilings and are decorated in a classic style, however they are not clean and well kept. There was dust on the mouldings, the paint was chipping, for over $400 a night this is not acceptable. The sound proofing is poor due to the age of the hotel, a baby next door kept us up as well as laughter conversations due to poor sound dampening.

Upon check out we were billed for a night stay even though our whole stay was pre paid on expedia. We were told that we should not have booked on expedia, and it took two attemps over phone and finally a trip to the desk to fix the overbilling.

We love staying at Fairmont hotels everywhere, and this hotel is a great location, great heritage, the Tonga room is a great space, however the value was not there for the price, i have stayed in smaller/less expensive hotels in San Fran with similar locations and can report a better overall experience.

Perhaps the other suites would have been a better choice, however they are extremely costly. I was very disappointed at the poor upkeep, the chipped paint/scuffed walls and mouldings : (

Brett and Margarita (Canada)
review.negativeRemarks: Upkeep, service, and cleanliness

review.title: Hospitality
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect in every way. We did have one problem with the cleanliness of our room one day. But after speaking to the manager, the issue was not only addressed thoroughly and immediately, but we were treated for breakfast. I was so impressed with the entire staff for their professional and courteous attitude. As to other aspects of the hotel, well, it's the Fairmont, the grandest of all.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything - the staff, the comfort, the decorum, and it's history.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect because it is away from the frenzy of the rest of the city. Yet it is has easy access to all of the city and cable cars near.

review.title: Excellent location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant stay, very convenient location and some rooms with excellent views

review.title: Amazing location, staff and lobby. Dingy room.
review.reviewText: The location is amazing, the hotel staff is awesome, Tonga Room is super fun, and lobby is beautiful. The room was adequate, but a little dated, and a little dirty. Dead yellow jacket by the window. But I'm just happy to say I stayed at the Fairmont. Definitely good for the price I paid through Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness and a little updating and just tinkering in the rooms.

review.title: Great location, beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText: I can't wait to go back! This hotel is beautiful, and the staff were more the wonderful!

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Attended a wedding and reception last week. The only minor criticism it that last call at the Tonga lounge was at 12:30.

review.title: Don't Go
review.reviewText: very over priced, when we got in Room it looked over the roof (Paid a Lot for view) Only water is $8.00 a bottle in room, $15.00 a night to hook up to internet Only about 7 channels unless you pay preview and then for toppers $70.00 to park my freakin car anyway never again.

review.title: Had an amazing experience!!
review.reviewText: Everyone we dealt with from the front desk, bell staff, etc. was so friendly & helpful! Our room was amazing w/ a breathtaking view! Highly recommend this hotel! Will def be coming back. Side note: if you want to try the Tonga Room, make a reservation. WAY in advance!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Location, amenities, night life, staff
review.negativeRemarks: The pillowcases needed to be replaced. Felt very worn
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, running, cable car rides, good food

review.title: On top of the town
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, older hotel but clean. Room was nice size with nice view. We will definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff when checking in. Also valet service was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was clean, but the maid left a few things in the room after cleaning. I am sure it was just an oversight.

review.title: Beautiful Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont has a spectacular Lobby. History & pictures throughout. All the staff from the front desk, housekeeping and restaurants were outstanding.We were in the newer towers in the newer towers on the 3rd floor with a beautiful view of Coit Tower, Alcatraz and the bay, just don't look directly below as the neighborhood is a little seedy- only complaint. We also had a lot of fun at the Tonga Room! This is a very special experience- Thanks Fairmont!!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf & The American Cup and of course, Scoma's !

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: This place was great. A very classy hotel with cool history to it. The rooms were huge. Felt like it was amazing with the expedia deal. Staff was very helpful. Only thing is be careful about ordering room service, tons of hidden fees...
review.negativeRemarks: Hidden room service food fees.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great

review.title: PRECIOUS HOTEL . A JEWEL
review.reviewText: I think that one of my best experiences in my first time in SF was this hotel experience. I had heard of The Fairmont (maybe in movies) but never expected such a beautiful hotel. Lobby is breathtaking. Rooms ultraconfortable. Toiletries, Rose 31, so delicious that went to the small convenience shop the hotel has to find out if they had the products for sale, but they didnt..... Restaurant so fine and delicious. Only imagine that Royalty and Presidents visit this hotel..... Location is perfect. Chinatown is at walking distance. We had a car, and got a Free Valet Parking rate. We had long walks around the hotel to visit its halls and corridors full with photos and memorabilia, ballrooms, terrace.... If I have the chance to return to SF I will definitively return to this hotel. Fell in love with it.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is a lovely city. Worth visiting it. Only problem... Parking!!!!!! But we could manage it.

review.title: IN TOWN FOR FAMILY WEDDING
review.reviewText: GREAT EXPERIENCE!!! WE STAYED AT THE FAIRMONT OVER 25 YEARS AGO...

review.title: Fairmont Delivers Again!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont over the recent Fourth of July weekend and once again the staff, facility, room and entire experience was top notch. Upon arrival the front desk staff were very welcoming and responsive providing me with an upgraded room at no charge. The person who arranged my check in was extremely friendly and engaging. The bell staff, valets and housekeeping all provided excellent service. The photos of past presidential visits and history of San Francisco including the earthquake and fire of 1906 are museum-worthy.
review.negativeRemarks: More shelf space in bathroom. Hooks in closet.
review.locationRemarks: The location is ideal, we walked back to the hotel from Aquatic park after the fireworks show. California Cable Car line goes right by hotel.

review.title: Good location, near to everything
review.reviewText:
We stayed for two nights. The hotel is very old, the rooms are renovated and clean, but noisy. Every morning, you hear room service tables being carried in the corridors or your neighbor guest showering. So if you are a light sleeper, this is not the best option. I have stayed at many hotels, this was THE best hotel Service I ever got. The staff are super good and the hotel is super clean. The breakfast is expensive but amazingly good. They provided gluten free bread for me, which made me really happy as I am allergic.
Make sure you check the café at the lowest level of the hotel, it's a good one
review.negativeRemarks: Noise in corridors that gets to your room every morning Overpriced minibar
review.locationRemarks: Everything is within a few blocks the union square shopping, the fisherman's wharf...

review.title: a gracious gem in a terrific spot
review.reviewText: perfect for business travel; elegant lobby with ideal clusters for small meetings; comfortable lounge and restaurant area just off the lobby

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a great location. Everyone was really helpful. Cost of food was a little pricey, but good.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillow to big
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Superb Fairmont Service
review.reviewText:
Staff was excellent - reception, concierge, valet, etc. Our room wasn't ready on time when we arrived but they compensated with complementary drinks at the bar while we waited. Nice way to unwind and start our stay! Concierge was helpful and passionate about job (so was everyone else for that matter).
Room was OK. I've stayed in other Fairmonts and our room in particular (this time) wasn't as nice as the others. Too bad there is no pool. Club One was under construction. We loved Caffe Centro! Tonga Room was fun and lively. I would have been nice to have a coffee maker in our room though.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker in room, pool access.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location. You can walk to Union Square. Cable Car stops next to hotel.

review.title: Fabulous!!!
review.reviewText: Beatiful hotel at great location. I cannot wait to go back. Close to everything.

review.title: Superb!
review.reviewText: This is definitely a superb hotel in one of the most beautiful locations in San Francisco. the lobby is exquisite, the rooms are beautiful with high ceilings and gorgeous finishes. Also, the spaciousness of each room is very hard to beat anywhere! When my wife and I first entered the room, the first thought was "We could throw a party in here!" All in all, a wonderful experience. The concierges were very helpful in recommending restaurants, tours and offering advice on directions. The only negative that I would offer is that wifi service and the fitness facility are available only at additional charges for regular guests. This is somewhat surprising given the price point for the rooms.

review.title: Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Fairmont in SF was delightful. Loved the historical elegance of this hotel and be sure to check out the Tonga Room. Would like to stay there again.

review.title: Classic Hotel at Top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Fairmont met or exceeded all of my expectations. The dining room was incredible and the brunch was excellent.

review.title: Fairmont
review.reviewText: Nice place with excellent valet service and facilities. Additional attention to detail by hotel staff (Check in, housekeeping) can improve the overall experience

review.title: Expensive hotel...worth it?
review.reviewText: Very fancy Inside. Nice tall coved ceilings in room. Very nice furnishings. Room and hallyways a little dirty for such an upscale hotel. Fitness room was being renovated and I was not told bout this on reservation. Very noisy...we may have just been unlucky with our neighbors. Expensive hotel and I'm not sure whether it was worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning. Free coffee in the morning. Free parking (it was ridiculously expensive).
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to waterfront, china town, shopping, etc...

review.title: Solid hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: The Fairmont on Nob Hill is very clean, the staff is very helpful and friendly, and the location is relatively central to the surrounding points-of-interest (Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, Embarcadero Center, etc.). However, I didn't think that it was a very good value, due to the smallish room and lack of a view.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The vintage feel was everywhere from the staff to the shower. It just one block from the cable car, 3 blocks from china town, and an easy down hill from little Italy. I plan on staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: If I could change anything I would try to get a city view room and not an interior view because sometimes felt like people could look in my room.
review.locationRemarks: Please see above

review.title: Elegant old San Francisco experience
review.reviewText: I remember this hotel from the 1960's and have always considered it a special experience. It has the look and feel of classy elegance, and brought back many memories of a cleaner, kinder, more formal San Francisco. Our stay was delightful, the staff was helpful and friendly, and we would definitely go back in a heartbeat.
review.positiveRemarks: Its classic beauty and the friendliness of staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I miss the intimate performances in the Venetian Room. It is sad that the Crown Room, with its amazing view, is not an open lounge anymore.
review.locationRemarks: Located at the top of Nob Hill, cable cars in all directions, beautiful Grace Cathedral across the street. Several top notch restaurants.

review.title: Excellent last minute decision
review.reviewText: Booked it two nights out. Had a great stay. Would absolutely recommend to friends... In fact, we already have.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, friendly service
review.reviewText: Overnight trip to the area, staff was friendly, room was clean and luxurious; enjoyed very much.
review.locationRemarks: Went for dinner in Chinatown.

review.title: Famous hotel that needs to step it up a bit
review.reviewText: Hotel has been around since the turn of last century...a lot of history. That's all well and good but being my first time in San Francisco I would say this place is okay at best. For the price of the stay, it should be superb but falls short. The hotel needs to be renovated but seems like this isn't happening (especially the lobby and bar area). For $250 plus a night you do not get WiFi...they have the nerve to ask for an additional $20 per day.....come on guys....Motel 6 gives you free WiFi (not cool these days when everybody is on the internet). I had to go to Starbucks to check my email...I refused to pay extra on top of the room fee's. It's not that the place was bad, it just wasn't nice enough. The room is clean (I had to move into a second room...the a/c wasn't working in the 1st room!)...the view was nice from the 21st floor (but that was SF not the Fairmont). Bottom line, if the room was $100 - $150 and included WiFi I would have been more satisfied.

review.title: Not acceptable
review.reviewText: Sorry Fairmont but you can do better. Drains barely handled water, walls were paper thin which led to two near sleepless nights, sheets were changed once in five days, constant noise from the hallway yet $400 per night. Ouch!

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a great view
review.reviewText: The staff was very accommodating and even had a bottle of champagne in our room along with some strawberries for an anniversary celebration. The Tonga Room is just as kitchy as you'd expect with great food, and so was their restaurant that served breakfast. Parking is a little expensive, but that's the norm in SFO.

review.title: Old school elegance and charm
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco never fails to deliver when it comes to old school elegance. The check in was seamless and the staff was excellent. Especially Helena at the front desk and Haley in the lounge. They had the right balance of warmth with professionalism which makes a stay at the Fairmont so wonderful. Our room was especially spacious and immaculate ! The only down side to our whole experience was a young heavy set doorman/bellman named Kevin. Being the first point of contact with the property, you would expect him to open the door of your car, smile, welcome you to the property and offer assistance. Unfortunately, none of that happened when I arrived, but instead received quite a bit of condescending tone in Kevin's voice and "I'm going WAY out of my way to help you" attitude. His manager needs to remind him that being the first contact to the property sets the tone for the guest's experience, and that he should be more polite and helpful. Attitude and tone of voice used when being addressed makes a tremendous difference in making a first impression. Otherwise the stay at the Fairmont was excellent !! So, if you see a young short haired heavy set man when you arrive, avoid him if you want a favorable impression.
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room was exceptional. Also, other than Kevin, the service was seamless and outstanding !
review.negativeRemarks: The toiletries. The Rose 31 toiletries are much too flowery/feminine for most male guests. Something more neutral would have been a better choice.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near Chinatown, with a cable car stop right outside the hotel ~ very convenient !

review.title: Best hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent service, quick check-in and out. Facilities are fantastic. Great views of SF from some of the rooms. 5 stars!

review.title: A wonderful experience
review.reviewText: Its the grandeur of the lobby.... the large comfortable room.... all the services provided within.... The really friendly staff.... The amenities... This is the hotel that sets the bar by which I will judge all hotels going forward. The Fairmont at Nob Hill was the easiest part of my stay in San Francisco and I recommend the experience to all. I have heard.. " I'm sorry"... Or we have no control over.... At many places. I truly believe that the "can do" attitude of the staff at the Fairmont was the most wonderful surprise of all.
review.negativeRemarks: ? I couldn't find anything ??
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located in an area easy to access all the light rails and cable cars without the craziness of Union Square. Perfect choice!!!

review.title: Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here for one night and it was a great experience, the room size was big for the area,the room was clean, but the bed had a droop on the right side that made sleeping uncomfortable, but overall a great looking hotel its located with great views of the city. the highlight of this hotel is the tonga room(tiki bar). We ate and enjoyed the entertainment.

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: Doesn't even have hair dryers in the room! Very small room
review.negativeRemarks: More updated rooms with ammenities

review.title: Birthday Getaway!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at the Fairmont! I booked my hotel on the same day, found a great room on the seventh floor.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby was beautiful, my room was spacious and clean
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: The location and view was perfect. We could see a lot of san franscisco

review.title: Beautiful Lobby. Old San Francisco grand feeling
review.reviewText: Grand lobby with beautiful restaurant bar. The room had no coffee. Its a pretty old grand hotel with wide hallways, good value and location.

review.title: Treating yourself is worth it, but costly
review.reviewText:
Everything was expensive but worth it. View was awesome, location was great. Staff was super friendly.

Pro Tip - don't take a cab to/from this hotel. You'll get scowls and raised eye brows. Arrive in a Uber TownCar or chauffeured Rolls Royce, not a joke to fit in.
review.positiveRemarks: Old world look and feel. VERY upscale.
review.negativeRemarks: The ladies wore fu-fu hats and the guys dressed like Thurston Howell the 3rd or they'd inherited riches from their grand-papy's railroad. Older crowd.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful view

review.title: Lovely, elegant hotel in the heart of Nob Hill, SF
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon. Within moments the staff quickly helped us get luggage up to our room, taking care of parking the car. Hotel staff allowed us to upgrade the room to a city-view, which enhanced our stay tremendously. The view was lovely, the room clean and updated beautifully. Elegant bathroom with oversized shower. Sink was a little small. We enjoyed the clean tile floors, a "pod" system coffee service, the lovely view and comfortable down-covered bed. A little bit of a perfumy smell in the room, which seems standard these days.
review.positiveRemarks: The locacation in the heart of San Francisco, the cleanliness, the elegance, the views. Staff was very helpful. Pampered feeling permeated the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Sink faucet could project out into the sink a little further to allow for hand washing easily.
review.locationRemarks: World-class restaurants abound in the area, cable cars nearby. We enjoy brisk walking, so we walked to the wharf area and all the sights nearby.

review.title: Comfortable with great views over SF
review.reviewText:
The only irritations were:
paying a fee for Wi Fi (unusual even in much cheaper hotels)
Overstocked pay per item fridge with no room for personal items
review.negativeRemarks: Always a steep climb to get back there!
review.locationRemarks: prime location at one of the highest points in downtown San Francisco

review.title: Best place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Great room, clean, and friendly staff. I would stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel gym facilities undergoing remodeling a big cumbersome.

review.title: 1 night in san francisco
review.reviewText: It was so so. The access to the hotel is too small, few cars and it is a traffic jam. Then at the lobby they proposed us an upgrade from queen bedroom to full bedroom trying to sell it to us as good news! The room was ok, nothing exceptional and the conditioner was noisy and not efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is impressive. Location is beautiful, the view from the window is to die for
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning could be much better
review.locationRemarks: fantastic locations, offers fantastic view of the city. The hotel is happily located close to a cable car stop on powell and california.

review.title: Hotel Great stay with a Warning
review.reviewText: It was a great getaway my only issue was with the items for purchase. The items for sale is in small print and so if you lift any of them it is like a mouse/guest trap and triggers the purchase on your room. It has an electronic probe. After I lifted a couple of items to read the contents that I noticed the warning. I asked why and hotel staff explained if you don't use the item? The hotel staff explained it they would credit it back to your account. I think they really should disclose this prior to your going into the room. Other than this it was a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location at the top of Nob Hill
review.negativeRemarks: The in room items mouse/guest trap
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful the best view of San Francisco

review.title: Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: Love the location. It is a beautiful hotel. The staff was great and the food was amazing. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Ok hotel, ok location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but disappointed with view from the window. Not as luxurious as expected for a fairmont.

review.title: Tired old queen
review.reviewText:
This is my second stay at The Fairmont. This is a very historical hotel, and at one time was a queen of San Francisco. Unfortunately it is showing its age. The hotel rooms are quite expensive, and most things commonly found in a cheaper hotel - like a Marriott Residence Inn - are not available. No free breakfast, no in room coffee maker, and no free wireless internet. I got the feeling that the owners of the hotel were trying to make money wherever possible.

Another problem is the distance from the hotel to good restaurants, unless you eat in Chinatown everyday. Not even a nearby Starbucks to access free internet.

The one upside of the hotel was the great attitude and helpfulness of the staff, further supporting the adage that the hotel's best assets are its people.
review.negativeRemarks: Chinsy attitude with no perks included.
review.locationRemarks: Too far from good restaurants requiring taxi rides everywhere.

review.title: Great couples hotel!
review.reviewText: A Grand historic hotel. Not a motel. Parking is valet. Staff is over the top for friendliness & effort. a $10 cab ride to the wharf area. Not a lot of shopping or medium priced restaurants in the immediate area.

review.title: Just ok...
review.reviewText:
I felt very torn rating this hotel.

PROS
Beautiful, historical building
Upscale location
Clean, fairly good sized rooms
Efficient check in and check out process
Great price if you catch a good deal on Expedia

CONS
A hike (literally) from most major tourist sites
Not a high level of customer service ( no ritz carlton here)
Slightly outdated furnishings
Expensive valet parking

review.title: Awesome Hotel for family vacation or quick getaway
review.reviewText: Excellent experience over the past weekend. The gentleman at the front desk upgraded us a e to a Suite!!! The room was clean, spacious bed very comfortable. The views were fantastic and the location can not be beat. Just a few blocks away from Union square and tons of night life with in walking distance or a quick 5 minute cab ride.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were awesome. Staff very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is always tough in the city and the Hotel charges $56 for Valet. Luckily valet was included in my deal on Expedia.
review.locationRemarks: Block away from shopping, restaurants and nightlife.

review.title: Excellent historic hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. Great location. We walked all over the city. It was a bit much by the end of the weekend.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Solid, clean hotel on the hill
review.reviewText: Stayed on Memorial Day weekend 2013. Obviously this is the grand dame of SF. Very clean rooms. Ask for Bay view even if it's more money. Very nice breakfast buffet. Valet parking is $50 a day so beware of that. Nice solid hotel with professional staff. Eat at neighborhood cafes for lunch and dinner, rather than hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room. Drinks in large lobby bar area.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are a little thin. We had noisy neighbors.
review.locationRemarks: A few nice local bistros but you are probably cabbing it to nice restaurants.

review.title: NOT KID FRIENDLY
review.reviewText:
NOT Kid Friendly!!

There are no kid friendly amenities (no pool, no activity area, not good tv options) here other than offering a crib in the room. We were placed on the same floor as a wedding party (actually our room was attached to one of the couples in the wedding) and they were very loud! There was nothin done about this and no consideration for us having a toddler.

Location- nice view as it is too of Hill, convenient cable car connection, impossible to walk anywhere especially with stroller (easiest to take taxi with stroller to pier area)
review.negativeRemarks: No kid friendly amenities or accommodations
review.locationRemarks: Nice view but inconvenient

review.title: Wonderful Anniversary
review.reviewText: The hotel made a great effort to help us celebrate our wedding anniversary. Thank you for showing a couple of Texans some wonderful hospitality to mark the 15th anniversary of our first stay at the Fairmont!

review.title: Ball game and China Town.
review.reviewText:
Took my 13 year old son to a Giants game and stayed the night.Everything was great!
Will have to do it again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was a bit lumpy.
review.locationRemarks: Great views and close to everything.

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old, when we checked in late night, they gave us a room was like an add on facing to the elevator, ouside of the windows are lots of AC compressor units, we cannot believe we paid $300 per night for a room like this. We asked manager on duty to switch a room for us, but she insisted there was no other room available. So we cancelled our booking at 12am then we booked ourselves at Hilton and much nicer and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Old and smell bad
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SF

review.title: Amazing hotel!
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel with attention to detail. The treatment was amazing! Can't wait to go back!

review.title: true san francisco experience
review.reviewText: If you want the full San Francisco experience stay here. Not that this would happen to you but we literally ran into Tony Bennett in the elevator
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Fabulous luxurious hotel
review.reviewText: Absolutely loved the Fairmont. My one complaint is that they don't have complimentary Wi-Fi. Howard Johnson's has that these days, and the Fairmont wants $13.95 per day! Other than that, it's like staying in a palace in a fabulous location. We were upgraded to a bay view room in the tower - it was just a great experience. We would definitely go back.
review.positiveRemarks: the luxurious decor, fantastic service, great location
review.negativeRemarks: no wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: fabulous, famous, beautiful

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText:
I could not have been happier with my stay. The lobby of this hotel is stunning, the rooms are immaculate, and the staff are about as friendly as any could be.

My only complaint is about cost. sixty-five (65) dollars to park for one night is excessive.
review.negativeRemarks: Be more reasonable about parking fees. I have used valet parking in Manhattan that has cost me less.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is on Nob Hill. If you like to walk, there is plenty to do nearby. If you don't like to walk, I hope you like either cars or cable cars.

review.title: Worthwhile splurge!
review.reviewText: Beautiful, elegant hotel. Lovely bright room with great view.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Spacious room, quiet, fast service from staff and great views. Will be back.

review.title: The top of San Fran.
review.reviewText: Very Nice and Fancy Hotel! Great deal with free valet parking included. Hotel has a ton of history. Took a nice jog one morning and the doorman had a bottle of water and towel afterwards.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is very close to a great italian restaurant called The Nob Hill Cafe.

review.title: Luxury and at Great Price
review.reviewText: A wonderful experience at the Fairmont. We got a great deal on Expedia and thoroughly enjoyed the location and comfort of our room. So quiet! This is not our usual standard of accommodation but the deal was so good I couldn't pass it up.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and standard of accommodation and friendliness of the staff
review.locationRemarks: Central to downtown and Fisherman's Wharf. Transport close at hand.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: This is a gorgeous hotel no doubt about it. I would never stay there again for a few reasons. The service was terrible! The hotel staff was not up to par for the cost of this historic landmark. Also, there are tourists everywhere taking pictures of the lobby, it is very hard to get around. I would return to have a drink at the Tonga room or in the lobby but will not be a hotel guest there. The rooms were nice and clean but getting around or getting service, forget it.

review.title: Nice, but...
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and well run, but there was some unidentifiable element missing that kept this from being a great stay. The only problem we had was the guest in the next room going on Skype at 5:30 a.m. one morning. We were quite surprised not only to be able to hear him absolutely clearly (when I woke up I thought he must be standing in our doorway), but we could also hear whoever he was talking to fairly clearly over his computer's speakers. I have done a fair bit of camping but did not expect a tenting experience in a place like this!
review.negativeRemarks: Rice paper walls
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous

review.title: Double Upgrade!
review.reviewText: Checked in on a Sunday, whether it was slow or not the clerk gave us an upgrade without asking, very nice. Mentioned it was my birthday, (it really was), and thanked him for what I considered to be a nice gift. Before I knew it he had upgraded us again to a fantastic room with views from the Golden Gate Bridge to Treasure Island- AWESOME!!!
review.positiveRemarks: It is the epitome of San Francisco elegance, history and first class accommodation.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower wasn't draining properly, a little puddling after just a few minutes, (reason for 4 rating on facilities/condition). Minor issue fixed easily.
review.locationRemarks: Tonga Room, Top of the Mark next door and of course shopping in and around Union Square.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous! It has the cable car station right outside of the hotel which goes wherever you need to go. Easy walking distance to most anything (if you like a hill or two!).

review.title: Stay at The Fairmont
review.reviewText: Beautiful old SF hotel in a great area--pay extra for the view of the bay, it is well worth it. Breakfast buffet is pretty good, but the service there wasn't great. All other staff at the hotel were fantastic though.

review.title: Wonderful Weekend away
review.reviewText:
We found the service excellent! They treated us very well from the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out!

Room's were very well made up, room service was excellent!

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText:
In general a nice place to stay, but staff not as friendly as one may expect, and we experienced different responses to the same questions from different staff. Doorman very helpful except for one....who was condescending. Room not ready, waited until after 3:30pm, had to leave for family plans, checked in at 10:30pm, luggage was still in lobby, not in room as we were told, and no refrigerator as requested, which took another three phone calls. Not a nice start to our vacation. My advice, if a staff member promises you something....ie..check in time, luggage in room , fixing curtains to close properly to block out light,
take names. Because when you call again, you will get a different story, and they were not very apologetic. Slightly Stuffy.
review.positiveRemarks: Physical building was beautiful, location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff could be more helpful and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very central to everything, a short cable car away, which you need to take given the hotel is on top of a very steep hill.

review.title: Wonderful experiene.
review.reviewText: Close to all public transportation and in close walking distance to Union Square. Room service was available 24 hours. Access to resturant inside hotel. All kinds of events were happening right outside the front door.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing thus far.
review.locationRemarks: Location is ideal. Union Square, Piers by Trolley, Sights on Nob Hill.

review.title: Thanks
review.reviewText: I had a last minute opportunity to be in San Francisco, I booked a room through Expedia and got a 50% reduced rate and free valet parking. when I arrived the room was great but no view, I asked and received a room on the 11th floor for a small price increase. This was an incredible opportunity made better by the staff of the Fairmont, thanks.

review.title: Feeling of Royalty for a Commoner
review.reviewText: If you want to feel like royalty, stay here! The service was impeccable. From the time we checked in until we checked out, we lacked for nothing.
review.positiveRemarks: The opalence of the lobby was breath taking. And, the concierge personnel were so well versed on anything and everything we asked them.
review.negativeRemarks: The hill! Hint, learn to take the shortcut thru the garage to Powell Street to catch the cable car - much easier on the legs.
review.locationRemarks: Middle of everything to see, but take the cable car!!

review.title: Grand hotel with the best American service
review.reviewText:
Friendly superb service. Drink and food prices are commensurate withe the grandness of the hotel but they also have a cafe on the side which goes onto the street and has street prices. And pastries to die for, and not too big

wifi in the hotel is $14 per day for the low grade option, but free in the cafe

Cocktail recommendation - Bombay sapphire, lime juice, basil, whisked up with egg white, touch of syrup. Can't remember its name

Nearby cable car museum (free) is small but has excellent display on the 1906 earhquake
review.positiveRemarks: stunning view - pay the extra for outside view, we could see F Wharf and Alcatraz.(worth the trip, but mostly derelict buildings on a windswept rock)
review.negativeRemarks: The immediate area has only one bar /cafe. The rest are other big hotels or apartments. To walk anywhere is down seriously steep hills
review.locationRemarks: Highest point of SF. Two cable car routes intersect at hotel - real fun. Hotel next door has 20th floor bar, but odd dress code no ladies in sandals

review.title: Lovely old world
review.reviewText: Sounds of other guests could be easily heard through the walls at night. Otherwise a lovely hotel.

review.title: Nob Hill San Francisco
review.reviewText:
A typical Fairmont property with the quality and features you would expect..
