My only word of warning would be is that the hotel is on Nob Hill and if you are considering walking it is a steep grade. Other than that most enjoyable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: A doorman that was a little condescending

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: We got a good deal for this sort of hotel by having the parking charge included in an already reasonable room rate. Parking rates are otherwise extortionate. We also had the excitement of a fire alarm - all fine though we thought some of the staff could have done with a bit more urgency, after all, it could have been the real thing. This is not really about the hotel but, if you're going to SF, check out the new procedure for the GG Bridge before you drive over it!

review.title: Well situated but dated
review.reviewText: The hotel is well situated, but a little dated in terms of decoration.
review.negativeRemarks: Decoration
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Luxury away from home
review.reviewText: Air conditioning unit very old and quite noisy. Wifi should be included in the room cost as it is in many lesser budget hotels. Pleasant and helpful staff, a comfortable stay all in all.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy air con
review.locationRemarks: Perfect except hills will be walked

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText:
Very fancy hotel, good room. Good location to everything.
Interesting history of the hotel.
Complimentary internet would have been nice
review.negativeRemarks: No complimentary internet
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill, fun walking down the hill not so much fun coming back up

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: I've stayed at Fairmont hotels before and the room I had really was not up to the standard I was used to from the group. The room was stuffy (and it was not that hot in SF), the bathroom could have used an update, and it was pretty noisy. Housekeeping staff wandering up and down the corridors early morning yelling "housekeeping, hello, hello" was not appreciated. Yappy dogs barking in the corridor did not help my mood either. Really, overpriced for what it was, and it wasn't the best location for the Moscone Center. I should have spent less for something on Union Square, as I don't think the standard of the room justified the price when I could have had a similar room at a lower price in a lower star hotel.

review.title: It's always an exhausting climb back to the hotel.
review.reviewText:
Reasonably priced for a formerly opulent, now rather faded hotel.
Some rooms very run-down.
Located at the top of a very steep hill. Do not stay here if you have mobility issues.
Food so-so.

review.title: Exceptional
review.reviewText: From the moment that we checked into The Fairmont Hotel we knew that this stay was going to be a special one. The hotel and staff lived up to everything that my husband and I expected. In fact, the level of service from the hotel staff surpassed all our expectations. The staff are so friendly, warm and always have a smile for their guests. The Hotel is exquisite. The rooms are so clean, comfortable and the view from our room into the garden area and city was fantastic. This is a superb Hotel. We have stayed in 5 star hotels before but this is the one that we will always regard as being the best one ever!
review.positiveRemarks: Service and friendliness of Hotel staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that we did not like.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is a great location to stay in San Francisco. It is on a hill with great views.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Great atmosphere. Excellent service! Food amazing!

review.title: 3 Day Stay
review.reviewText: A magnificent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: They were not able make an Irish coffee but the staff handled our concerns well.

review.title: Fading Glory
review.reviewText:
The glory days of the Fairmont are well behind it. The building is lovely, of course. The hallways gracious. And the rooms very nicely sized.

But the rooms and the fittings within them are in need of refurbishment. Our bed coverings were visibly stained. The walls, carpets and paint are showing some wear. Don't get me wrong. This is not a dump by any stretch of the imagination nor is it a shambles. It's just that for a hotel of this quality and cost, it's high time for some investment.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location on Nob HIll. Historic Building.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs some refurbishment

review.title: Awesome Hotel in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: I really enjoy staying at the Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco. It is such an exquisite place. The Tonga room is very cool and all the people you come in contact with are very freindly. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: We had a great time! Every staff member was friendly and accommodating. The hotel is absolutely beautiful!

review.title: The Extras Take Away From the Experience
review.reviewText: The "additional" costs policy is disappointing and not worthy of a five start hotel. For example: $15/day for internet. $15 - $20 per visit for the fitness facility. These charges as "extras" are expected at a Motel 6 not a Fairmont hotel. These costs should be clearly set out at the time of booking. The little "extras" that one would expect in a hotel of this calibre were also missing. For example, there was no coffee maker in the room. I expect to see this in Las Vegas, not San Francisco.

review.title: What a spectacular hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a magnificent, spectacularly beautiful historic hotel -- the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful, the room was lovely, and the hotel is in a great location complete with cable car stop conveniently just across the street. Nothing could have made our visit to the Fairmont better than it was!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, helpful staff; beautiful spacious room
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: convenient to cable car stop; beautiful view from a high point in the city

review.title: Wonderful Stay!
review.reviewText: Fairmont hotel has a great staff, we would love to stay there again on our next visit.
review.negativeRemarks: None

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
I loved everything about the Fairmont. It's just a beautiful hotel. The staff was friendly and professional, we had a great view from our room, and even from the bathroom. The exterior room was a great value and had really high ceilings, which makes the room feel a lot bigger than it is. Hearing the bells from Grace Cathedral was so relaxing. I didn't want to leave.
The only two negative things were that #1) the couple staying in the room next to us knocked on our door around 11pm to tell my friends and I that we were being too loud, when we were really just talking at what we thought was a normal level. Not the hotel's fault, but it made me wonder if the walls are really thin. Either way, we had to spend the rest of the night whispering, which was kind of annoying. #2) the two double beds in the room were pretty smalll. Wish they were two queens.
All in all, a wonderful stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The view, the Grace Cathedral bells, the staff, the spacious and high-ceiling room, the ornate beauty of the lobby and room, dinner at the Tonga Room.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls? Small beds.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful location, close to many attractions.

review.title: Wonderful, glamourous hotel with good service.
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stayed at the fairmont for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The rooms are so big that I would have loved to see a sofa in them, rather than 2 chairs. The furniture did not fill up the space. Our room was in a good location and looked out over the flags that flew over the front doors. The staff was very accomodating and helpful, especially the concierge. It would have been nice if the hotel had a shuttle from the airport or a car that could take you to a restaurant, but luckily the cable cars stopped right outside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel was old, usually in good condition, had to have the engineers repair the drain in the sink.
review.locationRemarks: At the top of Nob Hill, away from the hustle and bustle of San Francisco, but accessible to restaurants, shopping and sightseeing.

review.title: Lovely hotel, wish it were closer to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Let me start off by saying, I loved the Fairmont. We were on the 23rd floor of the tower, and had an amazing view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the city. Everything truly was top of the line. The staff are helpful and accomodating. The hotel itself is beautiful and grand. It has every modern convenience yet retains it's old world glamour.

My only complaint is that the hotel isn't really near anything. To get to any restaurants other than the ones in the hotel, one must catch a cable car down Powell St. to Union Square or a ride to Fisherman's Wharf.. It's not a long ride, but after a long day trekking around the city, sometimes the last thing you want is another ride/walk up/down to Union Square. This is also true for breakfast in the morning. Unless you want to pay top dollar for the hotel buffet, your only option is a little coffee shop attached to the hotel (Cafe Cento) on Powell St. Otherwise, it's down the hill you go.

I'm not sure I would stay there again, but it has nothing to do with the hotel itself, rather the location of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff are friendly and helpful; beautiful views from the tower.
review.negativeRemarks: No reasonably priced restaurants in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Not optimally located near major sight-seeing areas.

review.title: A terrible tired hotel
review.reviewText: 1st room was so small that bellhop advised us nt to accept it. Second room smelled of cigarrette smoke which probably came in through adjacent room. Maids could not remove strong odor
review.locationRemarks: Ok

review.title: Great style
review.reviewText: It's a great classic hotel in San Fran, good if you like the old feel versus new & modern. I like this location also, not in the main touristy area but easy to get around from here. The one thing that's mildly annoying is being charged extra for in-room wi-fi when I'm paying that much money for a hotel room, call me cheap.

review.title: Fairmont SF
review.reviewText: The location was great, but everything else was disappointing. The room was dusty and the service was not exceptional.
review.negativeRemarks: everything else
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Fantastic hotel for feeling special for a few dayS
review.reviewText:
The five days at this hotel were amazing. My first trip to San Francisco and this hotel was chosen because the final night was to attend a concert in the Venetian Room at the Fairmont. The hotel is beautiful both inside and out and the views of the city from our room was incredible.
The staff were friendly, helpful, courteous and nothing was too much trouble. I have to mention two of the guys on the concierge desk - Earl and an older man, sadly I didn't get his name, who were so accomodating it was untrue.
I felt like a VIP during my time at the hotel - the service was second to none and everyone seemed to be relaxed and enjoying themselves. It's in a wonderful location with cable cars in easy reach and easy walking to Union Square.
It's not a cheap option but perfect for that special occasion.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff - it was all great but they were outstanding
review.negativeRemarks: No tea/coffee facilities in the room
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant! With all the hills in San Francisco a hotel where all three cable car lines meet can't be beaten

review.title: One of the best
review.reviewText:
This is a wonderful hotel filled with style and history. The staff was wonderful as was the room we stayed in. The view from our room on the 23rd floor was unmatched.
Truly a wonderful experience in a wonderful city

photos.caption: View of Golden Gate Bridge from our hotel window
View of Alcatraz from our hotel room window
View of the city from our hotel room window

review.title: Most incredible hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous! It is less than a 1 block walk to the cable cars as well as walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square. The staff is so friendly, enormously helpful, and the rooms are beyond gorgeous. We had incredible views of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, the cable cars, and the city. The telescope in our room allowed us to view the sea lions relaxing at the Fisherman's Wharf, the end of the Chinese New Year parade (from our hotel window), and so much more. This is the only place we stay at when visiting San Francisco. HIGHLY recommend.

review.title: Grand in San Fran
review.reviewText: Grand in San Francisco with a great location atop Nob Hill. Staff is very friendly and big double rooms. The entry lounge is fantastic with superb sitting areas! Expensive but worth a nights splendor a,

review.title: Good hotel but upkeep of room poor
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and very grand - it feels like you in Europe. Breakfasts are expensive and there are not many coffee bars or restaurants near by. The upkeep for this type of hotel was very poor. The nets were torn, and the linen is awful with "bobbles" definitely not 100 % cotton - otherwise the room was comfortable. Also Internet is not free $14 per 24 hours - what a rip off
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast - although very pricey $30 per person + tax
review.negativeRemarks: Up keep of the room
review.locationRemarks: Good location but not many restaurants or coffee bars outside

review.title: Weekend getaway
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time! Room was spacious and elegant and the service was excellent

review.title: One of the best ever
review.reviewText:
Absolutely wonderful staff, fantastic location. The building is gorgeous.
Every staff member was knowledgeable and engaging. Service was fast and accurate.
One of the best hotels we have ever visited.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great staff and great location so I would go back again

review.title: Overall a pleasant stay. Very good location.
review.reviewText:
O k. Pleasant hotel friendly staff. Menu disappointing in laurel court.
Shortage of cupboard space and drawer space in room. Wifi free only in cafe cento accessible from lift

review.title: Can do better.
review.reviewText: Overall in need of a makeover. Doors are extremely heavy and constantly in your room you hear the slamming of doors from guests and housekeeping. Not a quiet night's sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, old curtains, rugs, decor, exorbitant breakfast cost.
review.locationRemarks: In Nob Hill. Near cablecar stops.

review.title: Plentiful size room for family of four.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel on the top of Nob Hill with extraordinary views (from certain aspects) and convenient to the cable cars which zip past in both directions (though are somewhat nerve wracking to board!). Our check-in couldn't have gone better: a lovely man greeted us and though a little early we were able to claim a room straight away. Plus he gave us helpful tips on catching the cable cars. Overall our stay was very good. The reason I haven't given top marks for the room is that while large and able to accommodate our family of four easily (for our short stay) the walls between the rooms are wafer thin. We could hear the family next door and the walls positively shook every time they slammed their door. Also the light shone brightly under the adjoining room which is disconcerting. If they had stayed up later and made even a bit more noise, it could have disrupted our night quite a bit. Luckily they didn't. Would I stay again despite this? Yes.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise disturbance between rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Well appointed at the top of Nob Hill.

review.title: cigrette small was strong in our room.
review.reviewText: Our room stunk of cigarettes. We were supposed to be on a non smoking floor. This is my main complaint.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. Lovely hotel, all staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Hooray
review.reviewText: Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Had a wonderful time.

review.title: Wonderful stay at Fairmont San Francisco
review.reviewText: Fairmont on Nob Hill in San Francisco is a must stay. The history, service and friendliness of staff (particularly Scott at reception and Ivan driver) was outstanding. The Fairmont beds are a dream and a wonderful relief from a long flight. Thanks Fairmont San Francisco, highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Service, character and history of hotel
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Wonderful Location is the Best Part...
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fairmont for three nights in January, 2013 and for the most part enjoyed our stay. Pluses: 1) Unbeatable location at the top of Nob Hill, opposite the old California Governor's Mansion. 2) Very grand, elegant lobby and dining area - although the style is old- fashioned and might not appeal to those who favor a chic, modern ambience. 3) Good breakfast! Fresh orange juice, good coffee...a nice start to the day. 4) We were offered a very good rate on our room - about $300/day, including tax. Minuses: 1) We stayed in the so-called Tower Block, which features better views than the main building - but you can't open the windows! Not even a crack... 2) The room was clean and the bed comfortable, but the decor is, well, tired. In fact the entire hotel looks a bit frayed around the edges. But for $300/night, I didn't mind. I am told (from a very reliable source) that the owner of the hotel is trying to convert the entire building into condos, which might explain why he doesn't seem to be putting a lot of effort, or money, into maintaining his property. 3) There was an enormous convention taking place at the hotel during our stay - we sometimes had to elbow our way through the crowds just to get to the elevator.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is one of the "grande dames" left in the United States, as it still holds its elegance and stature of days gone by. It is charming, upscale, comfortable and special. It has been maintained beautifully and is the best large hotel in San Francisco. It has a perfect location at the top of Nob Hill, with views all over the city. It is across the street from the Mark Hopkins Hotel and the Top of the Mark. It is convenient to the trolley, and it is surrounded by restaurants, cafes and shops of all kinds.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant, bar, parking availability and staff are the best.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no coffee maker or refrigerator in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to trolley, restaurants, bars, groceries

review.title: Best place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: What a wonderful hotel! History is amazing. Location, perfect. Will never stay anywhere else while in San Francisco. Our room in the tower had an incredible view. The entire hotel staff was professional and helpful. Thank you all for a wonderful anniversary weekend!
review.negativeRemarks: Tonga Room - drinks good, food not so much. Touristy.
review.locationRemarks: Great! Can catch trolly or bus to anywhere with just a short walk.

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: The lady at check in was not bothered. She did not even welcome us and when I asked for some changes to be made regarding my company details on the invoice she replied straight away (in a rude way) not possible. The on check it was possible. When I entered the room it smelled a lot of cigarette smoke. It was a very bad smell, nearly unbearable. Also the bell man noticed and he said when I asked him about the smell “ooo well sometimes people smoke in the room”. Then of course I went down to reception and I asked to change rooms (they upgraded me) but once again the lady was not bothered. She did not even apologize. Overall it is not worth its money. Also vey expensive Valet parking 67 dollars per day and Wi-Fi 13,99 per day. They even charge 25 dollars per day for 1 small fridge that I need for my medication.
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: OK. Near Union Square but a steep uphill road going back to the hotel.

review.title: First Class all the way
review.reviewText:
Excellent quality hotel. If it weren't for the super cheap rates we managed to get we wouldn't ordinarily stay at such as exclusive property.

Very grand building that literally sits on top of Nob Hill and has great views from the hotel and the street.

Thanks to Expedia for obtaining some discount rates.

The lobby area at xmas time was a sight to behold with their ginat xmas tree and 2 storey tall ginger bread house
review.negativeRemarks: not being able to stay another night
review.locationRemarks: Take a car, taxi or limo to get there as the walk up the hill is not for the faint hearted.

review.title: Happy with slight disappointment
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite wonderful but our room was on the top floor and obviously near air conditioning units as it was very noisy when the machinery was running. Windows can open and ours was open slightly - we would have had less noise with it closed. There was also a vibration at times that could be felt in the furniture. Otherwise, I would rate this hotel excellent. It had wonderful Christmas decorations - a lovely place to visit just for that reason.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was noisy but this would not be a problem with a different room not on the top floor.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great - we were tourists and it was well situated on the cable car route with easy access to the main tourist sites.

review.title: Need renew
review.reviewText: We were in the old part of the hotel. They really need to make upgrade for the rooms. Is a very old hotel, more than 100 years, but, i think they need to renew the rooms. The location is good, the hotel is very beautiful but is old.

review.title: In the heart of SF.
review.reviewText: Stunning views, a fantastic bathroom, great location, and some nice amenities like the downstairs gym and wi-fi in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Stunning views, a fantastic bathroom, great location, and some nice amenities like the downstairs gym and wi-fi in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: We stayed for 6 nights; it would have been nice to have the bath robes changed half way through our stay.

review.title: Christmas holiday at the Fairmont.
review.reviewText: Loved this place ! All the staff was always very helpful. Beautiful hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Right in the center of most tourist spots. Could either walk to them or take the cable cars. Many interesting things to see in just the hotel itself.
review.negativeRemarks: In room food was expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the center of most of the tourist spots. Could either walk to them to take the cable cars just right outside.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Beautiful, especially during Christmastime. Great location...I was worried about it being at the top of Knob Hill, but it was walking distance to everything (Union Square/North Beach/Fisherman's Wharf/Chinatown). And cable cars right there. Concierge was great. Didn't get a room with a view (it was actually a very terrible view), but for the steal I got the room it was expected.
review.negativeRemarks: View from room.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, walking distance to everything.

review.title: Weekend Getaway Disappointment
review.reviewText: I just got back from a stay at the Fairmont. I always looked forward to staying there but was very disappointed once I finally got the chance to go down. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful! Great location, wonderfull lobby and the Tonga Room is always amazing. However, the staff was very rude and unfriendly. At check in I was simply handed the key and that was it. The service at both restaurants we went to in the hotel was not great either. The room had a beautiful view of Coit Tower. However, that was one of the only good things. We could hear the people in the room next to ours like they were inside the same room. It got very old after awhile. The drain in the shower also didn't work. EW! Overall I would recomment this place to someone if they wanted to have a drink but that's about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff, Room, Service, Noise
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Better than a average safe place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice historic hotel, hotel room was large and comfortable. Whole place could use a good cleaning staff was generally grumpy other than Nester who was awesome
review.negativeRemarks: Grump staff just putting in time

review.title: Fairmont receives Fair review
review.reviewText:
Requests were not filled within a timely manner. Several phone calls had to meet needs to housekeeping or room service to be reminded of the requests made. I had trouble with Internet every day I had to call and get help to be reconnected. On our last day a bill for the in room refrigerator was slipped under the door with a huge bill being charged to us For beer and pop - When we actually had not consumed anything from the refrigerator.
I was also not impressed that the bathroom sink was backed up Throughout our six day stay. In my opinion this should have been attended to.
On day three hour robes were taken to be washed with our towels and were not replenished. We had to make another phone call to request new robes.
review.positiveRemarks:
- We had a spectacular view
- The hotel was beautifully decorated
- The concierge was helpful
- front Desk upgraded us to a satisfactory room
review.negativeRemarks:
- Housekeeping staff attitude and lack of English
- Request filled in an untimely manner - lots of waiting & had to make several calls
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Nob Hill

review.title: Disappointing for a Fairmont
review.reviewText: I've stayed in 3 fairmonts and this has been the only disappointing one. The main issue is that they nickel and dime you. Everything has an extra charge. The wi-fi, water, gym, etc. I understand this is routine in many hotels, but I expect more from the fairmont. They even had a bottle of wine sitting on the dresser in the room, I pick it up to see what type and a sensor promptly tells me 'for your convenience your room has been charged'. Again, not unexpected in many hotels, but come on. The hotel itself was beautiful with pleasant staff. Concierge was not very helpful. I tried getting ballet tickets and was told I'd be called back when they found out if any were available....no call. It's the details that set apart a great hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Warm was very warm with no way to make it cooler
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was over the top. The lobby started the experience with a grand Christmas tree and gingerbread house. People were always in the lobby taking pictures. Very friendly staff and the room was clean and comfortable. We will stay here again in the future.

review.title: Especially beautiful at Christmas!
review.reviewText:
We thought accommodations and physical plant were excellent. Service & attention to detail by staff as good as anywhere we've seen around the world.
Only negatives:
- water pressure in shower (in Tower Bldg) inadequate
- toiletries could have been replenished more frequently (had to ask for soap)
- need extra staff in dining room when high usage expected (e.g., Christmas morning breakfast. Service on that one day was poor.)
- only real issue was that the health club is inadequate for the type of hotel it is AND the locker room had an odor when entering. Cleanliness was an issue here (but certainly no where else in hotel)! Health club not consistent with rest of facility.

All in all, an excellent experience and would return!

P.S. Christmas decorations terrific - could recommend just for that!
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure on 15th floor Tower Bldg
review.locationRemarks: Have to be in good shape to walk around - lots of hills

review.title: A grand, historic hotel.
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont is a grand and historic hotel that everyone should visit when in San Francisco, even if they don't stay there. The lobby, with its marble floors and soaring columns, is a landmark all by itself. The Tonga Room tiki bar is another must-see attraction.

The staff was universally attentive and efficient. The room we stayed in was small but very comfortable. However, despite millions spent in renovations, this is an OLD building and not everything is up to date. The windows in our room were leaky and had peeling paint. But everything else was absolutely first class.
review.positiveRemarks: The building is a magnificent landmark, one of the grandest hotels in the U.S.
review.negativeRemarks: Leaky wooden windows.
review.locationRemarks: The location, on top of Nob Hill, is convenient to Chinatown, North Beach, Fishermen's Wharf and all cable car lines.

review.title: Jacob
review.reviewText: It is a classic and clean hotel. I like everything they decrarated for Christmas. The only problem I had was that the Queen-side bed was not as wide as the regular one and I can hear people closing the door from other rooms while I was sleeping at night. Other than these, it is still one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I would recommended it.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Great place to "come home to" when on the road. Good location, great service. The best of San Francisco.

review.title: The Best Hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. This is a beautiful property and the stuff is very helpful. The rooms are gorgeous and the bathrooms are super nice - especially the shower. My room was overlooking the city and the view was amazing! Thank you, David from the front desk for this free upgrade! As well, the Christmas decoration was one of the best I have ever seen.

I would have enjoyed more if there was a swimming pool & hot tubs on site, but otherwise it is a really nice hotel. The mini bar at the room is very expensive but there are so many dining options at San Francisco, so this was not a major issue for me. The hotel is awesome and one of the symbols of the city, so do not hesitate to stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: The city view, the bathroom & the Christmas decoration
review.negativeRemarks: No hot tubs
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect - close to everything!!! Super convenient!

review.title: A SF Landmark, not to be missed
review.reviewText:
The staff at the Fairmount from arrival through departure was nothing less than wonderful in every aspect of performance, from the outside entrance through signing in and after. The restaurant in the hotel was equally pleasant, and their knowledge of the city and hotel history was especially thought provoking.

A very fine two days.

review.title: Good for couples.
review.reviewText: incidentals were expensive, mini bar, in room movie,etc.

review.title: get away for bday celebration
review.reviewText: Thank you very much. We ve had a pleasant stay. Rooms are clean, service is nice. It was my bday celebration, nice walk to the major resraurants. Very safe environment.

review.title: Unhappy customer
review.reviewText: I thought the parking rates were excessive and free WI-Fi was not available to everyone.

review.title: We love the Fairmont!
review.reviewText: This was by far the best vacation we've had in SF. The Fairmont is beautiful, comfortable and the location cannot be beat. We'll be back for sure!
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't have a least favorite.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located. Everything is accessible by public transportation, which is also great!

review.title: Lovely escape
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, and a great, accessible location for the Financial District, China Town, North Beach and the Embarcadero.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is absurdly expensive.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was decorated nicely for the holidays- loved that! Room service was super expensive and walls in room were very thin. Could hear neighbors on both sides- very embarrassing! Loved everything else though. Nice place to stay- huge rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the room size, location, and Holiday decorations.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive room service and thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect!

review.title: Beautiful location and impeccable service
review.reviewText: The service at this hotel is always impeccable. Its an older, historic building so you have to figure that into your expectations. That said, I find it very comfortable. Fantastic location as well.

review.title: Christmas fun
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. The hotel was decorated beautifully for Christmas

review.title: Awesome hotel to stay at!
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely nice. It is an amazing place to stay especially when they have deals going on. I got an 24 hour deal and I am so glad I reserved the room. The hotel is very well kept and the staff is very friendly. The Christmas tree was beautiful along with all the other decorations. The parking is a little hard to get to but there is a parking garage on California Street that is not expensive and is walking distance to the hotel.

review.title: Busy bees
review.reviewText:
We loved it, our corner room had a view of the beehives that they use the honey from to make the honey beer- so that was fun! The decorations were beautiful. This is the busiest hotel lobby I've ever been in- lots of fun. The service in the bar a little rough- and apparently a known problem I you read reviews. You can purchase the money beer by the 4 pack in age cento- but you have to ask for it-
I was a tiny bit disappointed that there was no in room coffee but that's it
review.negativeRemarks: Walking Nob hill

review.title: Best Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Our favorite place to stay in SF. We go back frequently and enjoy it every time.
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill is like being on top of the world

review.title: Great for couples.
review.reviewText:
The room was small but cute and nicely furnished. The bed was attractive and very comfortable.
The hotel is gorgeous and really decorated nice for the holidaays.
review.positiveRemarks: It's the Fairmont; the name speaks for itself.
review.negativeRemarks: Not close to Bart
review.locationRemarks: Its a beautiful location and right up there among the other nice hotels.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Grand hotel that is simply gorgeous. Staff is extremely helpful. Beds are the most comfortable for any hotel I have stayed at. Room service is quick. Dining is pricey, but food is ok. Only had breadfast therem but the buffet was pretty good.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive dining
review.locationRemarks: Great location with fantastic views from some of the tower rooms. Bit of a hike from Union Square.

review.title: Great stay for Christmas Holidays
review.reviewText: The Holidays are a wonderful time to visit. The decorations are amazing! Best in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks:
The service, we were upgraded
The room with view of Grace Cathedral
The wonderful Xmas decor
review.negativeRemarks: the $50 a night parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Perfect but on top of Nob Hill so tough walking, cable car or cab

review.title: great hotel for all
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very elegant and the staff was amazing. Really enjoyed the tonga room. My wife and i went for a weekend get away, even with the rainy weather ended having a great time.. this hotel is close to most tourist attractions

review.title: Beautiful and graceful old dame of a hotel.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Service in the bar was slow and not attentive. Napkins weren't brought and ice was forgotten. Room wasn't ready when I arrived. Coffee shop line was almost one-half hour long. Man in Asian shop on lobby floor was rude. The hotel limo was not available to take me down the street. You need some really good help in the main areas. The maids were very nice and attentive and did a good job. Mouthwash in the bathroom would be nice. The Marriott has that. Love the hotel decorations and decor, but the service for the most part doesn't fit the class of modern great hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Service in the bar.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Great Hotel, bad matresses!
review.reviewText: the matress are awful!! couldnt sleep, they are very, very soft, but in a inconfortable way, I think they are old.
review.negativeRemarks: the beds
review.locationRemarks: well located

review.title: NIce Hotel
review.reviewText: It was nice tonga room expereience was fun- room small bad view but becaus of price that was expected.
review.positiveRemarks: The holiday decorations were really well done.
review.locationRemarks: Hard to walk to atop very steep Hill- can ride cable car but that has mmny

review.title: Beautiful icon and nice place to stay to enjoy SF
review.reviewText:
Fairmont is an icon in San Francisco. Beautiful. The room is comfortable. The bed is good, nicely decorated and a nice full bathroom. Bathrobes included!!!

Minus:
We had a drink in the bar/ lounge, but service was very very slow. They didnt bring us any complimentary water and everyone received nuts, except us. We ordered a snack but the dips were very cold and the breadsticks not fresh.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby and I always sleep very good in this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Slow service in bar
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown

review.title: San Francisco Fairmont
review.reviewText:
1) Upon arrival, the staff was extremely loud in the hall 'discussing' their issues of cleaning.
2# Windows were dirty, although there was a note that window washers were working. Why let them get that bad? Sink drained slowly.
3) Noisy neighbors at 1:00 am made for lousy sleep on last night, when we needed to arrise at 6:00 am for a flight. Condition was made worse by connecting room door#s#. I canceled room service breakfast to get some sleep time back. Security did quiet the situation very promptly and without incident.
4) Front desk very helpful and considerate at both check-in and check-out, however I was not furnished a statement at check out as it was pre paid through Expedia, but there were room service charges on my credit card that should not have been. I would have disputed them then if I had been aware of the charges.

review.title: Iconic Hotel at a great rate.
review.reviewText: This is an Iconic hotel in San Francisco and I was amazed that I could get a room for such a great price. It's a good workout just walking up Nob Hill from anywhere in the city so expect to take a cab if you're not ready for a steep walk. Other than that it was great.
review.negativeRemarks: They did try to charge me for a meal I didn't have at their restaurant, but they cleared that up right away.

review.title: Beautiful old SF
review.reviewText: Lovely and the decorations were very special, wonderful holiday time in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to wait for breakfast seating!
review.locationRemarks: Interesting

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: We loved the historic charm and beauty of The Fairmont. Our room was both comfortable and clean.

review.title: Why can't all hotels be like this?
review.reviewText: This hotel is wonderful. I wish I could live there. During the holidays, they have an enormous gingerbread house and Christmas tree in the lobby. The Tonga Room is such a fun kitschy place for happy hour and/or an evening of fun. And, Laurel Court was a great place for a drink and appetizers after a long day of meetings. Fairmont knows how to run a hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The gingerbread house for the holidays.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower was lacking a bit of water pressure.
review.locationRemarks: It is a great location on nob hill right next to the cable car lines.

review.title: Fantastic San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: Awesome location with wonderful views! The lobby of this place is absolutely breathtaking! Right on the cable car line with easy access to everything. Top of the Mark is across the street and I would highly recommend it for a great evening out.
review.negativeRemarks: No complimentary tea or coffee in the rooms.

review.title: loved it
review.reviewText: Was there last week (Dec 2012) for three nights and what can I say...a magnificent hotel with such history. Staff were fantastic - both personable and professional. breakfast was really nice (bircher muesli was yummm)...and location perfect. I loved my room and had such a good view overlooking SFO. would stay there again. Oh, I booked through Expedia and got a good rate and it all worked out well.

review.title: Nice Stay at a wonderful Hotel !
review.reviewText: I can recommend this Hotel to everyone who likes to be in a wonderful City!
review.locationRemarks: Superior !

review.title: overall a great place
review.reviewText: overall it was a great place. However, the bathroom was somewhat small, and it was impossible to get coffee at the coffee shop due to long slow lines. A coffee/tea machine in the room would have been great.

review.title: Must stay at the Fairmount.
review.reviewText: One of the best hotels I have experienced. Great service from entire staff especially the Concierge. Beautiful hotel in central location. The restaurant recommendations were all superb. Best weekend stay so far.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful, courteous and friendly. The hotel has great history. The Tango Room was entertaining. Great holiday decorations
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. Only wish the cigar lounge was open on Sundays and Mondays.
review.locationRemarks: Central to all attractions

review.title: Nice hotel, with all the charm of days gone by
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, with all the charm of days gone by. Staff was execellent, service top notch. We stayed at Thankgiving, the hotel was full of energy with Christmas festivities.

I'm a business traveler taking my wife on a long weekend to San Francisco. The street car stops outside the coffee shop via Powell Street providing easy access down to Fisherman Wharf etc.

I would stay there again.

review.title: Shortcomings defeat Grandeur and Charm
review.reviewText:
This is a beautiful hotel in a very convenient location in San Francisco within a 5 minute walk of Union Square. Unfortunately those are really the only good points that I can comment on.
The concierge service is probably the worst I have ever experienced. We were told by one concierge that there were no restaurants within walking distance that he could recommend, although we found 5 or 6 within a few blocks of the hotel, 2 of which we ate at that were incredibly delicious.Little to no recommendation on shopping districts other than a few quick circles on a map of San Francisco. No information on what types of stores or merchandise they may sell.
Twice we felt like having a drink in the lounge attached to the Restaurant just off the Lobby and it took 14 minutes to be served the first time and after 10 minutes the second time we walked up to the bar and ordered directly from the bartender.
The walls in our room are paper thin....I have never been in a hotel where you could hear every word that the next door guests were saying. Need less to say my wife and I either whispered or texted each other to keep our conversations private.
If you want a coffee, you have to go down 3 levels below the lobby and past the indoor garage to a coffee shop otherwise you get charged $ 18.00 for a small carafe.
Althought this is a beautiful hotel, it s shortcomings far outweigh its grandeur and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for quality service or privacy in their room.

review.title: Beautiful Landmark Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a beautiful, historic landmark hotel in San Francisco. The registration staff and housekeeping couldn't have been more accommodating. The hotel room was luxurious and spacious and the hotel was decorated beautifully for the holidays. On the other hand, the concierge's recommendation for dinner was "off". I asked for a Japanese or Chinese restaurant recommendation and the concierge suggested the "Sushi Boat". When I inquired if this restaurant had offerings other than sushi she told me yes. We later discovered that the restaurant only offered sushi. I wished the concierge had offered more/better suggestions for dinner. Be aware of the cost of overnight hotel parking - $61!!

review.title: one of the best in SF
review.reviewText: I said comfort was just okay because we could hear talking very clearly in early morning in room next door. It seems the walls are very thin, although the hotel feels very sturdy and solid. The bed was comfortable. Staff was amazing, and when my bf cracked the toliet seat just by sitting on it after the shower, it was replaced without incident.
review.positiveRemarks: the lobby. totally decorated for holidays. the ceilings and walls are just gorgeous.
review.negativeRemarks: the noise in adjacent room
review.locationRemarks: UP the HILL! you get your exercise! But, it's close to Union Square.

review.title: Nice surroundings for an old landmark.
review.reviewText: Outrageous fees nightly for your car. Very poor service with staff getting your car. It took a long time and staff was not helpful. When mentioned to manager and staff, nothing was done. Restaurants in the Fairmont were not good. Slow service and food was not at the level for a Fairmont hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: very good

review.title: experience was worth every penny
review.reviewText: very nice hotel and staff. just a heads up that parking at the hotel is not cheap and valet is required for those who havent been there. Sound travels through the room door so you can hear people in the hallway, that is the only thing that i didnt like but wasnt bad enough to make me not want to go there again.
review.negativeRemarks: can hear people in the hall through room door
review.locationRemarks: nice location. it is a bit of a walk to the beach from the hotel

review.title: Sound insulation please?
review.reviewText: Very classic and historical. Beautiful hotel. Superb location. My only complain is that the sound insulation is quite poor. We woke up to our next door's chatting and coughing noice.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and located in a great neighborhood. The staff were friendly and the lobby was gorgeous! This is a historic hotel a top nob hill.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful lobby. It has a unique and opulent decor. Atop of knob hill beautifully historic building. The Tanga Room was fun!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and location. However, in these times it seems incredible to me that a high end hotel would not have a coffee service in the room, or at least in the lobby in the morning. it was a trek to the (licensed) coffee shop. And the same goes for water. I think a bottle of water is a small benefit in a hotel of this quality and cost. It was never offered. Instead a bottle of water from the mini bar was $4.00. Lastly, we arrived at 9:00 pm on a long flight from Hawaii, and made it to the lounge by 10:05. We were informed by our waiter that the kitchen closed at 10:00. Meanwhile several other groups, with different waiters were served - even though they arrived after us.

I'd stay there again. but my expectations are now lower.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on nob hill at the intersection of both Cable Car routes

review.title: Fairmont
review.reviewText: Fairmont lives up to its reputation of being an excellent hotel. Food is great and location in center of town gives excellent access to all restaurants and attractions. We would strongly recommend

review.title: Exceptional!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, close everything, but the parking fee is excessive.

review.title: Luxury on a budget
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and informative. The room with two queen beds was spacious enough for myself and my two teenage daughters. The location was central to almost every place we wanted to visit. The area was safe at night as well.
review.locationRemarks: Central location in a safe quiet area.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: When we arrived to check in the hotel was fully booked and ended up putting us in a large corner room with a beautiful view of San Francisco. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was helpful. There were a few minor things that could be updated but overall it was a beautiful hotel and very comfortable to stay in. We traveled with our 8 year old son and they were very accommodating.

review.title: San Francisco Nights
review.reviewText: Spent a weekend there as the base for our San Francisco nights. This is a quality hotel in a quality location...
review.positiveRemarks: great location at the top of Nob Hill

review.title: Not for everyone
review.reviewText: Good hotel great price! but I did not consider that the special offer was only about the room so everything else was priced as a 5 star hotel: valet parking, breakfast, drinks into the room, internet connection, everything. This is just my personal evaluation but I don't know if a next time I repeat the experience or I will look for something more warm and welcoming .
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing included into the room price, high rate for everything
review.locationRemarks: location downtown but not close to the touristic spots so you need to move by bus or taxi

review.title: Venerable old hotel atop Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: Would have nice to have a view from inside, but all we had to do for a great view was step out into the street.
review.negativeRemarks: No views from anywhere inside.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location.

review.title: Anadequate hotel, but not a good value
review.reviewText: This hotel is expensive, and as such I had high expectations. They compare themselves to the Savoy in London. When I arrived at 8:00pm, the woman at the desk told me she was going to change my room so I could avoid being near a party. I was given a room on the seventh floor. My room was small and very musty. The phone, hair dryer, and scale were all from about 1985. It was like being in a very clean B&B owned by a fussy old lady. The linens were marvellous. Even the room service delivery man commented on how small the room was. Then, there was a party across the hall that started at about 2:00am and went until 4:00am. I was somewhat mollified by the wonderful breakfast. It was a fine hotel, but I can stay at a fine hotel for much less money.
review.negativeRemarks: noise
review.locationRemarks: lovely, but not accessible on public transport

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: We are from Houston and decided to fly to Northern California for a weekend get away. WE are so happy with the hotel but what made it more enjoyable is the hospitality of the staff. On our first day, we met a world-lass Filipino Bell Captain named Junior (I apologize for not remembering the last name). He was so accomodating and friendly and that alone set up our wonderful vacation. I highly recommend this hotel to friends, associates, and relatives just because of the experience that we had with Junior! Fairmont, you have a gem in this employee of yours! Keep him and make sure you take care of him. He is one of a kind!

review.title: Beautiful place!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very, very nice. It is beautiful and in a good location. The bed was very comfortable. The only complaint I have is that the service in the bar/restaurants/front desk was not up to a 5 star rating. Staffs were not very friendly or accommodating. For the price we paid, I would have expected better service.
review.negativeRemarks: Service from staff.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Good atmosphere
review.reviewText: Air condition could not be reduce temperature to desired levet

review.title: The view
review.reviewText: Be careful some rooms look out at a cement wall others have great views.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge not very helpfull
review.locationRemarks: Excellent on the trolley line

review.title: Wonderful hotel experience!
review.reviewText: One of my most memorable hotel stays. Hotel just fabulous; loved the location, the old hotel atmosphere, the Tonga Room and the view. Will definitely come back. My first time in San Fran and I fell in love with the city!!!
review.positiveRemarks: old hotel atmosphere... the lobby is so beautiful and my view from my room.
review.negativeRemarks: can't think of any.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great.

review.title: Comfortable and Clean
review.reviewText: We got a great rate for the night off of Expedia. The beds are extremely comfortable and the staff was very friendly. Just keep in mind there is a nightly fee of $54 plus tax for parking. It is a gorgeous hotel and it is location just a couple blocks from Union Square. They were also very understanding about needing a late check out.

review.title: Worth the money!
review.reviewText: I visited during Halloween and the hotel was decorated creatively for the season. Everyone was very helpful and welcoming; very elegant. The comfort of the bed and pillows was incredible!

review.title: The location is very good and it has good food
review.reviewText: The location is very good and it has good food. The staff is very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is very good and it has good food
review.locationRemarks: It was very close to cable line and Muni services so very good location.

review.reviewText: The Fairmont hotel is wonderful in a sense of its history and is a comfortable stay. With that said, you are in for a surprise in terms of a lot of hidden fees! The valet parking will set you back $61 for each overnight stay, the wireless internet is another $20 just to get connected, the gym is contracted out to "Club ONE" fitness and will cost you an additional fee to go inside. Unless of course, you are paying for the spa where they do not let you know when your time is up (this way, you get charged for 80 minutes instead of the 50 minute massage you reserved). On top of that, you can rent a movie if you decide to stay in for $19.99...really? Don't get me wrong, you are in a lavish, comfortable stay here at the Fairmont San Francisco...but make sure you pack a lot of cash along with your clothes. :)
review.negativeRemarks: The hidden fees that come with amenities that are advertised as if they are free (gym, valet, etc.)

review.title: Really Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed in the Towers and the views were awesome. This hotel may be one of the best I have stayed in and I've stayed at many Ritz-Carltons, Waldorf, Plaza, etc.

Spend the extra money and go Towers, you will not regret it.

review.title: OK, Not Perfect
review.reviewText: I love the location of the hotel and the ambience of the place. Two things made this less than perfect this time around. 1. Upon check-in, I was assigned a fourth floor room where a loud 50+ person party was being held across the hall with people spilling out into the hallway. I was able to exchange the room without issue for one on the second floor but received a room with very loud fan noise. Fortunately, the night was cool and I traded off airflow for quiet. I shut down the AC unit. The room was spacious, bedding was nice, everything else was ok but not superior. Expedia price was ok given other SF options.
review.positiveRemarks: Ambience and scale of lobby area
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: I love being on top of the hill!

review.title: Great lobby, shame about the rest
review.reviewText: Great lobby.... Which says it all. Once beyond the lobby the hotel is tired and dated. The rooms are on the small side and are definitely past their best. Closet space is small and the rooms feel very basic. We had a superior room so were expecting more. The general service was pretty dreadful too. Mistakes were made with orders every time. Breakfast was farcical, and at about 100 dollars a pop for 2 adults and 2 children under 5, it really should be spot on. We'll go back to the Vitale next time. Great views over the city though, but views from the Vitale rooftop are also pretty good...A classic hotel like this will only compete with the modern hotels if it maintains it's charm and high levels if service that one expects at a hotel of this calibre.
review.positiveRemarks: Views over the city from the bedroom
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: Convenient and great views

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great loction to everything in downtown San Franscisco.
review.negativeRemarks: prices
review.locationRemarks: great location in heart of San Franscisco

review.title: Great for our Honeymoon!
review.reviewText: The hotel has excellent facilities should you not be too busy exploring San Francisco, but it is good to know you can relax in comfort when you get back to the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: At the top of a steep hill but good views

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Close to the cable car trail. Close to most attractions. Everything was great except for the fact you had to pay for internet service. Otherwise, would recommend to everyone. Staff were very courteous and eager to help :), which always makes your stay pleasureable.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay for internet.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Easily one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in.

review.title: Great for business travellers
review.reviewText:
This hotel seems to have a rather large tour company clientele, room service gratuity added on in common, but they add another $ 5.00 delivery charge. Even if you are alone by yourself, tip is added to the tab at the restaurants.. what if I don't want to tip this time? No choice!
Car parking is a staggering $ 65.00 per night! yikes!
There was stuff in the shower from the last guest.. not very clean for a Fairmont.
Hairdryer was great, bathroom toiletries inadequate.
Service was excellent.. great for business travellers.

review.title: Nob Hill gem
review.reviewText:
great location at the top of Nob Hill. fun/safe walks to china town, fisherman's walk, union square. Outstanding restaurants nearby.

caveat: you must be in shape to walk the steep streets up/down Nob Hill.
review.positiveRemarks: great location relative to lots of interesting places. crazy hills, so be prepared if you choose to walk everywhere, as I did.

review.title: Old world charm
review.reviewText:
There was certainly an old world charm about the Fairmont. It was very spacious and luxurious.
Service was good and the staff very polite.
review.negativeRemarks: No fridge for your own use and no tea or coffee facilities in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Being on top of the hill you need to be absolutely sure of where you were heading.Could be easily heading in the wrong direction down the hill.

review.title: lovely and luxurious
review.reviewText:
All the staff are very professional and friendly. They call by name and they will make sure you get the best service ever! They have a very nice roof top garden to enjoy and relax, overlooking the whole city of San Francisco.

Also, visit their Tonga Restaurant and Hurricane Bar. They have the best DRINKS and live entertainment as well <3
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: The best!
review.userLocation: Hollywood Hills, Los Angeles, CA, USA

review.title: Service needs to be greatly improved
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, rooms were great but i would not stay again due to the lack of staff service. they were there but you did not get a warm and friendly feeling with them. This is from the doorman to the registration people to the parking valet. in fact, someone stated in an earlier review that they were indifferent. I should have listened. You felt like you were supposed to feel lucky to be at their hotel and they didn't need to be bothered with making you feel welcomed. The workout facility was also not very well done - it was stuck in the basement with old equipment. I've stayed at many Fairmont Hotels and would normally recommend it, but i would definitely not recommend the Fairmont San Francisco. Not worth the money!
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: worth it!
review.reviewText: wonderful hotel! very elegant!!! clean, freindly people. lots of history.

review.title: Great and Noisy
review.reviewText: Our room was very nice room. But !! Ferrari's Party's noise was very noisy early in the morning. The hotel was out of concern for your guests. It was only disappointed thing for us.

review.title: Great for Couples and Family!
review.reviewText:
If you consider any hotel staying in San Francisco, please do not hesitate to stay here!
You would love it right away.

review.title: Way better than Omni!
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Omni two nights then Fairmont. Fairmont WAS WAY BETTER! So beautiful in every way. The only thing that was a slight bummer was that the windows on the 19th floor were very dirty. It was worth the $.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty Window
review.locationRemarks: Cable Cars right outside will take you where you want to go. Awesome views because it sits on top of Nob Hill

review.title: It's The Hangover, nice but overhyped.
review.reviewText: Very nice atmosphere and within 5 minutes of arriving to our room, someone stopped by to see how everything was, and then a 2nd person 20 minutes later. But we slept in the first day and put the do not disturb sign out, and at 11 am got a note under the door informing us that we needed to call if we wanted housekeeping ( they stopped by later anyway). The concierge service was average at best - their knowledge often relied on what could be found in a Google search. But the biggest issue was that none of the taxis wanted to take us to Candlestick 2 and 1/2 hours before the game. . .when traffic was not that bad. We had to pay a contracted rate set by the doorman on the premise that the drivers are only supposed to be out for 30 minutes at a time and pay $1 for every minute they are late. So what should have been a $30 fare, including tip, cost us $70 and I doubt he was more than 10 minutes late getting back. A nice $30 windfall. Thanks doorman.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge service and doorman-taxi tag team
review.locationRemarks: Central to everything but being at the top of Nob Hill requires you to either spend more on cabs to get around, or be in excellent cardio shape.

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. It was in the middle of everything, so it was never a far walk to anything. I was able to get an early check-in very easily, which was pleasing, and the desk staff was very helpful in giving tips about the city. The room was clean and everything worked as it should. I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely come back when visiting San Francisco!
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect! Short walk to the Wharf, Union Square, and China Town.

review.title: Luxury at the top of SF
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is an elegant landmark hotel. At the top of Nob Hill it commands a spectacular view of San Francisco, removed from the noisy bustle of Market St but still easily walkable. The architecture is stunning and opulent, and the staff is unbelievably cheery and helpful. Our room was spotless and tastefully done. I had the best sleep I've had in ages. It's a nice taste of the good life. With that said, this place is not for the budget conscious traveler, even if you get a deal on the room. The parking is $55 / day, the breakfast is $30 / person, even WiFi costs extra. Come prepared to spend money like water and you'll get the most out of it. How terribly proletarian it would be to quibble over something as trivial as the bill, don't you think?
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, ambience, location, sense of history, helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: The room we had was next to the main street and it was a bit loud. We could hear the street cars and sirens during the night.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very nice and luxurious.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise level from the street in our room.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel was very nice with easy access to many activities.

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: Wonderful service! Beautiful decor, gorgeous rooms - everything was outstanding! Food is great, everything at this hotel is beyond what we expected. Will definitely stay there again in the future and at other Fairmont Hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: The service, the decor, the food - everything was exceptional!
review.negativeRemarks: Climbing up the hill to get back! That was a bit of a hike.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful view from the rooms but it is a little hard to walk back up the hill to return.

review.title: Good Hotel for a couple - great location for SF
review.reviewText:
Everything was great - requested a coffe pot and small refrigerator ahead of time and was there on our arrival.

One suggestion - $22.00 for breakfast??? My wife and i would have used the dining facilities more often if the prices had been reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Price of the dining - particulary breakfast which we though unreasonable
review.locationRemarks: great location - availability of cable car to the wharf and bus service back

review.title: What a delightful hotel
review.reviewText: Booked the cheapest room possible and was delighted when given a free upgrade to a corner suite. The view was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: Being given a free upgrade to a corner suite

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was very friendly and professional. The cleaning staff was very prompt.
review.negativeRemarks: hair in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: great skyline view

review.title: Disappointing. Not up to Fairmont standards.
review.reviewText: My experience at the Fairmont was disappointing based primarily on the quality of service in the main dining room/bar area. For a hotel with the Fairmont reputation, the service was very marginal. Wait staff indifferent, and at times insulting. The hotel is beautiful, and our evenings in the Tonga room were great. Tonga room staff 'gets it'. The experience there is fun, service excellent, and in keeping with the tradition and reputation of a hotel in the Fairmont Nob Hill tradition. In the future though, I will choose the St. Francis in Union Square, and cab it to the Tonga room for a night of fun. A thirty dollar breakfast in the Fairmont dining room should include good service and a nice attitude. The breakfast, by the way was not the buffet. Our evening nightcap in the dining/bar area was equally disappointing!

review.title: Cable Cars: Blessing and irritation!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Great history with a great location in central San Francisco. The only draw back to this hotel would be the bells of the cable cars at night. Any early and light sleepers may be slightly irritated. Small price to pay IMO. Cable cars were great alternative to walking up the steeps hills!

review.title: Family from Blue Bell, PA
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, room was comfortable and clean. We loved this hotel, its beautiful decor and people were very nice.The room was very stylish and quite large. Very nice bathroom, all spotlessly clean with plenty of fresh towels every day and towel robes. I strongly recommended this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, view, comfort and unique design inside and outside.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful location and wonderful view.

review.title: Great location, great stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great location, very central. We walked to everything we wanted to see. Although walking back up the hill was a pretty good workout. Hotel was clean and staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in the newer tower and were very pleased with the room. Hotel does not have a pool which may be an issue with some, but we didn't have time to be at the pool anyway. Too many other things to do!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, great staff. Beautiful building
review.negativeRemarks: No pool may be an issue to some people.
review.locationRemarks: Central. Walking distance to everything.

review.title: chance to take notice......
review.reviewText:
I only have one issue. my friend's room smelled of smoke and I was disappointed; however, I accept responsibility for not telling the hotel because she was gracious and did not want to make it be a problem..... so, in short, I would appreciate having non smoking rooms......
thank you.

other than that, i will definitely come back.. great location, wonderful staff....
thank you.

p.s. I hope if I ever do return that I don't get a pet room either.. hopefully the hotel notifies and only has special rooms for that... sorry, i'm not into pets when i'm on vacation.
review.negativeRemarks: the smokey room... my friend's that is.. i booked two rooms
review.locationRemarks: i loved it...

review.title: A Nob Hill Classic
review.reviewText: A two night getaway for my husband and me at the end of summer. Hotel booked to the gills but you wouldn't know it in the spacious lobby and by the courteous and attentive manner of the staff. We had a deluxe king room in the newer tower, well-appointed, sadly on the second floor next to the elevator. In spite of this, we had a lovely view of the formal garden, a peak of the bay and nary a sound from the elevator. The bed was very comfortable with summer weight bedding and very plump down pillows. Concierge and bell staff were very helpful. We enjoyed the continental breakfast buffet as well as late night dessert in the main restaurant, expensive but not unexpected. Cocktails and Polynesian fare are not to be missed in the Tonga Room, which also has live music, dancing and periodic rain showers over the "lagoon".
review.positiveRemarks: Marvelous lobby, typically Fairmont. Our room had a beautiful spacious bathroom in pink marble, impeccably clean and well-appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: No free coffee or tea anywhere, in spite of absence of coffeemaker in room--an amenity I have enjoyed at other Fairmont hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location near 2 cable car lines for easy travel to any part of SF, most room have excellent views.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, terrible service.
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and we loved the feeling of being in an old San Francisco hotel. My biggest disappointment was the service. No one was warm or welcoming. I booked a king exterior room with Expedia and when I arrived they didn't inform me that they were out of that room and I was in a smaller, queen interior room. When I got to the room I realized and called the front desk. The lady on the phone made me feel like it was my fault they were out of rooms and I shouldn't be complaining. I asked for the credit and they didn't even apply it. I had to ask them to apply it when I checked out. The location is great and ambiance is unrivaled, but the service was terrible.

photos.caption: Living area in the Diplomat Suite, astonishing views
The shower, in the main bathroom (there are 1.5 bathrooms)
The bed in the Diplomat Suite

review.title: Free Upgrades, Beautiful Room, Wonderful Stay!
review.reviewText: When we arrived for check-in, we were told that the hotel overbooked rooms and that rather than staying in the standard room, we would get to stay in the Diplomat Suite for a night, then get moved to a nearby suite in the tower for the rest of our stay. Not only did we get to stay in rooms with wonderful views on the 22nd floor, but because of the "inconvenience" of having to move rooms in the first place, the Fairmont provided us with a free in-room dining meal! All in all, the free upgrades made our vacation that much more amazing, and the staff was always really nice and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf, and the pier. I would recommend getting around with taxi & public transport

review.title: Their Queen beds are not regular Queen-sized!!!
review.reviewText: Main thing I want to advise to potential customers, is that their so-called "Queen" beds are not normal-sized Queens!!! If you are planning to share a bed and you are thinking of reserving a Queen, you may want to get a King. It was a tight squeeze for us. Their Queen beds are the size of Doubles.

review.title: Great Location ...easy to get to tourist sights
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very welcoming, accomdating and knowledgable with the tourist sights in San Fran and surrounding area. For any tour or information needed they have a great concierge! The hotel is situated at the top of Nob Hill which makes it easy to get to China Town, Fishman Wharf, Union Square and The Ferry Terminal by Cable Car which is right outside the hotel, or by walking because the walk is downward.The hotel has 2 restaurants and a beautiful lobby. The rooms are spacious, and clean but the walls are very thin, you can hear your neighbor's TV!
review.positiveRemarks: That it is situated at the top on Nob Hill and you can easily walk downward or catch a cable car right outside hotel
review.negativeRemarks: that there was a $15 charge to use the gym
review.locationRemarks: great location... near china town, union square , ferry building are within walking distance. fisherman's warf is just a cable car ride

review.title: great for a feeling for old san francisco
review.reviewText: Wonderful historic hotel. Great bed and towels. No coffee in lobby and no newspaper seemed a little cheap for a luxury hotel. Concierge ,bellmen and doormen were great. extremely helpful and friendly. Room was large and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: no newspaper at door
review.locationRemarks: top of Nob Hill. you will be in great shape after a few days

review.title: Fabulous Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a Beautiful hotel. Service is excellent. Our standard 1 queen bedroom was large and luxurious. Join the free President's club for free internet, newspapers, free access to fitness club and more. It is located on beautiful Nob Hill, but remember it is on the Top of the steep hills that are difficult to walk up. Two cables cars stop right outside the hotel, but unless you are driving or taking cabs, you will need to plan your route back via bus or cable car. That is the only negative to the hotel. Otherwise it is FABULOUS! Visit the Tonga Room for Happy Hour and make sure you just tour around the inside of the hotel to see all art work, gardens, marble structures, etc. Just sitting in the lobby is fun!
review.negativeRemarks: Returning home via steep hills.
review.locationRemarks: The very Top of Nob Hill.

review.title: One of the ALL-TIME GREAT Hotels!
review.reviewText: We went to SA to escape the Texas heat! The Fairmont atop Nob Hill is THE hotel under any category: highest rated, historic, luxury, charm, great food, service, etc. This is one of the finest hotels in the world. Pay to be in a Superior room in the tower and get a million dollar view.

review.title: Historic Fairmont
review.reviewText: The Fairmont Hotel is not only one of the most convenient but without a doubt one of the most historic and most beautiful in San Francisco. If we return, it will be to the Fairmont no question.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is in close proximity to all forms of transportation and sightseeing buses at Union Square. Multiple restaurants and diners are also nearby.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel's location on the top of Nob Hill is awesome...what a treat for a flatlander Floridian.

review.title: Great time at the Fairmont!!
review.reviewText: We celebrated our 10th Wedding Anniversry, and had a wonderful time. Our experience at the Fairmont was excellent!!
review.positiveRemarks: The building itself, and the rich history of the hotel.

review.title: Historiacal and convenient
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff.
Great location

Was greeted late at night and received a warm welcome by friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Little stores around hotel
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to cafe and shopping

review.title: Nice, but could have been better.
review.reviewText:
The entrance and lobby to this hotel is very impressive, and looks fantastic. The service was outstanding and the staff could not have been any more helpful and polite.

The room was slightly disappointing though. Although the bed was very comfy and the room was a good size with pleasant decoration, the up-keep and cleanliness weren't up to the standards I would have expected from the initial impression of the hotel. The sink had a large crack in it, the shower curtain had mold on the bottom of it and there were chips off of some of the furniture, which was a massive shame as otherwise the hotel was lovely. I hope it was just an unfortunate one off with our room.

The Tonga bar is definitely worth a visit also, again, excellent service and good cocktails, a great atmosphere and a thunderstorm every 20 minutes!

The location is good for China Town and the Financial District but it was a bit of a struggle getting to and from the Piers. The hotel has cable car stops outside it but the cable cars are so busy it was a good half hour wait before even 2 people could fit on one, and coming back to the hotel in the evening on cable car simply wasn't an option, with queues lasting over an hour to get back. You can walk for about 20 or so minutes downtown and get on a different cable car to the piers and then get a taxi back each time, which cost around $10, which is what we ended up doing.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness, ease of getting around San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: Based in a lovely area and easy access to China Town & the financial district it proved hard to get down to the Piers as cable cars always so so busy

review.title: Very nice, but expensive.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great location. Staff pleasant and helpful. Very pricey though. I think you pay a lot for the name and history of the hotel. For as lovely as it was, not sure it was worth the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Could walk to all the major sites.

review.title: Great hotel for vacation.
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff, room perfect each day when we returned. I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to San fransico on business or holiday.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, helpful staff and comfort of room.
review.negativeRemarks: Food was a little expensive
review.locationRemarks: Good location to most of the citys sites.

photos.caption: King rooms with views are best in SF

review.title: ask for upgrade
