review.reviewText: Luxury hotel which has seen better days. My first room had peeling wallpaper, and no view. So i paid $60/night to upgrade. So worth it! The new tower rooms have great views, improved ammenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Location! Views! Service! Wonderful food at restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The old interior courtyard view rooms
review.locationRemarks: Perfect! Easy walk to Chinatown, Union Square stores, cable car stops next to hotel. Best location in SF: Nob Hill.

review.title: Great hotel for anyone wanting a superb experience
review.reviewText: Very courteous staff that looked after all of our needs, making us feel very special.
review.negativeRemarks: There were none, just a totally great stay.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco, it doesn't get any better.

review.title: Great location, grand hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has an amazing history but unlike many hotels that trade on their past, we thought that Fairmont deserves its accolades. The staff are friendly and helpful, the only exception being the bell boy that forced our luggage into the boot of our rental causing a lightbulb to break. Its location is ideal, being close to spots like Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach. We had no problems with walking up and down the steep hills but if that will be an issue, then this might not be th hotel for you! We got a Signature Room with views of the bay which was gorgeous day and night. We had dinner at the famous Tonga Room which was fun, albeit bordering on tacky. We joined the Fairmont President's Club which gives you free in-room wireless internet access as well free daily newspapers and access to health club.

review.title: Memorable Stay at the Legendary Fairmont
review.reviewText: Very welcoming and helpful staff. Concierge is the best! They make you feel like royalty. It was a very enjoyable and gracious stay at one of the best hotels in the country. Yes, we will return!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very professional and friendly. Food was excellent. The service was first-class.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was nice but smallish.
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous Nob Hill location with a stunning tower view.

review.title: Beautiful, elegant hotel with impeccable service
review.reviewText: It was a real treat to stay at the Fairmont. We usually look for value lodging alternatives when we visit San Francisco, but we found a great deal at the Fairmont on Expedia and decided to treat ourselves on our last visit. We were not disappointed. The hotel itself is beautiful and well cared for. The staff is extremely efficient and friendly. They really cater to their clients and have service in mind with everything they do. The Tonga Room was an unexpected, fun and offbeat restaurant and bar in an otherwise elegant setting. We really enjoyed having a quiet, evening drink in the Laurel Court Bar. We would recommend this place to anyone and will have to look for another Expedia deal to return there some day.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is beautiful, and the service is fabulous
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive (which is not uncommon in SF) and thought the breakfast buffet could have been a little better for the price
review.locationRemarks: Central localation and gorgeous views

review.title: ONE NIGHT STAY
review.reviewText: THE FRONT DESK RECEPTION CURTIOUS . THE ROOM ,FOR THE RATE THEY CHARGE, WAS VERY SMALL WITH AVERAGE FURNISHINGS. THE BED WAS GOOD . IT WAS HELPFUL THAT IT WAS PET FRIENDLY HOTEL. OVERALL THE ROOM EXPERIENCE WAS DISAPPOINTING

review.title: A San Francisco treat
review.reviewText: Room service was terribly slow and not suer accurate but the rest of the hotel experience was terrific. The second floor has distinct noise with the whistle for taxis and ring of cable cars so very San Francisco but not super quiet just for reference.
review.positiveRemarks: the views and decor and SF history
review.negativeRemarks: room service
review.locationRemarks: fantastic

review.title: Nice but extra charges.
review.reviewText:
Town Car ride from Airport VERY expensive. More than double a taxi fare. Very helpful staff and concierge. The "Tonga Room" not recomended for night time fun.
They charge an additional fee for Health Club & Business center...really? The price of a room should cover the Business center and Health club
review.positiveRemarks: The old elegant feel of the property was a throw back. Originbal pictuers of the early 1900's was a nice touch to see where the place has been.
review.negativeRemarks: Tonga Room and they charge for an on site Health Center & Business center
review.locationRemarks: Right downtaown making it difficult to naviagte to the touristy locations. Buses and rail cars. Use the "F" Line, $2.00 each but ratrely check

review.title: Why stay anywhere else?
review.reviewText: I had a great experience, and can't imagine staying anywhere else on my next trip to San Francisco. I had a king bed that overlooked the city. The room and bathroom were very spacious, and it offered a huge walk-in closet. I believe the room size varies with the bed size, view, etc. The bed was comfortable. When I was in the bathroom I was able to hear the people next door, but they seemed to be arguing, kids screaming, etc. a good portion of their trip anyway. The staff was pleasant and accommodating, and the concierge booked a couple tours for me. The location is superb, and is only a quick cab ride to wherever you want to go. The cabs queue in front of the hotel so you won't have to wait. I felt really safe in the neighborhood too. The hotel is generally very busy (was sold out the entire time I was there), and the city outside is bustling as well. I don't recall hearing any street noise, but I'm not sensitive to that either. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants, but they were packed and are well known.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to see all the major things in San Francisco.

review.title: A tale of two grand dames-Fairmont and Mark Hopkin
review.reviewText: My two suggestions: free internet access should be available to the guests. Having stayed at both the Fairmont and Mark Hopkins, the breakfast at the Fairmont was quite limited in choices and was a few dollars more than the Mark Hopkins.

review.title: Superb stay but bring your own kettle!
review.reviewText: Superb hotel but no complimentary tea and coffee in room so unless you want to pay for room service it's off to the cafe! The offer of a newspaper would also have been nice.Upgrading room for view of bay is an absolute must - spectacular.

review.title: A World Unto Itself
review.reviewText: This hotel maintains an excellent standard of comfort and quality, with beautiful, large bathrooms, excellent quality linens on the bed, and delicious food in the restaurants. Part of the charm lies in its history, which is displayed on the walls throughout the hotel. I was amazed to learn that Tony Bennett first sang 'I Left My Heart in San Francisco' at the Fairmont. It it a world unto itself.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the bathroom with beautiful marble tiles, oversized tub, and separate shower. Our room service breakfast was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Charges for internet and valet parking were high.
review.locationRemarks: The Fairmont has an excellent location in the heart of Nob Hill, with dramatic views of the city.

review.title: Dirty and Noisy room, avoid
review.reviewText:
The room was not clean when we got in. There was still trash from the previous person who rented the room and some of the bathroom items had already been opened. I think for such an hotel it is unacceptable to have anything but a clean room. When we reported the issue to the hotel staff, they said "it happens, something people will check out but only hand off a subset of the keys, and after the room has been done they will go back to the room to use the restrooms" -- with no attempt whatsoever to try to repair the situation. This response from the staff is also unacceptable in an hotel of this standing.

The room was also very noisy. We could follow discussion on the next room and clearly hear them enjoy themselves afterward. We also heard the cable cars through the night.
Finally, our window was facing a wall and we had no view whatsoever.

On the upside, the bed was very comfortable and well decorated.

Avoid this one. The westin market street is much better and cheaper.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was not clean and there was still trash when we got the room. We heard a lot of noise and even discussions from other rooms
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill, San Francisco

review.title: Happy 28TH Wedding Anniversary!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is a beautiful place, the grounds are perfect, lobby is breathtaking, now for the lows, front desk not friendly at all!!!! but everyone else makes up for those snobs, I had to remember I'm the one with the money they just work behind that desk... The lady's in the restraurant were perfect, don't bother in the Tonga room, horrible drinks, staff is slow, 40 & 50 year olds acking like they are 20, I'm 47 and I was embarrassed, very cheesy, go across the street, they were great and the bar was fun. The rooms are dated but clean we stayed in the Tangier Suite for our 28th Wedding Anniv. they sent up champaign in the morning, what a great treat that was. Cable car, don't bother they are so full with people hanging everywhere you can't get on waited 30 min gave up, just take a cab it's much quicker and only a few dollars more.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff (GREAT PEOPLE) besides the FRONT DESK!!!
review.negativeRemarks: FRONT DESK!!!
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to everything or a short cab ride.

review.title: The hotel was perfect...top of the hill !
review.reviewText: This hotel was impressive for it's location, style and history as well as service and quality. They have a great gym with classes and excellent equipment. The food and drinks are very impressive. The location allows one to walk anywhere in the city in a short amount of time.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, gym, atmosphere and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The Tanga Room
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of it all in San Francisco.

review.title: A little inconvenient.....
review.reviewText:
Definitely a nice hotel-however...the cost of food, etc. is exceedingly overpriced. Also, I need my cup of java in the morning and the only way to get it here is to: a) pay over $15 for a pot with room service, b) go down to the restaurant which would require proper clothing... or c) go to the little coffee shop in the hotel (again-proper clothes issue) and wait in a long line. For this much money one should be able to make and enjoy a cup of coffee in their room (in their pjs) before facing the world.
Honestly, I think I'd find a different hotel for less money next time. Families-there is no microwave or fridge here so maybe find a more kid-friendly place to stay with those way under appreciated amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: No room amenities
review.locationRemarks: Sits atop Nob Hill. Those out of shape beware. Everything is located downhill which isn't a problem until you have to go back up....

review.title: Beautiful, historic hotel with friendly service
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, the hotel graciously upgraded us to what several hotel employees called their favorite room - room 616. It had a beautiful view of rooftop garden, the Transamerica Building and the bay. The staff could not have been more hospitable. The hotel is breathtaking. It is so nice to stay in a piece of San Francisco history. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco. My only complaint is that the cafe on the parking level is understaffed. There were only two women working while we were there and there was often a 20 minute wait to get cappuccino in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Its a beautiful location, but don't try walking up the hill to get to it.

review.title: Great location for seeing the sites in SF
review.reviewText:
Great king room with wonderful view of the city and Bay Bridge. Order room service for breakfast because there are really only 2 options - the hotel restaurant or a very crowded coffee shop. Perhaps there were other choices a few blocks away but I didn't find anything convenient. Room service was great.
Location was excellant!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast options

review.title: Hotel was swell, long walk up the hill, TongaRoom!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was great. We were booked into a small room with one queen bed, but after asking we were upgraded to a king - with a view, which was really nice.

I tried to explain to the cleaning person that we didn't need our room cleaned, but I was unable to understand her English.

The Tonga room was fun! We should have made reservations, but instead we sat in the bar and had expensive tropical drinks and appetizers and enjoyed the show.

The fridge is stocked with drinks, and sensors when you remove them. I'd really rather have a bit of space for leftovers - when I moved the drinks around I was charged for them (though they removed the charges when I asked). Still don't understand why hotels insist on a "captive audience" surcharge that puts a 40c can of Coke at $3.50.

There was a lot of noise from other drunken guests in the hallways late at night. Not sure what the hotel can do about this - the door was thick, but people were yelling at each other.

The biggest problem with this hotel is the location at the top of the hill - to get there you really need to either take a cab or a trolley, though I found out the 1 California bus also passes on the North side. Several times we walked up the hill from Chinatown/North Beach or Embarcadero/Powell - the hiking was good but carrying luggage was a schlepp.
review.positiveRemarks: View. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom tiles were lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Hiking up the hill. Hallway noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great views from the nice rooms, but it's a long hike (or a cab or trolley ride) up the hill.

review.title: Coffee
review.reviewText:
I found the price of eatting a little much and did not like how I had to wait in line for an hour in the morning to get a coffee or tea. I like to be able to make myself a cup in the morning right when I get up and then get ready for my day, as I am sure other people do as well. Other then that I had a great time staying at your beautiful hotel.

thanks

review.title: Great location atop Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Great location atop Nob Hill. Room was large. Be sure and get exterior facing room. Parking is $54 a night!!

review.title: NICE LOCATION
review.reviewText:
Nice place to stay - I like the fact that you can walk to Chinatown, Union Square and just about anywhere else you want to go (we even walked to Fishermans Wharf).

A couple of things I didn't like: When we first arrived, within the first 2 hours we got four visits to our room by hotel staff!! It was annoying to say the least.

Secondly, there was some service door down the hall that kept slamming shut ALL DAY AND NIGHT LONG!!!! I was on the 4th floor in room 422. The door noise actually kept me up one night for several hours
review.negativeRemarks: Slamming doors down the hallway
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great hotel for anyone.
review.reviewText:
Elegant with friendly helpful staff. Large rooms and comfortable beds and pillows. Only 1 thing would keep me from giving it the highest rating: Walls are a little thin and one can occasionally hear noise from other rooms. Noise not obtrusive, just slight.

Very centrally located with fantastic views.
review.positiveRemarks: Size of room and views from room
review.negativeRemarks: Wish there were more snack opportunities

review.title: Classy and rich with history.
review.reviewText: Traveling with kids.... be a doorman for the day. Kids get to hail a cab and take a picture with the doorman. Cute.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText:
Excellent king bed! Quiet Concierge gave two suggested
Restaurants and both were excellent in the city. Valet parking abut spendy at $61 a night

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: Everything was clean and well taken care of (as you should expect from the Fairmont). The cost of food was a bit high but I guess that also can be expected.

review.title: Fairmont Fantastic
review.reviewText: Wonderful atmosphere and people who bend over backwards to make your stay special. The restuarants in the Fairmont are Amazing!
review.positiveRemarks: The beautiful oppulence and Amazing restuarants

review.title: @ the Fairmont(not worth the $)
review.reviewText: The hotel staff seemed bothered whenever they had to perform any of the various tasks that are attached to their job description. Things were not as pristine as one would expect in an historical hotel. After staying at the Fairmont, I would never recommend it to anyone; unless someone described themselves as one that does not enjoy getting any bang for their buck. Luxury and charm were merely an illusion, brought on by the episode of "The Layover" which featured the hotel, that wore off after just a few nights. If you want to spend the money to stay at the Fairmont, just spend it more wisely by staying somewhere else.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, not great; and there are better spots that put you closer to what you want to see in San Francisco.

review.title: Great staff!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a beautiful and elegant hotel and I have traveled in many major cities world wide and not found the staff to be anywhere near the same quality as that of the Fairmont.

review.title: A real treat
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the finest I've ever stayed. The staff was exceptionally helpful and the room was very spacious and beautifully decorated.
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room and bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located with breathtaking views

review.title: lovely hotel Fairmont
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is lovely, and we were treated well. The lobby is luxurious, and our room was very comfortable and pretty. We had an inside room, which was fine, but we were upgraded from a queen size bed to a king size. I did ask for that.
review.negativeRemarks: the restaurants
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill--took cabs often

review.title: San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. I would stay there again. It was close to most attractions and easy access with the trolly cars and beautiful views of the bay.

review.title: The Fairmont
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay at The Fairmont. The area was nice, the lobby was nice, the service was great from everyone we dealt with. The great service we received and the nice lobby brought value to our stay but with the price difference between this hotel and others in the area as well as the reputation of this hotel we expected much more from our room itself.

review.title: A grand tradition of gouging
review.reviewText:
Our stay was marred by what I felt were attempts at egregios over-charging for basic services. I was shocked to learn that the overnight valet service set me back over $60. The hotel also tried to charge us $32 for a split of cheap wine that my daughter picked up. Apparently they have a sensor that automatically charges you when you touch certain items in the room. To their credit they reversed the phantom charge for the wine, but I left with a less favorable impressiong of the hotel, which was otherwise charming.

If you do stay, be sure to check out the rooftop garden.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking charges, cost of everything in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Nob hill, San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Great overall experience at this historic San Francisco hotel! The room was really nice and very clean. Hotel isn't super modern but has definitely been renovated to accommodate common day needs. Nob Hill is very convenient to almost everything and has beautiful city views. I will definitely be back!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a bit small
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to everything in the city

review.title: outstanding
review.reviewText: outstanding hotel. the only issue I have was location, nob hill is a killer to walk up. but that's SF for you. enjoy.

review.title: Concierge service not up to the rest of the hotel.
review.reviewText:
I had two or three opportunities for the concierge to help us and they failed each time. There is no "above and beyond the call of duty" attitude at that point of service.
The bell stand and greeting function were excellent and service minded.
The hotel is old, but well kept.
My wife and son had a great meal and time at Tonga's.
I couldn't believe the lobby coffee in the morning didn't have the cardboard heat collars. Even a Hampton Inn has those.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge didn't have a good "can do" attitude.
review.locationRemarks: It's on top of Nob Hill. So, walking anywhere is an up and down affair. Cabs and trolleys readily available. Parking $61! $30 a block away.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Impersonal service on a few occasions was a let down but The Fairmont is a grand and opulent hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent neighbourhood

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: We stayed in the main building of the hotel and our room was luxurious, large and emaculate. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only negative was the Cafe Centro coffee shop. The various baked goods we tried were bland and dry, and the hot cocoa was lukewarm. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again, but would find the Starbucks 3 blocks down on Powell sooner. In fact, I would recommend that the hotel replace the Cafe Centro with a Starbucks.
review.positiveRemarks: Luxurious and clean rooms. Awesome views. Helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Cafe Centro - should be replaced with a Starbucks or anyone that can make a muffin.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Within walking distance of major city attractions as well as near cable car and bus routes.

review.title: Beautifully maintained historic hotel.
review.reviewText: People were kind and attentive, but not overly so that they were interruptive. It is an historic hotel well maintained and updated where important.

review.title: Great location, but not worth the money
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel with my 3 kids and wife. The hotel is in a great location, has very big rooms and comfortable beds. The concierge was a bit snobbish for my taste and not very helpful. The concierge's recommendations were very poor which indicates a lack of knowledge or that he is receiving kickbacks for his recommendations. I have stayed at better places for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, big rooms and very comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: concierge was a bit snobbish for my taste and not very helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great locations just a few blocks from China Town and North Beach.

photos.caption: Grace Cathedral view from the window at the end of the hall

review.title: Vacation worth taking again!
review.reviewText: The room was spacious, very clean and quiet. The hotel is positioned very well for our trip. The restaurant was fantastic with a menu to be expected of a fine hotel. We did not make the Tonga room and cannot review it. The views from our room were terrific also.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very polite and helpful. They made you feel as though you were the only guest they had.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Grace Cathedral. Centrally located among most tourist sights and only an hour and ten minutes from Napa Valley.

review.title: Fairmont stay
review.reviewText: The entrance of the hotel is very nice and elegant. However the hotel halls and rooms dont fit to the fairmont standards. Its outdated and it smells old, it has a morbid feeling. The rooms are small with updated furniture but the fitures and carpets are blah. For the price its not worth it.

review.title: I Love San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
We love staying at Fairmont Hotels. The service is always consistent, the beds are comfortable, the concierge was very helpful. The breakfast buffet is a hefty $30 per person and comes to 74$ for 2 after taxes and manditory gratuity. The buffet is very good but a tad too expensive. The location was great, with easy access to the Muni and cable cars.
We had a great week and plan to be back next year.
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee in the room

review.title: Non-smoking policy lacks teeth
review.reviewText: I requested a non-smoking room. When I returned to my room from dinner, cigarette smoke permeated my room apparently from a guest in another room who was smoking and did so throughout the night and early morning. I was told by the reservations clerk that my room was located in the non-smoking portion of the hotel. It appeared there is no enforcement of the no-smoking policy and no accommodation was offered to me.

review.title: A Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a beautiful hotel, regal looking even. Our room was nice, with two minor issues: One, there was a lot of hallway noise; two, the bed slept hot.

review.title: Not what I would expect from a Fairmont.
review.reviewText:
Check-in went well, but as soon as I got into the room, I knew something wasn't right. I had booked and paid for a "Fairmont room" (queen-sized bed), but they had put me into a room which appeared to have a twin-sized bed. The windows faced a wall.

After I called to let them know I didn't get the room I paid for, they quickly put me in the correct room type - unfortunately this time I had to call them to let them know that the new room hadn't been cleaned. Further, the room was very musty and the window was propped open with a drinking glass (because the window couldn't stay up by itself).

I've been here many times before, but something clearly went wrong on this stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Problems getting the right room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, but plan to either take the cable car, bus or walk up a very steep hill.

review.title: Fairmont review
review.reviewText: The food and bar was pricey ($8.00 for a coors light?), the tonga room was closed on Monday and Tuesday. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The air conditioners in the room were not adequate. Also the bar wait staff were aloof, and not as friendly or timely when serving. The concierge was amazing. The hotel itself was beautiful and well maintained and the housekeeping was very polite.
review.negativeRemarks: The lounge service
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful

review.title: Worth it
review.reviewText: Had a pleasant time. Room comfortable. Generally, really great place. There was one spot near the shower where the wallpaper had lifted off.

review.title: Fairmont Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! couldn't have asked for a better location or views of San Francisco! the cable car stops are right outside of the hotel making it very easy to get around. We really didn't know much about SF before we left and we truly felt that we couldn't have lucked out more. Hotel staff was very knowledgeable and approachable. Our experience wouldn't have been as positive if not for their suggestions and guidance.
review.positiveRemarks: A beautiful hotel. Great, friendly and knowledgable staff, convenient coffee shop on lower level and very CLEAN!
review.negativeRemarks: House keeping comes early for those of us on vacation and like to sleep in. If you're not an early riser, make sure you put up your privacy sign.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel located on top of hill and has beautiful views of the city. Cable cars stop right outside making it very simple to get around.

photos.caption: rose garden - view from 6th floor room. note the Easter eggs. :)

review.title: beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText:
To quote my husband in the note he left for housekeeping (with the tip): we love the Fairmont, top to bottom.

beginning with the concierge (who upgraded our room without prompting) and lasting until he checked us out the next morning, it was a grand experience. we love the history of the hotel, the grandeur, and mostly the staff - all were so warm & even humorous.

just a beautiful place. we shall return.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is wonderful.. love it there.

review.title: History and Charm at the Fairmont San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco is a stately and historic hotel at the top of Nob Hill with lovely views and a central location. My wife and I stayed in a queen room with our five month old daughter. The hotel arranged for a nice crib to be brought up and the three of us were fairly comfortable. The staff at the hotel was all very accommodating and helpful with anything we needed. Parking at the hotel, while expensive, was very efficient. The rooftop garden is certainly a tranquil spot that should definitely not be missed. Overall, we would definitely stay at the Fairmont again.
review.positiveRemarks: The common areas of the hotel. Hotel history. Professional and courteous staff. Tonga Room.
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee maker in hotel room.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill with easy access to cable cars.

review.title: Best hotel is SF by far!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont SF was an amazing experience. Was upgraded on checkin and could not have had a better stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The suite was amazing, massive space, great pool table and best views in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: having to go home
review.locationRemarks: Great location at the top of the hill, fantastic views and fairly central.

review.title: Avoid the 7th Floor
review.reviewText: Have stayed at the Fairmont for over 35 years with no problems until this visit. Room was on the 7th (top) floor of the old building and there was an overwhelming odor of mildew or mold stepping off the elevator and continuing into the room. Cranked the A/C and then opened the window but no relief. Worried that my suits hanging in the closet would smell like wet basement. Went to the front desk and they responded immediately, eventually changing my room to a different floor and moving my luggage. etc while I was out of the hotel. They also said they would alert housekeeping. Probably need to alert a structural engineer, as it had rained the day before and my guess is they have a leaky roof. Hotel staff was extremely accommodating.

review.title: Beautiful old hotel
review.reviewText:
Beautiful old hotel - great service.

I would definitely stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: food
review.locationRemarks: very lovely and convienent

review.title: Elegant hotel
review.reviewText:
THE hotel to stay in San Fran! Surrounded with nostalgia , we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Highly recommend to all who enjoy charming, historical elegance.

review.title: Great Birthday Vacation Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel with great history. You could spend hours just looking around the whole hotel.
review.locationRemarks: located on a huge hill but great location

review.title: Very disappointing!
review.reviewText: We were looking forward to our stay at the Fairmont after being in Napa Valley for several days celebrating my birthday. We were extremely disappointed in the Fairmont. The room was awful. It was small, stuffy and smelled bad. The woman at the check-in desk was very helpful but then directed us to an awful touristy restaurant after we specifically said we didn't want a tourist spot. We spoke with 2 concierges and both were dreadful and knew nothing. It was not at all what one would expect from the Fairmont. We ended up going across the street to the Top of the Mark for a drink since there wasn't anywhere suitable at the Fairmont. There, staff told us that the Fairmont has been going through hard times which is why the change in the level of service. When we checked out of the hotel, the woman was rude and unpleasant. Overall, a very disappointing stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The room.
review.locationRemarks: Location on Nob Hill across from Grace Cathedral is wonderful.
review.userLocation: La Jolla, San Diego, CA 92037, USA

review.title: Recent stay while in town for a meeting
review.reviewText: So much history and a great venue overall, yet the rooms have modern conveniences too and the staff is just great.

review.title: It was o.k.
review.reviewText: The internet is ridiculously expensive so we didn't use it. There was a light bulb out in our bathroom and also dried urine on the toilet seat when we first got there. Housekeeping also bothered us twice while we were trying to nap. We were also disappointed that we couldn't get in to the Tonga room and that was one of the reasons we were staying there. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the staff at the front desk and at breakfast were wonderful.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Get a bayside room, the views are incredible. You can see from the Golden Gate to the transamerica pyramid. Alcatraz is straight on from your room in the bay. The room was comfortable, well updated. And after Ritz Carltons, and four seasons the Fairmont was a nice change. The room service was really good. The location is ok to walk to Union Square, but tough to walk uphill back to the hotel. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Restraunts are high end, without a comfortable coffe shop style place.
review.locationRemarks: Incredible

review.title: A San Francisco Classic
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont is a classic, and a must-stay when in San Francisco. It is, however, showing signs of neglect. For example, the paint on the window frame in our bathroom was peeling very, very badly, and baseboards were terribly beat up in some areas. Granted, this is a 100 year old hotel, but it also a very, very expensive one, and its age should not be a basis for "deferred maintenance".

Staff was great, especially Mark, our waiter at the in-house restaurant. He made our stay most enjoyable!

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: Very helpful front desk, concierge services, garage and other staff. Hotel is in good shape and in a superb location. Have stayed in a few Fairmont hotels in the US and abroad and they continue to impress.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel restaurant could use broader selection of offerings on the dinner menu. Plenty of good restaurants nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Superb

review.title: Overpriced.
review.reviewText: I was a little disappointed. I think the hotel has been neglected and needs to be updated and renovated.

review.title: The elegance of yesteryear still preserved
review.reviewText: Old-world elegance. Charm. Polished. What a wonderful experience!
review.positiveRemarks: It's right on all three cable car lines.
review.negativeRemarks: You can walk almost anywhere, as everything is downhill; however, the hill is steep in almost any direction, and you need a cab to get back.
review.locationRemarks: Woah!!

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Beautiful, clean and convenient! The Concierge was wonderful as well when needing recommendations.

review.title: Fabulous Old World San Francisco
review.reviewText: Elegant old world charm. Service, spaciousness...It was a great experience in the best location.

review.title: Great Room - Mediocre Service
review.reviewText:
The hotel is lovely but the overall service (bell, valet, front desk) was not as friendly and welcoming as it should have been. When I checked out on Sunday morning the agent didn't even ask me how my stay was, she simply printed my receipt and I was on my merry way. Disappointing.

The room was beautiful, though! Very nice sleeping room experience.
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: Fairmont SF / Nob Hill

review.title: Recent San Francisco overnight retreat
review.reviewText: We stayed in a room in the towers of the Fairmont Hotel. The room was nicely appointed. The view was exquisite. The staff were very nice and knowledgeable. Highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: long winding corridors to get to the elevators.
review.locationRemarks: On top of Nob Hill, Best views of San Francisco.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText:
I had the absolute pleasure to stay in this Fabulous Hotel for 5 nights.
The Check in was very fast where I was allocated with an absolutely MASSIVE Twin Room.
The hotel staff were fantastic when I called for a assistance, or when you arrived you were greeted with a friendly face.
The toiletries are so nice, and smell amazing.
Then there is the bed. THE most comfortable bed I have even had slept on. I was on a 4-day conference, and all of my colleagues commented on the comfort of the beds
I would most definitely stay there again, even if it just for the absolutely amazing beds!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds in the rooms are absolutely phenomenal! The roof garden was also stunning!
review.negativeRemarks: Not a bad thing for the hotel, but its up a huge hill, so a task and a half to walk up it!
review.locationRemarks: Good location, up Nob Hill. If you don't like walking or Hills... catch a cab, this will be sheer hell for otherwise.

review.title: NEW YEARS EVE AT THE FAIRMONT
review.reviewText:
A GREAT OLD SAN FRAN CLASSIC.
BEAUTIFUL LOBBY
ROOMS A GOOD SIZE
review.positiveRemarks: FELT LIKE COMING HOME EACH DAY
review.negativeRemarks: NOT MUCH. THE HOTEL IS GETTING OLD BUT STILL VERY GRACEFUL
review.locationRemarks: NOB HILL. WHERE ELSE IS BETTER?

review.title: Paul H.
review.reviewText: From check-in til check-out the entire staff of the Fairmont could not have been more accomadating. They upgraded our room at no charge. The concierge was cultured and on the top of his proffession. Internet access is free if you opt to enroll in the Presidents Cub at no charge. In summation, a great city and a great hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the way they treat the guests.
review.negativeRemarks: The calamari was dreadful.
review.locationRemarks: There is none better in the city.

review.title: Another Great Experinece at The Fairmont
review.reviewText: I visit San Francisco twice a year on business. After staying at most of the other big chain hotels, I now only stay at The Fairmont. Their service and hospitality is wonderful. I also like the location, not too far from Union Square without the hustle and buslte. I will continue to stay there on future trips. I also prefer the tower rooms with the view.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: A quite location with everything you would need is a short walk away.

review.title: View of the Bay
review.reviewText: Excellent room with a wanderful view of the Bay, Coit Tower, etc.

review.title: Landmark; but too much for parking
review.reviewText: It was great to stay at a San Francisco landmark. Visited the roof top garden. Beautiful oasis. A little disappointed with the cost to park! $62 per night is a little steep, even in San Fransicso.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING was absolutely expensive. I was afraid to even look in the refrig in fear of setting off a pressure sensative sale.
review.locationRemarks: I grew up admiring this facility. It is so stunning. I wish they provided tours!

review.title: Fairmont
review.reviewText: It'st a Fairmont : everyone there understands the hospitality business.

review.title: GEAT EXPERIENCE IN SF
review.reviewText:
Still one of the most beautiful hotels in SF
we got a room with the best view on the 17 floor
even do it was new year week, with lots of people they were
all lovely, and helpful. great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: up on the hill, but very easy to get to main attractions

review.title: Fabulous.
review.reviewText: Great location, excellent service, would have preferred a room with a view but we got a great rate thru Expedia so can't really complain. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Smoker Room Was Nasty
review.reviewText: We checked in and they had given us a "free upgrade" to a smoking level room which had a bay view. The room would have been nice but the overwhelming stench in the room was unbearable (neither my wife or I smoke). I also stepped on something wet on the floor which was really nasty. When I put a towel over it and blotted it, there was a nasty, brown, smelly stain. I dont know what that was but It really grossed me out and we had to switch rooms. Overall our trip was pleasant but the cleanliness was not up to par. I felt gross and tiptoed everywhere while in the room as to have as little contact as possible with the floor. The staff was friendly and I would recommend this hotel but would not recommend ever staying on the smokers level room unless your a chain smoker and have poor hygiene.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the room

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Staying here was an experience, and a fantastic one. Yes it's pricy, but a bit of luxury every now and then is good for you. I highly enjoyed our time here!

review.title: Lovely friendly hotel
review.reviewText: Only there for one night, but great. Very friendly staff, great room with bay view. Beautiful Christmas decorations in foyer...children loved it. Very family friendly...what more can I say, we would go back.

review.title: Great hotel, watch the hidden costs.
review.reviewText: This hotel is so awesome, I was suprised when I was nickeled and dimed over little things like internet access and use of the business center. Nice beds, great staff, cool history. Parking and internet were way overpriced hidden costs.

review.title: Good hotel but cannot use for business
review.reviewText: Generally it should be good but noisy and uncomfortable. Especially no supermarket around hotel and no shop in the hotel. And also it is not convenient for business, it means it was so far from central of business area (district area) and commercial area. Probably I felt no goos because my room was not god view even though this was at top of hill at SF. Therefore if I go to SF agan as business, will not use here.
review.locationRemarks: Westin hotel or Palace hotel

review.title: Excellence
review.reviewText: Our experience at the Fairmont was outstanding. From the front door welcoming until our departure. They were excellent. We will definately go back.

review.title: JAJ from D/FW
review.reviewText: Second stay and it won't be the last. Love this Hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is centrally locate with great views. Quiet.

review.title: "Planning to go back"
review.reviewText: We changed hotels during our stay in San Francisco due to excess noise and we were very pleased with our choice to stay at the Fairmont. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms were large and comfortable. It was the best sleep I got on my entire trip! Also their restaurant was perfect for dinner. We would definitely recommend the hotel.

review.title: Wow Breathtakingly Gorgeous
review.reviewText: Woderful enjoyed our stay
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf beautiful

review.title: Not as clean as I would expect
review.reviewText: I was excited to stay at the Fairmont, having heard many great things about it. Overall, the service was great and the buffet breakfast was outstanding, but I was really disappointed in the cleanliness of the upper floors. The minute I stepped off of the elevator and onto the fourth floor, I was overwhelmed with a musty and stagnant smell. It was clearly noticeable to me all three days we were there. When we entered our room, it was neat, but very dusty in places I would expect a hotel of this caliber NOT to overlook (tops of door frames, draperies, but especially near the head of the bed between the bed and nightstand or the bed and the wall). Clearly cleaning that requires moving furniture or stepping on a stool is not being done. The icing on the cake was the gum stuck to the desk near the bed, clearly visible to anyone who sat on the bed. My husband and I will try a different hotel next time we visit San Francisco. I would not recommend it simply based on the cleanliness even though everything else was very nice.

review.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is mediocre at best. Let me say this... We really wanted to have a great stay at the Fairmont. The only thing that it has going for it is the old nostalgic feel that the national "chain" hotels don't have anymore. The walls ARE PAPER THIN... Seriously paper thin. For being a resort hotel the room was not kept to the standards that one would expect. The bathroom had hair on the toilet seat and the carpets were not very clean. What also was annoying was the parking rates. In an already expensive city the Fairmont charges more than average for parking. I never waste my time rating hotels but my wife and I want to save you the frustration that you will have if you book a hotel here. DON'T DO IT!

review.title: Maria D
review.reviewText:
Great location! I was just surprise with the price you pay for the luxury,It should come with a coffee maker and tea just like the one at The Fairmont at Victoria Island in Canada This is the only hotel I stayed at in California with no complimentary coffee maker, but they were nice about it, we asked for a coffee maker, they said they will look for one, but the room does not come with it, and after our 2nd call they sent the coffee maker and I wish they throw in a free bottled water coz the evian water $8.00 is really too much. LOVED the TONGA ROOM! We love the 60.s 70's 80's music, our family was dancing the night away.
I love Fairmont Hotels, I would stay here again, but I will bring my own bottled water next time.
review.locationRemarks: It is two blocks from China Town but going back to your hotel from China Town could be quite a climb.

review.title: Love the Fairmont
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with great rooms esp in the older section.

review.title: On of San Francisco's finest
review.reviewText: This was a true joy! The hotel lived up to our expectations. A bit disappointed that a hotel as well known, famous and luxurious as The Fairmont cannot afford to run its own business center. It is offensive to pay this type of value for staying and then be asked to provide a credit card to charge a fee to use a computer to pull up directions to a destination within the city.

review.title: Full of Character
review.reviewText: Escellent hotel, good service but with limited in hotel dining

review.title: The Fairmont, Classic San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Upon arriving at the Fairmont, all I could say was WOW! The structure is grand and strikingly beautiful. You are greeted by a uniformed valet who takes your car and gets a porter for your bags. You walk up a carpeted staircase to glass swinging doors. Once inside you are welcomed to a Grand San Francisco room of yesteryear. In the center of the room is a Round blue velvet couch with colorful pillows and a huge floral arrangement in the center. Many other stuffed cushioned chairs and couches surround it. Large ornate columns and ceilings with paintings and gold accented wood beams. Glass & mirrors everywhere and a roof top Garden to see the view of San Francisco and walk your dog.
Several brass elevators to take you upstairs. The rooms are large, decorated beautifully, with a touch of elegant yesteryear. The bed was like having a queens bed, it was so soft and puffy. Everyone treated us well and the staff was very nice and helpful.
If you want to feel like a dignitary and see classic San Francisco, go to the Fairmont.

review.title: Perfect historical location
review.reviewText:
We loved the historical aspect of the hotel. The architecture is spectacular, and there is something unique about staying in a place that has been there for over 100 years. I think the management has done an excellent job of preserving the past while accommodating our modern requirements.
Great location, right on the intersection of two cable car routes. Easy walking distance to Union square as well.

review.title: Neat Hotel From Another Era
review.reviewText: Loved the old fashioned feel of this hotel and the details. Really enjoyed reading about the history, seeing the historic photos, and the menus from around 1940. Would like to go back and savor it more - trying to see the rooms, bars in action.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: The rooms were wonderful, very high ceilings, spacious closets and bathroom. I would definitely stay here again. Parking rates are high but worth it.

review.title: Great hotel with a lot of history
review.reviewText: Try to visit the penthouse!

review.title: Perfect hotel & location!
review.reviewText:
I reserved 2 rooms (each 2 Queens, exterior, non-smoking) at the Fairmont Hotel, Nob HIll. Expedia had only 2 rooms left at a price almost half of the hotel's published rate. I was concerned that because of this discount, I would get rooms close to elevators, ice machines. Our rooms were perfect! Clean, quiet, luxurious! The hotel is huge, so the walk to & from places is a long one.

Our family loved the Tonga Room, a Polynesian kitschy bar/restaurant with a live band floating on the lagoon in the middle of the room. (Best for adults).

The weekend brunch in the Laurel Room was great. The sticky buns were to die for. Pricey, but expected in these surroundings. Be aware of the fact that the tip is included in your bill for this buffet!

There is a roof top garden which is very pretty. A Hertz rental car office in the lobby. The hotel's British concierge was not the friendliest, however. Our kids loved the work out room. I loved to walk outside & see the cable cars going up & down the hill. We used cabs, as the hotel parking fee is $60 a nite. My son did rent a car for one day & it was great driving up & down the hills, seeing the Palace of Fine Arts, Seal Rock, all the different neighborhoods.

We all definitely recommend the Fairmont, on Mason St. on Nob Hill. The Fairmont has another hotel at Ghirardelli Square, way to touristy! ALso, I think you have a better chance of getting these rooms on Expedia if you can reserve way in advance! (I reserved 3 months in advance)

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, Servide was great, would recommend.

review.title: It is Fairmont!!
review.reviewText:
can't beat the location!! walking distance to Union Square and China town. right on the cable car route.
Hotel itself? this is Fairmont!

review.title: High quality, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was a very impressive and high quality hotel. The service was excellent. Our room was not immediately available when we arrived. After waiting about 40 minutes in the beautiful lobby, my husband complained to the general manager who was very accomodating. A platter of fruit, cookies and waters was delivered to our room shortly after we checked in. Nice touch. The climate control in our room did not work and it was quite stuffy. We were able to open the window but since there was no screen we did not want to leave it open long with pigeons out on the ledge!

review.title: Still a classic!
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel, very elegant and high class. Impressive lobby area. Room had beautiful furnishings and was extremely clean and comfortable. Our bathroom lighting and plumbing had slight malfunctions during the last day of our stay, though; and the bathroom exhaust fan never functioned at all while we were there. I've never seen a bathroom without either an exhaust fan or a window. There appeared to be a vent for a fan, but when I called to inquire I was told there was no fan (I still find that rather odd). I'm not sure the person understood what I was saying.

Most other hotel personnel were professional, friendly and helpful, but getting any attention at all from the doorman proved to be maddening on two of four occasions. Both times we waited out his conversation with someone until we gave up and hailed our own cab (different doorman each time). Very annoying.

The hotel coffee is not very good at all, but the food was absolutely delicious. I would definitely stay at The Fairmont again, but I would first mention to them the issues we encountered.

review.title: Not what I remembered
review.reviewText: No coffee service in room, hotel, with exception of lobby was past its prime. Not a good value at all.

review.title: A Tired Old Hotel with TERRIBLE SERVICE
review.reviewText: Did not get the room type I requested. Ate dinner in Tonga Room..food was lukewarm at best. Had a drink and appetizers int he bar..took over an hour for the apetizer to arrive..No apology..Rooms are small and many, like mine have absolutely no view. Never Again

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco is beautiful! The lobby and restaurant are both stunning. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is historic and has many charming features. A great place to stay if your looking for class and elegance. Enjoy!

review.title: Great hotel if you don't mind a long climb up
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great service. Just wish it was located without a climb of three very steep hills to reach.

review.title: elevator noise and dirty windows
review.reviewText:
Nice.... to spend $$$$ to splurge on a San Fran trip. Oh!! room was backed up to elevator and so much noise @ 6:00AM. View?? What view? Windows SO dirty couldn't see out of them. Knock on the door @ 8:30AM on day of check out (Sunday) to see if they could clean up the room!!!
Things are never the same twice remembered.

review.title: Great location, would recommend to others
review.reviewText:
We were made extremely welcome, nothing was too hard to make our stay enjoyable. Nice walk to Union Square and cable car line right outside.

The Concierge was fantastic! I forget her name, but she knew all the best restaurants, recommended a great drive north for the day, and just wanted to help. She just wanted us to be happy with our stay.

review.title: Very Impressed with the Fairmont
review.reviewText: The Fairmont far surpassed our expectations. It's a classy hotel, very clean and the service staff was extremely helpful. We would stay here again!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Only complaint is the outrageous $59 daily parking rate.

review.title: Fairmont SF - ho hum
review.reviewText:
Fairmont for a night to meet-up with an old friend who was staying there, other -wise the old lady might not have been my first thought for a SFran night.
I hadn't stayed in years and my most outstanding impression was just how little it has changed - which may be a good or a bad thing, depending on what one is looking for.
Its fine for the price, I suppose - if that old 'empire' style is still your thing and you absolutely, totally, utterly HAVE to stay up Nob Hill. Its an old building so you know what you're going to get in terms of the room. No problems though.
That said, personally, I wouldn't go back. It really only has its very own, very specific, very special location going for it nowadays and if that's not really important for you on your trip to SFran then somewhere like the Mandarin downtown may serve you better for the same money.

review.title: Love it!
review.reviewText: Not unlike every Fairmont, this hotel is lovely, quiet, clean and has fabulous customer service. The room was clean, had a super soft mattress with luxurious Sferra linens. Our view was beautiful and the Tonga Room was a fun experience! I highly recommend this property.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco was absolutely fantastic! Very elegant, the staff were all extremely customer service oriented, and the room was amazing. We requested a "signature room" in the tower portion of the hotel, and got a beautiful room on the 17th floor overlooking the Bay Bridge and Fisherman's Wharf. One thing to know - if you take any drinks out of the fridge, you IMMEDIATELY get charged so beware! It was no problem for us to get the charges reversed since we put everything back, but still a shock! The restaurant right off the lobby was awesome, great food and not completely outlandish prices...it was just what we needed after a busy day in the city. The sheets were so soft and luxurious! We definitely would stay there again.

review.title: Fairmont
review.reviewText: Great, huge room, good service. Central location. (But be prepared to take a cab back up the hill.)

review.title: Unpleasant odor
review.reviewText: Unfortunately the room smelled like someone had been sick, window was cracked open obviously to alleviate the smell. Don't know why housekeeping would not communicate with the front desk to take this room out of inventory.

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO IS A NICE CITY
review.reviewText: MY EXPERIENCE IN SAN FCO,WAS SO INTERESTING,THIS CITY IS A BEATIFUL CITY.

review.title: Would highly recommend
review.reviewText: Loved staying at the Fairmont. A lovely classic hotel in a fabulous location for buses, cable car and/or walking. Rooms were large, comfortable and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Great coffee shop on the corner. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great views and service
review.reviewText: Beautiful original Fairmont hotel everything else is downhill from here.... Literally. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Grandeur on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: This is the original Fairmont, built by the Fair sisters of San Francisco using the money of their father who was a California silver miner. The hotel was one of the few buildings to survive the great earthquake in the early 1900s. It was restored to great grandeur by the architect Julia Morgan (who also built Hearst's san Simeon). The building (especially the lobby) is simply beautiful and a pleasure to be in and return to each day. The staff seem genuinely interested in your welfare. The breakfast room makes you want to linger each morning (food great too). It is a gracious retreat in the busy city. We stayed for 6 days to see Wagner's Ring Cycle at the opera house. We will definitely be there again.

review.title: Not Impressed.
review.reviewText: I was not impressed, the location was good, but the room was quite small, and old. No view outside, i do not recommend this hotel as you should pay the high cost. Also you should expect $59 of parking charge for night.

review.title: Exceeded our expectations.
review.reviewText: The hotel is upscale and beautiful with old world elegance and style. The location is perfect with easy access to most anything. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Our room was large, clean and beautiful with a great view of the bay. We had breakfast in the hotel dining room and it was exceptional. We highly recommend the Fairmont and we will be staying there on all future trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Parking is a Ripoff
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and the rooms were clean. However, I expected more from this price level hotel. When I went to check out my bill had a charge for an expensive bottle of water that we did not drink. The charge was removed. However, the kicker was the overnight parking charge for our vehicle, $59.84 for one nights parking. Ridiculous.

review.title: One of San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: Beautiful room very quiet & comfortable , staff top of the line from the doorman to the room maids ...

review.title: He who rests on his laurels wears them in the wrong place
review.reviewText: The advantages of the Fairmount are quickly numbered: Beautifully situated on Nob Hill in a very pleasant neighbourhood; impressive entrance hall. Check in was quick and friendly, our request for to adjacent, interconnecting rooms with one double and two single beds with a good view was provided for perfectly. The beds were comfortabel. But that was about it. The rooms had been furnished without much consideration, the carpet was extremely ugly, and when it comes to service the Fairmount does not at all meet its own ambitions. We were not igiven the promised phone call when our rooms were ready. We had to find our rooms ourselves - in this kind of hotels I expect to be escorted to the room. When having breakfast (we tried it only once and after that experience preferred to go elsewhere), service was extremely slow and ineffektive. I had to go to the buffet to get milk for my coffee, orange juice was only refilled upon special request. When we returend from the buffet, we found fragments of a broken glass on our table. There was no real apology for this; instead, after my complaint, we were completely ignored; dirty dishes were not removed. Nevertheles, there was a gratuity fee of 25%. Free tablewater was not provided in rooms. When checking out, my husband nevertheless added gratuity to the bill. There was no thank for this and no question wether we had lenjoyed our stay as is common even in plain hotels. I am sure they know why they do not ask...

review.title: Best Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText:
I thought this hotel was absolutely fabulous!

It was simply stunning and elegant inside the lobby and the rooms, it was clean and had a very spacious bathroom (+++). The location was perfect for walking and taking the trolly/street car. I would definitely go back!!!

Only complaint was that we had to call down numerous times to get extra wine glasses brought up...don't mess with out wining! he he...seriously it was a minor complain compared to the pluses at this hotel!

review.title: would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: I only stayed there 1 night with my girlfriend. The Good: I found the staff very helpful. Everything was very clean. The room was stocked with a pretty nice mini bar. The building itself was beautiful. The Bad: The room service while good, was a little pricey for my taste. Also, the vallet and overnight parking was pretty expensive as well (50 or 60 bucks). Overall I enjoyed it, I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Just "okay," very average which is disappointing for an historic hotel
review.reviewText:
Beautiful lobby and spectacular views but not enough to make up for satisfactory service, inadequate room amenities, terrible room service (food, time to deliver and price) and uncomfortable room.

I was given a lovely suite in the tower with beautiful views. However, there were insufficient outlets which made it difficult to keep my computer and other equipment plugged in. I ended up using the bathroom outlet to charge my phone and a plug behind my bed to charge my computer.

The room temperature was very warm. After my second night I decided to request an engineer to help and was assured the air conditioner would be turned on. (I didn't know it was off!) Unfortunately my 3rd night was just as hot and I didn't want to deal with an engineer coming to my room at midnight so I just endured.

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Awesome Place...would stay in a heartbeat again.

review.title: Awesome hotel and town
review.reviewText: Great Historic Hotel. Highly Recommended !!

review.title: A Weekend at the Fairmont
review.reviewText:
I was first disappointed that our room had view of the a/c units, so I called down to the front desk to inquire abt upgrading to a room with a better view. They moved me to an excellent exterior room with a view of the bay at no extra charge. They even moved all of our bags to the new room while we were out exploring Chinatown just a few blocks away.

I was first disappointed at the cost of breakfast and resolved to go for the buffet since the cost would be about the same... was not disappointed at all. First class all the way. And, don't forget to try the sticky buns (a new benchmark for all sticky buns in the world) !!

review.title: you can get more bang for your buck somewhere esle
review.reviewText: the hotel is beautiful and in a great location. I wish they had coffee makers i the room, you have to all the was down to get a cup or pay 16. from room service.

review.title: The clasic SF hotel
review.reviewText: This is the clasic San Francisco hotel. Great location on top of Nob Hill that is quiet but is still a close walk to Union Square, China Town or Downtown. Great lobby with free coffee early in the morning and helpful and professional staff. My favorite hotel in the city!

review.title: Fairmont -- San Francisco (Nob Hill)
review.reviewText: All aspects of hotel living went smoothly for the entire week. Staff was respectfully friendly. Concierge services were top-notch. Meals within the hotel were limited, demanding exploration of a beautiful city -- not a difficult unintended consequence.

review.title: Fabulous experience in San Francisco's best
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous experience in San Francisco's best hotel. Excellent service, gorgeous view and fantastic location. Just steps from all the attractions and shopping. We took the Lands End hike in Golden Gate Park after a lovely brunch in Sausilito just minutes away. I highly recommend this hotel and its location, location, location.

review.title: SFO
review.reviewText: Disappointing stay with rude front desk staff, not enough menus in the restaurant so all diners had to wait to see the menu and order (up to 30 minutes). Poor maintenance and no effort by staff to replace a lightbulb in the bathroom despite repeated requests. Too bad, would rather stay across the street at the Intercontinental.

review.title: Great deal in a great location
review.reviewText:
The SF Fairmont is a classy old hotel in a convenient location in downtown San Francisco. Well maintained, great service, nice lobby lounge.
I would definitely return.

review.title: The Fairmont San Francisco... a true icon of the city
review.reviewText: The check-in was quick and easy. Our flight was delayed, and we arrived at the hotel after the check-in time, but it was no problem. The hotel room was clean, and the view was fantastic!

review.title: Great home base to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: Located on top of Nob Hill, the beautiful Fairmont is great place to stay to explore San Francisco. Close to the cable car line and other transit lines. Walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown.

review.title: fairmonth upgrade
review.reviewText: as usual, the old fairmont proved comfortable and very hospitable. staff was excellent as usual. went out of their way to upgrade me for free to a suite despite the fact i booked through expedia. made sure i joined the preferred guest club to save on cost of gym use. very proactive. besides a minor leak in the shower, it was a great stay for 5 days.

review.title: Great Hotel, Not-So-Great Service
review.reviewText:
The fairmont San Francisco looked beautiful, felt beautiful, and was an amazing experience. The exterior room I got looked out on the financial district, but more importantly onto their rooftop garden, which was lovely. However, there was much to be desired of such a nice and expensive hotel.

pros:
plenty of service opportunities
great view
comfortable bed

cons:
in-room dining was overly expensive, and they got the order completely wrong!
the TV didn't have signal for many of their advertised channels
the bathroom was much smaller than I'd have expected
the iron was broken
the parking was valet-only and was ridiculously expensive

in more detail:
the food ordered was cold where it shouldn't be, the drinks weren't cold, the food was soggy, and my girlfriend's breakfast wasn't even prepared properly, missing half the ingredients. Besides charging you higher rates anyways, they also charge a % service fee and a base fee, pushing the cost of a two person meal up by about $15.

the TV would go to the channel and then sputter out immediately... some channels worked intermittently.

the iron's spray misting feature just dumped water everywhere and leaked

Overall, if you're willing to live with the service faults and the expense, it's a great place to go. If you expect to get better quality with higher cost, think again!

review.title: Good family stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel to stay in. Everything was good about this hotel except the exhorbitant parking rate of $ 57 per night.

review.title: Grand Hotel!
review.reviewText: Wow.If you are not impressed when you walk in the lobby then wait until you walk to your room and look at the history on the walls.Great place in the heart of SF.

review.title: What a "Grand Hotel"
review.reviewText: We travel a great deal around the US and Europe; and staying at the Fairmont was indeed a wonderful experience. Our room was very comfortable and large. The staff was courteous and helpful. Transportation was available at the front entry; however we were within walking distance of all the major highlights of the city. The hotel has a great coffee shop as an alternative to a full breakfast. The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays and had a full service dinner available on Christmas Day in the evening. We arrived late and had snacks in the bar area and were fully immersed in the spirtit of the holidays. I would recommend this hotel highly!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, beautiful old hotel. That being said, things were a little run down around the edges for this pricepoint. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would still recommend the hotel and would stay there again. A couple of umbrella drinks in The Tonga Room and you won't notice the mold in the shower and hole in the lampshade.

review.title: Tested the service they are known for
review.reviewText: It was a great stay. We enjoyed everything. Lost my credit card on the first day there. informed the concierge and the security person showed up within one minute with my card. The maid found it in the hallway.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Our experience was perfect from start to finish. The hotel was beautiful and the room clean, spacious and nicely appointed.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Beautiful, but the noice level was loud. I could hear almost everything from the next room.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: Unbelievable price! The Fairmont is an exceptional hotel. Lots of history and in the middle of the city. Cable car lines run at its location and a easy walk (down hill) to Union Square. Take the cable cars to Fishermans Wharf, Union Square and from there you can catch all other modes of transportation. Sit in the lobby of the Fairmont and all of San Francisco pass through the door.

review.title: great hotel had to use the cable car because of location
review.reviewText: the hotel people went beyond the call of duty to make my stay great.

review.title: Would love to stay at a Fairmont again!
review.reviewText: Our trip was extremely satisfying as we had no "glitches" at all.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: It was everything my wife and I thought it would be. Outstanding.

review.title: WOW!!!!!
review.reviewText: Best place in town!!!!

review.title: IT WAS THE HOTEL OF MY DREAMS
review.reviewText: THIS HOTEL IS LIKE THE ONES YOU SEE IN A ROMANTIC MOVIE.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: We loved our room, the view, the comfortable beds, and the location. It was a perfect stay. Many thanks to the staff.

review.title: Older is not always better
review.reviewText:
Beautiful Hotel, but would only stay again in a tower room. The old building was very noisy, the walls were way to thin, and we could here everey noise coming from the room next door.
We put the DND sign out as we did not want our room serviced, came back from a great day in town, and found they ignored the sign and came in anyways?
Once our room was changed to a non-view suite and we complained about the housekeeping, it was better, though I had to tell the attendant we were fine every time I saw her as I came in and out of our room.

review.title: A must to stay in San Fran!!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was beautiful, the service was truly impecable. We had dinner in the Tonga Room and it was great, the music and service we A+
We will for sure stay at the Fairmont the next time we are in San Fran, super easy to Fishermans Wharf, China Town right on the trolley just walk out front and you are on a stop!!

Loved it, we can't wait to go back and we got the very best deal at Expedia which is why we were able to experience this historic and timeless hotel.

review.title: "Fairmount Makes Nob Hill Really Special"
review.reviewText: The view, the food, the service; the proximity to everything was very pleasing. I really want to go back. I wish I'd learned the trolley system more quickly. As soon as we found where everything was, it was time to catch our flight for home. I really thing 10 or more days would be super in the area.

review.title: Will stay again!
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel! We loved both our rooms here. We upgraded to a balcony suite and it had an awesome view! I highly recommend staying here. The prices are a little expensive in the restaurants so it's not a place to stay if you are on a budget. Other then that it's awesome!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. The Fairmont is centrally located and with views that create lasting memories. Hotel staff were always friendly, smiling, and willing to help...... and without the pompous attitude you typically find at better quality hotels.

review.title: disappointed with service
review.reviewText: I travelled to San Francisco for work. this hotel is full of high class travellers. because I am young and was dressed in jeans upon checkin, I was treated like a second-class citizen. in fact when I went to eat at the restaurant the host insisted that the restaurant was only for hotel guests. I told him that I was a hotel guest and he insisted on verifying this in the hotel computer. interestingly, he did not ask any other customers if they were hotel guests when they asked to be seated! I would not recommend staying here if you are young and wanted to be treated like a normal person.

review.title: Very posh
review.reviewText: Very posh hotel in exclusive Nob Hill, but sometimes you can get specials through Expedia that make it slightly affordable. Excellent service and cleanliness.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is elegant without pretension. Staff is pleasant, rooms are perfect.
Would loved to have stayed longer and will stay in this hotel every time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: nob hill review
review.reviewText: clean, hospitable, very helpful. parking in san fran is a pain and tickets prices are high, use the valet. may appear costly but well worth it as garages in the area are about $36 for a stay in only, parking over night is not allowed and tickets I am told are about $60. Well worth the convenience if you have a car! A car is not needed, but worth it as transportation gets costly.

review.title: Fairmont Stay
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel and service. People were awesome!

review.title: Step back into the past
review.reviewText: We loved the grandeur of the hotel and enjoyed learning of it's extensive history with the earthquake and fire still stood. It was wonderful to know so many important people had been and stayed there including many of our presidents. We stayed in a center room so no view at all. As this not so important with going out into the city everyday we didn't really mind. It is on top of a steep hill so when you go just remember back is a work out. It goes without mention that anything in the hotel excessively expensive. Our room was very nice and the bed super comfy!

review.title: Old hotel, forgotten basic customer service
review.reviewText: The Fairmont has an impressive facade, location and history but plainly it's trading on past glories. The bellhop was too busy chatting on his mobile to help us with our luggage. The receptionist did not acknowledge our arrival and we waited while she finished doing some data entry. When we asked the concierge for restaurant reservations he did not offer to call and make the reservation but he wanted us to give the restaurant his name. The room was clean but the furnishings and carpet were tired. A grand old hotel in its twilight years.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The best place and best location to stay in San Francisco--the entire hotel staff was courteous and very accomodating. I can't wait to go back and stay at this hotel!

review.title: San Francisco's finest!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was awesome. Great room, classy hotel, room service was good and the guests are treated like VIP's. I would recommend this hotel and plan on going there again.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText:
Staying at The Fairmont San Francisco was a really great experience. We had a Balcony Suite and the view and ability to sit out added so much!! So many hotels restrict you from opening a window, so fresh air while staying at a hotel is a welcomed change and great benefit.

All the services were excellent.

review.title: Simply Brilliant
review.reviewText: Staff were terrific from the moment you walked through the door, you felt at home. Room service was efficient and reasonably priced. I loved this hotel and although it was a bit expensive, it was definately worth the extra money spent. Definately will be coming back to stay!! Thank you Fairmont.

review.title: Disappointed. Not worth the price.
review.reviewText: Concierge usually referred instead of helping. Room very noisy. Overcharged for all services, even postage stamps! Food was mediocre. Seem to be relying on past reputation rather than current services. Not worth the cost. Stayed at Courtyard by Marriott before staying at Fairmont and had a much better experience for half the cost. Will not stay there again.

review.title: " Lovely Hotel , Great Location but Beware of the Breakfast"
review.reviewText:
This hotel has glamour, atmosphere and lovely rooms. The entry and lobby are fabulous. But our enjoyment of this grand hotel was dampened by the restaurant's bill for breakfast for two , which came to nearly ninety dollars.
Clearly the Fairmont believes that breakfast is the most important meal of the day.

review.title: good place to stay
review.reviewText: enjoyed the hotel VERY much; wouldn't eat breakfast there as the cost for 2 of us was $65, but the room was comfy, clean and all you could want.

review.title: Thrilled from Boise
review.reviewText: The hotel was absolutely perfect! I booked this hotel as part of a surprise 40th birthday weekend was wasn't disappointed at all. In fact, it was beyond anything I could have imagined. The front desk was courteous and then asked if we would like to know more about the immediate area to help us with dining, coffee shops, and transportation. The hotel room was just fine, especially for a hotel rich in history. It was by far the nicest accomodations I had ever been in. The food was great too. We only had one problem of not receiving two television stations, but a technician was sent to the room immediately and solved the problem. I still can't believe I stayed somewhere so fantastic for the price Expedia gave. Thank you Expedia!

review.title: the fairmont is wonderful!
