review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at The Fairmont. The staff were really friendly and the hotel was beautiful. I hope to stay again one day.

review.title: Only if you pay for a larger room
review.reviewText: Although I was satisfied with my stay, my room was small by today's standards. Service is good, restaurants a bit, but not terribly pricey--if you like old and elegant this is your place--if you're looking for a modern business hotel and price makes a difference, look elsewhere.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Loved everything about the hotel expect for the Tonga dining room which is polynesion cuisine which I'm not crazy about. The main dining room and lounge very nice great service.

review.title: The best hotel in town.
review.reviewText:
This is the best hotel in town. It is not cheap, but if you are looking for the best, this is it. Everything is top of the line.

The only minor downside is location. For this and the other high end hotels on 'nob hill' it is a steep three block walk to Union Square, where the major shopping is located. For some people that hill would be an issue.

review.title: Timeless Luxury
review.reviewText: Few hotels have the chops to compare to the The Fairmont in San Francisco. With excellent service from well trained employees and wonderfully appointed rooms with extraordinary views, this hotel is indeed at the pinnacle of luxury and comfort. Food service was high quality and hotel seating in the restaurant and lounge was warm and inviting. My family of four also enjoyed a show at the reopened Venetian Room. I recommend this hotel highly and will be returning soon.

review.title: Great hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a lovely hotel, really elegant in its style. The rooms are extremely spacious and comfortable. We had a lovely big bed that was really comfortable. Location was great, and easy to get to all main points and attractions of the city. I would stay there again!

review.title: if you've got the money stay at the fairmont
review.reviewText: although we enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont, it is pricey. the buffet breakfast is $30, however if you aren't in the mood for a buffet a coffee is $5, an OJ is $5 and a bagel is $5...that's pricey. The beds are incredibly comfortable to the point we are trying to get one for home. It is at the top of Nobhill and is a down hill walk to most things, but the walk back up to the Fairmont was a serious walk UP. We didn't mind but our travel companions did.

review.title: Classic feel, great experience
review.reviewText: Just a gorgeous hotel inside and out. Hallways and rooms give you that classic feel and the condition of the hotel is outstanding. Great location - we walked across the street and up to the Top of the Mark for drinks - unbelievable 360 degree view of the city. Just a short walk to catch the trolley, and was able to pick up our rental car at the hotel to avoid all the outrageous parking fees for days we wouldn't be driving much. Just a great experience - probably worth the higher price.

review.title: Top of Nob Hill !!
review.reviewText: What a wonderful hotel. Beautiful at every turn and the staff was super friendly and helpful from the Valet to the Hotel manager. The location was convienant to all of our needs. We had a car rental and they took care of the parking ($57.00 per night with tax) but the cable cars and taxis were great for just getting around the city. We truly can't wait to go back!!

review.title: Hotel in middle of a renovation
review.reviewText:
The hotel wasn't comfortable because the kitchen is in the middle of a renovation so for instance, for breakfast, if you don't want the buffet, there is nothing to eat. For lunch, very little to offer. I want to relax at the hotel, get into my room and eat there - couldn't do it at this hotel.
Hotel lobby is beautiful but it is confusing to find the elevators. I got lost and asked one of the employees for help to find the main elevators. He asked me, "For which building?" I said, I don't understand - this is the hotel, right? He answered, "We have 3 buildings here." This was just so he didn't have to help me to find my room. Jerk.
If you want to go to the convention center - this hotel is very far away.

review.title: The Fairmont is Awesome, but United Airlines bites!!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco was an excellent choice! We usually stay at the Westin on Market Place, but we decided to try out the The Fairmont. Extremely glad we did! Beautiful historical hotel with out being old (flat screen TV's, etc..) if you know what I mean. Great decor throughout the hotel from the lobby to the suite we were in. The balcony suite was simply gorgeous! However, I will never fly United Airlines again to San Francisco. We were booked on a small plane that the captain had to ask someone from the first 4 rows to move to row 11 to even out the weight of the plane before take off. Hmmm I should of seen it coming. Our return flight was cancelled because it rained earlier that morning. We had to fly stand by to LAX and our vehicle was in ONT. Lucky enough to get out on the next available flight and rented a car in LAX another (2hrs and $100 later). Got home at midnight and just a tad bit grumpy.

review.title: Beautiful San Francisco
review.reviewText: My best friend and I had a short trip planned to San Francisco and wanted to get the most out of the weekend there. The Fairmont Hotel was centrally located and had a bit of history to it. Beautiful hotel, nice restaurant and incredibly friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location and hotel
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. It is gorgeous, historical, but rooms are updated. It was comfortable, quiet, but close to everything that we wanted to do. The staff was exceptional. It had a bit of a European feel, but with larger rooms. VERY pleased! (Free coffee in the lobby, if you get up early also.)

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location with access to major cable car lines right outside your door. Staff were friendly and helpful. Bed was comfortable. We also ate at the Tonga Room and the food was quite tasty and there was also some live entertainment. Only issue with the hotel was that our bathroom faucet was leaky.

review.title: good and bad
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The room we were given the first night was noisy. Sounds from the corridor and particulary from the room next door were very loud. We had a neighbor that was up until 3:00 am and we called the desk to complain a couple of times. They contacted the room each time but it was still a disruptive night.

We were given another room the second night which was very nice.

It was bad that the 1st room was so noisy. It was great that the hotel worked with us for the second night.

review.title: San Francisco's Finest Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco was amazing. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and professional in every way. However, the Concierges went above and beyond professionalism, they helped us almost everyday we stayed. Choosing places to eat or helping us plan day trips, the Concierges where great.

review.title: Great Room + Great Service =Great Time!!
review.reviewText: When we arrived at 1:30 our room wasn't ready, but it was early and the hotel offed to store our luggage. We upgraded to a King sized room and it was worth the extra few dollars. We had a view f the courtyard and the Oakland Bridge and 3 other couples who were traveling with us and did not upgrade their room, had no view! The hotel is just beautiful, the bed was very comfortable. The valet suggested a wonderful Italian restaurant on e night, even made our reservations for us. The cafe down stairs was wonderful. Great coffee, pastries, etc. and the street cars were right there for jumping on! The Tonga room was a lot of fun and the drinks, service and entertainment were wonderful. I would definitely stay here at the Fairmont again,...be sure to check out the pictures down on the P level!

review.title: What a great place
review.reviewText: Our visit to San Francisco was wonderful, we were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary and had an excellent time. We were given an room upgrade at checkin since it was our anniversary. The conceirge was fantastic and very helpful. The location of this hotel can't be beat and the room size was perfect with a wondeful King size bed. Such great history at the Fairmont, I would very much recommend staying here even if you have to pay a little extra.

review.title: Had a great time!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was the perfect location for our trip! The room was a good size for the 4 of us and very comfortable. We will definitely come back to the Fairmont.

review.title: Top of the Mountain - Fairmont San Fran
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont San Francisco is a beautiful old hotel that is well maintained, the only down side to it is that it is at the top of Knob Hill in San Francisco so unless you like doing mountain hikes every day back to the hotel or paying for a cab or a trolley car, it is not that convenient, everything you want to go to is downhill from the hotel, shopping, sporting events, restaurants, so it makes for a long hike back.

The staff were friendly and accommodating and although we had a great experience we wouldn't necessarily stay there again, but more because of the location.

review.title: Unimpressed
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco is located on beautiful Nob Hill allowing you to see all on San Francisco. However I would not stay at the Fairmont again. It is highly over rated and the rooms were very noisy. Anytime someone open and close a door down the hall it would echo in our room. We had staging in front of our window becuase the hotel is under historic renovations. Parking your car at Fairmont is $57 per night and we would been better off staying outside the city for far less and free parking. I would recommend their Centro Coffee Shop for breakfast.

review.title: Uncomfortable Bed!
review.reviewText: Beautiful old historic hotel, but saggy bed in room 530 made for a lot of tossing at night, and not much sleep. Told front desk and young clerk didn't seem too concerned. Also, hotel too high on hill. Hard to get back to hotel after leaving and walking down hill. Lots of $ for taxi's. We love SF, and come here once a year for a weekend. We'll stay in Union Square next time.

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText: My wife and I were visiting San Francisco for a week and had heard that it's important that you stay at a hotel which is centrally located and easy to get around from. The Fairmont is just that with is being at the intersection of 2 street car lines. It was ideal for us to get around the city easily. On top of that everything else about the hotel was great. Don't forget to go to the Tonga Room while it's still around!!!

review.title: Loved San Fran
review.reviewText: Loved the city and senery

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: nice room great view

review.title: San Francisco Class !
review.reviewText: Best hotel we've ever stayed at. Great property, fine service.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Would recommend the Fairmont Hotel - Nob Hill to travellers to San Francisco. Great location - both cable car lines stop right outside the door. The Tonga Room is outstanding with their lightning and rain show.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Two girlfriends and I stayed at the Fairmont. It is a very upscale hotel. Fun to stay at, lots of history. The people who worked there were all so courteous and gracious. They were so helpful. We got in early and they stored our luggage while we waited for a room on an upper floor. Worth the wait. Loved the hotel and the people who worked there.

review.title: San Francisco's absolute best!
review.reviewText: San Francisco's best to offer.

review.title: Fairmont
review.reviewText: DO NOT recommend at all. Fairmont does not come close to its reputation. The hotel from outside looks classy but inside the rooms, hallways are presence of many years of wear and tare. The in-room dinning is expensive and not worth the value and the service is like going to your neighboring motel. When checking-out the host told me that he can't help since his computer was down, SOOOOO what's the solution. He had nothing say but my computer was down.

review.title: My hearts in San Francisco
review.reviewText: See above

review.title: Really the best
review.reviewText: The Fairmont truly lives up to its reputation for superlative comfort and service. I had expected something amazing and had told my wife so. We both concluded it is the place to stay in San Francisco. We would like to stay again.

review.title: Location informs the magic of this city
review.reviewText:
While I had lived in Berkeley for years and visited the City often, it was not until I stayed at the Fairmont Sept 8-10, 2010 that I understood the layout of the area.
From that point on Nob Hill all three cable car routes basically intersect. Make your choice to go to Fisherman's Wharf/Northbeach, Union Square or the Embarcadero/Fisherman's Building/Ferry terminal just outside the Fairmont's doors.
Walk to any of these locations "easily" as well.
The Happy Hour in the Tonga Room is a nice after excursion event and well priced.
I enjoyed walking everywhere, taking the cable cars and taking a shuttle to and
from the hotel from the airport. I also took a day tour to the Sonoma wine country and Muir Woods which I highly recommend doing. I was able to buy the shuttle and the Tour on the Expedia site and would not have known about the Tour without the site alerting/advertising it. Excellent experience in every way.

review.title: Fairmont in the Fall
review.reviewText: Love it!

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. Location, service at the hotel, rooms, were all great. Would defintely stay again.

review.title: Ehhh... Thought it would be better
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a truly beautiful hotel. But would i stay there again? No. Probably not. I thought, for the price, that our room was very , very small. And anyone visiting San Fran knows that there is beautiful scenary almost every where you look. especially when you are on top of a hill. Well our hotel room overlooked nothing. Air vents and concrete - literally. Very disappointing. Also, we had a problem with the AC in our room. They came to check it as soon as we called, told us it wasnt working properly and that they would be back the next day. They weren't. Luckily it was cool outside during our stay and we opened the window when it was too stuffy in the room. We were only there 3 days. I will say that the room was clean at our arrival and through our visit.

review.title: Great Hotel, but location is more business than tourist
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed our 3 day stay at the Fairmont, but we felt a bit isolated, and we ate in most nights.
Stayed at a different location a week later, and this was better as it was near the buzz of Fisherman's Wharf, which we thought was more for tourists.

review.title: The Grandest Hotel on the West Coast
review.reviewText:
What a hotel! Although we've traveled to San Francisco and stayed on Nob Hill, we've never stayed at the Fairmont, although we've wanted to do so. It was worth the wait.

The hotel is grand in every way. The lobby is among the most beautiful that I've ever seen. The marble, gold leaf, antiques, and chandeliers were incredible.

The room was spacious and very comfortable. The view from the tower rooms was well worth the extra price. Room 1901 has an incredible view.

Negatives? The prices for the extras was a bit much, e.g., in-room snacks, parking, fitness center, etc.

The staff and service were superb. We'll definitely go back, especially if we get the rates we got on expedia.com!

review.title: The Fairmont chain never disappoints.
review.reviewText:
We are never disappointed with the Fairmont Hotel, whether it be here in Canada or in the States. Two of our daughters had their weddings at Fairmont Hotels (the Banff Springs and the Palliser in Calgary).
The staff is always friendly, cordial and accomodating.
We found the same level of service in San Francisco that we have come to expect with the Fairmont.

review.title: Engaging Experience
review.reviewText: Beautiful old, classic hotel, with one of the most comfortable beds i have slept in at a hotel. Tough to decide between the bed at the Wynn and the Fairmont. The service was always pleasant and the facilities were spotless. Will definitely recommend and stay again next time in San Francisco. My girlfriend and I got engaged on this trip and staying at the Fairmont was the right choice for such a memorable weekend.

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText: Fairmont is quite grand and has old style grace despite its contemporary rooms.

review.title: Five Star Experience!!!
review.reviewText: The top of San Francisco!

review.title: Best of the Best
review.reviewText: Fantastic

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: The hotel had a great ambience; it was close to Chinatown , North Beach, Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. The only complaint??? It was located on the steepest hill!!!!!

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: I had always wanted to stay at the Fairmont, and with the deal they were offering this summer, I couldn't resist the chance to stay there. It definitely met my expectations. The room was beautiful and clean, the lobby is amazing, and the staff very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: class is still there
review.reviewText: it was a very relaxing atmosphere with willing staff--the bar was nice and made a wonderful moscow mule--old goodie!!!

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. Five nights inside room. We did not pay extra to upgrade to an outside room as we knew we were there to see the city not the hotel view. The room was very clean. There is a cafe downstairs for a quick bite in the morning. My only issue was the postcards I had the front desk mail never got to thier destination . . . but that could be the postal service.

review.title: I Love San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Fairmont for 4 days while in San Francisco. We had driven up the coast after staying in Carmel for three days.
Our room was spacious and the bathroom was quite large and modern.
The room had a huge walk in closet which was great as we could hang our clothes and store our luggage out of harms way with no suitcases around the room.
We ate a number of breakfasts and had one dinner at the hotel. The prices were steep but the service was excellent.
All of the staff from the bellman to the house maids and concierge were all pleasant and helpful.
I actually parked my rental car in their garage. I knew in advance that the price would be steep (57 per night), but I wanted the convenience as I planned to go to Muir Woods and Napa on seperate days.. If I had it to do over again and if did not plan to go out of the city (to NAPA), I might just get a limo from the airport and use cabs for distant runs out to the Presidio or Golden Gate Park.
The hotel has great location as all three cable car lines pass by either on Powell Strret or California.
All in all I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel and would recommend it highly. Very relaxing! I believe we got a good deal through expedia and would not hesitate staying there again.

review.title: Grand Old Hotel- Still Grand
review.reviewText: I have spent about 40 days in San Francisco on trips over the years. this was the best hotel that I have ever stayed in-most anywhere. My room was huge and quiet and well lit. It was easily accessed and had a nice view. But the room really has an old time elegance and the feeling of first rate- even for the early 1900s.

review.title: Excellent Nob Hill Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is excellent, as would be expected, with an outstanding Nob Hill location, elegant lobby and very attentive and responsive staff.
I would recommend the hotel and will stay again.

My only complaint isn't over the actual hotel, amenities or stay itself, it is the lack of any parking / valet fee on the website or hotel details. Given the location, we expected it, but were still surprised by the amount. This should be posted on under hotel policies.

review.title: San Francisco weekend
review.reviewText: We spent 3 nights here while in San Francisco for a wedding and were very pleased with this hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially as we were traveling with our 6 month old daughter. The Fairmont is in a great location near Union Square, and close to a cable car if walking back up the hill to the hotel is too much. Parking is limited, the hotel garage is overpriced and nearby parking garages are expensive but less so than the hotel option.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Rooms excellent, views great. If you are an early riser they have tea/coffee in reception until 7am. Try the "Nob Hill Cafe" on Taylor Street which is just around the corner - no walking up or down a hill - a cosy bistro serving Italian, it's popular so worth booking.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: all was good

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful and a wonderful history - be sure to go to the P level and look at windows with pictoral history of the earthquake and fire in the early 1900's and the vital role the hotel played and founders information.
It is very accessable to the cable car lines. We arrived and checked in late evening. However, my husband's luggage did not arrive to the airport with us. The Desk Person and Bell Man's desk assured us they would leave a message upon it's arrival. We delayed sightseeing and stayed in the hotel vacinity for the morning waiting. When we checked at the bell man's office, we learned it had arrived at midnight. We were disappointed in the lack of follow through and customer service. We lost valuable vacation time.
We must commend the service we received from the attendants in the lower level parking, next to the more reasonably priced breakfast cafe-both on level P. Parking is expensive- we had to call the hotel to find out current parking fee. It was not listed in the hotel description and services.
We love visiting San Francisco- so much to see and wonderful dining experiences. We happened to be there when the Golden Gate State Park's Dahlia garden was in full bloom. What an unexpected delightful find.
We will return but will try to find alternative transportation to avoid a high parking expense in the future.

review.title: Nice but poor insulation
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice but the insulation is very poor. We could hear TV from next room.

review.title: 360 degrees
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is such a wonderful place and sitting high on Nobb Hill, it provides a lovely perspective of the city.

review.title: Over the top
review.reviewText: Like a cross between the Grand Hotel des Bains on the lido in Venice and Grand Central Station, the lobby is opulent but can get rather busy. The hotel, however, stretches away in all directions - with rooms in the towering accommodation above, facilities all around and surpises in the bowels of the earth below - especially the bar and restaurant of the Tonga room, which has to be seen to be believed (a kind of rendition of "South Pacific" by Uncle Walt with added special effects). Our signature room gave a spectacular view across the bay (when the fog lifted) and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever reclined upon.

review.title: grand elegance, but with some hassles
review.reviewText: While the Fairmont is always lovely, and a great location, it was especially irksome to be charged for internet service. After being on the road, and getting free internet at the Best Westerns and Holiday Inn Express locations we stayed at, to come to The Fairmont at considerably higher price and find a $13.99 internet fee was annoying. I think its little things like that that trip up an otherwise fine hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel Bad Location
review.reviewText: This historical hotel was beautiful, the room was clean and comfortable and the service was great. The only downside is the location. While the neighbourhood is very nice it is completely residential. The only restaurants and cafes in the area are part of the hotel and there are no stores of any kind nearby. The hotel is on the top of a series of very steep hills. I usually have no problem walking very long distances but found the numerous steep hills a challenge. Getting a cab from the hotel was easy but finding a cab back was very difficult and many times impossible. If you decide to stay at this hotel make sure you have a rental vehicle.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time. Front desk, concierge, room service, and bellman services were terrific. The few minor glitches--missing hairdryer, robe, incorrect mini-bar charges--were promptly corrected with a smile! Caffe Cento great and convenient for a quick bite; loved the Fairmont scones!

review.title: best bed ever
review.reviewText: Very beautiful, extremely clean. I have environmental allergies and was this hotel was one of the best. Staff and room were perfect. Beautiful and the most comfortable bed ever.We will go back. Location is on top of the hill, we loved it but did a lot of walking.

review.title: An oasis of calm and old San Francisco style glamour in a great location
review.reviewText: We had quite a long trip this summer visiting elderly family in various places and San Francisco was our last stop before heading home to Hawaii. It was also my daughter;s 14th birthday and she's interested in architecture. I wanted someplace soothing for me and interesting for her and was able to book at the last moment.-a bit of a splurge. Her jaw dropped when she saw the lobby, it really is so welcoming and just has that feel of old time San Francisco glamour. I love this hotel - even though I didn't have a deluxe room, the rooms have tall ceilings, huge closets, comfy robes, great beds and linens, fabulous pillows, and the location on Nob Hill is outstanding. The staff at the Fairmont is attentive and the room service is fast, my only desire is for a different dining room-similar to what they use to have on a higher floor with the stunning views and a piano bar. The Tonga room is for some a tradition and the food is OK to good, but not outstanding. However, the hotel staff directed us to a fabulous little Italian Cafe in the Nob Hill area. This hotel is not cheap but worth the charge, I definitely recommend it for romantic long weekends or for parents with older teens who want to learn a little bit about San Francisco history and enjoy the architecture, sites, and sounds of a great city.

review.title: Fun at the Fairmont
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was classicly beautiful. It was very well maintained for an old hotel. Some construction and painting was being done outside our room which was extremely distracting as the men on the scaffolding were very noisy and their presence would have required us to keep the drapes closed all day, but that was easily remedied with a switch to a room on a higher floor. (Although I question why they would assign the room to a guest knowing the inconvenience in the first place.) The majority of the staff was helpful and professional, with the exception of one woman at the hotel's Hertz rental car desk who was incredibly rude when I inquired about renting a vehicle at the hotel. She actually said "I already answered one question - how many more do you plan on asking? My husband and I ended up renting from another rental agency who not only picked us up at the hotel, but charged a significant amount less. The food in both the restaurant and room service was excellent, but very pricey. I would recommend going down the hill in any direction and eating breakfast in a neighborhood cafe. Overall, a very nice experience.

review.title: A lovely, elegant experience!
review.reviewText: We were treated like "royalty" and, because we arrived early in the day, were given an upgrade to a bayview room. We looked out over Coit Tower! Our room was elegant and very large, with a walk-in closet bigger than most hotel rooms in San Franciscio. They also put a complimentary stamp on our letter . Yes, we would return again to the Fairmont if we were traveling to The City. Only downside was that printing out your travel boarding pass cost money in the computer room . . . opted to do it at the airport!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel. Full of history. Great location.

review.title: Impressive!
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful with lots of character. Extremely well maintained and very clean. Parking is very expensive, but that seems to be the case for all hotels in San Francisco. Conveniently located to cable cars. Would highly recommend.

review.title: Wonderful stay at The Fairmont San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We knew that the hotel was old with a lot of history. I somewhat anticipated smelling a musty smell like we've encountered at other older hotels. But we encountered nothing of the sort. The hotel was wonderful in every way. The lobby is extremely grand as is the main breakfast/cocktail/dining area. Then there's the terrific Tonga room - a Polynesian style restaurant. We had a great table right next to the central pool where the nightly entertainment plays on a boat pulled to the middle of the pool. As for our room, I had reserved a room with an outside view of Nob Hill. So at check-in, I mentioned that I hoped our room would have a good view. It turned out that they upgraded our room to a floor high in their tower. We had a terrific view of the surrounding area including a view of the bay. The hotel has numerous historical pictures and facts about the hotel on display. For example, the TV show 'Hotel' was based on The Fairmont San Francisco. We had a great time in San Francisco . Staying in The Fairmont San Francisco definitely enhanced our pleasurable experience.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: wonderful location, very nice staff

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was amazingly accommodating. We were given help whenever we asked. Just very helpful and offered extra information.

review.title: Well, it's a Fairmont Hotel...
review.reviewText: Everything you would expect from a high quality hotel chain. Great location (if you don't mind walking uphill) and excellent facilities and services.

review.title: The Hub at the Fairmont San Francisco
review.reviewText: Centrally located, although it's not quite as convenient as its made out to be, the Fairmont San Francisco is a lovely, historic hotel located on Nob Hill. There are three cable car lines running nearby, so it's easy to get to San Francisco's main attractions, including Union Square, Chinatown, and Fisherman's Wharf, but the cable cars are ridiculously overcrowded, particularly the Powell-Hyde and Powell-Mason lines. Still, this is a beautiful place to stay, and the staff were professional, friendly, and helpful. We had to change rooms because our requested room was not available, and were offered a discounted rate on an upgrade. The upgraded room was quite roomy and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay and have fond memories of our time in San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: We loved being centrally located between Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, the financial center and Union Square. The hotel has classic beauty.

review.title: A Nice Experience
review.reviewText: We got a great rate through Expedia, otherwise we would not have stayed here. It's a fancier hotel than we usually find ourselves in, so we really enjoyed our stay. We liked the historic value of the hotel and were very comfortable there. The cable cars are very close by, but they are often so packed full that you may wait a long time for one with room for you to get on. The bed in our room was incredibly comfortable. My husband had a hard time leaving it he loved it so much. We did not use many of the hotel's services because we are the independent budget traveler type. It was our first time in San Francisco and it was part of our honeymoon trip, and I would definitely recommend the Fairmont as a pleasant place to stay.

review.title: Can't wait to go back",
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable quiet, close to everything.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Got tickets to see "Wicked" and needed a place to stay that was close by. Hotel staff was awesome, and the actual hotel lived up to its reputation. The "Tonga Room" downstairs was pretty cool. My wife stated that the bed was most comfortable bed she has ever slept in (no lie).

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont was a great place for us to stay during our recent visit to San Francisco. The room was updated and clean and included a large luxurious bathroom and walk-in closet. The service from the entire staff (doorman, parking vallets,, bellmen) was prompt and courteous. The hotel's location at the junction of all three cable car routes makes it convenient to tourist and business destinations within the city.

Although expensive, we thought the Fairmont was a worth-while splurge to provide a memorable and romantic visit to a special city.

review.title: All you would expect from a Five Star
review.reviewText:
I was told that the Hotel was one of the best. The recommendation was understated. It is the best.
I can think of no other venue in SF to stay on future visits.

review.title: The Star of Nob Hill!
review.reviewText: It was a trip for my son's 7th birthday and we received a complimentary room upgrade. He felt so special and was thrilled to get a room with a perfect bay view! Staff at the Fairmont is always wonderfully kind and helpful. I've never had a bad stay with them. It is a beautiful hotel and has a fantastic location.

review.title: A Classic and Elegant San Francisco Treat!
review.reviewText:
I recommend this hotel to anyone, whether you are a casual vacationer, or a 5 star celebrity. I thought it would be too expensive, but Expedia had a good deal and the small difference between the Fairmont and other lesser hotel/motels was SOOOO worth it!!! (parking is expensive if you drive - so count that into your budget).

The location is central to everything fabulous in San Francisco. You can hop on a cable car right outside the door. The views are spectacular and the bedding and bathrooms were unbelievably luxurious.

review.title: The hotel is impressive!!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is impressive!!!! The staff was amazing and friendly. They called you by your Last name as if you were royalty. I would stay here again for sure and every time I come to San Fran for business or pleasure.

review.title: Ready to go again.
review.reviewText: This hotel made me feel like I was going back in time.The service was outstanding. I did miss having a coffee pot in the room.

review.title: Fabulous Fairmont
review.reviewText: The Fairmont Hotel was fabulous, very luxurious, very friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: I wish I could go back now... it was great.
review.reviewText: A wonderful city to visit.

review.title: Very impressed with quality of the hotel and location. I would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel, view and location. Gym was great, wouldn't stay anywhere else when in San Fransisco!

review.title: Must like to walk
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont is a lovely old hotel that has been maintained well.
The doors are quite heavey so the noise from the hallway was quite annoying. There are no frills at the hotel. No coffee maker or glasses.
I enjoyed the walk to the hotel but if an individual is not in good physical shape they would find it quite challanging to go up and down the hills that surround the hotel.
It is a good location half way to everywhere.

review.title: Excellent service and quality
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and excellent service especially the concierge and Hertz rental car service. We were able to pick up our car at the hotel. Wonderful breakfast. It's expensive but worth it. The beds were also very comfortable and we were upgraded to a tower room with an incredible view without asking. Movies, phones charges and parking are expensive.

review.title: a beauty atop Nob Hill
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for the weekend to visit the famous Tonga Room and Hurricane Bar which is inside of the hotel. I heard it may be closing and we wanted to see it first. The hotel is amazing and has so much history. Staff was very courteous. Room was very comfortable. Our first night was in the wrong room and when we brought it to their attention in the morning, they moved our bags for us and set us up in a nicely upgraded room on the 17th floor with a view. Walking distance from the cable car which can take you to most of the things you would want to see in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Surpassed my expectations and anxious to return.
review.reviewText: I quickly planned this trip to attend funeral services in San Francisco, a city I have spent considerable time visiting for business and lesuire. I felt safe and experienced excellent service for the entire four day stay. This hotel is definitely one of San Francisco's finest!

review.title: Overall a good experience
review.reviewText: Although checking in was rough, the overall stay was great. Room service was good and they ended up comping all of our internet charges. We were also upgraded to a tower room which was big, beautiful, and comfortable. The only other thing to remember is that it's on top of the highest hills in San Francisco and so walking away from the hotel is fine, but walking back can be a struggle. Make sure to get a cable car pass to get back up the hills - all of the lines stop near the hotel - or make sure to bring plenty of cab fare!

review.title: San Francsisco at it's best
review.reviewText:
Top rate hotel, all the staff were there to meet your needs.
Location provided easy access to all of the cities top sites by cable cars located at the door.
Try the happy hour in the Tonga room and watch it rain.

review.title: great hotel!
review.reviewText: Loved everything about this hotel. Location was great- out of the touristy areas but very convenient to public transportation. All staff were friendly and professional. The restaurant and cafe were excellent. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful and well designed. The only thing lacking was a coffee maker in the room. Coffee was available in the lobby until 7PM, however.

review.title: Beautiful Landmark
review.reviewText: Beautiful building. Very elegant and traditional, so if you like more modern installations, it is not for you. The rooms are comfortable but you can hear some noise through the walls from other rooms. Bathrooms lack space to put your toiletries. The gym is small and kind of cramped in the basement. The breakfast buffet is good and so is the service, although the room is small and I had to wait for 10 minutes to get a table.

review.title: awesome
review.reviewText: we had a veiw of the bay from the 15th floor

review.title: Second Class Citizen in Overpriced Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Russian Prime Minister showed up on his way to the G summit....we were quite invoncenienced . Between KGB agents swarming the hotel, elevator and enterances closed, K-9s wandering the hallways, the swat team on the roof, 52 police motorcycles to escort, the streets closed for two days...I felt as though my existance was irrelevant.
We couldnt go up in the elevators....only down......
To add insult to injury, the media filled the lobby as Arnold Schwartzeneger and Maria Schriver showed up at the hotel....more security.
The concierge was misleading when he insisted we must reserve the double decker site seeing buses....a $20 deposit per person to hold your spot. When we got to the bus stop for our tour the driver explained we neednt require a reservation and we had to pay their full price.....basically the $20 per person was the concierges commission.....really!! It was completely unnecessary and we felt we were mislead. They insisted on a particular bus (the blue ones), which run very infrequently compared to the more frequent and cheaper red ones. Our choice was limited..DONT BOOK WITH THE CONCIERGE....they wanted to make dinner reservations after our bus experience....we declined!
The hotel is nice, rooms are clean, location is okay - walking distance to Union Square, but theres many others to choose from. The last night we ate dinner at the hotel and were very unimpressed with the variety and quality. Price was steep....as was our room service coffee with muffin $40...

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Nice historical hotel well situated to have a nice view of the city or Alcatraz/Golden Gate bridge (if you stay in the newer "tower" section). Well situated to walk to most tourist attarctions(20 min on average). Just be careful with the neighboorhood. Good choice if you get a bargain on the price such as free nights. Probably one of the best hotels in San Francisco overall. I would probably try the Four Seasons next time if the prices are comparable.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is old, but very well kept up. I'd recommend it for a business or pleasure stay. The walls are thin, as other reviews have mentioned, but overall the room was very clean and in great shape. I especially liked that we were able to open the windows. The location of the hotel is good. My husband and I walked to and from Union Square both days we were there.

We didn't eat at the hotel, so can't comment on that.

Just a note: the trolley goes down to Fisherman's Wharf, but it's cheaper to just cab it (and faster).

review.title: Left my heart at the Fairmont
review.reviewText: The Fairmont gives just the right amount of attention to its guests in its beautiful and historic setting. It truly is the grandest of hotels in San Francisco.

review.title: All show but no go.
review.reviewText: We were so looking forward to our four day getaway in San Francisco. Staying at the historic Fairmont, being pampered, enjoying the first class furnishings seemed like a well deserved treat. Instead we found a hotel that was living of a reputation from earlier days. The room was dirty,my wife found pubic hairs on a facecloth, the sink was really dirty under the rim of the undermount. The furnishings were chipped although the bed was very comfortable and the linens were of good quality. No coffee machine,instead ,one had to take the elevator to the lowest floor and purchase coffee to go at the street access coffee shop . Having to get up get washed and dressed ,brush hair and teeth, spend half an hour facing the world before being able to relax in bed with my my wife and a cup of coffee and talk about the upcoming day is not my idea of luxury.The hated mini bar was full of overpriced drinks. Imagine $7 for a beer that only costs $1.50 tops. Talk about feeling ripped off. To top it off I was charged $1.50 for a fifteen second local call that costs nothing. There was no proper fan in the bathroom and the shower was a bathtub with a shower curtain. Not good enough. Yes the lobby was spectacular but it is the appointments of the rooms that make a great hotel. It was all about squeezing every possible dollar from the guests and giving little if anything in return. The high price of prestige!!!! Insiders Select, I don't think so.

review.title: best on nob hill
review.reviewText: Charming, older hotel atop Nob Hill. Loved the architecture outside and the comforts inside the room.

review.title: WI FI Internet charges--will not go back-Cheap for a luxury hotel!
review.reviewText: Could not believe that The Fairmont would charge for a wifi connection...approx. $13.98 ( I've forgotten the exact amount) to connect. That was really cheap! Even MacDonald's is free! Disappointed !

review.title: Nicely located
review.reviewText:
The hotel was lovely and located within walking distance to the shopping area and some great little cafes. The only hitch was having to ask several times for the additional roll-away bed we had requested but the hotel didn't end up charging us for the additional bed as it took so long.

I was a little disappointed that the hotel didn't provide a standard transfer from the international airport and quoted me $120 for a town car. I ended up getting a taxi for about $40.

review.title: I'm Going back for my Heart, in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
It was our first time there and we loved it. Took our daughter and son in law for her 40th birthday and we were in awe! Th Fairmoung Hotel was spectacular and beyond our imagination.I wish they would have had a coffee pot in the room instead of paying $12.00 per pot. The nice thing is that it is only 2.5 hours from Calgary. We drove to Napa Valley and did about 6 wine tastes but was surprised that we paid anywhere from $15.00 - $25.00 per person each time. When we visit the Okanagan in British Columbia and do the same thing, it ranges from $2.00 - $5.00. WE did the crooked street and had lunch at alittle cafe called Nob Hill Cafe...recommend doing both. It was fun,fun.We shopped at the Westfair mall and saw the worlds only longest spiral esculator.

Over all, everything was awesome and cant wait to go back.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Its location is convenient - really in the heart of where everyone wants to be. It has a retro-feel, but still has modern amenities.

review.title: Beautiful large room and bathroom. Can't wait to return
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the size of the room as we had three females with a lot of luggage. Plenty of room for all of us without having to step over anything. The employees were all very nice. Location of the hotel is great for getting around to other areas of SF. Would highly recommend this hotel

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: We knew we would be entering a great hotel, and getting it at a discount through Expedia was the icing on the cake!

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: I truly enjoyed staying at the Fairmont in San Francisco and found the staff very helpful. I did notice though that if you want turn-down service, it needs to be requested. However in general I had an enjoyable stay for reasonable costs through Expedia. It was a great central location to walk to all parts of the town and the cable cars were a great help up and down the hills. It is also located near Grace Cathedral and a lovely park across from the hotel. I love the history and ambiance of the hotel and would stay again. I did make some prior requests by phone before my arrival but nothing had been recorded in my guest notes. However the front desk was very accomodating. For a large conference hotel I found the services quite personal and responsive.

review.title: Great traditional hotel where everything is in walking distance!
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great, beautiful and just what I had hoped for. The restaurant in the basement of the hotel was really cool and really fun with a great atmosphere. The restaurant on the main level though was really over priced ($47.00 for one eggs benedict breakfast and 2 cups of coffee!) YIKES! The staff was very nice and helpful though.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The fairmont location on knob hill was excellent. Close to China Town, Business Center, transportation etc. Lobby was beautiful and hotel maintains a historic yet classy charm. Had some plumbing issues in the room. Toilet kept running and shower would back up. Cleaning service representatives were great, but hotel lobby, front door, and coffee shop representatives need some assistance with Customer Service. Food was really good.

review.title: Would Not Stay Again
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was a huge disappointment. Service was deplorable from the valet parking to the hotel restaurant, which was the worst I have ever encountered in a hotel of this purported rating. The service was terrible at breakfast, the food was cold, and the toast was blackened on one side. And for all that there is an automatic gratuity and breakfast surcharge. The room was small, but the worst thing about it was the incessant clatter of the ancient heating/cooling unit. I would never stay at this hotel again. There are too many good hotels more conveniently located in San Francisco to waste your money on this sub-par hotel.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel..Inconvenient Location
review.reviewText: Loved the history behind the Fairmont and the lovely lobby area. True, it's on all three cable car lines, but not as close to shopping & activities as other hotels. Still, the Fairmont is a charming and elegant hotel that we would visit again.

review.title: NICE HOTEL STAFF VERY HELPFUL
review.reviewText: WE FOUND THE STAFF AT THE HOTEL VERY HELPFUL FROM GETTING OUT THE TAXI AND THROUGHOUT THE STAY.

review.title: clean, comfortable and good location
review.reviewText: conventient to all with cable car stopping at the door. Bright and comfortable

review.title: Must-Do
review.reviewText: This hotel is fantastic. Even the interior rooms with no views are clean, comfortable, and quality.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont is located at the intersection of the cable car lines and was also a very convenient walk to most of the city. The room was a little on the small side but it was very clean and we had a nice view. The lobby is absolutely fabulous and the Tonga Room (it rains inside) was a very fun experience!

I would definitely recommend the Fairmont to other travelers due to the location and the services available at the hotel. Valet parking was very convenient and the staff was very helpful in providing directions around the city.

review.title: Lives up to its reputation
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at the Fairmont atop Nob Hill in San Francisco, and we couldn't have chosen more wisely! The convenience of the location cannot be topped, the staff was friendly yet professional, valet service was excellent- our car was brought around at any time of day and in merely 5 minutes-yet so much was within walking distance and we felt perfectly safe in doing so. The beds and room fixtures were luxurious, comfortable, and everything in top condition and in working order. We ate once at the Tonga Lounge and once in the Laurel Room, not expecting anything from "hotel food", but pleasantly surprised at the outstanding quality of the food and service. The waitstaff was so pleasant, it seemed like we were old friends by the end of the evening. The best calimari any of the 4 of us had ever had! All the cablecar lines meet down in the basement/garage level of the Fairmont, and a wonderful coffee shop there as well. It's no wonder that just 2 weeks after our stay we heard that's where President Obama stayed when he came to SF! Highly recommended.

review.title: Can't wait to go back...
review.reviewText: The Fairmont Hotel was more than I expected it to be.All their employees were eager to please and serve. Our hotel room had a magnificent view, it was clean and the beds were heavenly comfortable..It's a hotel with a lot of history. We took time to roam around the hotel. In one of the halls they have photos of a terrible earthquake and of the old TV series, Hotel, that was filmed at the Fairmont....The only thing that needs improvement is the noise insulation. On one occassion, the next door tv was so loud that we had to call the concierge to let him know. I don't know if they gave them another bedroom, but the situation was resolved within minutes. I am looking forward to go back to the Fairmont.

review.title: Fairmont is great
review.reviewText:
Nothing but favorable things to say. Really great hotel, perfect location, great concierge.

Can't wait to go back.

review.title: The BEST place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Upon check in we were upgraded to a complimentary suite which was to die for. The concierge was extremely helpful with everything from recommendations, directions, and reservations. The housekeeping staff was so friendly and did an amazing job. They even slipped a weather report under the door every evening for the following day. The Fairmont sits atop Nob Hill and we walked the entire city. Granted the hills are steep but we absolutely loved every second of it! I would stay there again in a heartbeat. We got a fabulous deal through Expedia and will definitely use them again.

review.title: A Classic Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Fairmont is a wonderful hotel, full of history and tradition. A slight disappointment was the tone or friendliness of the majority of the hotel staff. They need to brighten their dispositions a little to make the hotel experience warmer and more inviting (the exception was the very good waiting staffing the Laurel Court Bar).

Overall though, the stay was wonderful; it was an easy (slightly hilly!) walk to most of the attractions and the cable cars were always available to save weary legs if needed.

The Fairmont is definitely a great hotel for people interested in soaking up a bit of history and tradition around Nob Hill.

review.title: San Fran at its best
review.reviewText: The Fairmount is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. First class across the board. Gotta Love it.

review.title: Beautiful room and reasonably priced!
review.reviewText: Beautiful room and reasonably priced!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This is one of the most beautiful hotels we have stayed in. The locale is a little off the beaten path but the decor and staff make it worth it. My husband is a history buff so he particularly liked the hallway corridors which reflect photos and the history of the Fairmont. We would definitely stay at the Fairmont again.

review.title: great value from expedia
review.reviewText: when i checked in they upgraded my room and had me join the presidents club which is free and gives you free internet

review.title: Fantastic!
review.reviewText: I can't say enough about our stay at the Fairmont Hotel! We not only had a fabulous view, but the hotel itself is stunningly beautiful. It was a very romantic getaway with the hubs!!!!

review.title: Touch of history and style
review.reviewText: Hotel is a treat. Old time charisma and large room(s). Service very good.

review.title: The finest SF has to offer!
review.reviewText: I always have a fantastic experience at the Fairmont and this last stay was no exception! Originally I was able to book only a single queen room and at check in was able to upgrade to a room with two queen beds and a phenomenal view of the entire bay at no extra charge! The rooms are always spotless and beautifully maintained and the hotel staff is always friendly and courteous. Whenver I am in San Francisco I stay at the Fairmont. It really is my home away from home!

review.title: Excellent choice when staying in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Great staff, nice amenities, and a great location. We stayed in a Tower room which was well appointed, very up to date, and had an exceptional views of the Bay and the City!!

review.title: A San Francisco classic
review.reviewText: Beautiful spacious lobby. Friendly service by all staff. Parking very expensive $50 per day but typical of this city.

review.title: Love the Cable Cars!
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean, very quiet, great service and the breathtaking views. Easy access to good running routes.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: I would say the architecture and History of the hotel is amazing service not on that category ,thou we had a very nice waiter at the restaurant ,and some of the concierge are nice and helpful . I think the rooms, we have the main building needs to be fix up the bathroom windows paints are peeling and some cracks ..Its not worth the money you have to pay .There are more lower star rating hotel out there that would surpass fairmont

review.title: Great views
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and perfect location.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Our room was quite large, very clean, comfortable and bright. There was no tea/coffee service in the room as I would have liked but this was really not a concern. The health club was clean and well maintained as well (though the steam room was not working while we were there the sauna was) No pool but that made no difference either. We each had an ipod touch with us and the WiFi worked perfectly. The Caffe Cento in the hotel was excellent and very popular for breakfast (serving Illy's coffee. The only disappoint was it closed at 6pm and there was not another coffee place right near the hotel, The location was perfect one could walk to Union Square in about 20-25 minutes. Fisherman's Wharf was a 40-45 minute walk depending on how often one stopped along the way! Desk personal arranged for the shuttle to stop at the hotel and take us to the airport. We were very happy with our stay at the Fairmont San Francisco.

review.title: Wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was a lovely hotel, making sure to cover every detail. The sheets are the beds were heavenly making me want to purchase some for my home bed. The staff was there to answer any question a guest had and I sure wish I had one of the almond croissants from the coffee shop right now.

review.title: Enjoyed it
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco, and a Fairmont Hotel. Great location on top of Nob hill, easy access to Trams, and not too far to walk to Union Sq or Ferry Building. Couldn't really fault the hotel in any way, but it didn't "wow" me. Room could have been cleaner but a minor point. Check in was excellent though, young guy called James , took time to introduce us to the hotel services and a quick guide to the city.

review.title: Awesome upgrade
review.reviewText: Got upgraded to the 'Malaya Suite" on an expedia price that is almost to embarrassing to mention. Awesom

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Expedia got me a 50% discount at the Fairmont, which is a top-of-the-line hotel on Nob Hill, a block from my appointments. I was delighted with the hotel, the concierge service, and the breakfast. The history of the hotel (shown in multiple pictures on the walls) is fascinating and almost worth the price by itself. Thanks, Expedia!

review.title: Fabulous!
review.reviewText: We were thrilled with our hotel. It was a huge treat to be in such a fabulous San Francisco landmark. The location was perfect and right on the street car line, so it was easy to get around town. I watched the fares on Expedia and when a special came up for this hotel we grabbed it! It was everything we expected and more!!!

review.title: San Fran's Best!
review.reviewText:
Awesome!!! At check in they upgraded us to a room with a Bay view b/c we were staying such a long time; this extra hospitality made the stay WONDERFUL!! Very helpful..very friendly!!! Beautiful Hotel...wonderful serve :) Highly recommended ! :-)

5 out of 5 STARS IN MY BOOK!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, the staff should be better!
review.reviewText: Well let me say this, the bell man was much friendlier than the check in and check out clerk. That was disappointing. I like to be greeted by a staff that is friendly and has a smile on their face. I would recommend the hotel, but will for warn friends not to expect good service from the staff. The room was clean and quite comfortable.

review.title: Fabulous Views
review.reviewText: Usually we like to stay on Union Square, which is much closer to shopping, restaurants and theaters. The only downside to the Fairmont is that their "view restaurant" was not open, and we would have really enjoyed that. The Tonga Room was as funky as ever with good food, and lively music. There was only one restaurant open, The Terrace, which is OK, but there was a wait even for breakfast. So, overall, rooms and service were good, restaurant selection was not so good.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to many of San Fran's major attractions, this hotel made enjoying the city easy!

review.title: San Fran's best
review.reviewText: This is one of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. We were treated well, the place was beautiful and comfortable, the food good. Great experience. We have stayed at several fine San Fran hotels; this was the best.

review.title: "San Francisco's best Hotel"
review.reviewText: The Fairmont experience is wonderful. What a beautiful Hotel. This place is fit for a King and also for an ordinary person like me.This Hotel is in a great and safe neighbor. Close to the Cable cars, shopping, dining and China town. The Tonga room was fun. We only went down for an appetizer and couldn't get ourselves to leave. Loved staying here. Would definitley come back.

review.title: Old World Charm
review.reviewText:
Charming and old-worldly. My room was in the old main bit (not the tower) which was large and comfortable, but no view and the decor was pretty awful -- don't know about the tower, but it surely affords nice views.

Prices of drinks, etc. in the hotel are exorbitant (more so than usual), which felt a bit of a con, but otherwise really good. RIght at the top of a hill, so be prepared to trudge home if you're walking from Union Sq (or anywhere else).

review.title: Beautiful Room in the Tower
review.reviewText: I stayed in the Tower which provided a great view, beds were comfortable and the bathrooms had large soaking tubs.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at theFairmont. Our only complaint would be the size of the bathroom and the lack of "shelf" space around the sink. There was no place to put any personnal products , except on the floor. I would stay ther again and hope the bathroom was more convenient.

review.title: Great Experience traveling with babies
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Fairmont. Staff was friendly and helpful. Requested cribs were waiting in our room. Room was a little on the small side, especially with two cribs set up, but we didn't spend much time there. There is a wonderful park with a children's playground a block away!

review.title: What happened to Fairmonts service standards?
review.reviewText: For staying at a Fairmont I was very surprised at the service issues I encountered across the board. When I arrived and checked into my room it wasnt cleaned from the last guest and was missing a robe. Every morning I called room service and every meal was missing things that were ordered. Every morning there were no newspapers at the door, I had to request them each day. When I ate at the resturant in the hotel the glasses on the tables were not cleaned. I have stayed at Fairmonts before and never encountered this many service issues.

review.title: First Class historic hotel on top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Great hotel on top of Nob Hill. Cable cars stop at hotel. Excellant location. A San Francisco hotel with history. Survived San Francisco earthquake. The original location of the TV series Hotel. A classic hotel.

review.title: Divine
review.reviewText: Loooved the Fairmont. My room on the 17th floor of the new tower was one of the most comfortable and well-designed rooms I've ever slept in.

review.title: Can't wait to return
review.reviewText: The hotel is a famous hotel for housing US Presidents it is beautiful and beautifully located at the top of Nob Hill. The Cable Cars are within a block distant. Many nice breakfast restaurants within walking distance. Parking is expensive but is the only drawback at $57.00 for staying overnight. I recomend fly in and take a shuttle.

review.title: Was expecting more from The Fairmont
review.reviewText:
It was a bit disappointing what I mentioned previously:
There was only one person at the reception and she was busy finishing something she was doing in the computer or terminal. I had to wait for 5 minutes - I wouldn't expect that from a hotel such as The Fairmont.
In a hotel like The Fairmont, I would expect the staff who took my suitcase to my room to also show me how to operate the heating, TV set, where the mini bar is. That didn't happen but he was happy to take my tip......

review.title: First Class throughout
review.reviewText: i used to stay exclusively at the Mark Hopkins across the street from the Fairmont when in San Francisco, but the last couple of times the service to guest ratio seemed down, the valet parking a disorganized mess etc, so i decided to give the Fairmont a try. I'll be doing the Fairmont going forward! Also the views from the premium tower rooms are to die for.

review.title: Love San Francisco but I will try a different hotel next time.
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful but we didn't realize that there is an old section and a newer tower. I booked thru Expedia and was not given a choice so upon arrival We were shown to our room in the old section of the hotel which was fine, the room was nice but it was raining fairly hard outside and out room was on the top floor. We unpacked, went out to grab a bite to eat and upon our return all of our clothes were placed on a cart and a note was attached to contact the manager. Turned out we had 4 different water leaks in the room. They moved us to the new tower ( which they considered an upgrade even though the room was smaller but at least water wasn't leaking on our clothes) and we didn't have anymore problems. The staff was nice, food is extremely expensive ($8.00 for a glass of milk) and the rooms are just very average. Location is excellent as you can easily get anywhere in town from the hotel. Workout gym is decent but early mor Inge it is crowded with locals so it's best to wait until 10ish to use the treadmills and machines. We'll try a different hotel next time in the same area. The room was never really cleaned that well as we found 2 pair of socks (not ours) andunderwear (again, not ours) under the bed when we checked out.

review.title: amazing start to our honeymoon
review.reviewText: everything about the hotel was amazing. parking was pretty expensive, but thats expected in the city, the room service was quick and delicious, the view was perfect, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean.

review.title: A San Francisco landmark.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. HIghly recommend the Fairmont.

review.title: "Very impressed"
review.reviewText: A beautiful hotel with a great view of San Francisco. The hotel staff were amazing.

review.title: Gorgeous Hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great service, spacious rooms...sits at the top of the hill with a view of the water (when standing in the street, in front of the hotel). Definitely worth the money!

review.title: Old World Elegance
review.reviewText: For a wonderful price we spent the night in this historic place. The rennovation has brought the place back to its glory days. Take time to view the historical photos lining the halls.

review.title: Famous Fairmont of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed my overnight stay at the Fairmont. Everything was fantastic. The sheets and comforter alone were fabulous and luxurious. The Laurel restaurant had excellent food and wine pairings.
The one thing that was odd was the bar closed at 11pm. After coming back to the hotel after our show we wanted to sit down and have a cocktail. To our surprise the bar was closing up, but we squeaked by and we were able to order some wine. :)

I would definitely stay at the Fairmont again.

review.title: a great choice
review.reviewText:
Always nice to stay at a Fairmont. Our room was comfortable and clean, and we had a great view of the hotel garden and the skyline of San Francisco. There is no coffee maker in the room but that is not a problem because each morning there is a complimentary coffee and tea service cart in the lobby of the hotel.

We had a short walk to cable cars so found that the best way to get around. The area is lovely and very safe.

we didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel but had room service one evening, and it was great.

review.title: Fabulous Experience
review.reviewText: Spent four wonderful days at the Fairmont and can't wait to go back.

review.title: just ok
review.reviewText: I travel quite a bit and like to stay in 5 star hotels quite a bit. I liked the hotel overall because I know most of the rooms aren't this way, but my rooms air conditioner was extremely loud and my room was extremely hot. And this was in the winter. I couldn't sleep one night. The bed was Ok, but I had just stayed at the Hard Rock in San Diego and the Gansvoort in Miami. Both of those beds were much more comfortable, which is very important to me.

review.title: Very Fancy
review.reviewText: Got the rooms for my grow-up kids. They loved the hotel.

review.title: Best in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Went for my 50th birthday, given a room on 18th floor in Tower building, with a million dollar view of the bay. Hotel is spectacular, service is top notch. Wish there was a better place for a quick ,light breakfast. the Cafe Cento was not that great.
Would definitely recommend it if traveling to San Francisco, perfectly located.

review.title: Grand but tired
review.reviewText: Spent three nights in November in the Buckingham Suite in the main building. Nice, but pretty tired and old feeling. It also didn't feel clean...nothing obvious but just getting old. Staff were good, but if you like being near shopping, restaurants and other attractions, it is a bit out of the way being on Nob Hill. Had very high expectations but this grand old lady is in need of a major upgrade and cleaning.

review.title: Not worht for the money
review.reviewText: We stayed for a concert in downtown. Valet parking took 20 minutes to get my car. Receptionist was just average friendly at the check-in. It depends on what you expect from top class hotel but my overall impression is the hotel is highly priced against their standard service.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: This was a beautiful place to stay! My only comment would be to check on the price of the valet parking garage before you leave your car, you might be able to find a less expensive place to park.

review.title: wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: very nice hotel - not modern, but good location and great rooms

review.title: A great experience for our first time in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We were totally impressed with our experience at the Fairmont in San Fran. The staff were so professional and helpful beyond expectation. This hotel exudes luxury from the minute you walk in the door. Our room was very spacious, sparkling clean, and comfortable with inviting decor. The only negative was that our room was very hot (a corner room with large windows on each side) and the air conditioning didn't cool the temperature enough for our liking. All in all, we loved our visit and would not hesitate to stay at the Fairmont again. Thank you for making our stay a memorable one!

review.title: A SF Classic
review.reviewText: Georgeous old SF charm. Updated, rooms, high ceiling, wonderful lobby. Top of Nob Hill, steep hills, good exercise.

review.title: We'll be back
review.reviewText: You can"t go wrong here. Great hotel and location!!!

review.title: San Francisco is The Fairmont
review.reviewText: If you want to experience San Francisco with all its charm and beauty, you can't go past The Fairmont....from its history, grand architecture, prime location and breathtaking bay views. Try the Tower Signature Room - you won't be disappointed

review.title: Will only stay here on my return to San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is 5 star from the bellmen to the housekeepers. Our room was available when we checked in @ 12:30pm and house limo was available at no charge in place of taxis any time after 6:00pm. The conceierge was most helpful in local recomedations as well as out of the area suggestions. There are other places in the hotel area for breakfast instead of the pricy restaurant in the hotel. I am looking forward to my next visit at the Fairmont.

review.title: Would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.
review.reviewText:
My wife and I were extremely pleased with the hotel.The cable car stop was right outside the hotel. Pay a little extra and get a room with a view. We had a beautiful view of the bay. The rooms in the main building are not well insulated so there can be some noise from the next room. It happened once. We called the desk and the noise stopped within 5 minutes. The employees of the hotel were very helpful in arranging tours and answering questions. The lobby is gorgeous. There is complementary coffee and tea every morning.
We recommend this hotel highly.

review.title: welcome free upgrade
review.reviewText: The hotel is beuatiful, well maintained. The staff were lovely and offered a free upgrade to the tower room. Very spacious and beautiful bathroom. Would def go back. on top of a hill so a bit of a trek getting back but a little alcohol numbs the pain

review.title: SanFrancisco's finest
review.reviewText: It was wonderful to be in an old hotel in tiptop condition. We appreciated all the marble. It looked sparkling and grand.

review.title: ILOCP#1
review.reviewText:
ILOCP stands for In Lieu Of Christmas Presents a new family tradition whereby my wife and I take one of our 3 married children and their spouse on an extravagant all expenses paid vacation instead of lavishing them with Christmas presents.

San Francisco was our first annual event and having stayed at the Fairmount on Maui and receiving amazing personal service the Fairmount on Nob Hill was an immediate choice for us. Sadly our timing was not good as the Fairmount was host to the Presidents Cup Golf Tournament during our stay and we pretty much got lost in the celebrity shuffle.

Beautiful hotel, rooms with a fabulous view (upcharge) and great location but I seriously doubt I will stay at the Fairmount in San Francisco again; I may not be a celebrity but at Fairmount prices I expected to be feel like one during my stay there. I was just a tourist and that is how I was regarded by the entire staff. Maybe I will go back when I'm famous............nah!

review.title: Fairmont San francisco - 5 star not..
review.reviewText: Went to the airport about 7.00 pm to catch an earlier flight that night. The room was already bought and paid for, told staff that if we did not get on flight we would be back at 11.30pm abouts. Left a bottle in the room just in case. Arrived back to find room had been cleaned? bottle gone as if we were gone? The room manager tried to tell us that this was normal as a turn-down service? Funny we did get turn-down on the previous 2 nights??? Not impressed. Seems like opening/holding front entry hotel doors for you while you carry your cases in is a bit of an ask as well??

review.title: Classic Experience
review.reviewText: Comfortable mattress, great flat screen TV, and service whenever you asked for it.

review.title: Fantastic experience
review.reviewText: Could not have been better even though the weather was terrible (biggest rainfall in many years one day). The reservation was handled promptly and professionally and the hotel was exceptional in all respects. We will definitely be back.

review.title: Tops in Nob Hill!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel and the location was perfect for us. We wer eonly a block away from our friend's apartment and cute restaurants nearby. Not far from Union Square...walking distance so shopping is nearby!

review.title: Fair stay at The Fairmont
review.reviewText: This hotel was lovely if you're into historic places. However, our toilet was clogged the entire stay even though the staff tried to fix it. They were nice enough to comp our room service for the inconvenience. Great location; convenient to restaurants, sights, etc.

review.title: Very elegant and upscale
review.reviewText: Beautiful location, very glamorous lobby, beautiful room, comfortable bed, elegant linens. The hotel has a fun, retro bar and restaurant called the Tonga Room, in a 60s Polynesian style with periodic "rainstorms" and a band that floats into a pool in the middle of the restaurant. This restaurant is surprisingly reasonable, whereas the restaurant in their lobby is quite pricey, although that is to be expected in a hotel of this caliber.

review.title: Marvelous hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed in tower room. Was recently refurbished and was delightful.

review.title: Very luxurious hotel with nice amenities. The spa was great. Wonderful atmosphere.
review.reviewText: Best hotel I've stayed in San Francisco so far. Very luxurious and great amenities.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: From our arrival to our departure the staff at this hotel couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Ideally located for the cable cars(4 directions!) so we walked downhill and (mostly) used them back up.Room was good with all the facilities necessary.(Coffee-maker might have been a good addition but there is an excellent coffee bar attached on Parking level.)

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: This was our second visit in just under 6 months. First visit was wonderful, this latest visit was even better! We were celebrating an anniversary and desk staff upgraded us from the main building to an 11th floor tower room overlooking the financial district. Very comfy king bed, separate shower with great water pressure including instant hot water. We really like the central location, easy to walk down hill to the different areas, then an easy cable car ride back up. This will always be our first choice on return visits.

review.title: the best stay yet in San Francisco
review.reviewText: staff was most accomodating and very friendly, beautiful lounge

review.title: Great getaway weekend
review.reviewText: Very nice room, good view, vry comfortable bed, flat panel TV--it's all good.

review.title: Grand Hotel !
review.reviewText: Great hotel for people who like exclusive treatment. Staff are generally very helpful, and profesional. Would love to stay there again next time.

review.title: Perfect hideaway on top of the hill
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel in a great location. If you find an affordable deal, book it. One drawback: the gym, although located in the hotel building, is independent of the hotel and subject to a surcharge.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We had a problem with our room,We were moved and given a better room at no extra cost. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We will stay there again in the future.

review.title: The best San Francisco has to offer!
review.reviewText: My wife and I really enjoyed the Fairmont. Service was excellent and the hotel offered the quality and distinction we were looking for.

review.title: Good Stay
