review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and has a beauitful view. The rest of the hotel was average. The service was helpful if asked but seemed understaffed at times. Due to it's great location and comfortable bed I would stay their again.

review.title: Enjoyable
review.reviewText: First time traveler to San Francisco and my first time staying at a Fairmont hotel. The hotel room was a good size with a partial view of San Francisco from atop Nob Hill. The only complaint I have is that the faucet in the bathtub dripped. Call me cheap but I didn't dare drink the $8.00 bottle of Evian nor did I order room service so I can't comment on the quality of the food. The location of the hotel is very good but be prepared to climb some of San Francisco's steepest hills when walking to and from the hotel. Overall, I would to recommend this hotel to other travelers.

review.title: Classic Comfort
review.reviewText: Great classic hotel with top location on Nob Hill, on California St. cable car line and a block from the Powell St. line. Got a wonderful deal through Expedia with upgrade to king-size bed and outside view. Walk-in closet was bigger than our room earlier this year in London! Also liked openable windows, fabulous lobby/bar and very helpful staff. Only complaint, first night they had us in a 1st floor room above the marquee with no view, but were only too happy to move us for the rest of our stay.

review.title: Parking Expense
review.reviewText: The charge for parking our rental car cost more than the rental car! I think the hotel should reveal the cost of parking up front, but then they wouldn't have many guests stay there.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Fairmont San Francisco is a beautiful hotel and the room was awesome. However, it appears that the cleaning staff is not properly trained to clean the rooms: daily cleaning was limited to changing the towels and replacing the toiletries. The floors were never vacuumed, the dust was everywhere and our bathroom sink was never cleaned for all 4 days during our stay. This is such a shame considering that you pay extra to be in a 4 start hotel suite!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice, Elegance hotel on top of the hill. Eventhough it isn't located next to any tourist hot spots but walkable to a few like Chinatown, Union Square,...

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont provided wonderful accommodations and service.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, extras very pricey
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a long weekend with my children and husband. The location is incredible--kitty corner to the California line cable car. The hotel is beautiful and is very well maintained and the staff are great. Our room was large and airy and the bed very comfortable. The only reason I give it a 4 instead of a 5 is that all of the extras were soooo overpriced, even for a high end hotel. One night we ordered two bowls of icecream for the kids and 2 bowls of soup and I think the room service charge was $69. Breakfast was also very expensive but we found a couple of cute places for breakfast about a 10-minute walk from the hotel. Definitely stay there, just don't order room service!

review.title: Gorgeous Hotel - Dinner and Band in the Tonga Room very enjoyable
review.reviewText: There were 2 moments that spoiled my stay. Early in the afternoon there was a knock on my door. I yelled out öne moment please', but was obviously not heard. I'd just managed to put my dressing gown on, when a man opened the door, apologised and said he was checking for breakfast trollies. I had not ordered any room service and feel he should have at least checked to see if I had. Secondly, I had men working outside my bathroom window late one morning for over half an hour which delayed me from having a shower. I did not feel comfortable knowing that the window could not be locked. I suggest the Hotel should have informed me that they had organised work to be carried out on the window ledge.

review.title: Stay at the Fairmont San Fran!
review.reviewText: What a great experience! Everyone was so friendly. The hotel is gorgeous and the location could not be better!

review.title: beautiful old hotel. would stay there again.
review.reviewText: We were pleased to be upgraded to a suite!

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: Our driver always comments about our fondness for this hotel. We've "strayed" once or twice, but now we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. The staff is exceptional, the rooms have a spacious, old world style to them and you couldn't ask for a more centralized location. While in SF, this will always be our 'home away from home.'

review.title: the fairmont experience!!!
review.reviewText: beautiful property but watch out for the extra charges - only hotel in 11 day california trip that did not offer at least complimentary coffee/tea (location to purchase is in the sub basement and a city block away) - only hotel in 11 days that did not have in room wireless internet (only in lobby) - only hotel in 11 days that did not have a pool as they coverted it into a restaurant bar (record high 96 degrees one of the days we were there) - and don't get me started on parking ($57 dollars a day)

review.title: Very nice in many ways.
review.reviewText: I have two different reviews. The first night we stayed, the room was incomplete (blankets and robes missing) and not fixed when we requested it. The second night, they upgraded us to a nicer room and all amenities were present--a different experience. Still, we got a good rate and the hotel is pretty. I would recommend it.

review.title: weddings
review.reviewText: There were 3 weddings going on while we stayed there and if the receptionist had not told us that, we would have never known. Service was great.

review.title: Peak of San Francisco in many ways
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful six night stay at the Fairmont. Location, atop Nob Hill, might make it challenging for the less fit, but then again, hills are what make San Francisco a unique city. The gym is very well equiped and having access to the fitness classes (pilates, yoga and spinning)was a bonus. All staff were very courteous, friendly and genuinely pleased to offer any assistance they could to make your stay perfect. Loved wandering the main floor halways absorbing the picorials of the history of the hotel. Made for one very pleasant evening!

review.title: Wish I had more time to spend there!
review.reviewText: This is a very impressive hotel, to say the least. I found it very interesting to be in the hotel that the television series "Hotel" used. Also walking back to the garage and coffee shop, there were other articles and memorabilia about different movies the hotel had been used for. It would have been fun to spend the time to get a tour or something. Next time I'm in SF, I'm going to have to spend an extra day after my business is taken care of.

review.title: Best choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very elegant and charming. Positioned on the top of Nob Hill with an amazing view of the bay. The cable car stop next to the hotel. Historical Lobby The parking is quite expensive, but you can save money near there.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This hotel looks great inside and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It's walking distance from chinatown and union square. I actually walked downtown from the hotel.

review.title: Great Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Nicely updated rooms, friendly staff. Love the grandeur. Cable cars going to Fisherman's Wharf hard to get on during the day. Go early in the morning.

review.title: A wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was a beautiful hotel and the rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable. The dining room was very pleasant and my son and I had breakfast there one morning. The quality of the food and the service was excellent. My only complaints were the high cost of parking a vehicle at the hotel, the fact that internet service was extra and the hotel had an association with a fitness club located in the hotel that was also an add-on. That brought the cost of the three night stay up somewhat. I understand the high cost of parking in San Francisco, but the internet service is certainly something that I expected to be complimentary. It was almost like an "a la cart" meal, everything was an add-on. Other than that, it was an absolutely wonderful experience in one of the nicest locations in San Farncisco and within easy walking distance to a lot of attractions and shopping.

review.title: One of the best... mind parking cost.
review.reviewText: Great overall... the only downside is parking costs almost 50 dollars per day! They should tell you before hand!

review.title: Totally impressed
review.reviewText: "San Francisco's best Hotel" stayed here a number of times.

review.title: well worth it
review.reviewText: excellent experience. luxury hotel, superb service except at hotel restaurant, helpful and cheerful staff. concierges were a veritable fount of inside information. turned us on to great off-the-track restaurants. nice location, but high on the hill. it's tough walking back after going down into the city. but that's why there are cabs and busses. highly recommended.

review.title: Exceeds all expectations
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is spectacular. You must stay in the main building to get the full glamorous effect. It's a true experience in gorgeous decadence and ultimate comfort.

review.title: Great place to stay if looking for a little history!
review.reviewText: Everything from the customer service to the state of the rooms and even to the toiletries in the room were fabulous! While booking the trip we were looking for reviews on the historical building (vs. the new towers), but couldn't find any. We took a chance and took a chance on the lower rate of the historical building - we didn't regret it! While we don't know what the new tower rooms are like, our room in the historical building was beautiful and luxurious! Just a note: because the hotel was built so long ago, the acoustics travel and echo a little more than in a modern building, but it wasn't a problem at all. Also, the hotel is at the top of a steep hill, so make sure you have good walking shoes!

review.title: Decent and affordable
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel due to great price available on Expedia. Pros: Sign up for the Fairmont President's Club in advanc - you get free access to the gym and free wi-fi access in-room. Everyone was very friendly. Con: I stayed in the older part of the hotel and other reviewers are right that there is very little sound-proofing for noise in the hallway. I could easily hear anyone talking in the hallway or doors/elevators opening and closing. This didn't bother me because I was prepared for it, but it's worth mentioning.

review.title: Historic Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at a hotel that has been a part of the history of the city. The lobby is spectacular. The location, atop Nob Hill, is hard to beat. Easy walking to Chinatown and the waterfront. Walking back up Nob Hill provides great opportunity for exercise. Take the cable car if walking up hill bothers you. I would definitely come back to the stately old Fairmont.

review.title: Wonderful hotel would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: We visited San Franscisco for my birthday to catch up with some friends who were also travelling from Australia for a holiday. The hotel was one of the "grand old ladies" and we stayed in the Tower. The beds are very important when we travel and we were not disappointed here. Our friends stayed at another hotel in Union square and they paid the same sort of money as us but had no view, small room, no bath. Our room was wonderful. We have recommended it to several friends who are going next month. The Polynesian restaurant has great food and a good night too.

review.title: Elegant at the same time
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont on Nob Hill - Our heritage room was spacious with high ceilings. We slept unbelievably well on the down pillows and comforters - The sheets were so amazing we bought a set to take home with us! The concierge always gave us excellent tips and the service was superb. There are also a lot of wonderfully chic yet reasonably-priced restaurants in the area. You don't need to venture far from the hotel after a day of touring to have a great meal at the end of your day. We would absolutely recommend The Fairmont!

review.title: Grand Old Hotel
review.reviewText: Outstanding facilities and services in a hotel that is a landmark on Nob Hill.

review.title: Disappointed in Housekeeping
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely; the room was charming; and all the amenities we in place. We were disappointed in that Housekeeping did not clean/straighten our room in a timely manner. We left the room before 9:00 a.m. and did return and did not return until 3:30 p.m. The offered to clean it at that time, but after our day of site seeing we were too tired to leave the room.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful. The room was extremely spacious. We had 4 people staying in a room with 2 queen beds and there was more than enough room for us to move around without bumping into each other. I can't wait to stay there again.

review.title: Lovely hotel on the top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: I stayed at The Fairmont San Francisco for a short break in July 2009. The hotel is lovely and well located on the top of Nob Hill. Easy walk down to the Pier 39 and the bay. The lobby of the hotel has been beautifully restored to its original design with an abundance of marble while the rooms are comfortable. Hotel Staff was very helpful.

review.title: Pure Luxury, Fantastic Location and Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: Perfect Location right on Nob Hill, opulent surroundings with impeccable service and attention to detail. Don't miss out on the Tonga Room for a kitschy evening (book to avoid disappointment!)

review.title: Old world Charm
review.reviewText: A wonderful hotel with old world style and charm.

review.title: Bring Some Earplugs
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel is great. Unfortunately, the rooms are not. Sound insulation between rooms on the third floor was so poor that you could hear everything and anything going on in your neighbor's room on either side. They didn't necessarily have to be loud. Further the rooms themselves, while large, are on the faded and moldy side. Sure the lobby is impressive and the staff treats you very well but it just doesn't measure up to other luxury hotels.

review.title: Total Luxury
review.reviewText: This is an amazing hotel with a very Grand history. The location is away from the busy Union Square however a short cab ride to anywhere in San Fransisco. This hotel should be rated over 5 Star but due to the fact there is no swimming pool it is rated only 4 star. The service was incredible. Patricia

review.title: White House of the West
review.reviewText: The hotel claims to the be "White House of the West" (due to the fact that many American and Foreign dignitaries have stayed at the Fairmont SF). The lobby is beautiful with an abundance of Marble while the rooms are decent. Its location is great (nob hill). Hotel Staff was very accommodating.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, only issue was with doors being slammed on our floor. Also the hinges on the doors on our floor needed some oil. Clean room and excellent service.

review.title: Some construction created some inconvenience
review.reviewText: The Fairmont has some renovation going on right now. The elevators from the parking garage level to the lobby had only 1 operating shaft, which created some excessive waiting. Great historic hotel, will be better when the renovation has been completed.

review.title: A Big Disappointment
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Fairmont YEARS ago and I was completely disappointed. They try to make this a "grand" looking hotel but it was so poorly run and is in DESPERATE need of a full renovation. It felt very cheap inside. There was only ONE elevator working for the entire hotel both nights we were there and I have a feeling this is a lengthy project. Therefore, there were times we would have to wait over 10 minutes for the elevator which is ridiculous. The room was large although it felt empty. The closet was a walk in closet which is nice but again felt quite empty. The shower was appalling as the shower head was somewhat broken and had very little water pressure. Housekeeping came to do turndown service and left our wet towels on a chair and did not replace them with fresh towels. I shall never stay there again.

review.title: Stunning architecture in fabulous location
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco has wonderful interior and exterior features. The lobby and entire first floor are stunning; the rooms are attractive and well appointed. For me, the chief advantages are the location and the athletic facilities. This hotel is situated at the top of Nob Hill, 5 blocks from Union Square. Although some may prefer to be closer to the hustle and bustle of Union Square, I prefer this oasis in the middle of the city. With the views from Nob Hill, it is easy to believe that you are at the center of everything. All in all, one of my favorite hotels. (Regarding the athletic facilities, for better or worse guests must be 18 years old to use them.)

review.title: I'd go back in a minute
review.reviewText: The Fairmont lived up to my expectations.

review.title: Fairmont Hotel Knob Hill
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice and has a great cafe downstairs that is very affordable. The coffee and pasties are baked every morning and was always a treat during our stay. I recommend if you are in a hurry or don't want to go thru the formalities of a formal dining experience that could end up costing you over $50 dollars per person/per day just for breakfast. I was dissapointed with their customer service when asking them for directions to certain site seeing places (they were very rude and seemed very eager to hurry up and get to the next person in line). Overall this is a great hotel but does need improvement on their customer service. The AC also needs to be fixed in the rooms (barely running and not that cool). Tip: take the bus that stops around the corner from the hotel instead of taking the trolley into town (trolley cost $5 and bus only cost 1.25). Or you can walk up and down the very steep hill and pay nothing.

review.title: Fairmont knows how to do it!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont knows how to do it with class. The hotel was elegant and had a beautiful lobby. Service was excellent and the staff was friendly. I like that it was quiet and I was able to sleep. Although, it is a few blocks up from Union Square so if you don't like walking uphill, this is not the place you want to stay at. All in all, my husband and I were very happy with the hotel and we would stay there again anytime.

review.title: friendly and accommodating staff
review.reviewText: The staff at the Fairmont is very friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed our stay there very much, the only downside was the Tonga Room, seemed out of its element in this hotel, it seemed more like a cruise ship themed room. I excepted a more trendy lounge. Also food wasn't very appetizing and not worth value.

review.title: Beautiful but, a headache!
review.reviewText: We had bought the package deal months in advance. When we got to hotel, they did not have our room ready, even though we had checked in at the proper time. We waited over 30 minutes for a room, they kept saying they had. We had our son with us, and that is forever in a kids mind. However, once they got us a room, we were compensated with a great room. The bottom line: when you buy the package deals, and the room is not ready when you get there, that is just wrong no matter what kind of room they give you in return, especially for this kind of hotel.

review.title: Love staying at this icon
review.reviewText: This historic hotel offers lots of glam. It's location on Nob Hill at the only cable car crossroads makes it convenient to Chinatown, Union Square, Market Street and the wharf. With the muni pass, you can also use the cabled busses to get you around.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in a great location. The service was very good too.

review.title: Grand Dame hotel
review.reviewText: Great room with balcony overlooking "The City". The service was outstanding. A classic 5 star hotel.

review.title: Top notch hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Incredibly smart hotel but with very relaxed vibe in excellent location. Balcony suites offer great views down to the bay.Stay away from the minibar - prices are breathtaking

review.title: A Classic
review.reviewText: Still a classic. Was better being at top of hill and away from Union Square. Doesn't really have view rooms and the interior queen roooms are small and fairly dark. Go for exterior king rooms.

review.title: Always exceptional
review.reviewText: The service and the facilities cannot be beat -- Fairmont is the way to go. Ain't cheap.

review.title: A San Francisco treat!
review.reviewText: We went to SF for our ten year wedding anniversary and stayed at this beautiful hotel. The room was gorgeous, views amazing and staff very friendly and helpful. Everything we asked of the concierge was done quickly and with a smile. We can't wait to go back!

review.title: Nice Views
review.reviewText: We had a tower suite. It was GREAT to see the city day and night from such a great viewpoint. We loved our room, clean etc. BUT, kind of like grandma furniture in the living room. For such $$ prices I expected some chocolates, etc in the room or even a free bottled water. Nada. Also - please note TINY bathtub not made for 2. NO SWIMMING POOL AT THIS HOTEL. Bed was super cozy.

review.title: The Fairmont San Francisco - history, elegance, and a view!
review.reviewText: We spent one night in the Fairmont in June, 2009. All personnel encountered were friendly, welcoming, and helpful. The room was beautiful, very clean, and most comfortable. Incredible view of the bay, the bridge, and Alcatraz. Enjoyed the Tonga Room bar! And, a great deal on the rate through Expedia!

review.title: Great Classic Hotel
review.reviewText: I got a fantastic price on my stay and that certainly plays into my appreciation of the hotel. The bed was a little soft and the towels were a little rough, but a grand old hotel.

review.title: Amazing Hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I went the The Fairmont for our 1 year anniversary and we loved it! It may be a bit pricey, but the service, the rooms and amenities are well worth it! Great neighborhood and pretty centralized to many of the major things to do!

review.title: Very Glad we Chose the Fairmont ~ Will be back!!!
review.reviewText: By far this was the best hotel we stayed at on our month long trip. We were so glad that we chose the Fairmont and will be back again soon! The room was very comfortable,clean, and had a huge walk in closet for a hotel. The front desk, door and concierge staff were the best and were always glad to answer our questions. Extremely friendly actually :) Our only complaint was that on our last day there, the maids on our floor were letting the doors slam shut as they entered and exited the rooms that they were cleaning. We counted more than 200+ door slams in a period of 2 hours (from 8am-10am) It was very annoying as we were hoping to sleep in after a late night out. We mentioned this to the front desk and were told that the maids had already been warned not to do this and it would be reported to the head of housekeeping again. However, we would still return as the room and location can not be beat! Overall a pleasant stay with the exception of the last few hours.

review.title: Absolutely magnificent!
review.reviewText: Words cannot describe how wonderful and luxurious the Fairmont hotel is!! It has a magnificent grand lobby and piano bar that you feel like royalty just being there!! The guy at the hotel desk was so friendly and helpful - he upgraded us for free to a Tower Room with a spectacular view of the city skyline. The room was spacious and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The Hotel is in a great location with two cable cars going past. But the hills of Nob Hill are unbelievably steep so you'll definitely get a workout if you're walking!

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: Got a fantastic deal on a beautiful balcony suite. The room was beautiful even if it was in the older part of the hotel. It was also huge. The service went above and beyond. They let me check in at 11:30. The Bar staff made us feel right at home. The concierge was quite helpful. All in all a very nice stay and would return again.

review.title: So impressed
review.reviewText: The history about the Hotel, it's marvelous. The hall it's so nice and attention it's perfect. The rooms are so comfortable.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, but bring a full wallet
review.reviewText: Being accustomed to mostly 2 to 3 star hotels, we were blown away my the Fairmont's majestic lobby. The front desk employee was extremely helpful and more than happy to take on tasks normally associated with a consierge. We stayed in a king on the 5th floor overlooking Nob Hill and the room was absolutely huge. The bathroom was small, but the enormous walk-in closet was larger than some hotel rooms! The down side: the walls are very thin, as we could hear the conversation of the twenty-somethings next door late into the night. Also, everything that pertains to food is EXTREMELY expensive. To get an idea, think about how much you would normally pay for something and then double it. All in all, it was an experience that we are glad we had and we would definitely recommend it to everyone. However, there are so many places to stay in the city that we will try many other places before we return to the Fairmont. Plus the deal we got from Expedia was so good, I don't know if we will be able to afford it again!

review.title: The Grand Dame of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is beyond elegant and luxurious. The rooms are spacious. My one negative is that the bathrooms need to be updated. The bed was comfortable. The location cannot be beat if you want to be central. The California cable car line is out one door and the Powell line is out the other door. We found that taxi's to virtually anywhere in the city ran on the average $5 from our location. We would stay again.

review.title: the best
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fairmont for just one night! it was the start of a 4 night holiday in San Francisco. it was terrific the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. we slept well and enjoyed our in house breakfast. thank you

review.title: Lovely historic hotel.
review.reviewText: We would stay there again. Great price thru Expedia.

review.title: WILL BE BACK
review.reviewText: Great Hotel...centrally located , ...with a view of the Bay...12 th floor or up!...reserve a tower room...Great place to stay .

review.title: Lots of history too
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed. Classic, well-maintained and convenient plus some spectacular views from the top.

review.title: Great hotel but...
review.reviewText: Food and drinks were ridiculously expensive!! Beds were super comfy and everyone was very cordial and nice. A little far from all of the attractions but right on the cable car line. Be prepared to walk,, every way you go there is a HUGE hill to come back up to the hotel! Next time we will stay closer to the wine country.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved this hotel. It's gorgeous, chic and very comfortable. The staff, especially the concierges are very friendly and helpful. Also, the location was great. We were able to walk to several restaurants and stores close by. The only thing I would recommend is not to park in the hotel since the parking fees are pretty steep.

review.title: Wonderful place
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at the Fairmont. It's close to downtown San Francisco. As it's sitting on top of Nob Hill, the walk morphs into climbing (your mileage may vary). Found a long black hair in the bathtub while showering, but apart from that, it was great.

review.title: Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: A step back to a more elegant time.

review.title: Fairmont San Francisco is a definite 5 star hotel!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is an amazingly beautiful and elegant hotel with superb hospitality. The entire staff worked very hard to ensure that you are very comfortable and made you feel very welcomed. Thank you for taking care of my friends and making their anniversary weekend VERY SPECIAL.

review.title: Hard to beat
review.reviewText: Great room, service, and views!

review.title: Fairmont
review.reviewText: Staff was very courteous. Room was great..although on 19th floor. Definitely paid for view. San Fran not very sunny, so only on last day did we see the great views.

review.title: Second visit...will go back!
review.reviewText: Definitely one of my favorite hotels of all time. Elegant, sophisticated, and captures that 'Classic Old World San Francisco Charm'. In our opinion, pay for the upgrade and have a view! We suggest at least a Signature Grand Room where the view is spectacular. Overall, quite satisfied, however the Staff was significantly lower caliber than expected. After several requests, it took FOUR days to fix our in room safe. The Breakfast in the lobby, although phenomenal atmosphere, definitely overpriced! Despite these minor inconveniences, a very satisfied guest who will return.

review.title: Exclusive stay
review.reviewText: Of course a nice place to stay. About 10$ of taxi ride from every place of San Francisco. It's at the top of a hill, so... this should be considered if you don't like to pay for taxi =)

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel but location is not so good.

review.title: A great getaway hotel with all the grandeur
review.reviewText: My husband and I were celebrating our 15th anniversary and our Fairmont Hotel experience was unforgettable. The ornate lobby is breathtaking. The front desk offered us an upgraded room with a view which was a real plus. The concierge gave us a wonderful reccommendation for lunch. The large bathroom with the large tub was a total luxury. Being right in the middle of the city I thought it would be noisy but to sleep at night was very quiet. The king bed with the down bedding was very comfy. An added plus was all the historic photos and learning about all the famous people and presidents who have stayed there. We are planning another trip to the hotel already! Definitely worth the money. Convenient coffee and bagel shop for mornings on the run too if you do not want sit down for the big breakfast buffet.

review.title: Very good opportunity
review.reviewText: excellent location, very good service and a lovely building, full of charm, history and interesting details. I enjoyed it very much and plan to return on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel Excellent Price
review.reviewText: My one stay at the Nob Hill's Fairmont in San Francisco was excellent. The hotel is grand and beautiful, and lives up to its reputation as an old style hotel with historical significance. The room was large ( huge bathroom could be modernized), the elevators were appropriately old school and charming, and the common areas were elegant and grand. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel, including the low price (about 50% less than the published rates) I received from Expedia. Hotel is in the center of the city close to everything.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: This hotel is really good. The lobby is outstanding. The room comfort is great. Extreamly recomended!

review.title: One of the best!
review.reviewText: Can't go wrong with the Fairmont. A landmark in San Francisco and a tribute to what hotel customer service should be. Was very comfortable there and close to most parts of the city you'd want to go to. Only one slight downside, not too many things included with your room rate. For example: want to work out? $15/day. Want breakfast? $25 - 45, etc. Services that many hotel offer complimentary these days...

review.title: not bad, but wouldn't necessarily go back
review.reviewText: Our room at the Fairmont was clean and comfortable. However, the Fairmont's slick presentation erases any elements of historic charm that might be expected from an older property. We might as well have been staying at any other nice hotel. The room service and restaurant prices were exorbitant, so we left the hotel for food and drink. Also, inexplicably, the hotel linen service omitted certain towels - we never saw a washcloth during our four-day stay and only intermittently had a bath mat (which seems trivial, but the shower did spray - good water pressure!). Next time we go to San Francisco, we'll try and stay a little more "off the beaten path" in a less expensive place with more character.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel however there was a group of us staying there paying a difference of US$200 per night for the same room type.

review.title: Great Hotel and location
review.reviewText: Stayed 5 nights. A beautiful hotel and a good central location to transport and city attractions. Would definately stay again.

review.title: Historic landmark.
review.reviewText: If you want to stay somewhere with history and atmosphere in San Francisco then this is it.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel, perfect location & views.
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The lobby was breathtaking. We had a Deluxe room with great views, it was clean and the beds were MOST comfortable. Like home. The hotel is on the cable car route so perfect. Central so you can walk everywhere if you wish. Great coffee shop downstairs that makes great lattes and special coffee. Also complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby each morning. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Just a wonderful hotel with one a grand lobby, restaurant, and bar. Service and room comfort were fantastic. The staff was most helpful. Restaurant is expensive but good. Small cafe is too remotely located and no inbetween eatery. Great location and view of the city and bay. I whole-heartedly recommend the hotel.

review.title: Fantastic City, can't wait to go back....
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely and the staff were very friendly and attentive.

review.title: A Beautiful hotel, a pleasure to stay in
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel, first class, clean, with helpful staff. Lots of good suggestions for places to eat and lots of help to arrange any tours, trips etc. My only complaint was the food, it was expensive and not good, this hotel needs some place where you can go for breakfast without breaking the bank. they have a small coffee shop at the parking level but its very limited. I also had dinner there and was very disappointed my food was cold and not good. I would certainly go back if they would fix the food situation. It has so much history and is a beautiful place to stay.

review.title: A very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Beds have comforters, which I hate because they aren't suitable for use with normal room temperatures. Unfortunately the windows are locked shut, so we had to use the AC to sleep even though it was cool outside. Our room lacked a comfortable chair.

review.title: Classy with a great location
review.reviewText: Beatuiful property, walking distance to Union Square and all major attractions. Go for a room with a view.

review.title: Luxurious and friendly
review.reviewText: We enjoyed this beautiful survivor of the 1906 quake with our whole family. Three generations of mid westerners in our group appreciated the friendly service, quiet elegance, and convenient location.

review.title: Still the best
review.reviewText: As always, we enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. It still provides for one of the best "arrival" experiences in the City. The service was prompt and friendly and the rooms are consistently comfortable. I had one minor quibble this time around. In pre-booking I specifically asked to not be located next to an ice machine. You can guess the rest. Unfortunately we arrived late and had to hurry to a show, so I had no time to ask to be re-located, so we made do. Aside from that though, the stay was fine.

review.title: san fran
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel and a great location. Some of the common areas had shown signs of wear that need to be addressed but i thought it was a nice property and would stay again.

review.title: best ever
review.reviewText: had a great time staff was wonderfull

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Antique 1920's feel. Marble everywhere. Very clean. Staff were very polite and helpful. Rooms are up to date with over sized flat screens and bathroom was super clean with marble throughout. Great view. Only negative it is on top of Nob Hill so if you plan to walk back to the hotel after you have been out you need to be up for a steep climb.

review.title: WHAT A FUN CITY!
review.reviewText: WHILE WE WERE THERE, THEY CLOSED THE "TONGA" ROOM FOR ALL FOUR NIGHTS WE WERE THERE, LEAVING US WITH JUST BAR FOOD. HAD WE KNOWN, WOULD PROBABLY NOT HAVE STAYED. HOTEL IS NOT WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE (ON A LEVEL STREET) TO ANY NICE RESTAURANTS. ALLOWING FOR LONG WEEK-END GUESTS, THEY SHOULD HAVE NOT BOOKED IT OUT EVERY NIGHT. WHAT A SHAME, WHEN WE TELL PEOPLE WE STAYED THERE, THEIR FIRST COMMENT IS "ISN'T THE TONGA ROOM GREAT?" DON'T KNOW!

review.title: Loved it! Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Great location!

review.title: Classic Hotel with friendly staff and elegant appointments
review.reviewText: We stayed in the tower (new part). The room was nicely appointed, clean and had a wonderful view. Housekeeping was very good. The concierge made excellent suggestions for meals. (Knob Hill Cafe & Jardinere's) We only are breakfast in the hotel. We felt this was only average. We did go to the Tongo Club for a short while. Interesting concept. Drinks were prepared well. The hotel was hosting the 2009 California Mille - wonderful cars built prior to 1957. Great fun!! Roof garden beautiful. Location great.

review.title: Beautiful lobby , ok room
review.reviewText: I paid for a little better room expecting to get that. Was disappointed. Two lights in the room were broken, not that the light bulb didn't work they were broken. Nice bathroom. The floor we were on must of been the smoking floor before. It smelled like smoke. The lobby is beautiful and the service was great. The location is a little out of the way,(top of nob hill) which means quiet but a bit of a hassle. You are staying in a part of history thou!

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a lot of history. Friendly staff, good location with great access to the the street cars

review.title: Luxury Heaven (for a little less)
review.reviewText: The Fairmont really knows how to do their job well! Not only are the rooms luxurious and comfortable, the views of Alcatraz and Coit Tower were amazing. Room service dining was everything we were expecting, gourmet heaven! Also loved their bathroom toiletries.

review.title: OK value if you book with a discount.
review.reviewText: The lobby was very nice. The bed was great, loved the sheets. The soap and shampoo smelled great, good way to wake up. Gym facility was shabby not very well taken care of. No yoga mats. Steamroom was a nice way to unwind.

review.title: Grand old hotel
review.reviewText: The location is fantastic -- close to everything, great views. If you take a walk be prepared for a steep climb home. Service was very good. Room was nicely appointed. Their computer system was down when I checked in which meant I couldn't get a room key. This was aggravating, but the staff worked hard to lessen the inconvenience.

review.title: Too posh
review.reviewText: Messed up our room checking in. Got moved three times. We were hassled every day about something. Last straw was, they wanted us to pay for the last night even though our itinerary from Expedia said we were paid in full. The front desk was rude regarding this and even after they confirmed we were paid up placed a bill under our door on the last day for more money.

review.title: Exceeded expectations (if you can believe it!)
review.reviewText: When choosing a place with as much history as the Fairmont in San Francisco, we hoped the "legend" would be close to the "facts". What we found was something ever better. In among the history of this grand hotel my partner and I found a fantastic place from which to see the city. Everyone at the Fairmont made us feel both comfortable and pampered; their pride came through in everything they did. The room was great (of course), and the property was perfectly maintained. Centrally located (and on one of the high points of the city) made for a wonderful touring experience.

review.title: Dream come true
review.reviewText: I have read about the Fairmont in books, seen it in movies and was a fan of the TV show "Hotel". Our Fairmont stay was everything I had dreamed of. We had a fabulous view of the city and a wonderful room. Thanks for living up to all of our expectations!!

review.title: Splendid location
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally situated on cable car lines and within walking distance of most attractions. Standards were excellent and staff helpful but our room was poorly soundproofed - we could clearly hear the guests next door coughing and having telephone conversations.

review.title: Room service & housekeeping need to get their stories straight
review.reviewText: 1st class hotel but problem with departments. No one wanted to bring in clean wine and cocktail glasses each day. Housekeeping left the dirty ones in the hall, where they would sit for 2 days, and said they couldn't leave us clean ones as that was room services job. Had to call & wait for glasses 3 days out of our 5 day stay. Also no coffee maker in room, so be prepared to pay for room service in the morning or wait till you go out. Coffee available in lobby only until 7 am on week days. Considering the room rates, I think a coffee maker is in order.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: I hope they don't turn the tower, where we stayed, into condos.

review.title: Fantastic Stay
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was an outstanding hotel. The accomodations and service were great. The room I stayed in was outstanding and I had an excellent view of the Bay. The historical aspects of the hotel added to the experience and there is plenty to see regarding this history in the hotel.

review.title: Day trip to SFO
review.reviewText: This was a surprise trip for my wife on her 40th birthday so she was in fact surprised when we arrived at the hotel. We also received an upgrade to the Regency Suite which was amazing with the 180 deg view of the bay (Coit Tower, Golden Gate bridge, Alcatraz Island and Fisherman's Wharf. We were planning on staying in for breakfast but we decided to go downstairs to the cafe. The prices were a little high ($28 for breakfast buffet with 15% hotel tax plus the additional 15% gratiuty included). So $70 for breakfast is a little much. However, it was a fantastic breakfast!

review.title: Big and roomy , but outdated, parking too pricey
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and the staff very nice, but wow was everything else exspensive. To park your car at the hotel it was $57.00 per night. To eat a simple bacon and egg breakfast was $30.00 plus $3.50/person delivery, plus 20% service charge plus 14% tax, and this did not include coffe or juice. This is very pricey. And with children wow. There was no coffee bar in the room. To get coffee without going into bankrupcy you had to go down to the basement coffee bar/cafe, which had a very limited amount of stuff. i.e. muffins, coffee, no eggs or really a place to sit down for more than 5-10 people. Basically a snack bar. This place had limited eating facilities for the average traverler with children. There was a few very nice cafes within walking distance. For lunch the cafe at Nob Hill was great Italian. For breakfast Roxan's was very nice. The hotel just did'nt provide what the modern traverler is used too. I travel almost once a month all over the world and usually enjoy Fairmont Hotels, but this one is not going to see me again.

review.title: Outstanding Experience
review.reviewText: Not only did the Fairmont staff treat us as if we were royalty, but they let us check in early and gave us a 2-bedroom suite! The room was lovely, quiet, and spacious. The hotel is gorgeous, and the staff is fantastic. We had a simply perfect experience.

review.title: Terrific hotel in a terrific location
review.reviewText: This is a grand hotel celebrating the traditions of older flagship hotels. We went for a Mother/Daughter weekend and enjoyed every minute in the Fairmont and in San Francisco. This trip will always be a part of our memories! The Fairmont set the tone for the trip...impeccable service, elegant surroundings --- all in Nob Hill!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a very nice hotel. We enjoyed our stay there. Very friendly staff.

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: A bit of luxury at the beginning of our trip. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would have appreciated some tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Great views of San Francisco from the hotel.

review.title: Wonderful experience.
review.reviewText: Wonderful, quick service when we needed more towels. In room charge for Internet service but at check-out, she dismissed the charges without us requesting it! We'll be back.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel is very elequant but does not give the personal attention that some of the other hotels offer. I had to call for our robes and also called twice for a cork screw. Also don't stay in room 1001 because we were wakened up with a loud "pipe sounding" noise every morning at 4:00 a.m. We complained to the front desk for three mornings- finally my husband told them to send maintenance up so they could hear the noise. We were not offered another room and finally at the last night of our stay they gave us $80 towards food but all the restaurants were closed Monday & Tuesday evening so we had to order room service to redeem our compensation. I love San Francisco but would not stay at the Fairmount again.....

review.title: can't wait to visit again!
review.reviewText: nice hotel. it has a lot of history.

review.title: old fashoned
review.reviewText: the conditions of the hotel are very good considering the rate paid with the package. Breakfast is very expensive and, honestly, nothing special!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel with very nice3 atmosphere

review.title: Did I Ever Leave My Heart in SF!
review.reviewText: Wow seems such an understatement. Chose this hotel because of its location, name recognition, and the Expedia Special Price. What a terrific decision! Entering the hotel is like time-warping back to another era...glorious and golden. The staff were exceptional, providing expert advice and helpful hints to save time and money. Room was in the original building. Fantastic!!! A walk-in closet bigger than my bathroom! Comfortable bed, view of the Bay towards Alcatraz, high ceilings, good furnishings and amenities, etc. Reasonable internet price ($13.50 for 24 hours). Was almost tempted by the Concierge's offer to extend my stay for another day at an amazing price. Darn being responsible and heading back to work!!!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel Expedia had the best price

review.title: Totally Impressed!
review.reviewText: Price was fantastic, so when we got there I expected a small room with a courtyard view, but that was not the case, they up-graded me to a King room with a view of the Bay. What a beautiful site to see at night. All staff were friendly and very helpful.

review.title: Great location and lobby
review.reviewText: I had asked for a quite room so we were assigned to an interior courtyard room. Well, the interior air shaft is bland and has a giant HVAC fan and duct that I assume vents the kitchen and runs all night. So we had to keep the window closed and still the sound was overwhelming. Next time the hotel wants to spend big bucks on renovation, instead of doing the lobby or the rooms, both of which are done nicely, they should figure out how to remove the HVAC equipment from the core of the building and bring back some life to that area so that half the rooms can have better view, air and sound.

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont has an amazing history in San Francisco, and they have remained one of the elite hotels in the city.

review.title: Great location atop Nob Hill
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a SF classic, a cavernous grand dame. That said, the place could use some updating. The restaurant, like most in the city, is overpriced, so we did not partake

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were exemplary.

review.title: Wish I had stayed longer.
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing and the staff were extremely friendly and courteous. I left a few items in my room after I checked out. When I called back to see if they had been found it took a few transfers of my call to get me connected to the correct person, but they got my information, found my items, called me right back, and held them for me until I could go back and pick them up. I am extremely satisfied and always want to stay at the Fairmont. I wish the mini bar and room service were cheaper though. =)

review.title: Fairmont
review.reviewText: NOT CHEAP! And the TV in our room didn't work but the rest of our experience was exceptional. And the location is amazing.

review.title: Great deal, great hotel
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at the Fairmont again. We got a great deal through Expedia - 55% off the regular cost of a signature room. We got adjoining rooms, which I had requested, and had a very smooth stay.

review.title: Lovely accomodation
review.reviewText: We got a great deal on price through Expedia. The hotel couldn't be more elegant. The only drawback was the $57 a night parking and our car got scraped while in their care (and yes, we had tipped the valet).

review.title: plush
review.reviewText: Very beautiful lobby and good italian coffee at Centro Cafe on ground level. Only minus is that it's a hard climb up after a day of meetings or shopping.

review.title: Enjoyed !!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: A beautiful view and accomodations! Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The room in the Tower was amazing. We had a spectacular view of all of SF south of our room. The marble bathroom was beautiful and the shower was great. The rooms are also very quiet. We were by the elevator and didn't hear a thing.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Great location, service, friendly staff. Bedding was heaven to sleep in. Tonga room was fun. Room was clean. Con- internet should be provided without fee.

review.title: Outstanding!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is simply outstanding! Booked a balcony room and was pleasantly surprised to find a completely furnished terrace with amazing views of the city! Wonderfully charming hotel. Valet and Bell staff were extemely helpful and delightfully polite.

review.title: Gorgeous, grand dame hotel in heart of city
review.reviewText: The lobby area alone is worth the stay. Absolutely beautiful. Rooms were large and beds very comfortable. Would stay here again, no question.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is right on the cable car lines so easy access to most places you want to see.

review.title: It is an experience
review.reviewText: I loved to stay at such majestic hotel. everything was beautiful and the breakfast was really good.

review.title: Wow! Loved it!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel on top of Nob Hill. King size bed was very comfortable and room was very nice. Bathroom was awesome with a walk-in shower and a tub that we used to soak in every night after our days of walking the city.

review.title: Definitely Recommended
review.reviewText: Great service at the hotel. Very helpful and friendly staff. Would definitely stay there again. My only reservation was the themed restaurant in the hotel. The food wasn't great, not bad either. The dining room next to the check in is much better. Also, if you don't like walking, note this hotel is on top of a steep hill.

review.title: Nice but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and the room was spacious and clean. However, it was very noisy at night and in the morning as well. We could hear our neighbors' phone ring and hear their television.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, slow service and clientele
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, slow service and clientele. Our room service sat in our room all evening and morning because the suppport staff never came by to pick up the table after several calls to the dining room. The clientele was low. Even with that, they still tried to charge us for a minimum cover to sit at the bar downstairs to have drinks.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Other than the punishing walk from Union Square to Nob Hill, the stay at the Fairmont was great. Nice room with a large flat screen television.

review.title: Amazing Hotel
review.reviewText: A fantastic hotel. The service was exceptional, the view amazing. The rooms were large with a huge walk-in closet. I will return again very soon.

review.title: Great trip
review.reviewText: My wife and I wanted a special trip to San Francisco. The Fairmont was great - great view, great service, great location. We will definately be back.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel. Good service and comfortable rooms. Walking around may be a pain, but still a good location.

review.title: Long Weekend at Fairmont San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is still the grande dame of hotels in San Francisco even though many of its famous public rooms have been closed (Venetian, Cirque, Crown Rooms). The lobby is still a great place to watch people and to enjoy the large windows and stylish decor. We were upgraded to a room in the tower with a beautiful view over the interior garden, skyline, and cable car lines with the bay in the background. Although dining options are limited, we enjoyed Cento Cafe for a quick breakfast, coffee or snack where the cable cars meet and walking over to Nob Hill Cafe (suggested by Bellman Tommy) for a reasonable dinner of fresh pasta and pleasant surroundings. Our trip was for family business and it was a great setting for all of the family to meet. We all had memories of stays and evenings at the hotel in past years and it was a great pleasure to come back and enjoy this San Francisco landmark hotel again in such a comfortable and pleasant room. The bathrooms are large with separate shower and bath and the large flat screen television was nice to watch when you became tired of the view or lights of the city below. We'll return again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back again
review.reviewText: It's an attractive and comfortable hotel.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: Simple a classic San Francisco landmark hotel.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: I can't find anything wrong about my visit. It was excellent on every level.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: Good convenient location; great ambience; enjoyable stay.

review.title: Tired, old hotel....
review.reviewText: What was a shining light in SFO, is in need of proper modernisation - a plasma TV doesn't cut it. The rooms are a good size but lack any form of sound insulation, so if sleeping is important, think twice!

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautiful, windows do not open as the web says but the view made up for that! Staff not so friendly - only negative thing about the entire stay.

review.title: Very Nice Room and hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel and Super 5 Star Super Value

review.title: Superlative
review.reviewText: Great staff, great location = great hotel.

review.title: Always a great stay!
review.reviewText: Always enjoy staying at the Fairmont.

review.title: A good place to stay
review.reviewText: Overall, I like the hotel, clean and quite, close to chinatown. But U have to walk downhill to downtown and uphill back, quite an exercie.

review.title: Best in SF!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Can not best it in San Francisco. If you truely want to experiance the best in San Francisco, you must stay in Union Square and the Fairmont is the best hotel!

review.title: Best in the City
review.reviewText: We always enjoy our stays at the Fairmont. If the feel of an "arrival" matters to you, then the lobby experience at the Fairmont is hard to beat. The feeling is capped by exceptionally warm service. We've tried others in San Francisco but we keep coming back to the best!

review.title: We plan to return to The Fairmont. It's a lovely hotel.
review.reviewText: This is a grand old hotel. It's both beautiful and comfortable. Can't wait to return.

review.title: Grand Ol' Dame
review.reviewText: Really great room for a really incredible price. Very large rooms for such an urban location. Great views. Fabulous service. Dining and other services come at a steep price though.

review.title: Lovely hotel, but ...
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful, historic hotel with appropriate amenities. It does follow the unfortunate trend of charging extra for the fitness room and wireless Internet -- but both are free if you join the Presidents Club, at no charge. I would rate this hotel higher except that we had to wait more than an hour past the 3 p.m. check-in time for our room -- this was New Year's Day and supposedly the previous guests had "trashed" our room and checked out late. (It was fine when we finally checked in.) The valet parking charge is steep -- $50 a night! -- but we were delighted to find out that it was waived for us because we had rented a hybrid car.

review.title: great hotel and location
review.reviewText: first time to book through expedia....great price great hotel and great service what else could you ask for..thanks

review.title: Can't go wrong at the Fairmont SF
review.reviewText: Can't go wrong here. Easy access to the cable car to take you to the wharf or downtown shopping. Very clean and the staff is top notch...! Big and elegant lobby to relax in. I was there when I was a kid and I still go back 40 years later..! Eat and drink in the Tonga room and relax. Just drop your car with the valet out front and forget about it until you leave. Have fun....!

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont certainly lives up to it's reputation. Excellent quality combined with excellent service make this a do not miss hotel. The recommendations for restaurants from the concierge are top notch. We look forward to our next stay at the Fairmont!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable upscale hotel. My only complaint was parking was ~$50/day.

review.title: Great location and great hotel!
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the SF Fairmont and it will definitely not be my last. Service is always excellent and the rooms are beautiful! I loved the walk in closet!

review.title: A little bit of history...but that's most of SFO
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a beautiful piece of history. Lots of +'s and -'s to this hotel. Positives: location, big rooms, close to transporation/tolley's/shoppings. Negatives: expensive compared to other hotels in area, valet/parking is pricey ($40p/n). The problem with this hotel is the nicer/larger suite rooms are located in the tower and the restaurant/club is directly above. The music sounded as if the band was next door and went until 12:30am! Rates a 3.5 of 5

review.title: Great Value in Classy Hotel
review.reviewText: We travel extensively and we always try to stay in first-class hotels. The Fairmont San Francisco is a great older property that has been extensively updated and has a five star location on Nob Hill. Our room was quite confortable, good size, plush bedding, and had a very large marble bathroom. The rate on Expedia was a bargain, and I would stay there again without hesitation.

review.title: Impressive Hotel
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel through Expedia and got a great package deal. Pretty much free lodging at the Fairmont. Would definately go again. Some bad parts of town. Be familiar. The hotel is at the top of Nob hill so no matter where you go you'll have to come back up. It's pretty steep, Rice-a -Roni commercial steep.

review.title: an uplifting place to stay
review.reviewText: i loved my stay at the fairmont. the charm of this landmark permeated my time there. simply entering the lobby was a journey to another time, one of more graciousness. my room was large and comfortable, with a great view. the staff was a delight. the location is simply spectacular. i wish i had a season's pass to the fairmont.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is definitely a great experience. We always wanted to stay here and the great winter rates made it a possibility. Beautiful hotel and beautiful city.

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Entrance & lobby takes your breath away. Very oldtime & sophisticated. Rooms good size, clean, comfortable and very homely. Location isn't bad as close to cable cars. Quite a steep hike to hotel if you like to walk. If you are in to mountain climbing this is the place to stay! Only disadvantage with location is that there are few restaurants are shop in the near vicinity. Would recommend a stay here.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: I stayed here only one night. I think, that this hotel is one with the most impressive view to the bay, bridges and downtown in SF. The room was clean and service exeptional!

review.title: Lovely hotel that needs an attitude adjustment
review.reviewText: The Fairmont as a facility is stately and wonderful but a few of the concierge staff members seemed disinterested, or downright rude,when they were asked to suggest area restaurants that might be just a cut below four-star level. Also,with their lofty room rates, it might be nice if they didn't gouge you on every amenity (e.g.use of the fitness center;e-mail access in their business center).Oh well,I guess only really high-end hotels like Holiday Inn can afford to do that. Having said all this, the pluses far outweigh the minuses and I'd probably go back. Not much incentive for them to change, I suppose, which is really too bad. This grand old hotel, and its guests, both deserve better.

review.title: pretty snooty
review.reviewText: the conceiere (sp?) was horrible. we had to pry advice out of him and the advice that we did finally get was pathetic.

review.title: Fabulous - Gorgeous - Best Hotel Ever
review.reviewText: Superb. Breath taking lobby. Gracious staff. Gorgeous room.Try the hotel breakfast it is fabulous.Especially the omelette.Comfy beds.Good location. The only down side is that it is so good that you dont want to leave it to look at the sights.Almost cried with relief on locating the cafe down stairs after three weeks of bad coffee - it was a god send. The Tonga Bar was kitch in a good way.Hotel staff very helpful for tips in getting around.

review.title: Good Hotel, but very formal
review.reviewText: The hotel was good but not as good as its reputation would suggest. The staff were pleasant and the doormen very helpful, but it is maybe best suited to older customers or business travellers. Definatly not for young people or children. Our bed was very comfortable, but the bathroom smelled slightly weird! The hotel is also located at one of the highest points in the city, with very steep hills on either side. Not suitable for the unfit or anyone who doesnt like climbing mountains!

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Nothing special. I expect hotels to use some sort of fabric softener when cleaning the linens - towels were extremely rough (almost felt like starched). There are way better hotels in SF than Fairmont.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Fran, Great Location
review.reviewText: Having stayed somewhere else last time in San Fran, when we walked by the Fairmont we vowed to stay there the next time. The hotel was fantastic, located perfectly at the top of Knob Hill. Just a short walk to Union Square and a quick trolley ride to Fisherman's Wharf, the location is excellent. We stay in luxury hotels all over the world, and the Fairmont did not disappoint us. The service is outstanding.

review.title: Beautiful honeymoon stay
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was the most beautiful hotel my new bride and I had ever seen--much less stayed at. Everything was wonderful--comfortable, romantic, amazing views. We were fascinated by the history of the hotel and the remarkable renovations. We were treated like royalty, although we are young and never mentioned it was our honeymoon.

review.title: Incredible
review.reviewText: The Hotel is amazing, it seems like a european palace and service was excelent

review.title: Lovely San Fran pick
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby really sets the tone of a beautiful, upscale hotel. The service was excellent. And we enjoyed the bar area in the evening with live piano music. Our room was very spacious and the bed and linens were very comfortable. I'll definetly return.

review.title: Good value for the price
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Fairmount for 4 nights at really great Expedia rate. Hotel has alot of charm and the lobby is really elegant. Room was large enough for 3 of us and had a huge walk in closet where we stored our luggage. This was a great feature. Bathroom was also large. Mainly a positive experience with few annoyances. TV did not work one time as cleaning staff unhooked the cable, which we discovered when housekeeping came to check the unit and twice housekeeping tried to enter in the morning while we were getting ready. Lastly, we left a tip for the housekeeping staff when my husband and I left. When my daughter returned to the room no more than 15 minutes later to collect her luggage she noticed that the tip was gone. She looked in the hall and spoke with housekeeping, who said that only the guy who checks the minibar was in the room. She told them about the tip and we assume that the mini bar guy took it. The hotel is way on top of Nob Hill. We had a 3 day muni pass and used the cable cars as public transporation when we could and took cabs at other times. Definitely recommend hotel for those who do not mind the hills. Hotel resturant was not very good but the coffee place was excellent.

review.title: On top of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel, courteous staff. Our room wasn't ready as we arrived a couple of hours early but was upgraded to a good sized room with a King bed and a nice view of the bay. Very close to China town if you like chinese food. Two cable car routes right outside of the hotel. Only downside is that you have to travel via cable car, taxi or bus to get to any sights unless you're very fit as the hotel is at the top of San Francisco.

review.title: Awesome Hotel with an Amazing view of an Amazing City
review.reviewText: As soon as you walk in the door, you will know you have arrived at an amazing destination to enjoy this city. The hotel lobby is absolulety stunning and the staff is there to confirm the same in their service and friendlyness. The room....(tower room) The view is so beautiful of the bay, we just wanted to stay in our room and sleep in....flat screen TV & of course there was a marble & granite bathroom, seperate glass enclosed shower, phone in there if you need one, makeup mirror, etc, This hotel truly makes you want to live on Nob Hill.

review.title: Classic San Francisco
review.reviewText: Beautiful suite, exciting and glamorous get away. Would be great if they had a car service available.

review.title: Beautiful exterior and lobby, but it ends there.
review.reviewText: I could go on and on but I'll make it brief. We were checked into a room that some one else was staying in. It had a breathing machine next to the bed but the bellhop said it was just a mistake and removed it and told us to enjoy our stay as he left. My wife then went into the bathroom where she found an electric toothbrush, razor, mouthwash etc. There was an apology and we were moved to another room. The room was very warm so we turned the A/C down to 65 degrees and left for 6 hours. When we got back, the room was still at 85 degrees. A call was made and the first solution was to change the filter on the A/C unit in the room. This had no effect, NONE! We were then moved to a "nicer" room where the A/C had not even been turned on, and came to find that it worked even worse than the last one. After three rooms in 7 hours we gave up on a room with an A/C that worked. Oh, and I recommended that a buddy and his wife join us on their vacation and join us at the Fairmont. And no, their A/C didn't work either. If your looking for comfort in San Francisco, don't look to the Fairmont Hotel!! Oh yeah, the pillows are terrible also.

review.title: Wonderful hotel at a wonderful sale price.
review.reviewText: Beautiful, majestic hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was extremely large, the bed way too comfy, the views great, room service reasonably priced and the food very good.

review.title: Fairmont was wonderful
review.reviewText: Room was immense and staff was great. Hotel has history and nostalgia. Well maintained and up-to-date as well. Cable cars were easily accessible - good thing since this hotel is at the top of Nob Hill and not an easy walk.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel with a reach history. My corner room on 6 floor had fabulous downtown views. It was very spacious. Much larger than standard rooms at modern hotels. Hotel located near all cable cars lines. However, it is on the very top of quite steep hill. I used taxi service to get back to hotel after day of sightseeing.

review.title: Would return to this hotel in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very helpful. The rooms were large and immaculate. Have never slept in such a comfortable bed!

review.title: Great location, service, atmosphere...
review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 days. The location is great. We flew into Oakland, took the Bart to the nearest station, and took a taxi to the hotel. We were in the tower and had a "Bay view" room-the view was spectacular. Try the local restaurants around the hotel, etc. rather than the really expensive restaurant inside the hotel past the lobby (though the food there was good as well).

review.title: The Fairmont is Still Beautiful
review.reviewText: For my daughter's first trip to San Francisco, I wanted the iconic, elegant S.F. experience, and the Fairmont certainly fit the bill. It is as lovely as I remembered it. The staff is friendly and accommodating, our room was classic, comfortable, and clean. Our only meal in the hotel, breakfast, was perfect. I would return.

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO CLASS
review.reviewText: Everything about the Fairmont Hotel was pleasant and welcoming. We would go back in a minute!

review.title: The Fairmont San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Beautiful and historic. Bathrooms a little small.

review.title: Terrific stay
review.reviewText: We were put in a large room on the 6th floor with a fabulous view of the bay and an honest to goodness walk in closet. The hotel may be old but in great condition. Courteous staff, helpful concierge and wonderful location. We'll be back!

review.title: Good Visit
review.reviewText: Checked in with our kids for a weekend stay on a road trip. Room was not ready and did not receive the room we requested. Staff was very helpful, concierge, valet, front desk sent up milk and cookies at night to make up for delay. Nob Hill is a good place to stay being in the heart of SF but away from the busy downtown streets.

review.title: The Fairmont is a great place to stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel is beautiful and the view of the Bay is stunning. The location is great - a short walk from China Town, Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf -but far enough away to step away from it all. It is a stones throw from Grace Cathedral which is gorgeous.

review.title: Lovely friendly hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were extremely helpful and attentive. The room was fantastic and amazing for the price we paid through Expedia. An excellent base to see one of the older parts of he city. Highly recommended.

review.title: 1st class elegant!
review.reviewText: we loved our stay at the hotel, our room was ready when we arrived in the late morning. The lobby was classy and inviting, loads of room to sit and people watch, relax, and enjoy the lovely decor. the street cars are right there, nice to ride up the hill on! We had breakfast in the dinning room the day we were leaving, it was a delicious way to end our visit

review.title: Beautiful lobby but can't afford to eat there!
review.reviewText: Food in the restaurant and in the room is rediculously expensive (and only of fair quality). Continental breakfast for ONE costs about $35 dollars ($23 plus tax, tip, etc). An omelette would cost about $50 ($30 for the eggs). A small cheese pizza and a pot of hot chocolate costs almost $40. In the restaurant, a "full tea" with tiny sandwiches for a child is $25 and $36 for an adult. I skipped thisand my daughter and I shared a dessert and one small pot of tea in the bar, but every dessert is $10 so this tiny snack was about $20 with tax and tip. You get the idea. That wouldn't be so bad except there are no reasonable restaurants or cafes nearby. Also, you're on top of the highest hill in S.F. so even the 3-4 blocks to China town is exhausting to walk and you need a taxi to or fro, etc. The nearby cable car is often too croweded to get on and is $5 per adult if you don't have a pass. I highly recommend a pass. It's $18 for three days for an adult and $10 for a child and works for cable cars and trolleys, although sometimes the wait is so long and they don't go everywhere conveniently (e.g. 1 hour from the Wharf). Even with passes, I still took some taxis (e.g. to Golden Gate Park and to/fro the Asian museum because it was more convenient. I recommend getting passes and plan trips for which you need a taxi for days after the passes expire.

review.title: Hurray for Expedia! A tremendous bargain. Thank you.
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was gorgeous, as usual. The staff was solicitous. The room was very good-looking and comfortable; the environment was quiet. It was the least expensive room, but far above other hotels, and Expedia got more than 60% off !! We were the best-dressed couple there, which didn't take much. What is the matter with these Americans? They are sloppy looking.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: As I expected the Fairmont lived up to its reputation. The staff were friendly and extremely help. The location only adds to its allure although the hill can be a trial to your legs.

review.title: Nicely Done
review.reviewText: The room had a fantastic view of the bay. Also, had an added treat with the Gumball 3000 group with all their automobiles on display. I'll be back again in the future.

review.title: Perfect location, excellent accomodations
review.reviewText: Stayed 5 days, enjoyed every minute. All services excellent, food prices higher than expected, but cleanliness, friendliness and over all satification were also better than expected. Concierge service was great with perfect restaurant recommendations. Rooms were large and confortable and we will definitely consider this hotel for our next visit.

review.title: Nice, though not as quiet as I expected
review.reviewText: Lovely building, well positioned, pleasant staff. The one thing that surprised me was that while in the room (I was on the fifth floor, towards the middle) I could hear the occupant next door at odd times: coughing while asleep, the dialtone on his speakerphone, etc. I would have expected an old-school building like the Fairmont would have been built so solidly that it would have been very quiet. Not so.

review.title: One of the best
review.reviewText: I'd been to SF for business on several occasions, but this was the first time to take family on vacation there. The hotel was great - perfect mix of "golden days" architecture and setting with all the modern day conveniences. Would go back again in a minute.

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: Wish our vacation was longer

review.title: Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very courteous and helpful. Room was nice and quiet.

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a remodeled luxury hotel with a great location on Cable Car lines near most downtown attractions. Service is very good.

review.title: Not up to 4 star standards
review.reviewText: Our room was comfortable and quiet, but not in perfect shape. For example, there was a noticeable rip in an upholstered chair, a broken sink stopper,and a coffee spill in the bathroom. We had a pushy maid who knocked and opened the door simultaneously.

review.title: Yes, at the right price
review.reviewText: Good location, comfortable. Need to make sure to have a President Club number to save on internet access charges and fitness room. Hotel of that level should have these for free!!!

review.title: Very Impressed!!
review.reviewText: We just happen to come across this hotel on your website, but didn't know much about it when we booked our trip. We were blown away by the outstanding service, and overall ambience of this magnificiant place. When we checked in, we informed them it was our honeymoon, and they upgraded us and sent champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to our room. It was fantastic. They were very helpful if we needed anything, and our room was so comfortable and clean. While in San Fran, we took a tour around the city, and the Fairmont Hotel was actually part of the tour so you know it is a fantastic place.

review.title: What a treat!
review.reviewText: Great location with cable cars right outside the door!

review.title: 4 night stay at the SanFran Fairmont
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice and centrally located. Walking distance to many major places and right next to 2 cable car routes. They kindly stored our luggage before actual check in time as we arrived early. They did the same thing on our last day since we were not flying until the evening. Thus, The bell staff were very friendly. The bad: We got the Fairmont room on the 2nd floor. It was supposed to be a queen bed, but it was surely a double bed.
