The first night, there was a wedding happening underneath us so we could not sleep from the thumping music and singing. Called front desk, they laughed and said maybe we can get you ear plugs. I hung up, quite unhappy. The party did not end until 2am. They should not have issued those rooms if it was going to be so noisy! We never got the complimentary newspapers each morning. Someone put a big bottle of Evian water on our table in our room when we got back one evening. We did not order it, nor did we touch it. The next morning, we found a bill for $10 underneath our door asking us to pay for it... The housekeeping was inconsistent. After the 2nd night they took away the carpet in the washroom. Because of the Evian water incident, we decided to inform the front desk beforehand in case they decided to bill us for the stink'n carpet. They also did not replace the shower cap. Overall, it was just a so-so stay. I chose it just because we got a good deal on Expedia. But I probably choose a different hotel next time.

review.title: Great beds...
review.reviewText: A great space...great atmosphere, always something going on. The staff are very helpful, especially the concierge. This is an old but beautiful hotel, with beds you'll never want to get up from...

review.title: Choose somewhere else!
review.reviewText: Stayed in one of there main building rooms. The room had adjoining doors on both sides... We could hear every word our neighbors were making verbatim.... Not to mention that any noise in the hallways echoed right into the room! If you are looking at sleeping bring you ear plugs!! The finish of the room is also very dated with chips and scratches over all the furniture... For the money you would be better spent staying in one of the cities newer hotels and save the Fairmont for a quiet drink just to see the building.

review.title: It's OUR place
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is an absolutely true, San Franciscan experience. Our second visit, and we have named it, "OUR Hotel". It is the only place that we will stay in town. It is in a great location, close to alot of attractions, and cable car connections.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: I'll definately go back..

review.title: Classic elegance
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fairmount for 5 nights in July 2008. The hotel offered a special sale we took advantage of. We were immediatley offered a free upgrade to a tower room at check-in. This is a classic old style resort hotel. I would not recommend it for families with small children or even for most young adults. We had no negative experiences at all. The staff was very helpful and the concierge one of the best I have dealt with. We rented a car one dy from the Hertz desk in the hotel and it was the most pleasant experience I have ever had dealing with rental car agencies. The room was clean and spacious. My wife thought that the linens could have been better quality ( higher thread count), but the bed was comfortable and it was one of the best and largest bathrooms I have found in a hotel. Visit the Tonga Room , maybe have a drink but I would suggest skipping dinner. Nothing worng but for the price much better food can be found. Breakfast is expensive in the hotel. The buffet is fine and there is a good ala carte selection. Skip the buffet and order ala carte. You get more food than you can eat and save significant money. Plenty of other options if you want to walk toward Union Square, but face it, eating in San Francisci is expensive. Overall a great experience, but watch for a sale because at the rack rates I would not advise choosing this hotel.

review.title: Perfect room, great deal.
review.reviewText: We stayed in a suite in the new tower. It was in great condition and had great views of the SF Bay.

review.title: would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: Great place. Location good for all sights. Exceptional service! Good food!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont for four nights and we loved it! The location is right in the heart of San Francisco and both Chinatown and Union Square is within walking distance. There's a cable car right behind the hotel that you can take to go down to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel itself is very classic - a victorian feel to it which is hard to find these days. There's a hall that has pictures of hundreds of celebreties or important people that have stayed or vistied the hotel over the years - including Reagan, Kennedy, etc. The only draw back concerning the facility is that the room does appear somewhat old.Despite the updated appliances (LCD) and rennovations, there still is a sense of "oldness" in the air. Well, I guess if the hotel is over a hundred years old, you would have to expect this. But having said that, I would still prefer Fairmont's "antiquity" feel over any of Hilton or Marriot's monderness any day. Another draw back is of course - the price. It's not cheap! We were somewhat lucky and got a discounted summer package. But even so, it was quite pricey.

review.title: Perfect for any occassion
review.reviewText: The room and atmosphere were elegant. The service was top-notch. Although it is on the high end of my travel budget, it was definitely worth the extra dollars.

review.title: Fantastic!
review.reviewText: The Hotel is beautiful and is centrally located. Away from the busy Union Square area. Walking up the hill was a killer, we did not want to wait in line for a cable car. Bad ideas!(if you go up the street a few blocks you and generally hop on the cars since they never pack them full at the turn-a-round point) There are cable cars right out the doors of the hotel running to any place you want to go. Very quiet rooms, the beds are to die for. Most comfortable beds we have evr slept in with down pillows. The staff was more than helpful. With expedia we did not have a view of the city it was an interior room, however, we asked the last night and they upgraded us to a tower room on the 19th floor. Was hard to see through all the fog.

review.title: Fairmont Service is exemplary
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely friendly and accomodating with any request I had. This is a great place to stay. There is a lot of history surrounding this property which makes it a very interesting place to stay. It is located in the center of most museums, shopping, tourist locations, etc.

review.title: Definitely satisfied
review.reviewText: All services provided were outstanding. The luxurious bedding was like sleeping on a cloud. Incredible views. Beautiful lobby and common areas. Great location. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: There will be a return trip
review.reviewText: Would recommend this hotel to anybody, we had a fantastic view of the bay from our room, service was excellent from the moment we checked in to the day we checked out and "we will be back."

review.title: confortable vacation
review.reviewText: all is ok but is only one point the cost the parking for day is the 50 dlls

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont San Francisco is perfectly placed atop Nob Hill, convenient to anywhere in the city one may wish to go. The hotel is impecable, the service first class. I will be back.

review.title: Luxurious Hotel
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at this hotel, the room was nice and clean, the service top notch, one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. Valet parking was $50 when I stayed in early summer. This has a feel of an upscale, luxurious hotel. I highly recommend.

review.title: Awesome !
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, the staff was very helpful and friendly. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in, the tub was deep and my hot bubbly bath after a long day of walking and jumping on cable cars was absolute bliss - NO WAIT, wrapping myself in my soft white robe kicking back and watching tv...thats bliss =)

review.title: Our stay was great!
review.reviewText: We loved the Fairmont, it was truly a great experience. The staff was extremely helpful and the hotel is very elegant. I wish they had a coffee pot in the room but the scones in Cafe Cento made the coffee run worth the extra effort.

review.title: Patience is Key
review.reviewText: The Fairmont hotel is beautiful and grand. The beds are the most comfortable that we've ever slept in! Service, on the other hand, was not as impressive. Our fire alarm went off two different nights, one night at 11pm and the next night at 3am. It took a long time for maintenance to show up. It wasn't too comfortable standing in the hallway in our bathrobes! Once maintenance arrived, they removed the fire alarm and never replaced it as scheduled. We had to call the next day to ask where it was. The two different times that we called the concierge (for transportation), we were put on hold for quite awhile. We found we were served better when going to the desk. The elevators take a long time to get to your stop. Patience is key. The cable cars run outside the hotel doors, which is convenient, but expect to wait 1/2 hour before being able to board. People are picked up at Union Square so by the time it gets to your stop, there's no room. We ended up walking or taking a cab most of the time. The cab was cheaper than the trolley. Overall, the Fairmont is a beautiful hotel but you must have patience to stay there.

review.title: A Class Act
review.reviewText: The tower room was beautiful and looked like it was recently updated. We had a great view and the location can't be beat; classic elegance. Staff was very helpful.

review.title: I would try to stay at this hotel first in the future
review.reviewText: Have already recommended it to others. Very helpful service and comfortable stay.

review.title: Fairmont on Nob Hill - Awesome!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel! Great location on top of hill. Best mattress yet!

review.title: San Fran's best Hotel
review.reviewText: This was probably the best hotel we've ever stayed in. From the time you drive up to the person taking care of the room you are greated with such enthusiasm and professionalism. The staff is very friendly and so helpful. The conceirge recommened a wonderful Italian restautant, the trolley cars were right outside the front door, union square a few blocks away. what's not to like about it. We highly recommend this old and classic hotel.

review.title: Charming hotel at the very top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: My experience at the Fairmont hotel was great. The rooms are not as big I thought but they are cozy, charming and very clean. The bathroom was spotless and nice. I don't recommend ordering room service, their prices are higher than most hotels. The hotel is located in one of the best neighborhoods, Nob Hill. There are great restaurants in the neighborhood and the views of the city are spectacular. It also very convenient for people who don't want to drive at all. It's walking distance to most major attractions: cable car, Union Square, museums, and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Lives up to its reputation
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Fairmont San Francisco was an eye opener upon our entry into the magnificent lobby to our departure one week later. The staff were magnificent and the on main floor restaurant (Laurels) was great. The only questionable part was the "nightclub/restaurant" called "the Tonga room" Bad service by the waiters and they showed no control over some bad kids that were there. Interesting theme but out of place in that particular hotel. Another great point, the "Cafe Cento"! Top rate all around.

review.title: A good hotel to stay
review.reviewText: I stayed here for one night. It was good and you feel the Fairmont specialty in room furnishing, hallways, etc. A good place....probably a bit expensive.

review.title: I will definately keep the Fairmont in mind when I next visit the city.
review.reviewText: I was extremely impressed by the hotel. The staff was very helpful and professional. The hotel itself was beautiful. The bed was by far the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in away from home. The bathroom was spotless. I appreciated that each room was equiped with the essentials such as a blow dryer and iron. It helps not to have to bring those from home.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Historic, Very Clean. awesome location. very good view.

review.title: Fabulous Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Celebrating a 50th birthday (which didn't seem possible!)this hotel made it a wonderful experience. The front desk was immediately responsive when our lovely, original room was not acceptable due to a previous water spill beimg blown dry upon our entering the room. We were immediately escorted to a larger, upgraded room with apologies and we were just ecstatic. The Top of the Mark hotel bar is right next door at the Intercontinental and we were impressed with its' view but the hotel and lobby could not compare to our Fairmont. Awesome location for cable cars and a rather, steep walk up from Union Square - but, heck 50 is the new 30 and we hoofed it (once!) and then found that cabs were always available for just a few dollars. We'll definitely return to the Fairmont on our next trip to the City we love...

review.title: Loved the Fairmont!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont Hotel is a gorgeous place to stay! Not only are the rooms beautiful and the staff extremely courteous, the location can't be beat. The cable car stop is on the street directly behind the hotel making it extremely convenient. Our breakfast was great and there is also a coffee shop. The staff went out of their way to provide information on tours, restaurants, etc. I have stayed at several other hotels in the Union Square area and much prefer the Fairmont!

review.title: Classy Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, great lobby, fast service. Room service breakfast was average. Although small, the room was tastefully decorated. There was no coffee machine in the room.

review.title: SF's Best Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel will take your breath away from the moment you set foot in the lobby. Located centrally in downtown SF, Fairmont is THE hotel for a city vacation.

review.title: Great view in historic hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and staff, had a room on the 16 th floor of the tower. Beautiful view of the Bay, so it was well worth it. Staff very helpful and professional. This hotel has some great nostaligia.

review.title: Wow. Comfy and Quiet!
review.reviewText: Got the room at an excellent rate and really enjoyed my stay. Comfy bed and room. Clean, safe, and all around nice. Yes, hotel is on hill, but Trolley stop is out front and tons of cabs. Walking was fine. Perfect central location to tour San Fran! Great Views!

review.title: Overrated
review.reviewText: I've stayed at many of the nicer hotels in San Francisco and was excited to finally stay at the legendary Fairmont. From the minute I arrived (late evening)I was very disappointed. Don't get me wrong, it's not because the Faimont is an older hotel, it's beautiful. My concerns are as follows: no robes, no DND sign, only the basic bath amenities, broken steam iron, light in bathroom not working, key card stopped working twice. Because I arrived late, I ordered room service (bad idea), the order taker was rude and tried to discourage me from ordering saying "it will be a 90 minute wait". I ordered a burger, salad, and ice tea. The salad looked old with wilted lettuce, they forgot my ice tea, and the burger was the terrible with two pieces of hard old bacon on the side. This had to be the worst room service meal I have ever had anywhere.

review.title: Great San Francisco experience
review.reviewText: We chose to stay in the newer tower section. Great view of the city and much more quiet than the older section, according to hotel staff. The room was very comfortable and the staff was very pleasant. Parking is a little pricey,but then again it is San Francisco and nothing is cheap there. I look forward to returning to the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, incredible view
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel to stay at. The only downside was there was no pool, but everything else sure made up for it. Would definitely stay at again. Couldn't of had a better view.

review.title: Extremely luxurious
review.reviewText: One of San Francisco's finest hotels. Fabulous location on top of gorgeous Nob Hill. Cable car service practically at front door. Luxurious room. Breathtaking lobby. Would definitely stay here again! A piece of San Francisco history - really enjoyed reading about the hotel's history in the corridors. Every U.S. president since William Howard Taft has stayed here.

review.title: We will return many times to the Fairmount!
review.reviewText: This hotel treared us great. We were upgraded and given lots of extras. I will be a return customer.

review.title: It's the Fairmont
review.reviewText: My friend was more excited than I was. Apparently, this is a nice hotel, but I'd never heard of it. It's her city so I expected she'd know. Very nice looby and the front desk staff were nothing but smiles. The room itself was a great size...OOoohh and the bed was awesome! A LG LCD TV about 37-inches. My window view sucked....it was pointed towards a wall! Haha like out of a tv show (7th floor, Rm 706). Shower wasn't that great; weak pressure from the shower head and a bit slow for the hot water.

review.title: Very Good Hotel
review.reviewText: We got an upgraded room on the 23rd floor of the tower building. Could not ask for a better view. The room was spotless and the beds very comfortable. The bathroom had a seperate bath and shower and was very large. We did not dine in the hotel as there are so many restaurants in San Francisco. The location on Nob Hill is perfect to walk to Union Square and take cable cars to fisherman's wharf and chinatown/north beach.

review.title: Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful decor and service.

review.title: If you have strong legs this is the place to stay.
review.reviewText: The San Francisco Fairmont is a beautiful hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We didn't have much of a view, which was unfortunate because this hotel is atop Nob Hill and the views from there are phenomenal. One of the selling points of this hotel is that it is right on the cable car route. Besides cabs, cars and walking this is the only way to mount the excruciatingly steep hills. The cable car is almost always full of tourists going for a ride, and is not a consistent way to get to the top. Being pregnant and having to climb those hills was a killer. If you plan to have your own vehicle, or are in really good shape, this is one of many places to stay atop Nob Hill. We got a really good deal on the room, but could barely afford to eat there. Everything is very expensive. There are some really good restaurants in the area, and the hotel is mere blocks away from Chinatown. In conclusion I would recommend the hotel as long as you are aware of its placement and are prepared for the hills.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was absolutely amazing, after I reserved our room with Expedia, I spent the next two weeks researching everything I could about the Fairmont! When I got there to check in, the concierge said we had been upgraded to a suite! I thought that only happened in movies! Haha! We stayed in the Berkeley Suite on the 3rd floor of the tower, our suite looked over all of San Francisco, we could see Alcatraz & Coit tower from our room! It even had a telescope in there! The Fairmont was beautiful and everything I hoped it would be and MORE! After staying in the Fairmont, staying in a hotel will never be the same again. I'm definitley staying at the Fairmont next time I'm in Frisco! I reccommend this hotel to anyone who feels like being treated like royalty!

review.title: Top of its Game /and Hill
review.reviewText: The price was great for the hotel. The room was great size, location, bedding, bath...etc. I was there on the 4th of July. For some reason the air-conditioner was working properly - I had to open the window for cooler air. I could have changed rooms but it was to late in the day that I didn't change - so my fault. It is located on the top of Nob Hill so I hiked the Hill twice. I do hike alot and enjoyed most of it. But I wouldn't recommend the hike for anyone that has any type of hiking issues. I would stay there again.

review.title: I would go back
review.reviewText: Very nice friendly service for a large elaborate hotel. Being on top of Nob Hill make for nice views. Cable car runs along side hotel, which is good for getting back up the hill.

review.title: Waterfront vs Union Square? -- choose Nob Hill
review.reviewText: I read all the comparisons of staying on the waterfront vs staying in Union Square. I am glad I choose to stay on Nob Hill. The Fairmont is at the intersection of all the cable car lines. You can get to the waterfront -- either the Fisherman's Pier end or the Ferry Building end -- on one or other of the cable cars, and you can also get to Union Square on the cable cars. The Fairmont has outstanding views. It is in a quiet neighborhood, but is an easy walk to Chinatown or Union Square. It is a lovely, historic hotel which is very well maintained.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fairmont to experience the best of San Francisco. We did experience the best. Great location and service!!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed in "signature" room - a corner room with views over most of San Francisco. The room was beautiful, the views were magnificent, and the service was very high quality. Excellent choice!

review.title: Fabulous!!
review.reviewText: My overnight stay at the Fairmont Hotel, San Francisco, CA was like a mini vacation leaving all cares and worries at the entrance. The service excellent. The room so clean and beautiful it was a dream. The bed so comfortable I didn't want to get out of it. It's also got to be the best shower this side of the Mississippi. Stayed in it for an hour!! Plus took 2 more 1/2 hour showers. Plenty of clean towels, robes and tolietries. The atmosphere was so quiet and peaceful I haven't had a good night's sleep like this in ages. Plus the conceirge was excellent in suggesting restaurants and gave many useful tips of places to go. I didn't want to leave. If I could move in for a month I would! The LG TV and music system excellent. Room service great. I loved it!

review.title: One Of San Francisco's Grand Dames!
review.reviewText: From the time you pull into the entrance, thru check-in, and luggage assistance, you feel as if you're being welcomed back. The staff is friendly, helpful, and very competent. Rooms are large, with flat screen t.v.s. Beds have individualized coverings to assure cleanliness. Just great!

review.title: Very Friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. The room was beautiful and the staff was always willing to help.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Next to shops and bars and places to see. Clean, good layout and clean smell. Great rooms and in good order. Had to wait two hours as fully booked, and when entering the room, two bottles of wine and chocolates were given as "sorry". great service and really know how to look after guests. What a place. Fantastic. Made to feel welcome and clearly they know how to make guests feel welcome. Staff are excellent.

review.title: Fairmont San Francisco....is the best hotel i have ever stayed at!!!!!
review.reviewText: First, at arrival, we got an amazing welcome from the hotel staff. The nice man who checked us in, not only give us information on the city, but also checked us in early, and gave us an amazing room, with a beautiful city view. The room was large, bright and very clean. The bathroom was so shinny, huge bath and the shower was a walk in room. The hotel is close to Fisherman's wharf, only take the cable train. If you like shopping, go to Union Square, where anything can be found, and is 5 minutes from the hotel, it's possible to walk or take a cable train on Powell street.

review.title: a wonderful week i will always miss
review.reviewText: the hotels location was perfect for what my mom and I wanted to see and do in san francisco. we were asked twice to turn down our tv, first at 9:30pm and we quickly and appologetically did so, the second time we were watching tv but not being able to hear it, we turned on the closed captioning, but then at 11:34pm we were asked to be quiet again. whoever it was that complained about us must have been stressed out and took it out on us, or is one of those people that didn't realize they were in san francisco on a weekend. the hotel staff were very nice but didn't know where things were, don't ask them for directions, you will get lost. the beds were the best i have ever slept in in my life, and the hotel has that luxurious old feel that has a history with san francisco. we stayed a week and didn't want to leave.

review.title: A Classic Old World Experience
review.reviewText: Apart from the somewhat small room, the experience was great - and pricey. Classic "old world" hotel with modern facilities and excellent service. Great place for a business traveller, but not for the average tourist spending their own money.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, beautiful and comfortable rooms, very good service. The only thing that We did not like was that my 14 year old daugther could not use the fitness center.

review.title: I will stay here each time I am in San Francisco. It was great.
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was immaculate and the bed was so very comfortable. This is the second time I have stayed at the Fairmont and i will definitely be back.

review.title: Lovely elegance - Creme de la Creme
review.reviewText: Wow, what can I say? Expedia had a steal of deal for a room. I was worried I would get a dinky "servants quarters" kind of room for that slashed price, however, I got a luxurious room with high ceilings, lovely furniture, a large walk in closet, plasma TV and spacious spotless bathroom with marble since and lovely mirror, lighting and shower! The hotel is so old and historic, the room though felt sleek and modern, with old fashioned decor. The hotel did a good job making me feel like a prince for my 3 night stay, and I would return again!

review.title: Beautiful decor
review.reviewText: Loved the atmosphere

review.title: Oldie but goodie
review.reviewText: Still in great shape after 100 yrs.

review.title: Overpriced and underwhelming
review.reviewText: Way overpriced for what is provided. This is just a big touristy hotel with a very nice lobby. We paid extra for a view room thinking a view of the bay or at least downtown but got only a south view which was nothing special.

review.title: San Francisco's grand hotel
review.reviewText: good old grand hotel. good location A/c not working real well

review.title: San Francisco Landmark Hotel
review.reviewText: The view from the signature bay view room was spectacluar! Bed was extremely comfortable, and overall room decor was luxurious but relaxing.

review.title: Can't wait to go back! Very pleased!
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the Fairmont! The view of the bay from our room was stunning and the staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The history of the hotel and the elegant surroundings were outstanding, we are already talking about coming back and staying in the same place. Fantastic!

review.title: The best hotel experience ever.
review.reviewText: Old fashioned courtesy brought up to date with efficient service and amenities. 'Twas good for the eyes and the soul.

review.title: Beautifully restored hotel atop San Fran
review.reviewText: Fabulous location at the top of Nob Hill with great views of the bay complemented by nice comfy beds and a gorgeous bathroom suite. Only complaint was that there was no in-room coffee/tea making facilities. The rest of the hotel was absolutely gorgeous with many pictures of powerful and famous former guests adorning the corridors near the function rooms providing some interesting viewing on the way to/from our lifts.

review.title: Beautifully restored hotel atop San Fran
review.reviewText: Fabulous location at the top of Nob Hill with great views of the bay complemented by nice comfy beds and a gorgeous bathroom suite. Only complaint was that there was no in-room coffee/tea making facilities. The rest of the hotel was absolutely gorgeous with many pictures of powerful and famous former guests adorning the corridors near the function rooms providing some interesting viewing on the way to/from our lifts.

review.title: The best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We loved everything about the Fairmont. It was beautiful, well kept conveniently located and the service was great. The view from our room was unbelievable.

review.title: Great Place for a Get-away
review.reviewText: We chose the Fairmont for our first anniversary celebration. Picture old-world elegance, savvy and friendly staff, and just plain old-fashioned fun! The historical pictures of old San Francisco line the wall on the way to the Tower rooms. We had a great city view and watched the fireworks from the Black and White Ball. The Tonga Room has good entertainment for a small cover fee, and the desserts are fabulous! It was a splurge, and worth it!

review.title: fabulous
review.reviewText: Wonderful, classy and breath taking.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: This was my first time to stay at the Fairmont and what a wonderful experience. I'd stay there more often if the price was right. We got our room on sale for 1/2 price!

review.title: Best view in the City
review.reviewText: We stayed one night in a Bay View room on the 18th floor of the tower. The view was absolutely amazing. The hotel has been recently renovated, and the rooms are extremely clean. Our room was considerably larger than we expected and had a seperate shower and tub. The shower was absolutely amazing. The hotel staff were very friendly. In the restaurant, our server was very attentive and was very honest about the large portion sizes, telling us to share an appetizer. The food was absolutely amazing. It was probably the best meal we had on our vacation.

review.title: Not Worth the $$
review.reviewText: The room & bathroom were small. The room was hot, the air conditioning was not working and the window opened just a little bit (safety reasons). We were very dissapointed.

review.title: Could Be Better
review.reviewText: Thinking Fairmont, you automatically set the limits high. Our room was without any view. As a matter of fact the flags and the terrace were blocking our view from the window. Room did not have any pens, standard coffee maker or supplies and had a crack in the ceiling. I would prefer to experience other hotel(s) next time.

review.title: GREAT hotel at the top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: It's our anniversary trip & we're really enjoyed stay in this hotel

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a gorgeous hotel, great architecture, wonderful rooms, and really great service. It's close to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, and Nob Hill, so there's a lot to do within walking distance (although, the hotel sits on a huge hill, so you'll have to do some up- and down-hill walking). I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Marvelous place - we loved it - will stay there again
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. The room is overly spacious with a walk-in dressing room - it's amazing! Great for traveling with children.

review.title: Just a wonderfull stay.
review.reviewText: We are so please to have spend a night at the Fairmont Hotel. It's yust a wonderfull hotel.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: This was s superb hotel. It was in an ideal location for cable cars to access city. We had a fantastic room overlooking San Francisco bay. The conceige booked our trips which were reasonably priced and first class. The room service was punctual and well prsented. Would definately stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful in a great location. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Parking is very expensive, but if you have a hybrid, it is free.

review.title: Fascinating history and beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: We were at the Fairmont for our 25th wedding anniversary. Even though we don't live far away, neither of us had ever stayed there before. We were in the older part of the hotel and had heard that the walls were paper thin... well, we didn't hear a thing! The room was spacious and very clean. Had a beautiful view of the city. We also enjoyed the historic photos of the Fairmont. Would recommend.

review.title: Made SF visit all the better
review.reviewText: It was great and wonderful to stay at the Fairmount hotel,it is extremely great hotel,would go back,when in SF again. It is definetely worth staying at.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I have always wanted to stay at the Fairmont. It was everything I imagined. So elegant. Extremely courteous staff. The bed was so comfortable. A very fine hotel in one of the most wonderful cities in the world! What more could one ask for. We will be back!

review.title: A Treat
review.reviewText: My recent stay at the Fairmont was a treat. I stayed in the old section and my room was spacious and lovely. The lobby of the hotel is spectacular in an old world way and the Tonga room a trip. The service was exellent and the location central. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: The perfect place to stay
review.reviewText: L-O-V-E-D it! It was great, the service was great! It is close to everything; the very best location!

review.title: Fairmont lives up to its reputation
review.reviewText: We stayed on the 23rd floor of the tower, and the views were breathtaking! The room was so comfortable, as were the beds. The service was impecable. The concerige was a tremendous help when our flight home was cancelled at the last minute. Breakfast was very expensive at the Fairmont, so head down to Lori's Diner for more reasonable prices. (3 block walk downhill) Get the 7 day cable car pass so you can grab the cable car up Nob Hill if you aren't in excellent physical shape.

review.title: Great Luxurious Stay
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by my stay. The location is prime, the exterior grand, and the lobby is beautiful. The rooms are graciously sized, with comfortable bedding, Bose radio, and a plasma TV. The service was great and the hotel food was actually pretty good. One downside was not having a coffee maker in the room. It is expensive to have it delivered and the fee coffee in the lobby disappears before most guest wake-up. They direct you to a coffee shop that has over priced subpar coffee. The hotel is a perfect central location to see the city.

review.title: You feel like a million bucks!
review.reviewText: Great price to stay in such a beautiful hotel. Great service - staff don't know if you've paid top dollar or not for your room or not - so they treat you the same. Historical. Very impressive architecture (marble everywhere!). Great people watching hotel in lobby or bar area. Cable car access or walk for a great workout. Close to Union Square. Nice (no cover) jazz on Saturday. Self-parking close.

review.title: wonderful stay will come back!!
review.reviewText: Ask for a room with a view

review.title: Home Away from Home
review.reviewText: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at a fabulous hotel.

review.title: Great value on San Francisco's Nob Hill
review.reviewText: We found a terrific rate for two superior king, interior rooms in San Francisco's Grand Dame, The Fairmont, atop Nob Hill. The rooms were not too big but were large enough for adding a roll-away for our daughter. Our view from the second floor wasn't pretty and included part of the heating vent but the room was very quiet for sleeping, the bed was very comfortable and the linens fine. The room was very clean and all furnishings were in great shape. The service was not as good as we would have demanded if we were paying closer to rack rates - when our luggage did not arrive we walked down to the entrance and found it still, 30 minutes later, on the luggage trolley, outside. When we started rolling it in ourselves we passed two managers/security in the lobby and weren't stopped until we passed the bell desk. There was a long line at the front desk for check-in and found out from our bell-woman that there was a front office staff meeting and that they had failed to have sufficient coverage at the desk. Finally, the parking prices were exorbitant (as at most hotels in SF these days) and the doorman was friendly but we got the sense that all of his efforts were solely for obtaining a tip, not taking care of us.

review.title: It's the Fairmont - it's wonderful
review.reviewText: No complaints - everything was perfect.

review.title: Fairmont is Fantastic
review.reviewText: Our family of four only had a few days for a trip to San Francisco, so we decided to pick a really nice hotel for our stay. We chose the Fairmont and I have to say, we all loved it. The room was beautiful, clean and huge. We had a large, marble bath, a walk-in closet, flat-screen TV, the linens were sooo nice and the bed was luxurious. And the service was phenomenal. When Expedia messed up our reservation by not telling the hotel we reserved 2 double/queen beds, the hotel gave us 2 rooms with single queen beds right next to each other and couldn't have been nicer about it. They said this had already happened multiple times. The concierge helped us make dinner reservations, rent a car, reserve a shuttle back to the airport, gave us advice, and was pleasant while doing all of this. The lobby of The Fairmont is amazing. The only negative is there are not many options around the hotel for eating/drinking, although there are a couple. The new coffee bar downstairs makes great coffee. And it's a tough hike up Nob Hill, but the positive about that is we all lost a few pounds! I would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Thank you.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: We spent three nights at the Fairmont in a Signature Bay Room. Our 23rd floor room provided breathtaking views of the city and bay. The room was clean, well appointed, and spacious. We requested two queen beds, but only a king room was available at the time of our check-in. A rollaway bed was provided free of charge and the room easily accomodated the bed. The staff provided outstanding dining recommendations and the hotel's Tonga Room proved to be a fun dining experience for our teenager. (In my opinion, the Tonga Room is a FAMILY dining experience...tropical decor, indoor lake, indoor rain, and live music/dancing around the water. The Tonga is a great way to enterain children after a busy day in the city.) While the trolley stops outside the hotel, the hotel was within walking distance to many of the city's offerings.

review.title: San Fran's best hotel
review.reviewText: Central location, spectacular views of the Bay, and great food. This hotel is the perfect place to stay for a romantic weekend in one of the most romantic cities in North America. Classy with a capital "C".

review.title: Good hotel - Good Location - BUT FULL OF CONFERENCES
review.reviewText: A great hotel but seems to focus on conference trade, so hotel can be empty in public areas one day and packed the next. Good location but watch the bell desk as they try and put you in black limos rather than cabs at double the price.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Our stay was excellent, the Staff and the hotel is Super!!

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: The entire staff was fabulous from the time we stepped from our car.

review.title: My San Francisco Favorite
review.reviewText: Great View, Great staff, Great Location, Very comfortable!! I'll always consider the Fairmont San Francisco one of my favorites.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: Got a bay view room for a real good price. Big room, beautiful bathroom with seperate bath and showers. Big screen flat screen with very good reception. The room service was exceptional! Due to booking through expedia, I could not do video checkout- only draw back. They said they are working on it. oh well, no biggie.

review.title: Didn't want to leave
review.reviewText: This was a great place to go and relax. It was very quiet, clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were a treat compared to most hotels.

review.title: Classic San Francisco Hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, Great service, incredible views. Hope to go back soon.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont San Francisco. The hotel is beautiful and elegant throughout, and our room was well appointed. Service was at the level you would expect from a prestigous establishment, and if we had any questions about the city we could rely on the head concierge, who founded the US branch of Les Clefs D'Or. A nice central location for both downtown and the sights. Don't miss out on the delightfully kitschy Tonga Room in the basement.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: It was our first time visting San Fransisco and the friendly and hospitable atmosphere made our stay relaxing and certainly one to remember. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who wishes to visit this amazing and vibrant city.

review.title: A little thinner than expected
review.reviewText: I wonderful, historic hotel with large comfortable rooms but uncommonly thin walls between the rooms. Unless you are a private investigator, you will find hearing your neighbor on occasion annoying. Service was impeccable. It was a treat to walk around the halls and read about the history of the hotel.

review.title: cold room and little sympathy
review.reviewText: room cold - moved next door- room cold.Heating system failed in area. Moved to another room eventually.Tried to use complimentry sevice to finacial district. Female recptionist did not know what i was talking about. Tried other staff same result.Took cable car.Very comortable rooms when heating works. Very expensive hotel to stay in - food,drink, coffee etc

review.title: A Pleasant Surprise
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is known as one of the best and most historic hotels in San Francisco. The surprise was its affordability (with the sole exception of French champagne!) and the informality (Genes and suits equally acceptable). Our family had five rooms with some of the best views in the city. The location was great -- walking distance to Chinatown, for example. As expected, the service was outstanding. Also, take time to visit the hotel's gallery of historic photos.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: pretty good everything except the site of hotel(on the high hill) and expensive overnight parking fee..

review.title: Very Upscale Hotel, Great Price!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very upscale with a great old classic san francisco design. Very classy for a great price (if you wait for one of their deals).

review.title: Total Letdown
review.reviewText: Service in the hotel was horrible. Got locked out of room twice in same day. No vending machines to get drinks. Nothing nearby for food/drinks. Hotel is beautiful but would not stay here again

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: This was a great Hotel! Staff went out of their way to assist you and help you. The hotel is magnificently clean and beautiful. Great location!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The bathroom was a mess. The toilet would not flush and I had to call three times for it to get fixed. I asked for a room change and that was not accommidated. The front desk did not sound sincere about the inconveniences my family and I experienced. The walls are so thin you can hear noices from the hallway and from the adjacent rooms. For a four star hotel, my experience was like a two star or lower. I would never recomment this place.

review.title: Appreciate the helpful staff
review.reviewText: Our first night was a nightmare. This is a historic hotel so the walls are very thin. Our neighbors were loud and stayed up til 1:00am, then got up the next morning at 7:00! I asked the front desk if they were checking out and when I found out that they were on an extended stay, I asked to be moved. Even though we were there at a busy time of the year, they changed our room, no problem, and we ended up with a larger, quieter, much more comfortable room.

review.title: Great place - very close to a 5 ... but there are better hotels...
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. The staff were friendly and the beds were great. For a four star hotel the room service was very expensive though- $30 for a contential breakfast and $4 per person delivery makes breakfast for 2 close to $70 (for OJ / Coffee and a muffin...lol)... we ordered a pot of coffee for 2 and it was $15...thats crazy at any hotel. Apart from that it was a nice place and would recommend.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Overall the guest room is okay but the stuffs kinda old, and the matress is too soft ^^

review.title: Nice but make sure you get an outside room!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay here and the location is great. However, we did have to switch rooms. The first room we were given was a small, interior room and looked out onto an ugly roof area. This wasn't too bad but the room was so noisy! We could hear the entire cell phone conversation in the room next to ours and when his tv was on, he might as well have been in our room! When we went down to the front desk to ask for a quieter room, the clerk was nice enough but wanted to point out that the hotel was 100 years old and that any room may be noisy. Our new room was a corner room on the 2nd floor and looked out over the front of the hotel toward Grace Cathedral. Not only was it quite a bit bigger, it was also quiet!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Located on Nob Hill, the views from our room were spectacular. The hotel lobby was decorated for the holidays with a home made gingerbread setting freshly baked by their chefs. The marble pillers and floors make the setting very elegant.

review.title: Fine Hotel
review.reviewText: Really like the grandness of the hotel. Service was great and the rooms were big and had comfortable beds.

review.title: Excellent!!
review.reviewText: Very impressive, beautiful and confortable, I recommend.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, clean, great location but walls paper thin bring your ear plugs, no coffee pot in the room and bring your wallet EVERYTHING is extra nothing is complimentery you get 1 room that is it.

review.title: Fairmont at Christmas
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and decorations but I found the service subpar - people at desk not that friendly, no help with bags when I arrived and the cleaning staff kept coming in my room in the morning (annoying). Love the hotel, hate the service.

review.title: Previous stays were better...
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Fairmont again because our previous stays were enjoyable. Unfortunately, we may stay at another hotel on our next trip. The slamming doors in the older section of the hotel were a nuisance especially late at night. For some reason, our room was not made on the first night. The parking attendants need to pay closer attention to the people waiting for taxis and help them in the proper order.

review.title: Experience the best
review.reviewText: From the time we arrived, late in the evening,until we checked out the next day,we received excellent service. Per a recommend from the registration desk, we were able to enjoy a late night dinner with all the excellence we looked forward to dining in San Francisco. Breakfast was also equally great.

review.title: great trip
review.reviewText: just got back from spending 5 days in san francisco and it was amazing the hotel was great we got upgraded to a suite which was awesome it was nice clean and spacious, we also enjoyed hanging out in the lobby which was beautifully decorated for Christmas, the only downside was going up that hill at the end of day but honestly you get used to it:)

review.title: Classy establishment
review.reviewText: I love the decor and history surrounding these old hotels. The only downside is they aren't quite as quiet as the newer. Noisy pipes and echoing hallways render sleeping in a dream.

review.title: Grand Old Classic
review.reviewText: Stayed here 30 years ago and it's still a beautiful and breathtaking hotel. The Christmas decorations were up and the lobby and Laurel Court were beautiful. Arrived on an early a.m. flight but the hotel gave me an early check-in. Laurel Court's service wasn't the best at lunch but the food was excellent. Will gladly stay here on my next trip.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: It has the Wow factor

review.title: Not a real deal!
review.reviewText: The lobby is splendid! A beautiful old hotel, but this is it...I lived on the forth foor...on the other side of the elevators...it took around 6 mins (really!) to get to my room from the elevator on my floor!!! The window of the room didn't close and believe me, SF is cold in December! The toilet didn't flush for few hours, until the "engineer" (this was written on his tag) came with...a wodden pomp...As the cherry on the cake, I founded few bugs in the bad, which left me some signs on my skin...I am sorry to write such a review (I usually don't write reviews, at all) but unfortunately, these are the facts...pity for a lovely staff and a great outstanding building!!

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent, except for the food not great

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located in the middle of all San Francisco has to offer, just make sure to get the long stay cable car pass, it makes life during your safe truely memoriable!! A must in the Fairmont San Francisco is a trip to the Tonga bar, the food is to die for there!

review.title: Would go back in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: Absolutely wonderful position on top of Nob Hill. Just a block away from Cable Car stops into the City. Complimentary coffee available every morning between 05.00-07.00. Great if u are going on a day trip early to Yosemite or down the Coast. Was a good time to go as the hotel was quite empty lots of rooms on sale for Thanksgiving Week as normally is a hotel for Conventions. The Standard Room was very nice no panoramic view but u get that once u go outside. Overall fantastic and great deal.

review.title: Breakfast
review.reviewText: the buffet breakfast was one of the best I've had. Lots of fresh fruit, a waffle and egg station. The egg burritos were good, smoothies, oatmeal, fresh baking etc. The concierge was knowledgable about great restaurants in the area.

review.title: San Francisco Romance
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I chose the Fairmont because of the location and the history. Easy to catch a trolley, and an easy walk to cafes and romantic restaurants. Old fashioned, kind and helpful service. Beautiful clean room. Yummy french toast at the Laurel Court. Try a cocktail at the Tonga room. Looking forward to going back.

review.title: Not appropiate fitness facility
review.reviewText: Overall it was a very nice Hotel, conveniently located, and has comfortable and large rooms. I felt that the front desk staff was not very accommodating, and overall I was deeply disappointed with the luck of free access to a fitness room or swimming pool. To go the fitness room you have to pay $15 and it is only open until 7 pm. Most high class Hotels provide better service than this!

review.title: would definately come back again
review.reviewText: would definately come back again

review.title: Great historic hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely, century old hotel. Well maintained, old fashioned charm preserved without sacrificing any of the current day amenities. Excellent service. The only negative is the price of food. I wouldn't recommend eating at the hotel. Lots of great restaurants and cafes within walking distance that are a lot less expensive and just as good or better.

review.title: The Hotel itself was one of the highlights of my vacation.
review.reviewText: Excellent.

review.title: Best Hotel
review.reviewText: High on hillside - great views and has history to it.

review.title: Can't wait to go back, especially for the fantastic breakfast!!!
review.reviewText: The breakfast at the Fairmont is somenthing really really delicious! Everything is sooooo good! The hotel service, the room comfort are excellent, I almost didn't wanna go out just to relax on the bed.. I really recommend this hotel!

review.title: lived up to reputation
review.reviewText: I had always wanted to stay here and it was wonderful. Room in the old section...wonderful charm. Had View of interior which was not that interesting but very quiet. The only minor complaint was that check in took a while. Would definitely go back.

review.title: Beautiful hotel upon the hill
review.reviewText: Very pleasant reception even though we arrived early in the day. Room was beautiful with a great view. Spacious,clean,comfortable. Only negative comment would be that it's a bit of a walk to the elevator from the lobby if your room is in the tower. Close to everything and if you are too tired to climb the hill at the end of the day the cable car stops on the corner of California & Mason.

review.title: Good pick if you get a good deal
review.reviewText: Perfect location (although on a hill). Good size rooms. Well appointed.

review.title: Can't Wait to go back.
review.reviewText: The people that worked at The Fairmount were very helpful. The hotel room was very nice.

review.title: great historic hotel with large rooms with tall ceilings.
review.reviewText: Rooms where large and had tall ceilings, at least in the lower historic portion of the building. the dining room is very interesting with three domed rooms that are very elegant. Service was good in the dining rooms as well. the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The location was nice if you want to ride the cable cars on the historic lines. addtionally the little store off the lobby had many items at a normal price and not the "we are going to screw you price" they also had good backup things if you forget a dress shirt, or Ties, etc..

review.title: loved the stay
review.reviewText: great

review.title: Gorgeous hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great location and an extremely friendly staff.

review.title: Clean and comfortable, but nothing special
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel because the service was good including free overnight parking because I had a hybrid car. The one thing that I noticed was my room had that feeling of trying to be something it wasn't. The lobby is fancy and they pull that off, but my room seemed full of fake "nice" furniture and decorations, but who really cares. Maybe they pull off the look in the more expensive rooms. My room was clean and that is most important!

review.title: First class hotel at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: Good location, walking distance to Union Square, North Beach, Chinatown and Fihermen's Wharf. Good value for a first class hotel. Friendly staff. The concierge was very helpful in arranging tours. When I mentioned that I did not like my room because the balcony was blocking the sunlight, the staff did not hesistate to move me to another room right away. I have stayed at other more expensive Four star hotels. The Fairmont offers the same quality of service at half the price.

review.title: SF Fairmont Hotel/Privilege
review.reviewText: San Francisco is amazing & our stay @ the SF Fairmont Hotel made it a real privilege. We finished our business & celebrated our anniversary in an exceptional environment & enjoyed the Fairmont's outstanding service.

review.title: Nice hotel...great staff...
review.reviewText: My only complaint was that it was very noisy at night - I could hear telephones rining in other rooms and the room doors are very very loud when they close. Otherwise beautiful place, great service and great food.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location! A couple of blocks down the hill and you were in the main downtown shopping area. A couple of blocks to the side of the hotel and you were in Chinatown. Take a taxi or a trolley car further up and you would be in the Bay area, where you could do lots of shopping, sightseeing, or dining. Trolley cars accessible on both sides of hotel.

review.title: Historic San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our guest room at the beautiful Fairmont Hotel was wonderfully comfortable. Fluffy towels, high thread-count bed linens, comfortable furnishings, and a huge lighted closet, not to mention the dressing table with plenty of lighting, made the accomodations a delight. The historic appointments in lobbies and hallways are a constant reminder of the importance of this structure to San Francisco's past. Thank you, too, for the 1906 Fire Wall of Pictures on the Lobby Level. My hubby loved the garden outside for his cigar smoking, too.

review.title: Old Fashioned Service with Elegance
review.reviewText: We will definitely make this our choice for accommodations in SF in the future. It is old, elegant, and they really know how to treat you well.

review.title: Very Nice...
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel. Though the hotel is a bit on the stuffy side, the service was always top-notch even when we were casually dressed in jeans. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The locations was great, walking (or short taxi/cable car ride) from China Town and Fisherman's Wharf. The room was great, very comfortable and great views.

review.title: World Class Hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff, Fantastic Location, extremely comfortable beds in the rooms, had a great view of San Francisco Bay, what else can I say about this Historical Landmark?

review.title: Only complaint was the Tonga Lounge
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, staff was wonderful, room was wonderful, service was wonderful SAVE the tongo(sp) lounge. We tried twice to have a nice dinner in the lounge on the terrace level of the hotel and the first time we were bustled into the bar area and only stayed long enough to have a very expensive yet unsatisfying appetizer. The next evening we stood at the hostess station for 10 minutes (a huge line had formed behind us) waiting for a hostess to even come over...only to have her tell us there were no tables (clearly there were) and try to seat us in the bar again. My advice...stay away from the tonga room at the fairmount. Other than that...WONDERFUL!

review.title: Will definately return
review.reviewText: We loved the location, service and the ambiance. The location of the hotel is not too far from shopping but is on Nobb Hill which provided us with great views. The service was excellent. We did not like the room we were in because of the ice machine and elevator. We were moved immediately. The meals at the hotel were good and the Tonga room was kinda fun.

review.title: Fantastic Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and historic. The rooms are spacious and the view from our room was incredible. The staff, especially the concierge was very helpful. Don't use the mini-bar though, the items are Very pricey ($10.00 for a 1 liter bottle of water).

review.title: top of the the hill
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is located on top of the hill,expect to do some climbing if you don't have means of transport.

review.title: Good, but expensive extras.
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a flagship San Francisco hotel that has a great location at the top of Nob Hill, overlooking the city. The hotel retains its original character, with an impressive marble foyer and appropriately decorated rooms in the original part of the building. Summertime is busy in San Francisco, however. Unfortunately we had to wait over half an hour to be seated for breakfast on the Sunday morning, having already abandonned the idea the day before. We also thought the price of extras like parking and the restaurant were high and these added a considerable amount to the overall cost of staying there. Having said that, an enjoyable stay for a one-off experience.

review.title: Expected more...
review.reviewText: When we phoned the concierge for assistance with tickets, they asked if they could call us back. It took them an hour to call us back. It seemed like they gave you only as much attention as you tipped them for. The bed was very uncomfortable. Nice clean bathrooms, but the shower leaked tons of water on the floor. Location is not that great unless you enjoy cab rides instead of walks.

review.title: Great hotel but expensive stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel providing you choose a deluxe room to have the skyline view. Good location to visit fisherman's wharf and SF bay. Rooms are expensive and all services (internet, breakfast, no complementary tea/coffee) are extras.

review.title: The Nicest Service in a lovely setting
review.reviewText: The Fairmont itself is a lovely, elegant grand dame, so a stay here would be a treat under any circumstances, but the staff only enhance the experience. I encounter efficiency rarely enough in the course of frequent business travel. To encounter cheerful competence and genuine human kindness is rare. Not so at the Fairmont, where the staff was uniformly a delight.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I were in San Francisco for 3 nights at the end of July and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. The Hotel is in an excellent location in the city. Although it's at the top of a very steep hill, the trolly stop is right next to the Hotel if you can't face the walk up!! We ate at the Hotel twice and the food was delicious with excellent service as well. Cannot fault this Hotel and will definately stay here again when we return to San Francisco.

review.title: Our stay at The Fairmont Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We totally enjoyed our stay at The Fairmont and hope to return again real soon. Beautiful hotel and friendly staff who make sure you have everything you could possibly need. Concierge desk was great with us, very accomodating.

review.title: One Of The Best
review.reviewText: Thanks to the Fairmont Nob Hill for making our trip to San Fransisco one of my families best hotel experiences. We have also enjoyed the Kei Lani Fairmont on Maui and the Fairmont in New Orleans and look forward to checking out their other hotels-

review.title: Thin Walls
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel! Great location. Thin walls means you hear noise in the hall and your neighbours.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I were impressed with the hotel. The room was a good size and the bathroom was large! Conveniently located by Nob Hill and Union Square. Hotel staff was wonderful! We will stay here again!

review.title: A San Francisco Gem!
review.reviewText: This flagship of the Fairmont group is an absolute must for anyone visiting San Francisco. Having stayed at Fairmonts in other cities, this property definitely lives up to Fairmont's high standards. Upon checkin our room with two beds as requested was unavailable so they put us in two rooms at their expense the first night then moved us into our requested room type. The service is outstanding! Don't miss the legendary Tonga room and high tea is a definite treat! The conceirge at this property is most helpful in booking tours and dinner reservations!

review.title: Cannot wait to go back!!!!
review.reviewText: There had been an overbooking at our hotel unfortunately, so we were put up at another property cutting our stay at the Fairmont by 1 day. Due to this, our room was upgraded and we received amazing service from The Front Desk Manager. She was an absolute sweetheart of a lady and we appreciated all her help and accomodtions. We will be going back to San Francisco one day and I will only stay at this property. Thank you for an amazing trip!!!

review.title: Fabulous Fairmont
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived, we were surrounded in luxury. The service was amazing (each member of staff we came in contact with was helpful, knowledgeable and friendly). Our room had an amazing view of the city and roof-top terrace. When we return to San Francisco we'll definitely go back to the Fairmont!

review.title: Nice View
review.reviewText: I checked in a little early and my room was not ready. Checked back a couple hours later and it still was not ready. Slight free upgrade later and I'm on the 14th floor looking at a beautiful city. Great bed, bathroom and view!! Room looked like it was going to be updated, but still very nice.

review.title: Fairmont- wonderful!
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay- got upgraded to a small suite which was lovely. Very helpful staff. Nicely located hotel- we were able to walk to Union Square and Chinatown easily.

review.title: Great hotel, staff
review.reviewText: My husband and I and four friends all stayed at the hotel. The staff placed us all on the same floor when we requested it and everyone was very helpful. The concierge recommended great restaurants and arranged for us to take a tour of Napa Valley. The view from our room was wonderful. We could see the Bay Bridge and Golden Gate as well as Coit Tower. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Historical Landmark
review.reviewText: Excellent choice. Conveinent to trolley and easy to get around the city on public transportation

review.title: Congenial Splendor
review.reviewText: Best hotel we've ever used. Congenial, helpful staff, from the maids to the concierge. Concierge service was superior, and the staff projected a genuine interest in our needs and comfort. Service and splendor plus the best location in San Fran. Worth every penny.

review.title: A place you must stay at least once
review.reviewText: The atmosphere and service was excellent. Our room was hot and the air conditioner did not blow sufficiently to cool it. $45 a night to park the rental car seemed a bit steep, but not too bad. Overall, I would stay here again.

review.title: Grand dame still shines
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. Staff was extremely helpful, especially when we had difficulty with a noisy neighbor. They moved us to a different...and superior...room where we peacefully slept the remaining nights of our stay.

review.title: A Classic
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at The Fairmont, and enjoyed almost every aspect; the room service was promt and good quiality food. The room was nice. Good shower head/pressure, nice linens and towels. The walls are too thin, however, and we heard the family next door as if they were in our room. Also, there was never any coffee in the lobby urns, and I mean for 45 minutes at a clip, though the urns were out often with cups by their side.

review.title: Undeserved the reputation
review.reviewText: 1) The loud band music continued until midnight, we could not sleep. 2) The Business Center closed temporary, but no other alternative to receive fax. 3) The poor service of the fron desk. The front desk told us a wrong information that we would stay 3 nights although we booked only 2 nights.

review.title: Most Beautiful Hotel ever!!!!
review.reviewText: The Fairmont in San Francisco is absolutely beautiful. The history of the hotel is fascinating with dignitaries staying there since it's opening 100 years ago. You will feel like royalty. The lobby is so magnificent, people come in just to take photos. Dont' miss happy hour at the Tonga Room! Incredible appetizers, a rainforest rainshower every half hour and great ambience.One of our best trips ever.

review.title: Hotel Lovely! Breakfast Buffet Great! Park car elsewhere!
review.reviewText: Great Great Staff all around! Thank you for the golden service. Beautiful Hotel but thin walls and heavy doors. We could hear neighbors and hallway trafic and who's leaving and who's coming.

review.title: cant wait for next visit
review.reviewText: Could live there permanently! Great location, views,comfortable beds,excellent staff

review.title: Amazing
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend. Before our stay the staff were incredibly helpful with storing our luggage whilst we were on a trip to Yosemite with no hassle at all. On arrival at the hotel we were offered an upgrade to a suite at no extra cost. Our new room boasted an amazing view and huge bed. The staff we encountered were all charming and the room service we ordered was fantastic. Couldn't fault a single thing about our stay, it was perfect.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Our stay was very enjoyable. The hotel has alot of charm and history. The location is fantastic as it is within walking distance to the majority of sights. If transit is your thing, the cable cars are right outside the front doors. Very helpful and friendly staff.

review.title: Spacious Room at the Overwhelming Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Quite satisfied with spacious room at the hotel with full of historic atmosphere. Transportation is quite convenient, since you can have the access to all 3 cable cars right out of the hotel building. Do not expect any view if you are not paying extra dollars. (But it's also true that you can enjoy the magnificent view if you step out of your room into the garden)

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!
review.reviewText: The Hotel surpassed all my expectations!! Great service and great location. From China Town to Fisherman's Wharf to many more it was perfect.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: This was a very beautiful hotel. The decor as you walk into the lobby just takes your breath away, and the rooms size was generous compared to other hotels in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice but Snooty
review.reviewText: Beautiful old original hotel with visually stunning lobby. Staff is professional, but can be haughty/snooty. Walls are a little thin, so be prepared if you are sensitive to noise or are a screamer in bed.

review.title: luxury stay at discounted price
review.reviewText: Luxury stay at Expedia's discounted prices at its best. Nob Hill is a wonderful neighborhood. A trolley ride downhill takes you to all the shopping, restaurants, and even Fisherman's Wharf. Try the Tonga Room at the Fairmont.

review.title: One of San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: My stay over the Memorial day weekend was nothing less than exceptional! Desk service (upgraded room,no charge), Concierge, Restraunt service, even the Bar service were friendly and very helpful for my needs. Definitely will go back!

review.title: Rooms not Updated
review.reviewText: I have stayed at Fairmont several times in the past. During the recent saty, the noise from the adjacent room (TV and conversation) kept on going in the early morning. The walls are apparently very thin. The same issue was raise by my colleague on the same floor. Although the room was clean, the air conditioning did not work.. I do not recommend this hotel if you want a restful night....

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: This was a great location and perfect place to stay. Our room was a little small but very nice! Would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Excellent Service Always
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for one night on April 14, 2007. Although we live across the Bay, we typically stay in S.F. for events. On this particular evening, former President Clinton was speaking. Valet: Surprisingly, this was a prompt and efficient experience. Typically, when we stay at other hotels for events in SF, the valet is totally unprepared for the volume. Car was also waiting upon check-out. Check-In: There were several employees checking-in guests, so this was also a prompt and efficient experience. Elevators: This is a very historic hotel with historic elevators. If you are in a hurry, you will be disappointed. Rooms: We stayed in a room on one of the higher floors. Although the room had a queen bed, it reminded me of hotel rooms in Paris & Barcelona. In other words, very very small. Also, in the a.m., we could hear every single word spoken by the couple next door which was disturbing. Several years ago, I stayed in a suite which was a better experience. Bar Food: Over priced & too fancy if you are starving - even for S.F. I suggest getting a bite somewhere else. Tourists enjoy the Tonga Room which was a totally cool bar in the late 90s. I have also stayed at the Fairmont in San Jose & Chicago. Cannot go wrong with this hotel as the service is some of the best I have ever experienced.

review.title: The Only Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This amazing historic hotel adds a large spectacle to your journey to San Francisco. Like riding a Cable Car, San Francisco is not complete without staying here. Once you arrive there, you know you are in for a treat. Take time to admire the exterior before you have your breath taken away by the famous lobby. The staff here are extremly friendly and helpful. Our room was truly spectacular, with views over the cityscape looking out over the distinctive sklyine. Other rooms do vary with sea views and courtyard views. Every morning you wake up to the sound of Cable Car`s ringing their bells! Within the hotel it is difficult to choose from sitting in the Lobby bar for a nice local glass of wine, or experiencing the Tonga Lounge with its coctails, live entertainment and frequent rain storms! You have to see it to believe it! This is the most amazing hotel you will stay in, and adds a huge part to your visit in San Francisco. The sound of those Cable Cars waking you up each morning will echo in your mind forever. You will not just leave your heart in San Francisco, it will be left in the Fairmont. Once you have visted this hotel, you will have to return very soon!

review.title: Elegant hotel
review.reviewText: We highly recommend the Fairmont. The history and charm of the hotel cannot be overstated. Our room was large, clean, and very comfortable. The service was good too. The restaurants were both great - we enjoyed the breakfast buffet and had a lovely dinner at the Tonga room (where it rains indoors).

review.title: Disappointed in Room Service
review.reviewText: We order breakfast and we received the wrong item. We call back to get a corrected item and it took forever. We call back and cancel the order and we received the credit for it but we were still hungry.

review.title: San Francisco Icon
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel with a rich heritage. The tower rooms with the Bay view offer panoramic views of Bay Area.

review.title: good service
review.reviewText: I wish they had told me that parking space would charge separate, which is also expensive.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: The tower is the place to be!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful interior, wonderful situation.

review.title: Location, location, location?
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a gorgeous hotel and worth visiting for its landmark status, but you don't have to actually stay there to enjoy it. Being at the top of Nob Hill (a beautiful location) isolates you from other, more bustling parts of the city, such that even an impromptu trip to a coffee house is an effort that must be strategically planned around the steep hills and irregular cable cars. In truth, this did not detract terribly from our stay, but less able and willing visitors or those wishing to be in the middle of things would do better to stay in a different part of the city. That aside, the service was impeccable, and nothing about the Fairmont is cheap (breakfast $26 each, parking $51 per day), so if you're looking for quiet romance and price is no object, the Fairmont is a great spot. Just don't bring a car, be sure to ask for an outside room (so you can enjoy the view from atop the hill), and bring good walking shoes.

review.title: old time class
review.reviewText: Good hotel with an old time class

review.title: I expected excellence and it delivered
review.reviewText: Be sure to visit the 'Tonga Room' in the Fairmont on weekdays from 5-7pm for their happy hour buffet. What impressed me with this hotel was that the staff was not at all pretentious. Everyone was very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Old World Charm
review.reviewText: It was a great pleasure to stay and experience The Fairmont in San Francisco. The staff from the very beginning of check-in was friendly and helpful. There was no shortage of staff ready to help answer and questions. From the bell staff to the doormen, to the front desk staff, all were very helpful in giving dining tips, and must see attractions. Would stay again and recommend

review.title: Very NIce
review.reviewText: The Fairmont was a beautiful hotel and the service was great. All the staff went out of their way to make our stay special. The only thing I would change next time would be to request a larger room with a view. However, even our small room was quite comfortable. I would definitely go back again.

review.title: The best hotel that I've been to.
review.reviewText: This hotel makes you feel like you are a rich person at a price that you cannot believe. Thank you Expedia! Mihai

review.title: Old World Elegance
review.reviewText: The Fairmont is a shining example of Old World Elegance. The lobby is straight out of Paris, Rome, or Vienna. The rooms were spacious and the service excellent. My only negative comment is that the hotel sits atop the pinnacle of Nob Hill; any direction that you leave takes you straight down a steep pitch and straight up as you return.

review.title: Going back in Jan 2007
review.reviewText: We love this hotel. We were there for Thanksgiving weekend and their beautiful Christmas decorations were put up while we were there. We were disappointed that they did away with the restaurant/lounge at the top since our last stay in 1975, but were impressed with the renovation, the old world feel and the elegance of the hotel. If Caesar were alive, this would be his palace. The staff was very helpful, the room was beautifully furnished, etc. etc.

review.title: Fairmont SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was extremely nice. The buffet breakfast was nice but pricey. The parking was outrageous at $40/day. Internet service at $13/day was also outrageous.

review.title: A Must... Beautiful and good Quality.
review.reviewText: I stay at Fairmont four nights the last week of the year 2006. I took a little vacation with my two children for the first time to SF. The Fairmont is a very beautiful Hotel and accessible to every thing. I love the staff they are very friendly especially the valet parking attendants. I really recommend this Hotel is a must. I will keep it in mind next time I go to San Francisco.
