review.title: old style Grand Hotel
review.reviewText: Christmas was a great time to stay at the Fairmont. The decorations were great and the old world elegance takes you back in time and is very romantic. The only complaint was the towels were scratchy and hard...a little fabric softner would help! Overall, I would highly recommend this nicely situated hotel.

review.title: Best choice!
review.reviewText: Perfect location, updated, large rooms. Absolutely perfect!

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Parking is expensive, but expected to be in this location. This is a beautiful hotel and the service was great.

review.title: Classic Elegance in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Fairmont stood up well to its reputation as the historic queen of Nob Hill. Its restoration is beautiful, bringing back the elegant details created by Julia Morgan following the earthquake and fire of 1906. It's location is like an oasis in a busy city (although you'd better enjoy walking on steep hills, or have some means of transport to get back UP). The service was impeccable from beginning to end at the porte cochere, front desk, bell desk, lounge, Crown Room, and everywhere else we went. Car rental was available on-site, and was equally pleasant. The food and view from atop the new tower was fantastic, and housekeeping was impeccable. The only real nit was a little bit of paint wear and scuffing on some doors and woodwork. Also wish the windows would open more than a handspan. If you truly want to experience the elegance of old San Francisco, this is the place to stay. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

review.title: Mixed Review
review.reviewText: The checkin was incredibly slow for the President's Club which I am a member. Went to the general section after 15 minutes to get check-in service which was great once I got to it. Food service and restaurant is excellent as would be expected, and food quality also. Concierge service dragged out and caused waiting; the Assistant was condescending. Paint peeling from ceiling of room, cracked from being old. Overall, the service was spotty this weekend, like the staff was tired from a long hard summer. So hard to say, as it is atypical of the fine service I have received from the Fairmont properties overall.

review.title: Nice High End Value Except...
review.reviewText: Checking in took way too long. Despite a reasonable arrival of around 6:45 I noticed a long line for check-in and only 2 staff members, one of which was handling the club clients. I headed to the Tonga lounge for a cocktail and the tail end of the $7 happy hour buffet. Lounge is downstairs from lobby at end of drab hallway across from gym. Nevertheless, it is fun it a slightly tacky way with the hourly rainstorms and floating bandstands. Yes, they put mini-umbrellas in the typical repertoire of tropical drinks. When I went back to check in, line was short but only one person was working the front desk. At my turn, it took 5 minutes of searching before they said no garden rooms were ready yet as of 7:30 PM so they upgraded me to tower. Room had a nice view and was reportedly slightly larger, but I had hoped for more character by staying in older section. All in, hotel is nice and I will assume check in was out of character but I prefer the better neighborhood restaurants selection in the Union Square area.

review.title: Very nice place to stay
review.reviewText: will recomend to others for any event.

review.title: Would go back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at The Fairmont. Our room was beautiful, with much character and charm. The staff was very polite, very helpful and treated us wonderfully. Our room had beautiful views and was in an excellent central location, which allowed us to easily visit Fisherman's Wharf, the Financial District and Union Square.

review.title: one of san francisco's finest hotels
review.reviewText: Loved everything about the service, room, high quality sheets, spaciousness of room, wonderful bathrobes, superb soap. A bit higher priced than the 'average' room but truly a great value.

review.title: The Best Place To Stay In San Fran
review.reviewText: They have a way of making your stay with them something that you will always remember.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A lot of history in this hotel. The view from our room was breath taking. The service was best ever experienced!

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Excellent Staff, very helpful, would love to go back!!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location. Could tell that the hotel dates from the early 1900's but the recent renovation (5 years ago) has updated things nicely. Bathroom could have been a little bigger. Highly recommend at expedia rate.

review.title: Would love to go back!
review.reviewText: Hotel is truly elegant and provided a quiet stay. I was in a small "expedia bargain" room and it was elegant and wonderful. Everything was spotless and although no great view it was nice not hearing any street noise. It was a great place to go back after a day of touring and relax.

review.title: A solid business hotel
review.reviewText: Make sure to join their President's club (free) in order to obtain free (fast) internet service during your stay.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in great location. Staff is top notch.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel history was wonderful, the staff was extremely helpful for guiding us to wonderful restaurants, cafes, etc.

review.title: The ultimate in pampering and luxury!
review.reviewText: I was there for 2 weekend nights and loved every minute of it. I was already impressed with the history and grandeur of the hotel, but, after staying there, I became even more in awe. My room was on the 6th floor overlooking Alcatraz, Coit Tower, and the bay. It was incredibly beautiful. The service was superb as well. I have been to S.F. about 15 times now, and this, by far, was my favorite place to stay.

review.title: awesome hotel
review.reviewText: i travel extensively for medical conferences throughout the US and sometimes europe.This was the best hotel i stayed at hands down.staff was awesome.what surprised me was when i called up the front desk soon as they picked up the phone they d address me using my name.the restaurants were awesome including tonga room STAFF was awesome

review.title: First Class
review.reviewText: Great old grand hotel in wonderfull shape, one of the better hotels I have ever stayed in.

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: I'd definitely stay here again!

review.title: Fabulous remodel to old grandeur
review.reviewText: Very welcoming and comfortable with all the amenities of today and style and grace of yesterday.

review.title: will always stay there for business in SF
review.reviewText: Beautiful historic hotel with amazing views. Just like going home.

review.title: I could like in this hotel
review.reviewText: You cant help feel like royalty when you stay here, the hotel was in my top three of niceset places that i have ever stayed

review.title: Perfect View -San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Besides the old fashioned high service focus and top notch facilites - my room had the perfect San Fransisco view. - Golden Gate Bridge, ALcatraz , Coit tower and sunsets what more could you ask for....oh yes free access to the internet and a wonderful bed...made Business PLeasure

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel; great service; great location. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Quality always shines through!
review.reviewText: Without question, the most elegant hotel we've ever experienced. The Fairmont was our Christmas treat to ourselves and we were not disappointed. The staff is ultra-attentive, the hotel just radiates old-style San Francisco charm and one of the nicest surprises was its proximity to the cable cars. You are literally steps away from all the best attractions. The quiet of Nob Hill and yet a trolly ride away from the best the City has to offer. This is now our San Francisco hotel!

review.title: Gorgeous hotel
review.reviewText: This was everything I expected and more as far as the room. Meals are very expensive. Location is central, but Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf would work better for convenience of transportation and restaurants.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful. The room was large and the view was incredible. All staff members we encountered were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was good but pricy for the amount of food served. This was our anniversary present to each and my wife and I have never had a better one.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well kept but the rooms do nothing to block out noise. It is not pleasurqble to hear kids playing games and running around or to hear other adults talking.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Beautiful appoinments throughout the hotel. The old world charm envelopes the building in the architecture. Our room offered spectacular views of downtown and the San Francisco bay. The comfort of the mattress and pillows left a lot to be desired but it was a pleasant experience nonetheless.

review.title: Beautiful View But A Cab Ride to Union Square
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. It is on Nob Hill and is thus a bit isolated from shopping, theaters, etc.

review.title: "Old San Francisco" Charm
review.reviewText:
We haven't stayed here since 1986.  Loved the re-decoraed lobby and the Old San Francisco atmosphere.  
     Re-visited the Tonga Room for before-dinner drinks.  Hasn't changed a bit--great Polynesian flair with generous strong tropical drinks!
     The queen-bed room was very nicely furnished with high ceilings for added feeling of spaciousness.  Very comfortable bed.  Nice marble appointments in the bathroom--very little counter space, however.  Roomy closet.
Nice, quiet room for a good night's sleep.  Friendly personnel.  Would recommend this lodging.
